positionName: Business Analyst, Customer Service by Amazon
description:
2+ years of experience in analytics or operations
Experience working with complex data sets in data warehouse environments
Experience with data visualization software
Experience utilizing analytical and quantitative skills to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, develop business cases, and complete root cause analyses
Experience managing multiple competing priorities and projects in a fast-paced environment

Description
Amazon’s mission is to be ‘Earth’s most customer-centric company’, and our award-winning Customer Service (CS) team is an essential part of that mission. Amazon CS is one of the largest customer service organizations in the world. Our tens of thousands of Customer Service Associates around the globe provide world-class support to customers 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, and in over 20 languages (and growing).

One of our newest customer service programs, Customer Service by Amazon (CSBA), enables Marketplace sellers to delegate their customer service to Amazon. We are seeking an experienced Business Analyst to enable effective decision making and prioritization by retrieving, aggregating and analyzing data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format. You will leverage a variety of data platforms and analytical tools to provide a holistic view of the customer experience. You build deep contextual and domain knowledge, ensure data quality and build scalable tools. You effectively communicate findings across a wide range of senior stakeholders.

The successful candidate will be a key member of the global CSBA program team, working with stakeholders across Europe, the US and Asia.

Responsibility includes but is not limited to:

Translate complex or ambiguous business problem statements into analysis requirements
Proactively and independently work with stakeholders to define analytical approach and construct use cases
Build knowledge on data and metrics of the wider business for providing the big picture on the customer experience and how it translates into business metrics
Solve ambiguous analyses with less well-defined inputs and outputs; drive to the heart of the problem and identify root causes
Derive recommendations from analysis that significantly impact a department, create new processes, change existing processes and drive prioritization of roadmaps
Work with a variety of data sources and large data sets, pull data using efficient query development and provide a holistic and consistent view of the data
Provide insights through basic statistical measures such as hypothesis testing for improvement initiatives
Actively drive automation of data requirements by scaling data processes and create self-service tools
Communicate complex analytical insights and business implications effectively
Actively manage the timeline and deliverables of projects, anticipate risks and resolve issues
Master’s degree in Statistics, Applied Math, Operations Research, Economics, or a related quantitative field
3+ years of professional experience in business intelligence or data analysis
Strong knowledge of advanced statistics
Proficient with analysis programming languages and statistical software, i.e. SQL, Quicksight, Tableau, Excel, R, Python etc.
Experience working with global teams
Ability to take loosely defined business questions and translate them into clearly defined technical/data specifications
Passion for operational excellence with a commitment to delighting customers
Strong verbal and written communication & data presentation skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us

The Qualtrics XM Platform™ is a system of action that helps businesses to attract customers who stay longer and buy more, to engage and empower employees to do the best work of their lives, to develop breakthrough products people love, and to build a brand people can’t imagine living without.
Joining Qualtrics means becoming part of a team bold enough to chase breakthrough experiences - like building a technology that will be a force for good. A team committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion because of a conviction that every voice holds value, with a vision for representation that matches the world around us and inclusion that far exceeds it. You could belong to a team whose values center on transparency, being all in, having customer obsession, acting as one team, and operating with scrappiness. All so you can do the best work of your career.
We believe every interaction is an opportunity. Are we yours?
Healthcare Data Analyst

Evolution of Roles to Support CAHPS Programs for Healthcare

Overview

Intent is to address rapid growth within healthcare that requires expertise in regulatory programs, data quality and Qualtrics technology for healthcare providers as well as payers. This position would own the data governance aspect of all CAHPS programs to ensure complete and accurate data for auditing, tracking and official submission to a data warehouse or other governing entities.
CAHPS Data Analyst

Description

Tracking and monitoring data flow between the client, Qualtrics, and vendor partners. Oversight of sampling engine to ensure sampling protocols are adhered to and clients are sampling consistently throughout the month.
Working with Engineering to provide regulatory program insights during implementation when needed.
Responsible for all data quality and QA across CAHPS programs both in Excel and other file formats along with leveraging automated alerts and reporting for necessary data updates.
Partnering with Engineering and Product to build requirements for quality automation and data visualization.
Preparing files for quarterly submission to CMS via a data warehouse.

Work Experience

2+ years with Voice of Customer, Direct Customer Experience, Data Analytics, CAHPS program management experience preferred.

Education

BS in data science, healthcare administration,or research science preferred but not required.

Travel

10%



Alignment of Role to Sales Process


Post-Sale Delivery: Partner with Qualtrics or Partner implementation teams to oversee the CAHPS data intake, ensure all data guidelines are met, all required fields are populated with the expected data elements and track all QA for auditing.


Oversee all CAHPS data governance across programs, own and manage all file preparation for quarterly data submission.

Expectations for Success
Lead CAHPS data quality management from data intake all the way through data submission to QualityNet.
Identify data quality issues, data security, data storage issues and work with appropriate resources to address
Ensuring all required data fields are setup and populated correctly and consistently for each client
Coordinate and advise on data quality for submission from identifying missing data elements to requesting client update files.
Responsible for all QA of CAHPS data across clients and preparation for data submission
Be proficient in use of the Excel, XML, .XLS and common data file formats.
A natural curiosity about the data! Ability to identify and questions anomalies in the data
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree
2-5 years in data quality and program oversight
Comfortable with GSuite, and Microsoft office for MACs
Superb communication and project management skills
Comfortable in a fast-pace, and highly competitive environment
Ability to communicate clearly and pleasantly through both written and spoken mode
Able to analyze response data and report back to clients for actioning.


Preferred Qualifications
2-5 years of experience in data quality and program oversight in a healthcare related environment.
Survey research knowledge and experience
Knowledge and experience with government regulatory programsExperience in execution of many aspects of CX program delivery, including: survey design and execution, data analysis, dashboard and reporting, making best practice recommendations specific to CAHPS
Bachelor’s degree in data science, healthcare administration, or other research-oriented field.


Responsibilities:
Establish and Monitor client sampling in accordance with regulatory guidelines
Oversee data intake requirements for new CAHPS clients
Track all required quality checks
Manage data quality in preparation for data submission
Communicate any required CAHPS updates to clients
Assist in monitoring websites for individual CAHPS program updates and trainings
Attend required CAHPS trainings
Assist in maintaining CAHPS QAP documentation
Assist in maintaining CAHPS training documentation
Assist in preparing for and participate in annual CAHPS audits


A Day in the Life

From managing the data collection process, to customer interfacing, to seeking ways to improve the processes and scalability of our team, there are no boring days for our team members.

You will oversee the CAHPS data quality across a wide variety of healthcare clients using standard guidelines and methodologies from project onset through delivery of final deliverables. This entails data quality oversight across all phases of project execution, possibly including survey design, data collection, data processing, analysis and reporting. Along the way you will work with internal teams to analyze and investigate data, map data for reporting, and advise implementation and Engineering teams on regulatory requirements for data validation.

Along with providing client and program updates on data analysis, you will continue to take on new programs which involves learning and understanding regulatory requirements and protocols for data management. Some projects are fundamentally easy and quick, but many others are complex and require creative thought and a dedicated thought process!

As you grow in this role, there will be opportunities to coach and manage other data quality analysts as they begin their careers, including teaching technical, regulatory, and data management skills as well as mentoring on longer term career goals.

In combination with the core duty of managing research programs, our teams also have the opportunity to work on side projects of their choosing that will help to make the team a better environment, as well as to help it run more efficiently and expand our team’s capabilities. As Qualtrics continues its exponential growth so does the Research Services team, and that means a need for scalable processes, continued innovation on our offer, and constant revisions to the current practices in order to fine tune and better our operations.

Being at Qualtrics during this time of unprecedented growth is already exciting, and being a part of the Research Services team only adds to that level of energy and potential. More leadership is needed and we’re hoping it will be you!

The leader in real-time TV ad data and analytics is currently seeking a Data Analyst – BI who will design and develop custom reports for iSpot clients. We are seeking a talent who will share our obsession for data accuracy; someone with an insatiable appetite for learning new things and accomplishing challenging goals in a fast-paced (and not always structured) environment. We are looking for someone that is highly motivated and knows how to get things done quickly and efficiently.
We have a product that is changing how brands, agencies and networks measure and assess the impact of TV advertising campaigns. Our software uses proprietary audio and video analysis to monitor and extract TV commercials, movie trailers and other promotional content from TV. At the same time, our software analyzes consumer interactions with TV ads on the digital screen across search, video and social. Interactions are matched with specific ads and attributed back to airings on TV. Our platform collects and analyzes massive amounts of data in real-time.
This is a rare opportunity to get equity in the early stages of a company with significant early traction and which is run by an experienced team.
Responsibilities:
As a key member of the custom analytics team, you will be responsible for a variety of business-critical work that includes, but not limited to:
Distilling storylines and themes from reports or analysis conducted related to TV measurement and performance.
Summarizing topline insights that are relevant to a particular client or industry. This may involve creating additional views from created reports, gathering additional/contextual data points from our dashboard product, researching relevant industry data points, and producing additional collateral (Power Point slides or other data visuals) to help explain pertinent learnings.
Communicating with internal iSpot teams (including Engineering, Customer Success, and Sales) to understand data validity, key business questions a client may want answered, timelines for deliverables, and required formats.
Occasionally query from large, complex data sets (using SQL) to get data that is most relevant for analysis related to TV advertisement measurement. Be proficient in knowing how to join and aggregate potentially large data sets to make sense and provide valuable insight. Be curious about results and have a desire to understand how the data tells a story.
Present findings to internal and external stakeholders in a simple, consumable, valuable format.
Document project status, updates, roadblocks, resolutions, dependencies, and deliverables in project tracking tool (JIRA).
You should be an open communicator and have a desire to participate in team discussions and help troubleshoot when you have knowledge that a team member might need.
You will be expected to manage multiple projects at the same time…not too many, but usually not just one. You should be able to communicate roadblocks and risks proactively…we will have your back when you do!
Ideally you have some curiosity for the TV ad measurement space and think that tying ad measurement to business outcomes leads to some very interesting, sometimes exploratory, analysis.
Requirements to be successful in this role:
3-5 years of professional experience and bachelor’s degree, including:
3-5 years as a data or insights analyst, focused on interpretation of results, analysis, and visualization.
2-3 years in a role that required communication to clarify requirements, summarize results, or advise clients on analysis.
At least 2 years of experience with Excel or Tableau or a similar BI tool is required, including creating pivot tables and extracting or manipulating data inside of BI tools.
Proficiency in SQL would be helpful.
Knowledge of the television industry either as client, agency, or sell side helpful
Must be able to communicate risks and roadblocks for analysis projects to team leads or VP of Reporting and Analytics.
Must be able to communicate status of projects clearly for technical and non-technical audiences and independently manage and prioritize assignments.
Strong attention to detail.
Strong quantitative, analytical, process development, facilitation and organizational skills required.
Ability to multi-task and work well under deadlines in a changing environment.

ITSM Analysts are responsible for managing the lifecycle of all problems and for the end-to-end management of problem investigations by facilitating root cause investigations and progressing the implementation of corrective and preventative measures. The Analyst will work to prevent problems to eliminate recurring incidents, and to minimize the impact of incidents that cannot be prevented. The analyst will utilize quantitative data analysis to identify and resolve problems. They will need to perform data mining, validation, aggregation, as well as testing and explaining results. This position works on activities required to diagnose the root cause of incidents identified through incident management, and determine the resolution for those problems. The Analyst is also responsible for ensuring that the resolution is implemented through the appropriate control procedures. The Analyst is a dynamic team member and a self-motivated individual, who will be involved in coordinating across teams, helping ensure a timely investigation of root causes and implementation of fixes to problems of IS supported information technology as a result of incidents.

If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined.

ROLE

Executes proactive problem management analysis to identify and minimize future problems.
Monitors Incidents and Problem records to identify impacted system and application outages that require follow-up analysis.
Extracts data from a variety of sources, providing analysis and trending.
Manages active problems ensuring they are kept up to date with clear concise information.
Secures and assigns required resources to perform problem management activities.
Owns and coordinates actions of assigned problems.
Engages with appropriate technical and business teams within the organization to assist in the resolution of problem records.
Liaises with key stakeholders to keep them informed of progress.
Chairs problem management and RCA meetings to review outstanding problems and resolutions.
Manages appropriate escalations where operational level agreement breaches occur.
Facilitates during post incident reviews with senior team members.
Generates and promotes a monthly Post Incident Report (PIR) health report.
Assists in production and maintenance of Known Error library documentation.
Generates and promotes weekly action item statuses.
Produces statistics and reports to demonstrate performance of the Problem Management process such as, incident trend data to identify and eliminate root causes, diagnosis of issue, and determining whether new incidents are related to existing problems.
Identifies problems, analyzes, and recommends service improvement plans.
Participates in the constant improvement to the Problem Management Process.
Monitors key performance indicators assigned to customers and team members.
Ensures concerns are addressed in a timely manner, including the following: events, ticketing issues, requests, questions, and training opportunities; handles escalations as needed.
Monitors relevant reports and tools to identify, address, and proactively engage employees.
Manages queues within ServiceNow and monitors all open and aging cases daily.
Audits problem tickets to ensure processes for problem records are being followed.
Ensures compliance of process policies and standards.

REQUIRED

Excellent analytical skills (logical/critical thinking). Previous experience performing trend analysis and documenting themes.
Creative problem solving – following an issue through to its logical conclusion and escalating where necessary.
Extensive soft skills, including communication, negotiation, organization, time management and problem solving.
Writing skills – maintaining accurate documentation and technical authorship of complex documents.
Ability to work independently as well as being part of a team.
Ability to work with multiple teams to drive problem resolution.
Resourceful - utilize all tools, expertise, and knowledge bases to drive constant improvement of the problem process.
Excellent communication skills both verbal and written; arranging meetings, completing post incident reports, note taking, providing root cause updates to key stakeholders.
Experience working with a diverse team in a fast-paced environment.
Experience in a customer facing role implementing solutions or providing service with a high level of accountability.
Superior teamwork skills.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills are a must; ability to read, write, and speak in a professional manner.
Must possess a personal sense of urgency.
Ability to effectively multi-task and adapt to changing business priorities.
Superior customer service skills.
Excellent time management and organizational skills.
Excellent attention to detail.

Recommended
ITIL / ITOM / DevOps / SRE framework knowledge.
Experience with statistical techniques to control the IT Management process.
Service Modeling experience that supports Incident/Change and Problem processes.
Writing user stories in support of joint process and system enhancements for ITSM.
Lean Six Sigma skills for Continual Service Improvement.
Structured RCA framework knowledge and practice.
Process Mining to turn event data into insights and actions.
Experience in an ITIL based role, such as Service Desk, Incident, Problem, and/or Change Management.
Large scale multi-site IS operations experience.

Cover Letter
Resume

ROLE DESCRIPTION

Mapping Data Analyst is a subject-matter expert in data mining & analysis, and dashboard or report creation dedicated to improving operational efficiency, accuracy and consistency. The Mapping Data Analyst is expected to draw insights and find improvement opportunities, gather insights and make proposals, help accelerate throughput of models and algorithms, and act as a team’s data POC.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

Understand analytical needs, document and prioritize requirements, and develop plans for process or tools improvement initiatives.
Build and maintain analytical SQL queries, scripts, and dashboards to track task progress or operational productivity.
Use statistical methods to analyze data and generate insightful project reports.
Identify and recommend new ways to improve quality and productivity by streamlining operational processes.
Collaborate and coordinate with other Advanced Operators to test hypotheses of possible process improvements.
Use SQL, Oracle, Python or other programing languages to prepare and present data in a way that is visually appealing and simple for clients to navigate and comprehend.
Assist in evolving data pipelines to improve throughput and provide near real-time data insights.
Quantify, track and manage solution implementation with before and after metrics.
Identify and develop data quality initiatives and opportunities for automation.
Ensure scripts and data management practices comply with internal best practices.

System Specialist Role

ROLE DESCRIPTION

The team works on keeping Maps Data current and reflective of real world changes. They work on issues submitted by end users of Maps or tests the location results of user queries submitted via Search (Web) or Maps interface.

A Mapping System Specialist is a domain specific subject-matter expert in functionality, features, and purpose of tools, applications, and infrastructure. They are expected to improve processes by finding ways to better utilize existing tools or by suggesting better configuration, additional features, or functionality.

Role & Responsibilities

Draft tools requirements documents (ORDs).

Conduct black-box testing of new tool features and provide detailed feedback.

Manage domain issue configurations, configuration files, and run batch issue creation/mutation scripts, Read/Create regular expressions

Support Geo Mapping Data Technicians by creating and improving configurations to improve daily workflows.

Use GIS skills to support the geo data processing lifecycle from ingestion to submission.

Document and quantify the impact of suggested feature/functionality or infrastructure changes.

positionName: Data Analyst / Data Journalist - Public Relations
description:
WW is looking for candidates to help change people’s lives. We are a global wellness technology company inspiring millions of people to adopt healthy habits for real life. We do this through engaging digital experiences, face-to-face workshops and sustainable programs that encourage people to move more, shift their mindset and eat healthier while enjoying the foods they love. By drawing on over five decades of experience and expertise in behavioral science, we build communities in order to deliver wellness for all.
Role Overview:
WW is seeking an analyst to find interesting things in data that can tell a great story. Our data includes anonymized health-related tracking from over 5 million subscribers around the world. The analyst who fills this role will dig into our data on weight loss, physical activity, sleep, and mindset, and figure out anything that anyone would find interesting. No kidding. If you’re curious about how people establish healthy habits, this role is a chance for you to be professionally curious and get answers to your questions. The answers you find will then be used by the public relations team to pitch media and get the word out about how WW supports our members .
This role collaborates with Public Relations to help everyone learn about what WW offers and to help further solidify that WW is the leader in weight loss and wellness. Recent questions we have included, “Can we see what people are eating now that they are socializing more coming out of the pandemic?”, and “Are changes in eating patterns making it harder for members to lose weight?” If these kinds of questions are what you would like to dig into, this is a job for you.
The work includes brainstorming with Public Relations to think of interesting questions; data wrangling and a lot of SQL to find answers; and writing up findings to share results. The extent of the write-ups will vary depending on how Public Relations will use the information. Much of the research will be correlational, but WW runs a lot of experiments (A/B tests), and data on causation will be available for some questions. The role could include some machine learning to enhance the data (think fuzzy matching to find the right foods in a database).
Key Responsibilities:
Plan and run data analyses to discover and report interesting findings
Collaborate with PR team on choosing what questions to pursue
Requirements:
Required Experience & Skills
Great comfort in SQL
5+ years experience in data analytics
Great write up and reporting skills
Collaboration and presentation skills: show what is interesting and why it is interesting
Familiarity with research methods and statistical analysis
For example, understanding why correlation is not causation, and what statistical significance is
Preferred Experience & Skills
Public relations; press releases; journalism
Reporting and presenting to leadership
Cross-functional consulting, collaboration, and negotiation
Python
R
Machine learning
Bachelors/advanced degree in a related field
Snowflake
Business intelligence dashboarding
At WW, it is our priority to cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace. We are committed as individuals, as an organization, and as fellow humans, to advocate for and support our employees, our members, and our communities. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we do not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, color, creed, national origin, marital status, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.

Company Description

We guide their projects and initiatives in strategy, business transformation, IT & digital strategy, and Data Science. As the pioneer of Consulting 4.0, we develop consulting bots and integrate AI in our solutions

Job Description
Our values have led us to two decades of global expansion. Our Seattle team is a key part of that story, supporting many of the biggest names in tech with expertise in business transformation, strategy, and implementation. We are looking to meet talented candidates with at least two years of client-facing consulting experience in data analytics using data to provide meaningful, actionable insights to businesses. These insights can inform which products to offer to customers, marketing strategies to adopt, or improvements to make to manufacturing and production processes. As a Data Analyst Consultant, you will extract, collect, and organize data to find correlations and patterns that produce meaningful conclusions relevant to businesses.
We are especially interested in meeting consultants with a background in high tech, energy/utilities, retail, and non-profit. If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Manage master data, including creation, updates, and deletion
Process confidential data and information according to guidelines

Manage program/project charters including vision, governance model, high-level scope, goals, benefits, risk/issue management, and success metric
Manage program dependencies between projects and milestones
Provide status reporting of progress, dependencies, issues, risks and overall program health

Support project execution by helping the program owner, as well as supporting leadership meetings, facilitation and coordination with all clients
Contribute to internal communications and readiness activity within the program team and with client groups

Qualifications

2+ years of client facing consulting experience
Previous experience as a data analyst or in related field
Agile/Scrum experience preferred
 Experience in data modeling, cleansing, profiling, and remediation

 Knowledge of Excel, SQL, Oracle, etc.
 Knowledge of relational databases with command of programming languages such as SQL, Python, R, etc.
Expertise with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, etc.
Basic understanding of applied statistics (mean, median, mode, range, bell curves, etc.)
Ability to troubleshoot reporting errors

Experience in cloud computing (AWS, Azure) services including storage, databases, networking, software, analytics, and intelligence preferred

Senior Data Analyst
Position Overview:
The Climate Corporation’s mission is to help the world’s farmers sustainably increase their productivity with digital tools. The Business Analytics Team is focused on creating a competitive advantage for Climate and our customers through metrics, insights, and data services. We are an entrepreneurial team that builds and uses state-of-the-art analytics systems. Sitting within the Customer Experience and Enablement Department, our work informs decisions and direction for our business, while also impacting our products.
Sr. Data Analysts are part of a core team that enables strategic decision making throughout the company. As a member of the team, your primary responsibility will be to work with department leaders to derive insights that improve business performance. This includes exploratory analysis of large data sets, metrics identification and report creation, and development and maintenance of analytic systems. This role will broadly influence the company’s products, operational effectiveness, sales/marketing strategy, and elevate the role of data as an asset to the business. We are looking for a candidate with a passion for data analysis.
What You Will Do:
Serve as a subject matter expert on company data and work with stakeholders to solve problems, identify trends and develop detailed metrics to assess KPI performance
Develop new analyses and actionable insights that inform business decisions and help stakeholders execute on strategies and tactics
Lead projects and perform detailed data exploration and validation from a variety of sources
Act as a liaison between Global teams and provide consultative services related to data and processes
Manage team Jira board and assign tasks/projects to junior analysts
Design and execute analytical experiments and perform statistical analysis
Create content for stakeholder and team training (governance, sharing, usage and interpretation)
Expert in crafting stories, presentations and visualizations with data

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, Math or a related quantitative discipline and at least 5 years of relevant analytic experience or a Master’s degree in Analytics or related field and at least 2 years of relevant analytic experience
Fully proficient in SQL and Python or R
Experience working as an analyst in a product, marketing or sales organization
Some managerial experience required
Preferred Qualifications:
Master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics or a related discipline.
Development experience with BI platforms like Looker
A deep understanding of statistical analysis and experiment design
Ability to execute research projects, and generate practical results and recommendations
Self-starter who enjoys working in both individual and team settings
Excellent communication and collaborative skills
What We Offer:
Our teams are composed of industry experts, top scientists, and talented engineers. The environment is extremely engaging and fast-paced, with dozens of specialties coming together to provide the best possible products and experiences for our customers.
We provide competitive salaries and some of the best perks in the industry, including:
Superb medical, dental, vision, life, disability benefits, and a 401k matching program
We take part and offer various workshops, conferences, meet-up groups, tech-talks, and hackathons to encourage participation and growth in both community involvement and career development
We also hinge our cultural DNA on these five values:
Inspire one another
Innovate in all we do
Leave a mark on the world

At Compass, we envision a world where the experience of selling or buying a home is simple and pleasant for everyone. Founded in 2012, Compass provides an end-to-end platform that empowers residential real estate agents to deliver exceptional service to their seller and buyer clients, all in service of our mission to help everyone find their place in the world.
Compass is looking for a Staff Business/Data Analyst, supporting our Transaction Operations team, who is experienced in leveraging multiple complex data sources to derive a clear and actionable visualization of the data. This position will be responsible for developing metrics and reporting, understanding and managing data structure, strategic analysis, and rigorous deep dives to impact the business. They will work with technical teams, product teams, program teams, finance, and operations to drive reporting to visualize our success towards our goals, as well as to articulate productivity within the teams. This role will be responsible to map and define data parity across multiple business tools and processes, to ensure that data is consistent and complete. Additionally the role will be responsible for ensuring data continuity across platforms that have been sunset and replaced with new platforms, enabling a single source of truth for all of the historical and future reporting needs. This role requires an individual with excellent analytical abilities as well as outstanding business acumen and comfort with technical teams and systems. The successful candidate will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, with strong attention to detail, and an ability to work in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment.

If you are passionate about solving complex problems and thrive in a fast-paced environment, we'd be thrilled to meet you. This is a full-time position that will report directly to the Sr. Director of Program Management.

At Compass You Will:

Drive the Transaction Operations Data analytics, working across multi-functional teams to prioritize roadmaps, improve processes, deliver clear and concise data reporting and insights.
Drive standard business reporting processes, including weekly flashes, productivity reporting and any other data needed to support the Transaction Operations.
Accountable for generating key business insights required to deliver against core input/output metric goals.
Proactively seek to identify business opportunities and provide solutions based on a broad and deep knowledge of Compass data resources, industry best-practices, and work done by other teams.
Simplify complex data structures to present clear, informative and actionable data visualizations.

What We Look For:

+8 years of direct analytics experience, or equivalent combination of degree and experience
BA/BS degree in Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Operations Research, Business Analytics, Information Systems or related field
Advanced understanding and experience working with data warehousing, data quality, and data visualization.
Advanced proficiency with Tableau, Snowflake, Data Bricks, Redshift and Google Sheets.
Preferred experience with real estate industry tools such as SkySlope, PlanetRE, Profit Power as well as standard business tools such as NetSuite.
Familiarity with SQL, relational databases. Python, and ETLM
Familiarity manipulating large sets of data, summarizing into metrics, and conducting appropriate statistical tests (e.g., regression, t-test, chi-square)
Experience implementing basic software solutions to automate data source, visualization and/or data modeling application
Outstanding communication skills - written and verbal - with the ability to tailor messaging strategy for different audiences.
Outstanding organizational, project management, people and communication skills, including strong writing abilities and proven experience communicating key value messages to a variety of audiences both internal and external to Compass.
Ability to prioritize, problem solve, multitask, and work independently in a dynamic, rapidly changing workplace with a bias towards action.
Proficiency in sourcing and analyzing the data needed to make effective decisions as well as a high comfort level in operating with and making decisions with partial information
Strong soft skills and experience managing with empathy, including the ability to face challenges with a positive attitude.
Do your best work, be your authentic self.

At Compass, we believe that everyone deserves to find their place in the world — a place where they feel like they belong, where they can be their authentic selves, where they can thrive. Our collaborative, energetic culture is grounded in our Compass Entrepreneurship Principles and our commitment to diversity, equity, inclusion, growth and mobility. As an equal opportunity employer, we offer competitive compensation packages, robust benefits and professional growth opportunities aimed at helping to improve our employees' lives and careers.

positionName: Data Operations - Quality Control Analyst - SEA
description:
Description
About this role
Data Operations and Solutions is entrusted with maintaining all data integral to the investment decision process. The function serves BlackRock the Investment Manager and its BlackRock Solutions (BRS) business, in our proprietary Aladdin® end-to-end investment platform. This team closely partners with key internal teams, such as Portfolio Management, Global Capital Markets, Relationship Management, Portfolio Compliance, Risk Analytics, Regulatory Reporting, and others, to ensure their business data needs are met accurately, timely, and efficiently.
The Data Ops and Solutions philosophy is anchored on BlackRock’s cornerstone principles: Fiduciary focus, Passion for Performance, the unified purpose of One BlackRock, taking Emotional Ownership and Being Committed to a Better Future. Through this lens, we strive to build value for our clients by understanding their needs, the markets, and using technology to create best in class solutions. Our function has presence across 12 offices in 8 countries, servicing more than $25 trillion in AUM on Aladdin for a client base spanning 6 continents and all spectrums of the financial markets.

Within the data organization sits the Quality Control function, which owns security and portfolio level risk analytics quality control along with the governance and design of these QC processes. This team ensures our clients have the highest quality of risk analytics. We do so by focusing on building scale and efficiency by integrating data science to craft and implement a centralized quality control platform for key risk analytics metrics. The team strives to build in-depth subject matter expertise in risk analytics, capital markets as well as BlackRock's proprietary risk models and Aladdin software suite to service that mission.

Responsibilities include:
Daily support of a risk analytics trading process for BlackRock and BlackRock Solutions’ clients.
Learning the intricacies and interconnectivities of Aladdin® end to end investment platform.
Sophisticated research into the risk profile of global investments that involves broad experience in Equities, Fixed Income, Derivatives, and Alternatives, across the vast global investment marketplace.
Daily quality control and validation of intraday risk analytics and providing specialist advice related to reference, index, and pricing data.
Envisioning, designing, and developing enhanced quality control models using machine learning and data science methodologies.
Performing efficiency reviews of internal processes and recommending improvements.
Utilizing research skills, critical thinking and financial math to analyze macroeconomic and market trends to incorporate into improvement proposals to QC models and methodologies
Close collaboration with market analytics and financial modeling groups to expand understanding of our models.
Interacting with clients to serve as a security-level risk knowledge desk to provide outstanding customer service
Performing testing of in-house programs relevant to owned processes
Ability to operate in an agile environment and employ agile methodology principles, project management and process design
Qualifications:
The applicant must possess and demonstrate an understanding of fixed income, equity, and derivative financial instruments.
You should have the interest and ability to work in a fast-paced and entrepreneurial working environment along with comfort in working closely with teammates on shared projects and objectives.
Have some flexibility regarding their work hours.
Excellent communication skills are required to orchestrate working relationships with internal and external partners.
A bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Accounting, Economics, Finance, Computer Science, or Engineering is required. Non-target degrees will be considered if a solid understanding of global markets can be proven.
A “Student of the Markets” mentality: Intellectually curious with a passion for learning about the global financial markets and the investment management business.
Experience or education related to agile methodologies is a bonus.
Proven grasp and comprehension of technical tools such as SQL, Python and Unix is helpful. PERL is a plus, but not required.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation”
Our benefits

To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including a strong retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, comprehensive healthcare, support for working parents and Flexible Time Off (FTO) so you can relax, recharge and be there for the people you care about.
About BlackRock
At BlackRock, we are all connected by one mission: to help more and more people experience financial well-being. Our clients, and the people they serve, are saving for retirement, paying for their children’s educations, buying homes and starting businesses. Their investments also help to strengthen the global economy: support businesses small and large; finance infrastructure projects that connect and power cities; and facilitate innovations that drive progress.
This mission would not be possible without our smartest investment – the one we make in our employees. It’s why we’re dedicated to creating an environment where our colleagues feel welcomed, valued and supported with networks, benefits and development opportunities to help them thrive.
BlackRock is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, and other statuses protected by law.
BlackRock will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records in a manner consistent with the requirements of the law, including any applicable fair chance law.

Company Description
PayScale is the world leader in modern compensation software. Our rich data and unique algorithms power the world’s largest real-time database of salary profiles, giving both employers and employees immediate visibility into the right pay for any position. We are bringing the dark art of compensation into the light by helping more than 6,500 businesses to stay competitive in the labor market and retain and manage their largest investment: their people.
We’re disrupting the compensation industry and are looking to bring on talented professionals with diverse perspectives. We foster a playful work atmosphere where highly motivated individuals can be truly innovative. Are you bright, tenacious, and inventive? If so, PayScale may be the perfect place for you to grow your career!
We are a fast-growing Warburg Pincus portfolio company who is thrilled to have brought the MarketPay product into our suite of offerings in 2016, and started a strategic alliance with Mercer in 2017. We can't wait for you to join us!

Job Description
Does the opportunity to work with a truly unique compensation dataset that comprises nearly a third of the U.S. working population excite you? What about working on important issues like pay equity?
The Data team at Payscale works on a variety of different problems that have a direct impact on people's lives by improving compensation practices. We are a small team working on high impact projects that drive innovation in our customer facing products and across the organization. The Data team partners closely with data scientists, engineers, compensation professionals, product managers, and other internal stakeholders to design and develop the data sets that power our compensation tools.
What you’ll be doing:
Ensure the accuracy and quality of data sets by performing thorough and complex data analysis and validation
Provide internal and external client support on all data sets including, answering questions on data methodology, pulling sample data and compiling reports, creating data visualization dashboards, and joining client calls.
Own and drive various data analysis projects
Work with cross functional teams to provide assistance on or insight to ongoing data analysis projects
Understanding the ins and outs of our compensation datasets to become a subject matter expert on the various factors that influence pay.
Opportunities to collaborate with data scientists and data engineers to expand your data analytics toolkit.
Technology we use:
SQL, Snowflake, Tableau, Python (pandas, scikit-learn, NumPy, SpaCy, Git, JIRA, and Docker

Qualifications

1-3 years proven experience working with data
Excellent excel skills and are comfortable with advanced functions including v-lookups, experience writing macros a plus
A background in statistics, economics, mathematics or other related fields
An aptitude for data and experience writing well structured queries to get information from disparate datasets; experience writing SQL queries a plus.
Experience with Python or R
Experience with data visualization skills – Tableau experience preferred
Ability to effectively communicate and share results with both technical and non-technical partners.
Strong critical thinking, communication, and interpersonal skills.
A desire to be the best, with a positive work attitude and inquisitive nature. You will be working in a highly flexible and fast paced environment.
Additional Information
Benefits and Perks – The Highlights:
All around awesome culture where together we strive to:
Pursue excellence every day
Create customer value
Compete to win (and lose!) as a team
As part of our culture of transparency and commitment to employee engagement, we have several programs and resources such as:
Regular virtual company meetings
Coffee chats
Table for 4 Executive conversation
Spirit Week
Pulsing tools for continuous conversations to drive performance and career growth
Strengths based tools designed to help employees engage with peers and managers, supported through a program called StandOut
Access to top notch learning courses for all employees through LinkedIn Learning
As well as constant re-evaluation of what our employees need to be successful at work!
Our more standard benefits include:
Flexible Paid Time Off program – most employees average around 3 weeks per year
14 paid holidays including Independence Week, Juneteenth and World Mental Health Day
3 comprehensive health plans to fit your unique needs; plans have up to 100% company-paid premium coverage for employee Medical, Dental and Vision
Access to Premera’s Healthcare Services including an Employee Assistance Program (EAP), 24-hour Nurse Hotline, Telehealth (Doctor on Demand), Talkspace, and other virtual care options
Flexible Spending Account (FSA) options for pre-tax employee allocations towards: Medical, Dependent Care, Parking, and Transit
Company Paid Short Term Disability, Long Term Disability, and Life Insurance
Comprehensive Paid Parental / Adoption Leave program
401k program with fully vested, immediate company match
PayScale provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. PayScale complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.

As a UW employee, you have a unique opportunity to change lives on our campuses, in our state and around the world. UW employees offer their boundless energy, creative problem solving skills and dedication to build stronger minds and a healthier world. UW is Committed to attracting and retaining a diverse staff, your experiences, perspectives and unique identities will be honored at the University of Washington. Together, our community strives to create and maintain working and learning environments that are inclusive, equitable, and welcoming.


UW faculty and staff also enjoy outstanding benefits, professional growth opportunities and unique resources in an environment noted for diversity, intellectual excitement, artistic pursuits and natural beauty. All of which has allowed the UW to be nationally recognized as a “Great College to Work For” for six consecutive years.


UW-IT is the central IT organization for the University of Washington, providing technology solutions to all three campuses, UW medical centers and global research operations. UW-IT collaborates with University partners to advance teaching, learning, innovation and discovery at the UW. UW-IT is currently looking for a Business Analyst who will support the UW-IT work on Finance Transformation, the University’s large scale project to modernize its finance operations, business systems and processes. The position is a role in the newly established UW-IT FT program (ITF).


The Business Analyst will perform detailed requirements analysis, document business processes, and identify areas for improvement. Working in a team with other analysts, this position will participate in best practices and processes for business analysis. This position must work with and influence decisions across multiple teams, including: teams responsible for legacy systems, enterprise IT services, and integrations; the UW’s Finance Transformation program; and partner IT and business units at the UW.


REQUIREMENTS:

Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Information Science, Computer Science or related area or experience.

Minimum of four years of experience performing progressively more complex work in business analysis.

Demonstrated experience in business analysis and requirements gathering.

Demonstrated collaboration skills with colleagues at all levels and across different organizations.

Demonstrated ability to work independently and with minimal supervision.

Experience facilitating meetings, constructively addressing input and criticism, and resolving conflicts.

Effectively presents complex technical material to non-technical audiences in an approachable way.

About JLL –
We’re JLL—a leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We have operations in over 80 countries and a workforce of over 91,000 individuals around the world who help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. As a global Fortune 500 company, we also have an inherent responsibility to drive sustainability and corporate social responsibility. That’s why we’re committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. We’re using the most advanced technology to create rewarding opportunities, amazing spaces and sustainable real estate solutions for our clients, our people and our communities.
Our core values of teamwork, ethics and excellence are also fundamental to everything we do and we’re honored to be recognized with awards for our success by organizations both globally and locally.
Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where we all feel welcomed, valued and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are today and where we’re headed in the future. And we know that unique backgrounds, experiences and perspectives help us think bigger, spark innovation and succeed together.
If this job description resonates with you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet all of the requirements below. We’re interested in getting to know you and what you bring to the table!
Job Description
We are seeking an Analyst to join our successful Technology Real Estate Team in Seattle. The analyst’s primary responsibilities will be to track and analyze the Global data center / telecom real estate market with a focus on data center and telecom data analytics and developing content through several mediums, primarily ArcGIS. Specifically, a successful candidate will be expected to contribute to the team through Data Visualization and Validation, GIS Mapping, Client PowerPoint Deliverables, Operational and Administrative functions, and Integration and Maintenance of our Clients' data. This position will work closely with the brokerage team, the team’s clients, and research colleagues, in the Seattle market, as well as with research and brokerage colleagues both regionally, nationally, and globally.

GIS & Data Analyst Overall objectives:
Continually develop and enhance new methodologies and quantitative approaches to analyzing commercial real estate data and demographics related to the medical office market.
Proactively deliver interactive mapping solutions using Esri products (primarily ArcGIS) and manage information and insights through Tableau, with a focus on data center and telecom activity, trends and forecasts, as well as economic and demographics activity
Expand the research platform’s processes, products, and ability to positively impact the business by generating content and insights using new technologies and methodologies
Work with research colleagues and brokerage leaders to contribute to business development efforts and grow the business
Assist on projects from initial debrief to finished product with significant self-direction and limited oversight.

Specific responsibilities:
Interpreting data and information and creating innovative ways to present and visualize.
Deliver interactive mapping solutions using Esri products and provide subject matter expertise on ArcGIS to the brokerage team
Using, or willingness to learn, code for map building.
Facilitate the use of research and ArcGIS as a differentiator when client facing and supporting business development efforts
Develop content through Tableau, ArcGIS, PowerPoint and other data visualization products that leverages market research data and quantitative findings, working on projects independently and in partnership with team leaders
In partnership with research colleagues, track tenant, investor, development, and demographics activity globally on a market by market basis
Develop new methodologies for leveraging and analyzing quantitative data, including lease transactions, to identify trends, insights, and forecasts
High-level analytical and problem-solving skills and strategic-thinking capacity
Work with other colleagues to use ArcGIS as a client deliverable, information storing medium via JLL software.

Experience and qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in geography, GIS, urban planning, Data Management, or relatable corporate experience and strong academic performance required
Advanced proficiency with technology, including: The Esri platform: ArcMap/ArcGIS Pro, ArcGIS Online, and ArcGIS applications
Expertise with other data analytics tools, and data visualization applications, such as Tableau
Microsoft Office Suite (includes Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, OneNote and Word)
Data management in Excel a high priority

Demonstrated passion in real estate with a strong commitment to learning micro- and macro-level market dynamics. While previous commercial real estate experience is ideal, it is not required.
Strong quantitative skillset with ability to identify new insights and trends through data analytics
Strong attention to detail and data verification skills required: validating data points, spotting inaccuracies or errors
Collaborative attitude and willingness to both work independently and as part of a dynamic team
Ability to multitask and effectively manage time and workload in a fast-paced environment
Strong written and oral communication skills required
Willingness to learn
This will be an on site position
Positive, winning attitude
What you can expect from us
We succeed together and believe the best inspire the best, so we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our success.
Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your career ambitions, recognizing your contributions, investing in your well-being and providing competitive benefits and pay.
We can’t wait to see where your ambitions take you at JLL. Apply today!

Team player with strong interpersonal skills and ability to build effective working relationships throughout all levels of the organization

Solution-focused

Data and Analytics Engineering (DAE) Senior Data Analysts profile, define, and catalog analytical data structures, messages, and databases to enable translation of complex business data into usable computer systems. Senior Data Analysts work with data modelers, data stewards, engineers and data architects to profile data and assist with designing databases and data structures that meet organizational needs using data models. They support the creation of data models and data catalogs designed to improve efficiency and business value and may focus on issues such as reducing data redundancy, improving data quality or improving data movement across systems.
An ideal DAE Senior Data Analyst is an analytical and creative thinker who is not intimidated by roadblocks and challenges. They understand how to successfully evaluate problems and develop appropriate solutions. Senior Data Analysts perform well under pressure, possessing great focus while completing projects efficiently. They should be able to work well as part of a team, but also carry responsibility for their own work. Senior Data Analysts also need to be able to work on multiple projects at a time, with the ability to quickly understand and incorporate new technologies.
What you will do:
Work with the Data Stewards, Data Modelers, Data Architects, DAE and Application Development teams to profile data and translate business needs into practical data definitions
Support the creation of Conceptual Data Models for multiple domains within our Canonical Model
Support the creation of Physical Data Models using Data Vault 2.0 for our datalake and data warehouse aligned to the canonical model
Lead and facilitate requirements and data characteristics gathering sessions
Support modeling teams with table creation and development team mentoring
Support the creation and oversight of data governance policies and processes
Contribute policies and guidelines for the governance of Data Management standards and best practices
Understand and document how data is, or will be used, and its implications on people, processes, products and technology
What you will need:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or similar
Experience in insurance industry
2+ years experience with Erwin modeling tool
Prior experience with Snowflake or similar SaaS offering
3+ years experience with cloud-based Data Warehouse and Data Lake environments
Previous experience translating business requirements into Data Profiles, Conceptual models and Data Catalogs
3+ years experience with SQL
Must be able to work independently and collaboratively on large scale data projects
Experience in these areas is a Plus:
Prior experience modeling using Data Vault 2.0
Previous experience supporting the modeling of an enterprise canonical model
Has worked with industry standard ACORD model
Experience with ETL tools such as Informatica or Snaplogic
Exposure to Business Intelligence tools (PowerBI, MicroStrategy)
Exposure with messaging solution like Kafka and MQ
Experience in Enterprise reference and master data management strategies

Creating insights to revolutionize an industry
The Opportunity:

Fast, accurate insights are integral in allowing us to fulfill our mission of fixing the user experience in global trade. At Flexport you'll conduct analyses that are at the forefront of reshaping the entire logistics & supply chain industries. You'll work alongside self-starters interested in solving real-world problems and streamlining the inefficiencies in the complex global trade industry. You'll have the opportunity to improve an industry by analyzing the new operating system for global trade.

You will:
Flexport is a company that runs on data - you'll be transforming data into action by working cross-functionally with the entirety of Flexport
Meet with business stakeholders, understand business requirements, and use your analytic mindset to implement solutions ranging from process improvements to dashboards. Our mantra is to make sure everyone is working smarter rather than just harder
Provide reports, analyses, and data-driven insights on key sales drivers, progress to plan, and results to key stakeholders.
Develop LookML in our reporting system via the Looker Developer user interface
Write SQL tests for LookML to ensure the quality of our reporting system.
Maintain or update small SQL pipelines written in DBT
Implement metric calculations with an eye towards accuracy and maintainability
Write high quality metric and report documentation that enhances trust and transparency in the company's reporting system
You should have:
Bachelors in Business, Statistics, Engineering, or another quantitative discipline
1+ years of experience using SQL in a professional environment
Experience building dashboards - you know the trade-offs and impacts of using one metric versus another
Ideally experience working within JIRA, Looker, Snowflake, and DBT #LI-LB1
About Flexport:

We believe global trade can move the human race forward. That's why it's our mission to make global trade easier for everyone. We aim to do this by building the Operating System for Global trade - a strategic model combining advanced technology and data analytics, logistics infrastructure, and supply chain expertise. Flexport today connects almost 10,000 clients and suppliers across 109 countries, including established global brands like Georgia-Pacific as well as emerging innovators like Sonos. Started in 2013, we've raised over $1.3B in funding from SoftBank Vision Fund, Founders Fund, GV, First Round Capital and Y Combinator. We're excited about the three big ways we're moving forward after our recent $1B investment from SoftBank Vision Fund in February 2019.

Worried about not having any freight forwarding experience?
Don't be! We're building the first Operating System for Global Trade. That's why it's incredibly important for us to bring people from diverse backgrounds and experiences together with our industry veterans to help move the freight forwarding industry forward.
What's freight forwarding and why does it matter? Freight forwarding is the coordination and shipment of goods from one place to another and it's what makes global trade possible. Flexport is on a mission to make global trade easier for everyone because we believe it can help connect the world and break down economic barriers.
We know this industry is complex. That's why we invest in education starting day one with Flexport Academy, a one week intensive onboarding program designed specifically to set every new Flexport employee up for success.

At Flexport, our ability to fulfill our mission of making global trade easy for everyone relies on having a diverse, dedicated and engaged workforce. That is why Flexport is committed to creating and nurturing an environment where anyone can be their authentic self. Description:
Providence St. Joseph Health is calling a Senior EMR Business Intelligence Analyst to one of our locations in the Seattle, Portland, or Los Angeles area.
We are seeking a Senior EMR Business Intelligence Analyst who will be accountable for delivering standard reporting and data and analytics solutions for EMR users across Ptovidence and our Community Connect clients. This position will support major Epic initiatives, including go lives, new implementations, upgrades and optimizations; as well as support legacy EMRs for new affiliations pending Epic go lives. This position will work closely with the Epic Applications and Informatics teams to ensure a seamless end user experience for their data and analytics needs. This position will also work closely with the end user to understand their business requirements, and provide high quality and relevant data solutions.
In this position you will have the following responsibilities:
Develop and maintain standard reporting and data and analytics solutions utilizing primarily Oracle SQL, Business Objects, and Toad. Requires understanding of full HI offerings (SQL Developer, Tableau, SAP HANA) to ensure duplicative solutions are not provided, and existing HI offerings are leveraged.
Work closely with the end user to define requirements, understanding what is needed to answer the business question (which may be different from what is asked). Demonstrate an open willingness to listen and learn clinical or business needs, then create standard reports or other data and analytics solutions that are of excellent quality (as measured by SQL performance, data integrity, and following HI coding standards).
Articulate key process flows and stakeholders; describe and manipulate data sets, sources and structures; gather requirements and manage multiple inputs and priorities; and develop reporting or other data solutions to make data more meaningful to business initiatives. Analyze data quantitatively and qualitatively and communicate findings; identify root cause of problems with reports or data sets within the domain; and collaborate on data quality conditions and monitoring with domain business subject matter experts.
Develop a deep understanding of Epic capabilities and functionality through study and certification, but also through embedding with business units or leaders as appropriate. Understand what insight can and should be provided through Reporting Workbench, to avoid duplicative solutions.
Periodically review and update standard reporting or other EMR delivered solutions, reviewing usage of the reports, optimizing for performance, retiring dated content to ensure continued relevance and tracking with regulatory, environmental and business changes.
Understand Epic Clinical Optimization projects, and provide data and analytics support as appropriate.
Analyze information in the reports developed to identify issues, trends, or interesting findings to be shared with the business customer. Help the business customer interpret and understand data in reports and how to apply them in improving patient care.
Provide training on standard EMR reporting and data and analytics solutions. Mentor other analysts to share knowledge and improve business understanding and technical skills.
Develop a fluency in the HI 1-page summary to fully understand the scope of HI delivered solutions.
Qualifications:
Required qualifications for this position include:
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Public Health, Business Management, Information Services or equivalent education/experience.
5 years Healthcare setting or related field.
5 years Relational databases, automated reporting tools.
5 years SQL.
5 years Epic Certification, or other relevant EMR certifications.
Preferred qualifications for this position include:
Master's Degree in Computer Science, Public Health, Business Management, Information Services.
5 years Clinical, financial, or operational experience.

Job Description
Princess Cruises, Holland America Line, Seabourn and P&O Cruises Australia, united as Holland America Group, offering world-renown vacations at sea to travelers around the globe, are building a dynamic, unified organization to serve its highly experienced teams in both our corporate offices and on board our ships.
While cruising paused worldwide, we laid the groundwork to take our brands to even greater success, with fresh perspectives and new ways of working. We’re looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to help lead our efforts in providing quality assurance activities on reports and information delivered to internal organizations through an understanding of the business functions of the sources of information, including the testing, and maintenance of production reporting, as well as the creation of ad hoc reporting necessary for business decision-making. The Analyst conducts research and analysis in support of company business decisions. Additionally, this individual will help in projects in the areas of data migration, data management, data clean up, and quality.

The Business Intelligence Analyst will work with teams across Holland America Group, with reporting offices in Santa Clarita, CA, and Seattle, WA, we’re looking for amazing humans across the country for this role. HA Group offers strong compensation and outstanding benefits including cruise travel.
Here’s a summary of what Holland America Group is looking for in its Business Intelligence Analyst. Is this you?

Conduct testing of data for accuracy for reports in development as well as trouble shooting production reports.
Prepares morning, weekly, and monthly reports, identifies changes with large revenue impacts and ensures data accuracy
Performs Ad hoc reporting as needed utilizing Excel, Power Pivot, SQL, and Tableau
Conducts research and analysis in support of company business decisions
Make recommendations for new analytical and detail reporting solutions or modifications to existing reporting solutions.
Partners with IT to maintain reporting applications for user groups.
Participates in corporate planning and applies appropriate quality assurance practices.
Maintain effective relationships with user department personnel.

Requirements
B.S. or B.A. degree in Business, Computer Sciences or related technical field plus 3 years or Master’s degree in Business, Computer Sciences or related technical field.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel
Experience with databases querying tools, such as Oracle SQL, SQL, Power BI, Power Pivot, or Tableau a plus
Experience with Report tools such as SSRS, Hyperion, Crystal Reports, Power BI, Tableau, or Power View.
Must be very detail oriented and accurate
Familiarity with revenue management concepts and/or prior revenue management or sales experience, especially in the travel industry
Strong analytical, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills.
Ability to clearly communicate and interact with multiple departments at all levels.
Ability to manage multiple projects independently
Requires a strong combination of data and information analysis skills and must be able to communicate effectively to department management

NEP is currently seeking a dynamic individual to become part of our Analytics team as a Data Analyst.

Uses Structured Query Language (SQL) to gather and assess data from the reporting database, transactional database, operational data store, and external systems to assist university leadership in decision making.

Continually researches and identifies best practices for business data analysis via published literature, formalized training and professional development efforts.
Authenticates and interprets data based on results using a variety of techniques, ranging from simple data aggregation via statistical analysis to complex data mining.

Reasonable and consistent attendance to fulfill requirements of the position

Expert in SQL query writing.

Work with senior leadership to create and analyze reports and ad hoc data requests for decision making.
Ability to work in a team-oriented environment.
Ability to communicate clearly to a variety of constituents in both verbal and written communication.
Ability to work remotely, and be available during Arizona time zone hours.
Attention to detail, highly organized, and ability to execute multiple initiatives within budgeted timeframes. Proficient with Microsoft Word and other applications in the Microsoft Office suite

Bachelor's degree with focus in business or related field required
Minimum of 2-3 years of experience conducting data analyses, developing metrics, and creating reports required
1-2 years working with Visualizations tools such as Tableau, Birst, PowerBI
Proficient in query design, generation, and reporting; SQL and SSRS (2008 SQL Server Reporting Services) required.
1-2 years working with AWS S3, Redshift, and other cloud vendors.
Experience with the online delivery of education preferred.
Experience in higher education preferred
Experience working in a technology-driven enterprise preferred
All skills, abilities and education will be considered for minimum qualifications
Working Conditions
This position operates in a remote home office. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.
Good working environment with the absence of disagreeable conditions.
The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.
Regular and reliable attendance is required.

The position can reside in the Dallas, Houston, Los Angeles, New York, or Washington, D.C. office and will be responsible for providing in-depth analysis of diversity data in support of the firm’s diversity, equity and inclusion programs, initiatives, committees and groups. The DEI Data Analyst is expected to perform all responsibilities with a commitment to providing superior service to the firm’s attorneys, advisors and staff, producing quality work product, and maintaining an atmosphere of teamwork and continuous improvement.

Key responsibilities of this position include:

Serve as the primary contact for DE&I data reporting, as requested
Create, analyze and assess data trends to provide insights and measure the effectiveness of the firm’s DE&I strategy
Source and provide data for client surveys, firm management and industry surveys, data requests, RFPs and client reports
Develop tracking methods to effectively measure DE&I progress, report progress and help ensure goals are achieved
Support the DE&I efforts across the firm by providing administrative support to firmwide resource groups, to build engagement, support associate development and ensure consistency across the enterprise
Provide data insights and recommendations to support Recruiting, Attorney Development, Alumni Relations, Practice Management, Client Development, and the DE&I team
Track and update key industry benchmarks
Survey firm attorneys from time to time and compile and analyze the results
Analyze and track annual spend according to office and resource group
Provide project management assistance for select initiatives promoted by the firm’s resource groups and diversity, equity and inclusion councils
Research emerging trends in the legal field, leading issues that impact diversity, equity and inclusion as it relates to individual, social and cultural identity
Special projects and duties as assigned

Qualifications (Experience, Knowledge, Skills & Abilities):

Bachelor’s degree required
Minimum of four years related experience in a law firm, government agency, or professional services organization desired
Demonstrated experience performing detailed data analysis
Demonstrated experience in using tools such as Microsoft Power BI to enable engaging data visualizations
Ability to be flexible to work overtime as needed, including being accessible outside of typical business hours
Excellent interpersonal skills
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Very strong proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, including Word, Outlook, PowerPoint and Excel, familiarity with Power BI a plus.
Strong service orientation and an ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with peers; attorneys; office, firm and practice management; and outside business partners
Ability to work effectively and efficiently under pressure
Ability to manage multiple projects with specific deadlines and adjust to changing priorities in a professional manner
Strong organizational and project management skills
Ability to use initiative and independent judgment to accomplish results
Demonstrated judgment, discretion and tact
Ability to work independently and with a team
Ability to manage resources effectively
Ability to read, comprehend and follow instructions
Unfailing attention to detail
Ability to use critique of work to improve performance
Commitment to professional growth and development
