This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. In 2018, Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals.


Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”.


The Ecommerce Services Management team is highly visible and critical to the success of our multi-billion dollar website business by enabling Costco’s current and future growth plans. This team works closely with external vendors and internal IT teams to establish, drive and ensure that our service level objectives are met and effectively improve service uptime and performance.

The Functional Analyst for Ecommerce Services Management will partner with various teams to gather and analyze data and determine actionable insights to facilitate discussions around risks, priorities, and investment targets. Success requires the ability to visualize and develop accurate and meaningful dashboards for key stakeholders, including trend identification, metric definition and the related efforts to decrease service disruption. Additionally this role will own the successful measurement of service targets ensuring provisions for accountability of vendors is documented in their contracts. Follow up on these contractual and fiduciary obligations in the event of an exceeded error budget is critical. This individual must enjoy problem-solving for others across a wide variety of business areas and have an enthusiasm for Costco’s success.

If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined.

ROLE

Extracts and formats data to perform analysis and to identify anomalies to determine data patterns.
Creates accessible visualizations that quickly and clearly communicate their intent.
Identifies areas where data analysis could reveal hidden value and work with management to explore it.
Performs data analysis to support and move forward any area of Costco’s Ecommerce business.
Identifies and documents incident and problem trends and progress in relation to vendor services.
Provides contract knowledge and drives ongoing value from the supplier through contract negotiations, changes, reviews and terminations. Ensures supplier's contractual compliance.
Works with Ecommerce IT Management on contract requests, revisions, and extensions, ensuring they align with projected forecasts for each vendor.
Coordinates with the IT Business teams to ensure timeliness of contract execution and financial payment.
Makes effective use of mathematical and statistical techniques to analyze and interpret data.
Communicates with internal clients, peers and management to understand clear scope for all requests.
Ensures timely, clear communication regarding high priority issues with the appropriate stakeholders.
Creates executive level dashboards and presentations to represent the state of Ecom Services Management.
Develops reports and dashboards in ServiceNow for the purpose of extraction, sharing or presentation.
Presents findings and recommendations to business users in clear terms with meaningful interpretation and actionable insights.
Collaborates with appropriate business and IT stakeholders to determine root cause and problem identification and as appropriate, enhancement identification for future development work.
Ensures solutions follow development life cycle, conforming to requirements and quality standards.
Defines, captures, and validates IT requirements and other artifacts, ensuring appropriate stakeholders are involved.
Provides technical assistance and troubleshooting by effectively responding to inquiries.
Analyzes internal IS customer needs and priorities, and initiates delivery efforts.
Documents and manages risks, issues, assumptions and constraints impacting delivery efforts.
Develops and coordinates legal/compliance, operational controls and associated metrics to measure success.
Develops and implements standards, processes, and procedures for new technology solutions to ensure newer solutions will not negatively impact current service commitments.
Participates in periodic audits for solutions, planning and delivery functions.

REQUIRED

5+ years’ experience understanding trends in data sets and leveraging key data points to drive decision-making.
3+ years’ experience with monitoring tools such as Splunk, Tivoli, and Dynatrace.
3+ year’ experience automating toil in IT environments using scripting languages; Powershell, Bash.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills with the ability to effectively negotiate with other teams to create a mutually beneficial solution.
Experience with negotiating and managing supplier contracts.
Able to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Ability to think creatively in order to logically envision relationships between data.
Detail-oriented and strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze a situation for potential future problems.
Experience deriving insights from data, thinking creatively to logically envision relationships between data.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, interacting across multiple departments and levels within Costco.
Able to communicate technical information in a layman’s terms through summaries, presentations, lay terms, graphs, etc.
Proven ability to handle diverse projects at once and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment with shifting priorities.
Resourceful, self-motivated and accountable team player with a constructive attitude.
The ability to quickly learn new technology, dedication to developing deep knowledge of available data and data tools, while managing multiple efforts is required.
Ability to conduct monthly meetings with stakeholders to drive increased availability in identified trends.
Intellectually inquisitive nature with the ability to be open minded to varying opinions.
Innovative, creative, and extremely responsive in respect to service quality and ways in which it can be improved.
Highly responsive and available to support business needs, flexing as needed.
Good understanding of corporate IT policies, procedures, and standards.
Knowledge of:
IT strategies, customers, and services provided.
Costco’s core business environment related to Ecommerce, Merchandising, Warehouse Operations, and company philosophies.
Service analysis and other tools: ServiceNow, Google Apps, Smartsheets.

Recommended
At least 8 years’ professional experience working with business teams to provide actionable insights from data via reporting, presentations and dashboarding.
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience in Data Science, Analytics, Marketing or similar disciplines.
Familiarity with multiple Costco business areas from an IT perspective.
Experience developing reports and dashboards in Ecommerce domains.
Strong understanding of current trends in data analysis and visualization.
Successful internal candidates will have spent one year or more on their current team.
Understanding of Agile contracts.

Cover Letter
Resume

The Seattle Cancer Care Alliance (SCCA), located in Seattle, Washington, is part of a dynamic collaboration among three organizations known nationally and internationally for their patient care and research: Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research Center, University of Washington, and Seattle Children's. Over the past 25 years, these institutions have worked together to support their mission of adult and pediatric oncology patient care services, research and education.

Support initiatives to improve workflows with data analysis

MS PowerPoint and MS Word proficient

Job Description Summary:
This job role supports State Portfolio Business Analysts serve as a business partner with the Director, Portfolio Management, Portfolio Managers, Director and Managers, Sales Finance for Washington and/or Oregon. Duties would include various key responsibilities which are directly related to supplier relations.
Job Description:
Job duties for this role include supporting the Portfolio Managers and Director, Portfolio Management in managing the portfolio of designated suppliers including various key responsibilities which are directly related to supplier relations and performance tracking in Washington and/or Oregon.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Maintains and updates reports on sales and distribution programs and confirms the accuracy of the required reports.
Tracks sales incentives and recaps at the end of each program period.
Supports Portfolio Management team with reports and data for all supplier review meetings, planning meetings, etc.
Coordinates and/or manages all pre-sells, holiday VAP orders, specialty and a llocated i tems once Portfolio Managers have determined the proper distribution levels.
Maintain current sell sheets in box and other electronic filing systems.
Review backorder report and other inventory management tools daily to identify inventory issues and opportunities. Communicates any issues timely and with a sense of urgency to the appropriate chain of command.
Identifies sales opportunities through analysis of categories, trends, price categories, etc.
Participate in supplier review meetings, when needed and assists in providing written meeting recaps and in communicating follow-up steps internally and externally.
Assist in coordinating new item set up and launches for sales divisions.
Help to maintain current list of supplier portfolio contacts.
Manage applicable workflows, standard of operations and appropriate record keeping for compliance.
Attend meetings with sales leadership and assigned suppliers, when needed. May participate in budget or KPI reviews when needed.
Assist in the identification of real and potential portfolio problems and help troubleshoot issues for solutions.
Carry out responsibilities in accordance with all company policies and applicable laws.
Perform other related duties and responsibilities as needed or as assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s degree from a four-year college or university is preferred.
2 or more years of related analyst experience is required.
At least one year of experience in the beverage alcohol industry is preferred.
Strong Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint skills required. Experience with manipulating large amounts of data as well as the ability to quickly learn new systems/tools is necessary.
Knowledge of and basic skill working with Oracle is highly preferred.
Experience with supply chain software is necessary. Familiarity with Demantra is preferred.
DISCLAIMER:
The above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.
EOE/Minorities/Females/Vet/Disability
Enjoy a career with us!

We Are:
As part of our Data & AI, you will lead technology innovation for our clients through robust delivery of world-class solutions. You will build better software better! There will never be a typical day and that’s why people love it here. The opportunities to make a difference within exciting client initiatives are unlimited in the ever-changing technology landscape. You will be part of a highly collaborative and growing network of technology and data experts, who are taking on today’s biggest, most complex business challenges using the latest data and analytics technologies. We will nurture your talent in an inclusive culture that values diversity. You will have an opportunity to work in roles such as Data Scientist, Data Engineer, or Chief Data Officer covering all aspects of Data including Data Management, Data Governance, Data Intelligence, Knowledge Graphs, and IoT. Come grow your career in Technology at Accenture!
You Are:
A Business Intelligence pro with a talent for blending creativity, critical thinking, and strategy to help clients visualize their data. You build and deliver solutions that collect, transform, analyze, and report data, and you provide key knowledge and value at different levels—strategic and tactical as well as operational. You’re in your element in a team setting where you can use your formidable creative and analytical powers to crush problems. Communication and people skills You have both in spades, along with strong leadership chops. Working in an information systems environment makes you more than happy.
The Work:
Answer client’s business questions by dissecting their data, using measurement techniques, drafting KPIs, and building reports and dashboards.Collaborate with clients and team members on data visualizations using tools such as Tableau, Qlik, IBM Cognos, Plotly, and Kibana, per clients’ needs.Generate requirements for application designs while pinpointing the best type of visualization to meet your client’s needs.Build and test functional prototypes for BI, data discovery, and analytics solutions.Run data and dashboard quality assurance throughout the design phase in collaboration with your team.Build dashboard automation processes and pull together and deliver presentations based on your findings.Work together with IT Architects, BI analysts, database developers, application developers, and functional practitioners, as well as with clients/partners.

What You Need:
Minimum of 2 years of combined data, analytics and strategic consulting experience
Minimum of 2 years of analytical delivery platform implementation experience
Minimum of 2 years of experience one or more of the following areas:
Minimum of two years of experience one or more of the following areas:
Business Translator (identifying business problem, initiative, analytics intervention, data scientist management, data science interpretation, storytelling)
Analytics led Performance models (spanning multi-functions with direct/ indirect causality, used to inform strategic and operational planning and decision making)
Data & Analytics Transformation (current state assessment, strategy development, value case, roadmap, and blueprint)
Process Automation, Machine Learning, and Artificial Intelligence practices (knowledge of how advancing digital tools and techniques are applied in enterprise data and analytics strategies and roadmaps)
A Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience (12 years) or an Associate’s Degree with 6 years of work experience
Bonus points if you have:
Experience with any cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP) is a strong plus
Create a value chain to help address the challenges of acquiring data, evaluating its value, distilling & analyzing.
Lead data modeling activities to capture and model data requirements, business rules, and logical and physical models
Examine data from multiple sources, and share insights which provide competitive advantage

Egencia Commercial Analytics team is seeking a talented candidate for the role of Data Scientist. Using advance analytical techniques, the role will support our finance team through critical projects and influence decisions based on data and analyses to help achieve mainly internal Stakeholder’s objectives.
The lead analyst will have prior experience working through complex business problems and partnering with internal stakeholders using a consultative approach. This position will need to be comfortable working with ambiguity and have the ability to define, think creatively, and to solve problems and propose solutions.
The lead Analyst has excellent communication and relationship building skills from stakeholders up to executive level. This role represents an exciting opportunity to join Egencia, the fast-growing leader in the B2B travel space.
Job Description
Core Duties and Responsibilities
Passionate about story-telling and bringing date to live. Work closely with stakeholders to collect project requirements and built prototypes of dashboards to show proof of concepts and new methodologies for succinct business story telling through data.
Apply fundamental machine learning models, advanced analytics techniques and statistical methods to solve business problems.
Pick analytically valid approaches, appropriate in terms of level of effort, favouring iterative delivery that solves for the objective, not just the ask (i.e. not just order-taking).
You will help design and build models to prioritize and classify critical touch points along the client journey in order to maximize internal guidance and prioritization.
Influence partners and senior leaders through communicating across various levels of the organization in a clear and compelling way.
You will work closely with finance to understand metric movements, financial solutions, forecasting variance and key business end-to-end monitoring.
Financial analytic projects could include: Client retention, client behaviors and segmentation, contract and pricing strategies, or trading performance.
Required Skills/Knowledge/Experience
MSc or PhD degree in any of the following fields: machine learning or computer science, statistics, mathematics with strong understating of machine learning components.
The applicant should have at least 4-5 years of work experience in a business environment.
Display a true passion for data, analytics, and solving complex business hypothesis and possess a strong commercial acumen.
Strong SQL skills and working with large datasets; demonstrated experience of using Python or R (or similar) to structure, transform and visualize big data, and a willingness to learn new frameworks and languages required for the task.
Able to perform in a fast-paced environment and be comfortable with ambiguity. A sharp focus on results and strong attention to detail.
Able to structure / work on data exploration problems, with innovative approaches and creative solutions, bringing to bear strong reporting and data visualization skills
Excellent verbal, written communication, and data presentation skills

Expedia Group (NASDAQ: EXPE) powers travel for everyone, everywhere through our global platform. Driven by the core belief that travel is a force for good, we help people experience the world in new ways and build lasting connections. This role offers analytically-minded candidates the opportunity to be a part of one of T-Mobile’s fastest-growing divisions—T-Mobile for Business. As a Sr. Analyst of Data Quality and Governance, you will collaborate with TFB Analytics and Reporting, TFB Operations, and our Enterprise Technology Services teams to:
Identify and explore data sources
Align proposed changes to application data models with the enterprise data model
Design source system data transformations for the data warehouse,
Research data quality issues, identify root causes, engage with system, process, and data owners to apply corrective actions
Develop and maintain monitoring reports and processes to measure and maintain data quality across key systems and the data warehouse
Document your findings and propose updates to data models and data dictionaries
You will work closely with the data warehouse development team to ensure data quality is a foundational component of the ongoing DWH, Data Mart, and Data Cube operations. You must be experienced at querying, exploring and ingesting data from a wide variety of data platforms (including Oracle, Microsoft SQL and Azure, Teradata, and Salesforce.com) and query languages (various forms of SQL, SOQL, and APIs), using Azure Data Factory or Databricks (Data Flow and pySpark), often in the absence of a complete data dictionary. This role reports to the Sr. Manager, Business Analysis on the Data Governance & Platforms team.
At least 18 years of age
Legally authorized to work in the United States
High School Diploma or GED
T-Mobile requires all employees in this position to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 prior to starting work. The CDC defines "fully vaccinated" as two weeks after the second dose for Pfizer and Moderna, and two weeks after the single dose of Johnson & Johnson. T-Mobile will require proof of vaccination and consider requests for exemption from this requirement during the offer phase as a reasonable accommodation for medical reasons or sincerely held religious beliefs where the accommodation would not cause T-Mobile undue hardship or pose a direct threat to the health and safety of others.
Minimum 4-7 years’ experience with SQL (Transact-SQL preferred), designing and implementing ETL for Data Warehousing (preferably Databricks, but SSIS experience acceptable), and metrics reporting.
Highly proficient in SQL and direct work experience with pySpark, python, or other scripting languages. Must be willing to become proficient in pySpark and Databricks.
Proficiency and direct work experience with PowerBI for data visualization development (report development).
Have a solid understanding of Data Quality and Data Modeling concepts.
Excellent communication skills with experience collaborating with various functional teams.
Proficient in Microsoft Office.
Bachelor’s degree or professional equivalent required.
At least 18 years of age.
Legally authorized to work in the United States.
Desire to learn.
Desired
Cross-functional collaboration with sales operations, commissioning, marketing, and/or billing data.
Technical writing experience and skills in producing clear deliverables.
Identify source systems and explore application data structures.
Explore, understand, and document the processes and context by which the data is generated, stored, maintained, moved, transformed, and combined to capture data lineage and business rules, assure proper interpretation, and maintain data quality.
Design and implement business rules and transformations to incorporate source system data into the data warehouse, data marts, and analytical cubes to support business metrics and analysis.
Write ETL, scripts, etc. within the Databricks environment using pySpark and SQL, queries to evaluate, explore and validate the data to identify issues and root causes, and ensure data quality requirements are met.
Validate transformations (ETL) and the objects built in the data warehouse and track data quality issues to resolution.
Establish data quality metrics and targets, develop data quality dashboards in Power BI, and establish monitoring and corrective actions processes to maintain data quality metrics.
Develop and maintain positive working relationships with partner teams in a collaborative team environment, especially when engaging system, process, and data owners, to “own” data quality and take corrective action.
Track and report progress against data quality metrics and goals.
Develop and maintain documentation on data quality approaches, metrics, and processes.

Virtuoso is the leading global travel agency network specializing in luxury and experiential travel. We bring together 20,000 of the world's most sought-after travel advisors and more than 2,000 elite travel companies, from five-star hotel groups and renowned cruise lines to boutique properties and high-end adventure travel outfitters around the world. Whether in the pages of Virtuoso Life magazine, on Virtuoso.com, in e-mail newsletters, or across social media, our goal is to inspire people to travel Virtuoso-style, with the help of a Virtuoso travel advisor and Virtuoso-preferred partners.
Position Summary: Position is responsible for providing data analysis, data visualization and data modeling. This role works in partnership across the organization to provide key insights which inform marketing strategies while also providing tangible/sharable performance results to customers ("members" and "partners") who seek to understand the value of their investments in Virtuoso. Additionally, this position will illuminate and share consumer/traveler insights and trends which can directly inform CRM to increase marketing effectiveness for Virtuoso and its customers.
As a matrixed role, this position works in very close collaboration with the Business Intelligence team while focusing on proactively providing insights that drive increasingly effective marketing outcomes.
Primary Duties & Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
Provide advanced data analysis to inform marketing strategies that engage and motivate travelers to use Virtuoso advisors and preferred partner products which in turn drive increased partner (travel supplier) and member (travel agency/advisors) engagement
Combine data sources to discover insights, identify trends, and investigate anomalies.
Develop data visualizations using BI tools that inform business users of performance, opportunities and room for improvement across our product/marketing offering.
Support, deliver, and explain reporting across the business to inform users of how reports operate, what they are displaying, and what they mean.
Enable account managers and marketing team members to share key data insights and ROI analysis with customers
Work with complex projects and business requirements while making output user friendly and comprehensive.
Create effective ETL processes that combine data from multiple sources.
Perform ad-hoc analysis around all product types inside the Virtuoso network.
Identify and implement improvements to reporting processes.
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in any quantitative field (Business, Math, Finance, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.) or equivalent work experience.
2-4 years of related work experience
Skills, Abilities, Experience
Advanced data visualization tool knowledge (Domo, Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
Advanced SQL skills (MS SQL Server, Snowflake, etc.)
Proficiency in data analysis languages (Python, R, etc.)
Proficiency in web analytics tools (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, etc.)
Ability to build data models with high level strategic guidance
Forward thinking, curious, and creative
Able to lead projects
Aware of current business trend knowledge
Able to collect and analyze complex information, problem solve, and make decisions
Strong skills in inspiring the win-win-win
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively
Travel Requirements
Infrequent travel may be required to attend company events. (1-3 trips per year)
Travel will be primarily domestic but may include some international.
Type & Nature of Contacts
Internal: Key job contacts are primarily with director level staff and above outside of the job's immediate work unit/department.
External: Contact possible with members, partners, and outside vendors
We offer a competitive salary and full benefits package, including medical/dental/vision/life, a company matched 401(k) savings plan, and more. Virtuoso is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to promoting a diverse workforce.

Job description
We are looking for an experienced Forecasting & Data Analyst who is an expert in eCommerce retail space to join our remote team.
The ideal candidate for this position is an extremely accurate, organized and a detailed-oriented professional that knows how to clean, filter, and present data for actionable KPIs to support different departments. Our ideal Forecasting Data Analyst will have a background in e-commerce data analysis (particularly on Amazon seller central, Walmart, Shopify, eBay etc), be able to multi-task and manage large data sets in Excel. We are looking for someone who really enjoys mining for metrics and turning big data into real insights through visualizations like tables, graphs, and charts.
Job Responsibilities
Assist forecasts for all assigned processes with help of various statistical forecasting norms and business intelligence.
Prepare summaries of all items and evaluate all sales and forecast patterns. Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Create and implement databases for historical data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Strong analytical skills with the ability to accurately collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate large data sets of information into actionable KPIs with attention to detail and accuracy
Generating reports from single or multiple software systems or e-commerce portal platforms
Translate raw data into custom, non-technical presentations such as tables, graphs, and charts
Analyze and interpret all sales in its initial stage to ensure better quality of products and services.
Coordinate with purchasing and inventory teams to complete all orders and provide upgrades to the overall supply chain.
Perform regular analysis on various metrics such business seasonality, inventory and determine forecast presentation with accuracy.
Administer inventory required to reach all targets and improve all services and provide excellent forecasts.
Coordinate with various teams and gather and explain data from multiple sources to formulate future sales forecasts.
Supervise statistical accuracy of current and future forecasts and make adjustments according to market requirements.
Prepare an inventory and make future plans for programs for assigned product lines.
Provide ad hoc forecasts, sales and prepare archive reports as requested to assist management decisions.
Assist to prepare inventory reduction initiatives for assigned product lines and rationalization process for product lines.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:
Must Have: Strong Written and Oral Communication; fluent in oral and written English
Must Have: Minimum of 3 Years of Experience with Data Analysis & Forecasting
Must Have: Minimum of 3 Years of Experience with Excel
Must Have: Experience with Amazon Seller Central, Shopify, and other E-commerce Platform
Highly Organized with Strong Documentation and Excel Presentation Skills Confident Problem-Solver with a Team-Winning Mentality
Experience with Microsoft Office including Outlook, Word, Power Point
Experience with Gmail, Google Drive, and Google Spreadsheets
EDUCATION:
Must Have: Degree

The Trust & Integrity Protection (TrIP) team has an immediate opening for an experienced Detection and Threat Analyst to own and manage brand new capabilities: detection and monitoring of high-risk data protection and fraud scenarios. Once deployed, these capabilities will alert against inappropriate activity, enable proactive investigation & response to issues and incidents, and surface known weak spots. This role is vital for TrIP’s ability to grow customer trust and reduce risk by relentlessly protecting data and operational integrity across the Microsoft Customer and Partner Solutions.
Tackling such a vast problem space requires strong program management abilities; creativity, passion, leadership, and tenacity are also necessary traits.
Microsoft Services’ mission is to deliver the right business outcomes to our commercial customers through digital solutions, cloud enablement and modern support. Key to providing consistent, high quality customer solutions is building and maintaining world-class operations. That’s where we come in. Microsoft Customer and Partner Solutions charter is to ensure services can compete effectively by enabling agile and trusted experiences that continuously meet the needs of our customers, partners and colleagues. If you are a leader who loves to partner with colleagues around the world to make our employee and customer experience better, we have a career opportunity for you!
Responsibilities
Responsibilities
Develop, mature, and grow the detection and monitoring program by continuously expanding the scenarios and business coverage areas
Frame the data protection and fraud scenarios, then drive the creation and deployment of robust detection & monitoring solutions against high-risk scenarios
Engage in continuous planning cycle to drive next wave planning while keeping pulse on execution and stepping into execution where uniquely required
Develop, foster, and maintain effective working relationships with various groups within the organization including engineering, BI teams, enterprise services\support, and partner teams to deliver key business metrics
Work across different technical and business teams to create a plan, get dependencies identified and locked, and keep everyone informed of progress
Collaborate effectively and inclusively with colleagues across the company, to drive clarity, generate energy, and deliver results
Qualifications
Qualifications
4+ years of program management experience, preferably in security, threat, risk, or compliance areas is preferred.
Experience with threat management, security and incident response, risk management or compliance is preferred
Strong communication skills to effectively drive recommendations and establish priorities across various customers, partners, senior executives, and organization boundaries
Self-driven engaging individual with a proven history of demonstrated technical skills and leadership
Ability to work and create structure in complex and ambiguous situations and respond flexibly in time sensitive situations
Critical thinking, intellectual curiosity, strong track record of structuring and solving complex problem
Depth of understanding in computer security related disciplines, including but not limited to the following subject areas: software vulnerabilities and exploitation, host forensics, malware analysis, network traffic analysis, and web-focused security topics
Knowledgeable about both common attacks (Software, Network and People) and modern security related subjects and trends such as Advanced Persistent Threat (APT), rootkits, Spear Phishing, PtH and other credential compromise techniques
Experience leading collaborative post-mortem and root cause analysis efforts and creating and/or implementing their remediation plans
Ability to analyze data to identify trends and weaknesses and develop programs to address them
Ability to motivate self and others, often virtually
Conflict / Negotiation management - demonstrated influencing skills

positionName: Detection & Monitoring Operations Analyst (3rd Shift Weds-Sun 11pm-9am EST)
description:
Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!
Role:
The Splunk Detection and Monitoring Operations (D&MO) Analyst reports to the Sr. Manager of Detection and Monitoring Operations. The role is based in Tyson’s Corner, VA. In this role, you will be responsible for the 24x7 monitoring, operations and response to cyber security threats. You will have a solid understanding of Information Security principles and disciplines coupled with excellent communications skills and a continuous desire to learn and grow. We are a passionate team who has fun, enjoys a good laugh but above all else thinks security first.
Responsibilities:
Independently evaluate and analyze data of a diverse scope and select methods and techniques for obtaining solutions
Resolve wide range of issues in creative ways
You will perform monitoring, research, assessment and analysis on all notable security events from a variety of technologies such as firewalls, intrusion detection systems, cloud services, endpoint security and operating system events
You will create and follow appropriate pre-defined procedures to further investigate security events and handle escalations to other required personnel as necessary
You will work closely and network with the Product Security, Threat and Vulnerability Management and Cyber Threat Intelligence teams to implement custom detection of new and emerging threats
You will participate in routine compliance and control monitoring and assist in creation of new monitoring capabilities as controls evolve
You will handle daily tasks, ad-hoc assignments and leading small projects as needed
You will maintain operational reports for Key Performance Indicators and weekly and monthly metrics
You will work on digitization efforts to automate routine playbooks and always be on the lookout for opportunities for automation
You will participate as a member of the SplunkCIRT during major incidents and lend contributions to post-Incident review and continuous improvement
Requirements:
Able to work 2nd and 3rd shifts
You have 5 years of experience as a Security Administrator or equivalent knowledge
Experienced level of knowledge of security related technologies including firewalls, intrusion detection systems and endpoint security tools
Full understanding of TCP/IP protocols, network analysis, and the OSI framework
In depth understanding of Incident Response framework, root cause analysis
Working knowledge of endpoint and server systems administration
Working knowledge of Cloud technologies
Ability to multitask, prioritize and take-charge
Willingness and desire to think outside of the box for creative solutions to problems with the moxie to follow-through
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to see things through the customer’s eyes
Strong attention to detail
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information security or related discipline is required or equivalent work experience
We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.
For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
(Colorado only*) Minimum base salary of $95,000. You may also be
eligible for incentive pay + equity + benefits. Note: Disclosure per sb19-085 (8-5-201 et seq).

Varsity Tutors is seeking an innovative Senior Data Analyst to join our team and work on impactful initiatives providing decision support to business leadership through quantitative analysis mining our data for opportunities, and technical development of new data pipelines and reporting. The Senior Data Analyst will be responsible for collecting, transforming, and organizing our data to find insights, make predictions, and drive to the next decision.

About Varsity Tutors

Varsity Tutors, a Nerdy Company, is the leading direct-to-consumer platform for live online learning benefiting both learners and experts. We have built a comprehensive online learning destination that enables the delivery of scaled high-quality live expertise for learners of all ages across thousands of subjects and multiple learning formats through the application of technology and AI. We've raised $107M million in venture capital from TCV, Learn Capital, and the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative. We also recently announced that Nerdy, the parent company of Varsity Tutors, plans to go public via a SPAC with TPG Pace Tech Opportunities later this year, with a $1.7 billion market valuation.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, or related field or equivalent experience.
5+ years of experience as a Data Analyst
Advanced proficiency with Excel or other analytical tool
Working knowledge of SQL
Ability to summarize large fields of data and present and visualize this information in a compelling, digestible fashion.
Superior analytical and quantitative skills; experience using data and metrics to test theories, confirm assumptions, and measure success.
Ability to effectively communicate data and information to senior management.
Comfortable diving deep into very large fields of data
Deep and abiding love for figuring out how things work, then relentlessly testing and optimizing to drive desired outcomes.
Proven ability to identify, analyze, and solve ambiguous problems with an extreme attention to detail.
Exceptional problem-solving, decision-making, and written communication skills.
Comfortable with data wrangling; experience working with data engineers to source and efficiently operationalize new data streams.
Experience with Looker a plus.
Forecasting or demand planning experience a plus

Responsibilities

Work with partners in respective domains to develop deep understanding of their use cases, data schema, develop metrics, and drive insights and decision making.
Pull data, analyze, and communicate results. Pivot or shift approaches when necessary in response to what you learn.
Identify optimization opportunities, areas of high variance; provide guidance on operational improvements.
Generate robust data reports at both high (summary) and low (verbose deep-dive) level. Clear presentation and communication of data and highlights is key.
Strive to reduce friction through automation of reports, consolidation of data sources, and exploration of additional metrics and data points to track.

Role Summary
The Business Intelligence Analyst works in a fast-paced, high-exposure team whose responsibilities include data analysis, demand modeling and research, optimization, project management, and solution design/delivery. The BI team will translate business intelligence strategy into advanced analytical experiments and models that blend data sources for creative insights into business problems and to align performance with the company’s strategic goals, detailed action plans, key performance indicators, and progress metrics. The team also develops and implements systems and technology to produce decision support tools that enable leaders and system practitioners to take strategic action. You must be able to develops visualizations grounded in statistical best practices that facilitate effective communication of results and key findings to internal and external customers.
Key Duties
In the entry level, under general supervision, you will analyze data and make recommendations for moderately complex business problems and provide input into solutions.
In the intermediate level you will use solid understanding of BI principles to analyze data, make recommendations for approach to problem solving and make recommendations for solutions to complex business problems.
In the senior level, as a subject matter expert in business intelligence, you will apply deep knowledge and use considerable judgement to determine the approach to ambiguous challenges, exercise considerable judgement to make decisions and influence across the company.

UW Medicine works to improve the health of the public by advancing medical knowledge, providing outstanding primary and specialty medical care to people of the region, and preparing tomorrow's physicians, scientists and other health professionals.


UW Medicine currently has an outstanding opportunity for a GME Business Analyst. The Business Analyst will provide financial operations and analyses support for GME Finance. Under the direction of the Director of GME Finance, the Business Analyst works independently overseeing activities in areas of billing, reconciliation, accounts payable, accounts receivable, and financial modeling. Written and verbal communication with GME stakeholders, including School of Medicine departments and medical resident sites is an integral responsibility of the work to trouble-shoot, problem solve, and explain processes as needed.


The Business Analyst ensures compliance with the State of Washington, University of Washington, UW Medicine, and GME Finance policies and procedures. In addition to standard monthly processes, the Analyst is responsible for directing and implementing special projects that may include process review, change recommendation, documentation of policies and procedures, and training to GME Finance personnel. This position acts in an advisory capacity to senior management within GME Finance providing research and analytical support on important financial issues and must demonstrate effective project management analysis and sound business judgement. The Analyst exercises substantial discretion, independent judgment, and decision-making authority in applying the responsibilities called for. Responsibilities are carried out with technical expertise and provide authoritative advice and counsel to executive and other senior leadership within GME Finance. This position may provide access to restricted or confidential information, including employee and patient information, medical center strategic plans and initiatives, financial information or other sensitive materials and information. The Analyst should access and use the minimum necessary employee and organization information to perform job responsibilities and duties and only for authorized purposes.


The position responsibilities include:


Policy/Process Improvement and Operations (80%):

Ensure program compliance with GME billing and medical resident/fellows tracking policies and procedures, including working with, and providing training to 100+ program administrators who submit monthly billing data in residency management system.

Oversight and communication with programs and sponsoring institutions regarding billing and payment.

Bring continuous thinking and process improvements to the current billing and scheduling residency management systems.

Develop, document, and manage policies and procedures for implementation, control, and review/audit of systematic operations.

Collaborate with leadership and staff to review processes and efficiencies to propose financial improvements toward alignment with GME strategies.

Implement processes to comply with federal regulations and internal systems, and conduct training sessions for system users.

Identify relevant metrics for tracking and reporting performance improvement, exceptions and process opportunities. Implement the use of metrics to drive outcomes within GME.

Cross train and act as a backup to the billing and accounts receivable functions of two Classified staff.


Financial Strategy (20%):

Implement and sustain strong processes and capabilities through the enhancement, deployment, and maintenance of methods, metrics, tools, training, education, and communication.

Monitor financial reports to ensure the overall financial health and stability of GME; provide financial and management reports to Director.


MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor's Degree in Business, Accounting, Finance, Management, or related field and at least three years of related experience in accounting.

Experience in Finance.

Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Word.


Equivalent education and/or experience may substitute for minimum requirements.


DESIRED REQUIREMENTS

Experience with billing systems.

Three years of related experience, preferably in hospital or large medical system.

Intermediate knowledge of regulatory requirements regarding medical residency management that impact academic medical centers.

Experience with Continuing Process Improvement/Lean management.

Lean or Continuous Process Improvement certification.

MedHub experience.

Description

Are you self-motivated and looking for a position where you can be instrumental in paving the way for the technological future of Public Works? We have a Business Technology Analyst position open for this exciting opportunity! The Snohomish County Department of Public Works Administrative Operations (AO) Division is currently seeking a highly qualified individual to fill a Business Technology Analyst position as part of the Public Works Records and Technology Management Team.

Job Summary
This position will be responsible for leading, coordinating, and/or collaborating on a wide range of technology solutions used to support programs and projects throughout Public Works, including Engineering Services, Road Maintenance, Solid Waste and Transportation and Environmental Services.

The ideal candidate will have knowledge of:
Resource and infrastructure management systems
Resource and budget planning
Principles and practices of inspection, monitoring and maintenance of public infrastructure capital improvements, asset life cycle and performance conditional analysis
Principles and procedures of project management
Current computer hardware and software capabilities and implementation strategies
GIS applications, hardware and software including mobile applications
Relational database software systems
Timekeeping and current management systems
 Additionally, the successful candidate will possess:

Excellent verbal and written communication skills
The ability to write technical manuals and/or related policies and train others in their execution
The ability to troubleshoot and demonstrate creative thinking skills to mitigate challenges encountered in implementation and maintenance of all systems
The ability to be flexible, yet persistent in schedules and goals; always keeping in mind the objectives of the organization
About Snohomish County Public Works Department
Snohomish County Public Works is responsible for more than 1,600 miles of county roads, 201 bridges and 202 traffic control signals, as well as processing nearly 600,000 tons of garbage per year. Its mission is to focus on safety and mobility while practicing fiscal responsibility and preserving the environment. Public Works has won numerous state and national honors for its work and is the largest department within Snohomish County government with approximately 500 employees plus seasonal staff. Its main office is located at 3000 Rockefeller Ave., Everett, WA 98201.

When joining Public Works, you will work in an environment where innovation, collaboration and continuous improvement is highly encouraged and supported. We strive to not only provide a meaningful job, but a lifelong career at Snohomish County.

Visit www.snohomishcountywa.gov/PublicWorks for more information about Snohomish County Public Works.

Declaration of Emergency
Snohomish County is currently under a Declaration of Emergency due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

The County has put in place initiatives to protect the health of its employees, and as a result, this position may temporarily be assigned to telework. There may be occasions when this position may be required to work in the office or in the field to perform certain job duties. Safety guidelines in compliance with the state, CDC and Snohomish County Health District are required to be followed during those times.

We offer competitive wages; job flexibility and stability; pension opportunities; and employer paid ORCA cards. Flexible work schedules for some positions.
Sick leave: You will accrue sick leave each month.
Vacation Leave: You will accrue vacation each month. Your leave accruals increase based on your years of employment with the County.
Holiday Pay: The County observes ten (10) paid legal holidays per year and provides employees with two (2) floating holidays annually.
Pension Benefits: County employees are eligible for Washington State PERS enrollment.
Benefits: The County offers a wide range of benefits including, medical, and dental, vision, life insurance, LTD, deferred compensation and more.

About Snohomish County
Snohomish County, north of Seattle, is located in northwest Washington between the Puget Sound and the Cascade Mountains. The county has rich scenery, numerous activities and a thriving economy. Snohomish County is a great place to live, work, play, and raise a family. When joining Public Works, you will work in an environment where innovation, collaboration and continuous improvement are highly encouraged and supported. BASIC FUNCTION
 To manage the implementation, documentation, workflow and project management for complex technology solutions to ensure the division's technology goals are met. Coordinate as a liaison with other departments, divisions and the Public Works (PW) Technology group on technology matters as required and with the Department of Information Technology (DoIT).
STATEMENT OF ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES
Performs key role in planning the annual work programs and projects for the assigned division. Analyzes data, prepares reports and provides results to management. Participates in the development of the division's annual budget and work plan.
Designs, develops and implements for quality control, documentation and workflow for operational database and software programs to ensure the division's technology goals are met.
Directs the collection and analysis of data; prepares and guides the development of reports for regulatory agencies to meet the requirements of certain mandates pertaining to water quality, routine maintenance, traffic safety, flood control, etc.
Coordinates, schedules, assigns and evaluates the project work of subordinate technical and support staff as required related to area of assignment; advises, provides technical guidance, and trains subordinates and division personnel as necessary.
Assumes project lead responsibility; identifies requirements, resolves problems and develops, or acquires and implements, systems to meet division technology needs; obtains approval for system acquisition or design in coordination with Public Works Technology and DoIT; prepares contract documents for consultant and vendor services.
Acts as a division lead for Asset Management Maintenance System (AMMS). Analyzes, identifies and participates in the selection and implementation of AMMS for the assigned division. Develops AMMS and related project implementation schedules; identifies and manages projects to meet established milestones and deliverables. Analyzes AMMS data for business planning purposes.
Reviews project deliverables with management; participates in walkthroughs as required at satellite shops, other offices or field locations to determine and prove oversight and quality of each hardware or software deliverable.
May identify labor resource needs, directs the labor resources and controls project budget including accountabilities specified by management, related to area of assignment.
Establishes and controls a project documentation plan for all project assignments, including the project definition and requirements, schedule, quality assurance, and testing and implementation plan. Develops technical user and training guides, policies and procedures as needed for applications, provide training for technology users.
Analyzes, specifies, designs and directs the implementation of specialized equipment and software programs as may pertain to innovative applications utilizing hand-held units, mobile units, personal computers, or network applications, in the development of field automation and office applications for the division.
Acts as a GIS liaison to other divisions and departments. Develops applications, conducts field implementation, and trains division employees in the use of hardware and software applications; provides oversight and quality control of GIS data for business planning purposes.
STATEMENT OF OTHER JOB DUTIES
May be required to perform all the duties of subordinate level classifications.
Performs related duties as required.
Minimum Qualifications
 A Bachelor's degree in computer science or closely related field; PLUS, three (3) years of experience in resource planning and/or management systems, GIS, databases and/or data processing; or any equivalent combination of education, training and/or experience that meets the required knowledge and abilities. Must pass job related tests.

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS

 A valid Washington State Driver's License is required for employment.
Additional Information
KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES

Knowledge of:
resource and infrastructure management systems
resource and budget planning
principles and practices of inspection, monitoring and maintenance of public infrastructure
capital improvements, asset life cycle and performance conditional analysis
principles and procedures of project management
current computer hardware and software capabilities and implementation strategies
GIS applications, hardware and software including mobile applications
AMMS applications, hardware and software
relational database software systems
timekeeping and current management systems

Ability to:
operate computer and related peripheral equipment to schedule, control, model or construct project or project components
effectively function as a team member and project leader
train others in the use of computer software and hardware
independently analyze and solve problems and assist others in problem-solving
communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing
establish and maintain effective working relationships with other departments, divisions, vendors, superiors, and associates
write technical manuals and procedures for various applications and systems
read, understand and apply technical manuals and procedures
work under pressure and meet deadlines
maintain required records and prepare necessary reports

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENT

 Physical exertion may be required to lift equipment up to fifty (50) pounds.

SUPERVISION

 Employee receives direction and supervision from the assigned supervisor. The work is performed with considerable independence and is reviewed through periodic meetings, status reports and results obtained.

WORKING CONDITIONS

The work is performed in the usual office environment as well as offsite county locations. Employees may be on-call during off duty hours and may be required to work evenings, weekends and holidays as necessary.

Accommodations for individuals with disabilities are provided upon request.

Job Category
Sales
Job Details
What you’ll be doing…
The Senior Sales Operations Reporting Analyst is responsible for building and standardizing a suite of reporting and data tools to maximize efficiency at all levels across the sales organization. This person will be a data expert and will play a critical role in developing a framework for scalable reporting, strategic planning, and supporting senior sales and sales operations leadership.
Projects may include defining and analyzing key performance indicators (KPIs), developing standard data sources for analytics and sales partners, deploying and refining industry best practice forecasting processes, in-depth ad hoc sales performance analysis, working cross functionally to support a scalable reporting infrastructure, and the packaging of findings/recommendations into presentation-ready content for senior leadership.
Some of the things you'll be doing will include...
Build repeatable processes and reporting packages to empower both sales leaders and reps with critical operational data related to sales strategy and execution.
Develop and maintain standardized operational reports, and dashboards, and data sources to monitor overall territory health, data integrity, and other key objectives and performance indicators
Monitor and share fluctuations in business critical KPIs with executive leadership
Support ongoing analysis of business performance. Inform executive decisions
Collect, analyze, evaluate, and report data to track sales performance and metrics
Support day-to-day inquiries from the sales team, providing prompt and efficient resolution to a wide range of issues and developing operational procedures and policies to manage volume.
Collaborate cross-functionally within the Sales Operations organization to ensure consistent reporting standards and processes
Collaborate cross-functionally with Sales, Marketing, and Finance teams on development of critical metrics
Who you are
Experienced. 8+ years of experience as a data analyst in consulting, finance, sales/marketing/operations, or product management. Experience at a top-tier management consultancy or investment bank, in a product management, sales operations, or in a similar business operations capacity at a technology firm. Bachelor’s degree or equivalent related experience. Advanced degree is a plus.
Technically Savvy. Prior experience with Tableau Software strongly preferred. SQL experience is a plus. Technically savvy with a sense of urgency and accountability. Strong knowledge of relational database technologies such as Microsoft Excel, Salesforce, and Tableau’s full product suite.
Passionate. Passion for creating scalable reporting products that are intuitive to use and enable others to interpret data.
Exceptional Communicator. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey complex concepts and information to a broad audience, including working with executive level leaders.
Urgency. Ability to thrive in a fast paced, dynamic work environment and can multi-task and keep on top of priorities while accomplishing the details of the task at hand.
Analytical. Ability to perform complex analysis including regression, forecasting, and probability modeling.
Team-Player . A natural leader with an ability to build things from scratch. A knack for creating structure wherever needed. You thrive in collaborative, cross-functional roles where you network, build relationships and influence others.
You are a Recruiter! Tableau hires company builders, and, in this role, you will be asked to be on the constant lookout for the best talent to bring onboard to help us continue to build one of the best companies in the world.

Job Description
At Seabourn, we are passionate about travel. We believe that traveling for pleasure has a redemptive power that enriches people’s lives. And we believe that people should travel well. Seabourn pioneered small-ship, ultra-luxury cruising, and continues to represent the pinnacle of that unique style of travel.
While cruising paused worldwide, we laid the groundwork to take our company to even greater success, with fresh perspectives and new ways of working. The Product Analyst will work with teams across Seabourn, with our office Seattle, WA, we’re looking for amazing humans across the country for this role. Seabourn offers strong compensation and outstanding benefits including cruise travel.
Here’s a summary of what Seabourn is looking for in its Product Analyst. Is this you?
Responsibilities:
Product Management and Development is responsible for maximizing the net ticket revenue of every sailing by managing the pricing, and coordinating with Sales and Marketing to stimulate demand. The Product Analyst manages cruise demand by recommending and applying pricing and inventory controls to achieve the highest possible net revenue results. Works with key tracking mechanisms over multiple business sources to allow for yield maximization. Evaluates and approves pricing and inventory management processes as necessary to achieve objectives.
For assigned cruise programs and sailings, directs and controls independent traveler, group and other rate contracts at the cabin category level to achieve the highest possible net revenue and occupancy level
Facilitate and audit pricing actions in reservation system to ensure support of promotional pieces and deadlines.
Monitors oversells and capacity goals to alleviate buyoffs, buy-downs
Reports current inventory trends and establishes booking curves ("paces") for a each new program and sailing to measure future progress against.
Monitors competitive products, pricing, and promotional activity, as well as the overall cruise and vacation industries to provide perspective and specific information for decision making.
Produces status reports summarizing bookings, revenue, pace, expected and required future progress, current actions, proposed actions, and contingent actions for review at weekly inventory meetings.
Uses available data to analyze past performance for the same or similar products - booking curves, source of business, achieved yields, and total revenues, etc.

Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Economics or similar
Or 4+ years of analytical experience in a commercial environment required
2 years related revenue management experience preferred
Familiarity with cruise revenue management concepts and/or prior revenue management experience, travel industry preferred.
Strong analytical, communication & organizational skills essential
Knowledge of the cruise industry business environment including marketing, sales and operations
Ability to analyze data, make decisions and be accountable for bottom-line performance.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and working knowledge of database and report writing tools
Benefits
Cruise and Travel Privileges for you and your family
Health Benefits
401(k)
Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Training & Professional Development
Rewards & Incentives
Our Culture…Stronger Together:
Our highest responsibility, and therefore our top priorities, are always compliance; environmental protection; and the health, safety, and well-being of our guests, the people in places we visit, and our Carnival family, both shoreside, and shipboard. Please visit our site to learn more about our Culture Essentials, Corporate vision Statement and our Core Values at: https://www.seabourn.com/en_US/our-company/mission-values.html.

Job Summary
Finance & Asset Management (FAM) has one of the most diverse sets of responsibilities of any City department. FAM oversees financial functions such as business taxes and licenses, accounting, budgeting, economic forecasting, and vendor services/purchasing as well as managing the City’s fleet, real property, and land survey functions.
We are looking for a team-oriented, self-motivated, detail-focused Economic Analyst to join our team. You will bring your technical savvy and knowledge of financial and economic analysis techniques to support both the city's general economic forecasting and the Transportation Infrastructure Finance and Innovations Act (TIFIA) loan which supports mobility projects in the BelRed area. You will share responsibility for coordinating a portion of the City's biennial budget and Capital Investment Program, support presentation of complex financial information to management and other groups, conduct research into economic trends, model and analyze finance-related projects including but not limited to program evaluations, budget monitoring, performance measurement/benchmarking on legislative impacts; and assist in the preparation of the City's long-range financial forecasts.
 Bellevue is a dynamic, international and multicultural, future-focused, diversity driven, high performing City. Our Council vision is: "Bellevue welcomes the world, our diversity is our strength." We value all employees and their contributions. The City invests in its employees and encourages and rewards employee growth and development by building on our commonalities and our differences. Bellevue is noted for its diversity, community involvement, intellectual excitement, artistic pursuits, and natural beauty. We work collectively to make it a place where you want to work, live and play.

 *****This position requires working from Washington State
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Conduct economic analysis independently and in coordination with the City’s Economist.
Prepare explanations and summary materials on financial issues and trends.
Serve as a technical support on economic matters.
Provide information on alternatives and draws conclusions from financial data; summarize findings and communicates recommendations to management.
Complete special analytical assignments and modeling.
Prepare fiscal impact analysis of legislative actions.
Assist in the preparation of budget materials and the City's financial forecast through the economic/financial research and analysis.
Plan and carry out budget procedures, including monitoring budget performance and fiscal forecasts; attend budget meetings, as needed.
Gain expertise in TIFIA loan requirements; investigate potential compliance issues; interpret policies and procedures; stay abreast of current rules.
Perform analytical work in coordinating, monitoring and reporting on federal grant programs.
Provide cash flow analysis.
Coordinate and prepare the required annual bond rating presentations.
Establish collaborative and cooperative relationships with departments in order to problem solve and assist departments.
Manage both internal and external projects from start to finish. This includes scoping, identifying issues and concerns, research, identifying resource gaps (related to project workload), drafting reports, presenting findings, and initiating follow-up analysis.
Actively participate in the Finance & Asset Management Department’s continuous improvement and strategic plan initiatives.
Maintain a positive outlook and growth mindset in one’s own development and work product.
Supervision Received & Exercised:
Work under the general supervision of the City's Economist.
No formal supervisory responsibilities.
May act as lead of cross-departmental projects and work products or teams.
Qualifications
The Ideal Candidate:
 The ideal candidate will be inquisitive and a quick study, including:
Strong empirical and analytical skills
Experience working with and analyzing data in Excel, Access, or other programs
Experience with financial and economic analysis
Ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-pacing environment and meet required deadlines with minimal supervision
Ability to communicate technical issues in a clear and understandable manner
Proven skills in the ability to learn complex requirements to ensure compliance with grants, laws, regulations and policies
Ability to organize and structure tracking and monitoring systems to ensure compliance and cash flow availability.
Education & Experience Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Economics, Finance, Accounting, Business, Public Administration, Statistics or related field from an accredited four-year college or university; and
Four or more years of professional-related experience in financial analysis; or a Master's degree could be supplanted for experience.
Any equivalent combination of education, experience, and training that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.
Must pass a criminal background check prior to hire.
Core Competencies (Knowledge, Skills, Abilities):
This position is expected to be fully competent in City-wide core competencies for all employees as well as Finance Department Core Competencies. All competencies identified for this position are listed below:
Customer Focus: Building strong customer relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions.
Financial Monitoring & Analysis: Monitor and collect data to assess accuracy and integrity; analyze data; ensure compliance with applicable standards, rules, regulations and systems of internal control; interpret and evaluate results, prepare documentation; create financial reports and/or presentations.
Data Analysis: Knowledge of quantitative and qualitative analysis, research methodology and use of statistical theory and applications. Ability to collect, research, assess accuracy, validity, and integrity of data sets. Ability to interpret, evaluate and apply results, and create reports and or/presentations or recommendations in response to analysis.
Professional & Technical Knowledge: Demonstrate a proficient level of technical skills and/or knowledge in enterprise financial systems (preferably JD Edwards) and all Microsoft Products. Expertise with databases, spreadsheets, and report writing software. Proven experience developing systematic and manual operations procedures. Considerable knowledge in Public budget, accounting and Finance. Ability to analyze large amounts of data, make judgments and develop reports and presentations. Ability to explain complex financial issues to non-technical and political audiences. Ability to train and assist other staff in the use of the department's primary financial systems. Basic knowledge of accounting and financial principles.
Innovation: The creation of better or more effective products, processing, technologies, or ideas that create positive change for the organization by challenging the status quo, improving what exists and creating new approaches.
Instills Trust: Gaining the confidence and trust of others through honesty, integrity, and authenticity.
Communicates Effectively: Developing and delivering multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences.
Action Oriented: Taking on new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency, high energy, and enthusiasm.
Decision Quality: Making good and timely decisions that keep the organization moving.
Nimble Learning: Actively learning through experimentation when tracking new problems, using both successes and failures as learning fodder.
Manages Complexity: Making sense of complex, high quantity, and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems in a political environment.
Plans & Aligns: Planning and prioritizing work to meet commitments aligned with organizational goals.
Functional Oversight: Oversee and administer a process or function to ensure compliance with appropriate laws, policies, and procedures and meet appropriate goals and objectives. Participate in development of goals, objectives and measures related to the process or function for inclusion in strategic plans. Propose or participate in process improvements related to the function. May support clients in accomplishing objectives related to the function. May be required to work with clients to implement changes to processes or function. Ability to remain flexible to meet constantly changing and sometimes opposing demands.
Project Management: Application of knowledge, skills, tools and techniques to project activities to meet project requirements. Using project management processes of initiating, planning, executing, monitoring, controlling and closing.
Values Differences: Recognizing the value that different perspectives and cultures bring to an organization.
Drives Engagement: Creating a climate where people are motivated to do their best to help the organization achieve its objectives.
Other
For questions regarding this position please contact Liqiong Chen at 425-452-4618 or LChen@bellevuewa.gov.
