PSE's IT Application Solutions team is looking for qualified candidates to fill an open Data Governance Analyst position!
Job Description
Join our Data Services team, and help us build our new data analytics community. We are looking for a data-savvy analyst with Data Governance experience to develop and implement effective, best-practice approaches to improving and sustaining our data landscape. Our team is responsible for exploring new data science and data management technologies, and developing proactive collection, measurement, monitoring, profiling and reporting methodologies to support PSE operations and Beyond Zero Carbon reduction initiatives. We also use cutting edge tools such as Informatica Enterprise Data Catalog, Axon Data Governance and Informatica Data Quality analytical tools to analyze and manage digital media, web, search, structured data and unstructured information.
Job Responsibilities
Provide strong SQL development experience and ability to easily navigate through SQL Server or Oracle DBMS for structured data
Support the development of detailed and effective Data Governance capabilities, and work with business colleagues to identify, prioritize and execute data governance models and mitigation processes
Be familiar with PowerBI and Python reporting tools
Help PSE to optimize user experience through information and data governance
Capture, interpret and present data and insights to support data governance and enablement strategies, solve business challenges, and drive efficiencies in technical and business performance
Help build our analytics capabilities to support our digital transformation, risk management and data enablement efforts for our keys systems such as SAP and OpenText
Improve or create data management workflow and data flow diagrams and related processes
Partner with our external vendors, our business teams and internal stakeholders to define, capture, develop and deliver on core business metrics and KPIs that support key requirements for our company's initiatives and objectives, including related analysis and planning, reporting and ongoing project support across our organization.
Work closely with the Manager of Data Services to engage technical and business stakeholders to solve data and information challenges
Partner with other data and business analysts to proactive governance processes including modeling and visualization efforts
Work closely with business colleagues, Records and Information Management and Data Management team members to ensure the accuracy of fact and dimensional data related to channels, sources of acquisition, frequency, transactions and significance testing
Generates ad hoc reports and test datasets or report information for end-users using system tools and database or data warehouse queries and scripts
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Industrial Engineering, Business Administration, or related field.
5+ years IT experience, including several years of systems development experience in the design and development of department-wide or enterprise-wide applications.
Detailed understanding and 5+ years programming languages (specialized technical requirements as shown in attachment) and strong knowledge of office applications (e.g. Microsoft Office).
Possesses full technical knowledge of phases of software development life cycle.
Experience with at least two full life cycle implementations of a new application or purchased application.
Extensive knowledge of multiple languages, i.e (specialized technical requirements as shown in attachment) environment, active business processes, business areas, as well as industry.
Knowledge of systems and/or business analysis design concepts. Demonstrated proficiency in the applied use of systems and process analysis tools. Full system life cycle experience, including development lifecycle methodologies.
Demonstrated understanding of Structured Query Language (SQL).
Ability to facilitate interactive design and functional specification sessions.
Highly developed interpersonal, written and verbal skills with an ability to express complex technical concepts in business terms. Excellent technical writing and system documentation skills.
Strong analytical problem-solving, and conceptual skills.
Demonstrated project management skills for moderate sized projects.
Must be a “team player” able to work with management in developing and implementing new processes and enabling systems. Able to work with end user groups to define application needs and identify feasible solutions.
Proactive, self-motivated with the ability to motivate others and a customer-focused service attitude.
Good organizational skills, with the ability to meet objectives and effectively multi-task.
Ability to work with multiple levels of the organization, both technical and non-technical.
Desired Qualifications
Two years of data governance modeling and measurement skills including data validation processes, and
An analytical approach to problem-solving, coupled with the ability to conceptualize systems.
Experience with and ability to easily navigate through either SQL Server or Oracle DBMS.
Understanding of MDM strategies and concepts, application, and impact to data analytics efforts. Proven experience and success with reference data modeling, ontologies and taxonomies, and metadata management
Demonstrated ability to develop tool sets and approaches for data management processes as well as educate others on how to apply these processes

The Washington State Hospital Association (WSHA) is seeking a full-time dynamic, dedicated, and professional Senior Data Analyst to join our team!
About WSHA:
WSHA has been in existence for over 80 years and is the trusted voice and indispensable resource that leads, challenges, and assists Washington hospitals and health systems to improve the health of the communities they serve. We are a strong advocate for and provide value to our members in achieving their missions by committing to the following:
Service:
We are a member-led association committed to providing servant leadership.
Integrity:
We are honest in our work and operate with transparency and accountability.
Collaboration:
We act cooperatively, incorporate diverse perspectives, and use the power of the collective to achieve our mission.
Innovation:
We are agile and drive continuous quality improvement.
We are in beautiful downtown Seattle, surrounded by wonderful views of the Puget Sound and the Olympic Mountains, with easy access to bus lines and underground parking.
For more information about WSHA, visit us at www.wsha.org.
POSITION SUMMARY:
As directed by leadership, this position is responsible for interpreting and providing complex data analysis, specialized reports, dashboards, and ensuring highly reliable and accurate data. This position integrates inferential statistics into their dashboards to provide actionable insights for hospitals. Responsibilities include developing visualizations to communicate and clarify the data, collaborate with members on product logistics, delivers content through Tableau Server & Interworks, and creates educational materials to conduct training on understanding data, analysis, and definition of the measures one-on-one and in groups.
DUTIES:
Perform complex data analysis and reporting to support Association staff and members.
Develop, prepare, and present specialized reports and dashboards for dissemination to Association members with the purpose of advancing the work at the state, hospital, and unit level.
Analyze data and provide various reports for different scenarios to reflect solutions/recommendations in response to anticipated and unanticipated fluctuations for members.
Interpret data analysis and develop related communication to provide multiple constituencies an understanding of the analysis.
Support monthly data collection process, and continuously address and clarify data related inquiries as needed. Perform routine data validation and integrity checks with fully documented processes to ensure highly reliable data accuracy.

Amazon’s mission is to be ‘Earth’s most customer-centric company’, and our award-winning Customer Service (CS) team is an essential part of that mission. Our tens of thousands of Customer Service Associates around the globe provide world-class support to customers 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, and in over 20 languages (and growing).

One of our newest customer service programs, Customer Service by Amazon (CSBA), enables Marketplace sellers to delegate their customer service to Amazon. We are seeking an experienced Sr. Business Intelligence Engineer to lead global analytics for this program. At Navigating Cancer, our mission is to improve the lives of cancer patients and those who care for them. We enable oncology clinics to provide personalized, efficient care to every patient by providing relevant educational materials, giving the whole care team visibility to patient issues and needs, and delivering useful insights so that care teams can identify and resolve gaps in care. Through our platform, patients receive a holistic service offering to support their individual goals and needs.
In order to advance our mission to – “Enable Personalized Care for Every Cancer Patient,” we are seeking candidates for the following role:
Senior BI Analyst, Real-World Data (RWD)
Job Summary:
As a Senior BI Analyst for Navigating Cancer, you possess a strong curiosity for discovering insights and applications for novel healthcare data assets. You discover these insights by interfacing with internal and external stakeholders (technical, clinical, and business leaders) to understand the problems we are trying to solve. You identify opportunities and contribute solutions to meet those needs. You promote progress through collaborative teamwork in our dynamic environment. You deliver novel analytics solutions, the highest levels of customer service, and product improvements. You communicate with clarity and honesty. You take initiative and assume ownership of results.
Responsibilities
Operate as the data SME for business stakeholders, including product management, business development and operations
Gather, analyze, and translate requirements in the Analytics area – recommend an existing solution, develop a new solution, or synthesize requirements for the engineering team
Provide expert advice in the use and interpretation of data to business partners
Develop analyses and visualizations to uncover key insights and trends
Eliminate redundancy in existing analyses
Challenge everyone to understand their requirements and reach the best solutions, near term and long term.
Partner with product and application engineering to ensure upstream data capture is designed in a way so that efficient analyses can be developed
Implement process improvements that impact your own work and the work of others
Qualifications
4+ years of experience in data analytics
B.S. in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Information Science, Health Care administration, Statistics, Data Science or related area
Familiarity with medical terminologies (RXNORM, LOINC, SNOMED, ICD-10, CPT, etc)
Strong analytical, quantitative, statistics, and math skills
Practical SQL skills
Professional experience with Python
Familiarity with dashboard tools such as Tableau
Exceptional communication and presentation skills
Strong work ethic and enthusiasm to get things done
Creative thinking, an eye for detail, and the ability to work independently are important prerequisites for this job
Nice to have
Knowledge of healthcare interoperability standards (CCDs, HL7, FHIR, etc)
1+ years of proven experience in healthcare
Experience working in a research environment
Why work here?
We support thousands of healthcare professionals and tens of thousands of cancer patients every day. We help cancer patients get better care—and consider this a valuable and meaningful reason to come to work every day. You get to work with leading technology, wear many hats, and contribute every day to our business success! Join us to help us grow and establish ourselves as a world-class business. We are lean, agile, and lightweight. We believe in each other, believe in our work, and have fun along the way.
This position is full time 100% remote with the option to come into the Seattle corporate office on a voluntary basis for local employees.

Be Agile. Discover creative solutions, welcome change. Adapt and pursue continuous improvement.
Seek Simplicity. Reduce complexity for our customers and patients. Simplify our products, our processes and our messages.

The Cloud Marketing web experience team is looking for a business intelligence leader to help support the rapid growth of our portfolio of Cloud Marketing websites.
Our Team
The Global Demand Center (GDC) Cloud Marketing team has a vision to create world class websites by inspiring, educating, and supporting customers throughout their digital experience. We are a fast-paced group with a focus on getting things done, simplifying anything and everything, and having fun doing it. You will be in the middle of it all, helping to make decisions that impact customer experiences, acquisition funnels, and global web experiences.
Role Overview
This role will own and drive the transformation of our Cloud web business intelligence teams by planning, designing, operating, and managing our Business Intelligence and web analytics programs. This team is looking for an experienced professional with excellent analytical skills and strong business acumen to develop and implement BI management disciplines, tools and reporting mechanisms in a fast-paced and innovative environment with global remit. This role requires someone with strong relationship building skills who will work with stakeholders across multiple stakeholder teams.

Responsibilities
Develop a deep understanding of the cloud marketing business and our needs for decision making tools using data and insights.

Break through communication issues and effectively develop relationships with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.

Excellent communication, inter-personal, and cross group collaboration skills.

This position will follow defined departmental standards, and help define new ones as appropriate, as well as advise and transfer knowledge end users.

A successful candidate will need to interact directly with business owners and business users, as well as other functional Business Analysts, Project Managers, and Support staff.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Analyze, and document existing business processes and Standard Operating Procedures (SOP).

Develop functional specifications for system modifications.
Develop Test Cases and Test Plans.
Responsible to test system changes within specified functional areas, and regression testing.

3+ years Dynamics AX for Manufacturing and MRP experience.
3+ years experience working with core manufacturing business processes (Shop Floor Controls, Material and Resource Planning/Scheduling, Production Routing, Bill of Material Costing, and Warehouse Management)
3+ years experience in business system analysis and business process improvement.

Experience with Dynamics AX 2012 implementations and configurations.
Excellent communication, both verbal and written.
Strong requirements gathering skills (interviewing business owners and operational users).
Excellent project management and organizational skills.

positionName: Analyst III, Governed Data Steward: Supply Chain
description:
As part of a small, passionate and accomplished team of experts, you will join in the development and implementation of Company’s enterprise-wide data governance program with the core mandate of improving the health and utility of Company’s enterprise and domain data assets. Stewardship is a critical component of Company’s evolving Enterprise Data Strategy which will ultimately allow the corporation to optimize, protect, and leverage data as an enterprise asset. This role is a member of the Data Governance Office, reporting to the Senior Manager of Data Governance. You will be an integral member of Company’s fledgling Data Steward Network which is where the rubber meets the road to space. This is where ideas are turned into action, and where we see results that translate into true value for the business.
The Data Steward Network provides data transparency, makes data more meaningful, ensures data accuracy, increases trust in data, and safeguards our information assets. You will operate across the people, process, and technology pillars of Data Governance. You will be responsible for key elements within the full spectrum of data governance activities from policy and process improvement to tool enhancements. You will collaborate with subject matter experts including data consumers and producers within your specific product group where you will be embedded to ensure high quality, consistent, defined, accurate, and fully pedigreed governed data that is fit for use exists to support business and analytic operations. You will serve as the bridge between those stakeholders and the central data governance office bringing the needs of your stakeholders and your expertise as a governance-minded steward to the forefront. In this way you will advise on governance policies, principles, procedures, and standards. You will evaluate issues in the governance of enterprise data, including problem definition, root cause analysis, and opportunity and solution recommendations.
You will serve as the direct custodian of key data assets to ensure your product group has the most accurate and reliable core information and by doing so, will play a key role in progressing our technology, advancing the mission of Company and shaping the future of human spaceflight.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
You will engage key stakeholders and subject matter experts to identify and document the current state of highly complex end-to-end business processes and their systems’ data. Based on your analysis you will work with key business leaders and propose process improvements that will increase business process efficiency and/or system data quality. You will apply deep process expertise and a range of process improvement methodologies. You will be responsible for the cleanliness, accuracy, integrity and accessibility of governed data including but not limited to master data across supply chain systems including Coupa. You will understand and document all process and data model changes, and the impacts of those changes throughout the business process. You will become a subject matter expert in supply chain business processes and find ways to continuously improve. You will be a data steward of supply chain master data.
Manage release schedule of data governance and data stewardship services with stakeholders
Ensure data governance and data stewardship consistency between supply chain’s processes and those of other business areas and functions.
Be the custodian of the data within your purview and utilize tools available to you including our data management software, EnterWorks™ (by Winshuttle) to track and manage the Data Quality Index (DQI) of that data.
Provide data governance tool demonstrations to your stakeholders to empower self-governing and awareness within the supply chain organization
Aid in developing data governance and data stewardship playbooks
Aid in developing and then execute a data governance and data stewardship communications strategy
Aid in developing and implementing data steward onboarding processes and procedures so the data steward network can grow in a consistent and meaningful way
Develop data governance and stewardship self-service training materials, in partnership with our internal training team.
Collaborate with architecture and analytics teams to establish, analyze and provide metrics to leadership in order to prioritize the needs and requests of the supply chain organization.
Promote the use and reference of the data dictionary by data consumers and producers alike including fellow Governed Data Stewards, business analysts, buyers, and supply chain managers.
Recommend new data quality processes for transactional data and push for data quality operations to move upstream.
Maintain flexibility in an ever-evolving landscape to perform additional duties as needed.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Required:
Minimum of 3 years of data stewardship, data governance, and/or master data experience with a bachelor’s degree in a related field.
Direct experience working on data quality, data warehousing or other enterprise data and analytic management initiatives.
Experience leading change management and knowledge sharing activities
Experience developing training and communication materials
Experience in Integrated Supply Chain, Supplier Management and/or Procurement
A successful track record navigating uncertainty and ambiguity in critical, enterprise-wide, multidisciplinary initiatives that meaningfully improve organizational effectiveness
Basic understanding and ability to interrogate databases using SQL
Strong business point of view and communication, presentation and negotiation skills
Strong ability to self-manage and drive toward high-quality results
Strong analytical, conceptual and problem-solving skills with a proven track record for gathering and documenting comprehensive business requirements.
Thrive in complex, often ambiguous, and fast paced environments.
Must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.
Desired:
Passion for our mission of millions of people living and working in space to benefit earth
Experience using data governance and data quality tools (specifically EnterWorks™)
Experience using procurement software including Coupa and Costpoint
Certified Information Management Professional (CIMP) or Data Governance and Stewardship Professional (DGSP) credential.
Experience developing and implementing data governance policies and guidelines
Experience performing as a data steward
Demonstrated effectiveness in leading/directing small project teams

positionName: Senior Data Analyst - EA CTO PI&E
description:
We are EA

And we make games – how cool is that? In fact, we entertain millions of people across the globe with the most amazing and immersive interactive software in the industry. But making games is challenging. That’s why we employ the most creative, passionate people in the industry.

Our games are played everywhere in the world, in countries as diverse as the USA, Germany, Russia, Brazil, South Korea, China, and the Emirates, on any kind of gaming device (PC, web, console, mobile, smart TV’s, etc.) and support different business models (digital downloads, PDLC, F2P, subscriptions.)

The Challenge Ahead

The EA Product Infrastructure & Engineering (PI&E) group is part of the CTO organization and is the foundation on which EA’s games are built and operate. PI&E builds and operates a broad platform of infrastructure services that powers games and enables game development across EA’s global ecosystem Our team’s charter is to make EA's games and services available to all players anytime and anywhere. To do this, we focus on the high availability of infrastructure, core services, and studio services. Additionally, we aim to enable developers to experiment and build new games quickly with infrastructure services on-demand and workflows that enable rapid development in the cloud. In all of this, we partner across EA to drive infrastructure cost efficiency and infrastructure optimization.

The Role

As a senior data analyst, you will charter new approaches to analyze the data and influence the business with high impact. You will collaborate across different teams including Infrastructure Optimization, Engineering, Studios, PMO, Operations, and Finance, to drive data-driven decisions. You will be responsible for developing metrics, reporting, and analysis in support of the platform.

This role requires that individuals have deep analytical abilities paired with strategic acumen, strong communication skills, and comfort levels working with technology teams.

Within the PI&E Infrastructure Optimization team, you will support the Infrastructure Capacity Management team who is responsible for developing, deploying, and ingraining best practices throughout the organization related to cloud and on-prem infrastructure capacity planning such as cloud and on-prem infrastructure capacity management process, systems, metrics, reporting, or training - building “infrastructure” for the team. You have strong influencing and customer service skills, are comfortable navigating ambiguity, collaborating with multiple teams, and building strong relationships with stakeholders.

Your work in modeling business scenarios or tracking utilization across teams, spend drivers, will be incorporated by Infrastructure Optimization in the build-out of systems, tools, and platforms. More specifically, you will be tasked with building forecasts, utilization forecasts, capacity models, and reporting infrastructures.

You will gather insights into infrastructure forecast and consumption patterns across hundreds of internal customers, and synthesize and deliver these findings in QBRs and presentations.

Responsibilities:
Research new ways of modeling data to unlock actionable procurement, capacity utilization, and capacity efficiency insights and monitor performance indicators, highlighting trends, and analyzing causes of unexpected variance.
Establish the processes needed to achieve business operational excellence in all areas to improve visibility and transparency of infrastructure efficiency and capacity optimization.
Make business recommendations with effective presentations of findings at multiple levels of stakeholders through visual displays of quantitative information.
Envision, develop, and deploy procurement, capacity efficiency, resource utilization analytics solutions to streamline processes that will lead to efficiency gains and improvement of key metrics.
Define, lead, and project manage by bringing together/interpreting internal and external data to produce insightful findings matched to business requirements.
Create dashboards and reports to make KPIs and OKRs data available for different stakeholders and provide analytical decision-making support for key projects.

Qualifications

Background and technical skills:
Advanced SQL skills including experience querying complex data sets.
7+ years of relevant hands-on analytical experience, with the ability to manage the analytical process and translate the findings from the data into recommendations for our partners.
Undergrad/Graduate Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or Engineering Sciences preferred.
Experience in data mining, statistical computing, and data visualization (Knowledge of tools like R, Tableau, Python, etc.).
Strong business operations acumen with an understanding of decision support models, business operations research, capacity planning.
Experience with data visualization using Snowflake, Looker, or similar tools.
Experience sourcing, integrating and managing big data from multiple systems.
Experience leveraging statistical tools & methods and utilizing data science tools (machine learning models, etc.) to develop insights and predictive models.
Strong collaboration skills and demonstrated strengths working across groups.

Soft skills:
If you:
usually see challenges as opportunities
are independent and committed to seeing your projects until the end and you always push for great quality work
know that details are important, but you always keep in mind the full context
have a clear desire for continuous growth and active investment in own learning
want to meet a global and diverse group of colleagues coming from different backgrounds

...we would be happy to meet you!

Notes: As a UW employee, you will enjoy generous benefits and work/life programs. For a complete description of our benefits for this position, please visit our website, click here.


As a UW employee, you have a unique opportunity to change lives on our campuses, in our state and around the world. UW employees offer their boundless energy, creative problem solving skills and dedication to build stronger minds and a healthier world.


UW faculty and staff also enjoy outstanding benefits, professional growth opportunities and unique resources in an environment noted for diversity, intellectual excitement, artistic pursuits and natural beauty.


About Genome Sciences:

The Department of Genome Sciences (GS) is part of the University of Washington School of Medicine (UW SoM) and is comprised of 30 labs addressing leading edge questions in biology and medicine by developing and applying genetic, genomic and computational approaches taking advantage of genomic information now available for a host of species. GS is making major contributions in the application of genome science to understand the fundamentals of biology and to improve human health and well-being.


Genome Sciences is a collaborative department supported by very different academic disciplines. We work with a multitude of Program Investigators (PIs) in departments both on the UW campus as well as worldwide. The department has gone through significant expansion since its beginning in 2001 with annual grant awards of $68.5M in FY21. The department has 62 training, teaching, and research faculty.


Position Purpose

The Department of Genome Sciences has an outstanding opportunity for a Bioinformatics Variant Review Analyst. The position will play an important role in the All of Us Research Program. This individual will review and interpret genetic variants from genomic-based next generation DNA sequencing and assist lab directors with interpretation and reporting. This includes the review of genetic panels based on clinical genomes, and other advanced diagnostic testing applied to large research studies providing expert interpretation, and developing novel methods and techniques to analyze data.


Position Complexities

The Northwest Genomics Center (NWGC) at the University of Washington is one of the leading genome centers in the United States. The NWGC, housed within UW Medicine’s Department of Genome Sciences, is the largest self-sustaining genome center in the Pacific Northwest and one of the most successful genome centers in the country. It has partnered to deliver exome or whole genome sequence (WGS) data for many highly successful large-scale human genetic projects of both rare conditions and common diseases. These projects include the Mendelian Genomics Research Consortium (MGRC), the NHLBI Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine Program (TOPMed), and, most recently, the All of Us program that has the goal of sequencing one million Americans.


RESPONSIBILITIES

Bioinformatics Research – (100%)

Responsible for review and interpretation of genomic results under direction of clinical laboratory Directors and staff.

Develop and coordinate data analysis strategies and implementation for large research projects.

Responsible to review genomic data and maintain the active knowledgebase for variant interpretation.

Update variant curation strategies, variant scoring process, interpretation process, and reporting process on an ongoing basis.

Develop expertise in interpreting genetic data from open source and proprietary analysis software and databases.

Support/design of software tools to assist in more efficient variant review for the variant review scientist and affiliated faculty.

Thrive in a fast-paced work environment that requires independent self-direction with an aptitude for team collaboration and open communication.

Provide support in writing manuscripts, abstracts and presentations.

Present analysis findings at group meetings and national conferences, if necessary.


Dimensions and Impact to the University

This position will play a principal role in supporting the various NGS variant analysis workflows in the NWGC which provides core resources for other programs at UW (e.g. All of Us Research Program and Mendelian Genomics Research Consortium).


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Master’s Degree in genetics, genomics, bioinformatics, molecular biology, chemistry, biochemistry or related discipline and one year of related experience.


ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:

Excellent understanding of human genetics and variant interpretation.

Strong knowledge of exploratory data analyses.

Documented experience with ClinVar, ClinGen, and ACMG standards and recommendations for variant reporting.

Ability to manage projects and solve problems independently.

Excellent collaborator with interdisciplinary teams.

Strong written and oral communication skills.


DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS

Ph.D., or foreign equivalent, in human genetics, bioinformatics, computer sciences, or related field.

Knowledge of clinical standards for medically relevant variants and their interpretation

Knowledge of laboratory information systems (LIMS) design and implementation

Knowledge of CLIA/CAP policies and procedures for best laboratory practices


WORKING CONDITIONS

The Bioinformatics Analyst position is expected to respond immediately to questions from investigators, teammates, and provide expert technical support for developing, reports or trouble-shooting workflows. On occasion, it will be neceessary to respond immediately to urgent questions from the P.I. and other managers if problems arise that impact the work flow or deadlines for the NWGC production center - these tend to happen on a weekly basis and occasionally require extra hours be worked on a given day.


Application Process:

The application process for UW positions may include completion of a variety of online assessments to obtain additional information that will be used in the evaluation process. These assessments may include Work Authorization, Cover Letter and/or others. Any assessments that you need to complete will appear on your screen as soon as you select “Apply to this position”. Once you begin an assessment, it must be completed at that time; if you do not complete the assessment you will be prompted to do so the next time you access your “My Jobs” page. If you select to take it later, it will appear on your "My Jobs" page to take when you are ready. Please note that your application will not be reviewed, and you will not be considered for this position until all required assessments have been completed.

#LI-KC1

POSITION: LIMS Analyst
REPORTS TO: Clinical Data Manager
DEPARTMENT: Data Sciences
STATUS: Exempt

TWINSTRAND BIOSCIENCES OVERVIEW
TwinStrand Biosciences is a Seattle-based genomics company focused on developing cutting-edge approaches for early detection of cancer, treatment optimization, and risk prediction using our ultra-accurate TwinStrand Duplex Sequencing™ technology. Our technology enables researchers and clinicians to detect genetic “needles in a haystack.” By identifying ultra-low frequency DNA mutations with a resolution 10,000-fold greater than conventional tools on the market, TwinStrand enables detection, quantification, and characterization of variants that were previously undetectable. We have recently closed a $50 million Series B financing and will continue our accelerated growth to make a difference in life sciences and medicine.
POSITION OVERVIEW
TwinStrand Biosciences is seeking a qualified individual for the position of LIMS Analyst. As a LIMS Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in supporting the implementation, enhancement, maintenance, and compliance of TwinStrand’s Laboratory Information Management System (LIMS).
As a member of the Data Sciences Department, you will initially work on assisting with the implementation and validation of a LIMS within a CLIA regulated environment. You will also be responsible for documenting validation plans, standard operating procedures, and training lab personnel in the use of LIMS to maintain standards of exceptional data quality. TwinStrand is moving towards higher levels of regulatory achievement and compliance for its many assays, and you will be a key asset to the clinical data management group.
A process-oriented individual with exceptional attention to detail will excel in the role of LIMS Analyst. Familiarity with Good Clinical Practice (GCP) and Good Clinical Data Management Practices (GCDMP) will be essential for your success in this role. At TwinStrand, you will learn many skills beyond those required for the core role of LIMS Analyst as our team is incredibly education and career development focused, and we are interested in seeing you grow in your role while continuing to take on more responsibility.
You are the ideal LIMS Analyst if you are a self-starter, that thrives in a collaborative environment, delivering high-quality solutions in lab information management to meet cross functional requirements across multiple scientific and operations departments. We need your expertise in bringing our Duplex Sequencing technology into regulated spaces so that we can continue to pioneer solutions for human health improvement.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Actively participate in all phases of application implementation, including the ownership of key deliverables such as User Requirements Specifications, Functional Specification, Design Specification, Configuration specification, and test cases
Participate in software systems validation activities including the support of and review of master validation plans, development, and execution of IQ/OQ/PQ testing
Document and maintain standard operating procedures for clinical data management including LIMS administration
Provide work instructions and technical support of LIMS and other e-systems to support clinical and other business operations
Collaborate with internal departments such as Quality, Operations, Manufacturing, R&D, to develop business justification for enhancements of clinical data management systems
Provide input on design and implementation strategy of LIMS and data management features and processes
Assist in tracking, documenting, or performing root cause analysis during clinical data management-related quality events such as deviations, triage, and CAPAs
Train staff on proper use of LIMS, particularly on new solutions developed by the group to address business gaps or improvement opportunities
Be the secondary subject matter expert (SME) for LIMS during audits and assist in the audit readiness of the following: qualification documentation, user lists & privileges, logs, and procedures
Update specifications, analyses, and other static data within the LIMS
Other duties as assigned

EXPERIENCE AND CAPABILITIES
B.S. in life sciences, computer science, health informatics, or related field
3-5+ years of related experience
Expert in analytics platforms and dashboarding tools such as: Crystal Reports or Tableau
Experience with popular commercial LIMS solutions and their configuration
Experience working with LIMS users to extract requirements for projects and tasks
Experience in a Pharma/CLIA, or other regulated environment, which include validation, documentation, quality control, and audits
Experience in leading business process implementing or integrating efforts for at least 1 medium-to-large LIMS enhancement projects
Proficiency in at least one programming language, and awareness of others
Knowledgeable in 21 CFR Part 11 compliance requirements
Effective communication skills

OUTSTANDING CANDIDATES WILL
Experience in leading business process implementing or integrating efforts for at least 3 medium-to-large LIMS enhancement projects
Understand the value of a process-centric approach to business analysis
Have experience with regulatory data management and compliance in the cloud
Expert ability in at least one programming language, and proficiency in others
Familiarity with version control systems like Git
Have previous biotechnology experience, startup company a bonus

PHYSICAL AND TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS
Prolonged periods sitting at a desk, using a computer, and maintaining a home office
Ability to travel nationally up to 10% of the time for headquarters visits

ABOUT TWINSTRAND BIOSCIENCES
We are a vibrant, young company committed to applying a powerful new genomic technology across disciplines to improve human health and accelerate scientific discovery. Our mission is to develop and deliver the unprecedented accuracy of duplex sequencing for applications in the life sciences and medicine where it can do the greatest good for the maximum number of people.
Our business is multifaceted and encompasses internal development projects, external collaborations, and empowering of our partner organizations and customers. Our mission is strongly rooted in academic principles of responsible citizenship within the broader scientific community, yet executed with the nimbleness of a startup, such that research can be rapidly translated into solutions that benefit the scientific and medical community. To the greatest extent possible, we strive for open sharing of knowledge and discovery through academic presentations and peer-reviewed publications.
At TwinStrand we put a premium on creativity, dynamic thinking, and a rigorous scientific approach. You will be challenged to push the boundaries of your knowledge, skills, and comfort zone and to take ownership of your area of expertise. We expect all team members to take on some form of leadership role over time and mentor new team members as we continue to expand. We want every member of our community to come to work excited each day and able to take pride in the high-quality science to improve human health that they are contributing to.
TwinStrand Biosciences is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

We are:
Applied Intelligence, the people who love using data to tell a story. We’re also the world’s largest team of data scientists, data engineers, and experts in machine learning and AI. A great day for us? Solving big problems using the latest tech, serious brain power, and deep knowledge of just about every industry. We believe a mix of data, analytics, automation, and responsible AI can do almost anything—spark digital metamorphoses, widen the range of what humans can do, and breathe life into smart products and services. Want to join our crew of sharp analytical minds? Visit us here to find out more about Applied Intelligence.
You Are:
A data visionary – literally! You are fascinated by data, no matter where it comes from. Your superpower? Leading data visualization efforts by creating crystal clear, compelling visualizations of data in clients’ standard platforms – then teasing out and sharing insights from that data. You have top-notch communication skills and you’re in your element juggling priorities in a fast-paced setting where results are everything.
The Work:
Be a part of a team that is in charge of building end-to-end digital transformation capabilities and lead fast moving development teams using Agile methodologies.
Consult on and help with the making of creative data visualization to give users the best experience possible.
Help migrate users’ homegrown data visualization applications to enterprise standard.
Collaborate on creation efforts between the Accenture team and client business users to define and validate compelling Analytics applications or dashboards that drive value add.
Keep everyone from individual contributors to top executives in the loop about progress, communicating across organizations and levels. If critical issues block progress, refer them up the chain of command to be resolved in a timely manner.
Pinpoint and clarify key issues that need action, lead the response and articulate results clearly in actionable form.
Show a strong aptitude for carrying out solutions and translating objectives into a scalable solution that meets end customers’ needs within deadlines.

Here’s what you need:
Minimum of a Bachelor's degree or 2 years of hands on data visualization experience
Minimum 2 years of full life cycle Development. Agile and waterfall delivery experience
Minimum 2 years of design or development experience with 2 or more of the following data visualization tools; Tableau, Qlik, Spotfire, PowerBI, ThoughtSpot; as well as SQL and Python scripting
Minimum 1 year of data technology experience to include ETL tools (BODS, Informatica, Talend, Alteryx, Ab Initio, DataStage) or Data Modeling (Oracle, Teradata, SAP, Netezza) or other reporting tools such as Cognos, MicroStrategy, Business Objects
Bonus Points If:
2+ years experience with Looker and/or Data Studio
Certified in Google Cloud or many of the technologies mentioned above
Custom data visualization experience using Javascript, R, CSS, HTML5 and/or d3.js
Machine Learning and/or AI experience
Previous consulting experience

Finance Analyst
Overview
We lead the industry in the breadth and depth of how we support our customers—by becoming an extension of their internal team. The Finance team is looking for an experienced Sr. Finance Analyst, who is eager to step in and make an immediate impact in our growing organization. The ideal candidate will be detail oriented, extremely organized, and a motivated self-starter. The Sr. Finance Analyst is responsible for a variety of tasks within the Finance organization, including maintaining financial reports, data accessibility and availability, data governance and stewardship activities as well as all other monthly and quarterly management reporting.
What you will do:
Coordinates data governance and stewardship activities
Help to increase data accessibility and availability
Drive information integration
Understands the business issues and data challenges of the line of business
Prepare monthly financials ensuring all key business deliverables are met
Conduct analysis of monthly financial, KPIs and explanations of key variances and preparation of financial performance reports and explain the business drivers and impacts
Analyzing current and past financial data and performance, prepare monthly and quarterly management reporting, including monthly rolling forecast and other financial reporting templates based on the analysis
Prepare the monthly reporting deck to highlight financial trends and summarize business plans
Identifying trends in financial performance and providing recommendations for improvement
Support and lead special projects and ad hoc analyses
Identify and implement improvements across financial processes
What you will bring:
3-5 years of Finance/Data Analyst experience
1-2 Strong analytical skills including financial/business modelling and analysis, attention to detail
Great presentation skills
Bachelor’s degree in Business/Finance
Proven track record of being able to collaborate across departments and levels of an organization
Must be comfortable leveraging technology to conduct and improve processes associated with the role – prefer experience working with NetSuite
Must have excellent communication skills (written, verbal) and be comfortable in presenting and discussing issues related to spend at all levels of the organization
Demonstrated ability to drive process improvement in a fast-paced environment
Must be comfortable with ambiguity, working independently and adapting to changing business needs

positionName: Business Analyst II/III - GNS & Transcon Products, IS Operational Experience
description:
Company Description
“We’re not in the shipping business; we’re in the information business” -Peter Rose, Expeditors Founder
Global supply chain management is what we do, but at the heart of Expeditors you will find professionalism, leadership, and a friendly environment, all of which foster an innovative, customer service-based approach to logistics.
18,000 trained professionals
300+ locations worldwide
Fortune 500
Globally unified systems

Job Description
As part of the Operational Experience IS Portfolio, the Ground Network Service (GNS) & Transcon teams are responsible for migrating user functionality from our Legacy systems to our Exp.o system platform. As a Business Analyst, you will work closely with the Product Owner and will be responsible to assist the team deliver business value and user functionality.
The ideal candidate for this position is a problem solver and facilitator. You will use business knowledge, system analysis, critical thinking skills to clarify requirements with stakeholders and have the team participate in collaborations to build user functionality. The ideal Business Analyst has strong communication and facilitation skills and can build relationships with both their team members and stakeholders.
If you are self-motivated and passionate about technology, customer service, teamwork and building valuable business and user functionality, this could be the right position for you.
Roles and Responsibilities
Supports our Migration Strategy to Deliver the exp.o System
Promotes and enforces Data Governance best practices
Elicitation, organization, translation, analysis and prioritization of both business level and functional requirements
Development of process flow and data processing logic
Create and execute tactical plans to achieve both short and long-term objectives
Lead cross-functional teams to solve complex technical challenges, maximizing team productivity and velocity
Participate in team check-ins, demos, reviews and retrospectives with an eye toward continuous improvement
Prepare for Program activities, including PI Planning, System Demos, and Inspect and Adapt
Contribute to team objectives for each Iteration and Program Increment (PI)

Qualifications
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
3+ years of Business Analysis experience or equivalent work in software development.
Demonstrated leadership, analytical, organization, interpersonal, and communication skills
Ability to provide exceptional customer service, research and resolve issues, and demonstrated commitment to continuous learning
Comfortable communicating details and concepts to a broad range of audiences
Broad knowledge of database structures, data relationships, and data modeling
Possesses an advanced knowledge about industry information/data management best practices
Possesses agility for learning technical and business concepts
Management of multiple and competing priorities
Ability to simplify complex business and technical needs.
DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Prior experience or understanding of the transportation/logistics industry.
Experience with Agile or Scrum development practices.
Effective at navigating ambiguity and helping diverse teams drive toward clarity and consensus
Results orientated, willingness to commit to a direction and drive to completion
Passion for technology
Working knowledge of Azure DevOps, SharePoint, Microsoft Office
SAFe familiarity and/or certification
Additional Information
Expeditors offers excellent benefits:
Paid Vacation, Holiday, Sick Time
Health Plan: Medical, Prescription Drug, Dental and Vision
Life and Long Term Disability Insurance
401(k) Retirement Savings Plan
Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Training and Personnel Development Program
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Successful candidates must pass a background check.

Notes: As a UW employee, you will enjoy generous benefits and work/life programs. For detailed information on Benefits for this position, click here.


As a UW employee, you have a unique opportunity to change lives on our campuses, in our state and around the world. UW employees offer their boundless energy, creative problem solving skills and dedication to build stronger minds and a healthier world.


UW faculty and staff also enjoy outstanding benefits, professional growth opportunities and unique resources in an environment noted for diversity, intellectual excitement, artistic pursuits and natural beauty.


The University is currently involved in a multi-year program to modernize its existing financial systems. The UW Finance Transformation Program (UWFT) is implementing Workday Financials with a planned go-live date of July 2023. These positions will support the ISC’s efforts as they work with the UWFT Program on the changes this implementation will have on the current configuration of Workday HCM. These positions are funded for the duration of the Program, with an expected end date in December 2023.


The Integrated Service Center (ISC) supports the University’s faculty, staff and student workers by serving as a first point of contact for designated HR and Payroll inquiries and by processing a limited scope of centralized Human Capital Management (HCM) transactions (i.e., within the HR, Benefits and Payroll domains). The hallmarks of the ISC is in delivering services that are timely, accurate and highly attuned to the fast-paced university environment.


Reporting to the ISC Production Manager, the Payroll Business Analyst will provide analytical support and expertise to a team dedicated to executing Tier 2 payroll processing/transactional functions within the ISC framework.


More specific responsibilities will include analyzing payroll data, general ledger reconciliations and reporting, and reporting metrics, leading development of payroll procedures, supporting successful execution of payroll processes as required, and coordinating with a combination of HCM, Benefits, and Payroll resources within the ISC, finance transformation and advanced domain experts external to the ISC to address escalated inquiries. As a member of a team focused on continuous improvement, this role will also be expected to identify process issues, assess opportunities for improvement and advance recommended solutions in support of Workday Finance implementation.


In order to be successful, the incumbent will need to exhibit a high level of payroll expertise and knowledge in areas of pay processing including pay and retro calculations, demonstrate a keen attention to detail while remaining aware of broader University objectives along with federal, state, and university policies, procedures and laws required to meet compliance. Additionally, the role will require strong analytical acumen, an ability to prioritize multiple timelines, and competing goals, play a critical role in delivering quality payroll results, and excellent documentation skills.


RESPONSIBILITIES:


Payroll Analysis and Reporting

Analyzes payroll transactions, data, processes and deductions data to develop reports and metrics to support Finance Transformation optimization for payroll functions.

Develops systems and measurements to support process improvement/LEAN program.

Supports all data requirements/system requirements for Payroll Production including on-cycle and off-cycle pay, deductions, vendor payments, and measurements to support continuous process improvements.

Assist Production Manager to analysis data trends to support business decisions and processes including developing and documentation of processes. Develop avenues to share trends with departments (under and overpayment) to aid in reduction of errors and established timelines.

Complies data from multiple data sources (Workday, UWConnect, Finance) for reconciliations and reporting.

Uses analytical tools such as SQL Server, Microsoft Reporting Services, Access, Excel and/or similar applications to extract and analyze large volumes of payroll data.

Coordinates with ISC leadership and stakeholders to interpret payroll data, identify issues and implement resolution plans. Assist in the development of goals and measurements to support Payroll.

Document current and future payroll processes as part of Finance Transformation readiness.

Develop and test user cases for Finance Transformation and other payroll projects.

Participate in reviewing pay results associated with Finance Transformation testing and other pay related projects to insure pay results are accurate, discrepancies are located, reviewed and corrected.


Payroll Processing

Supports successful execution of payroll processes as required, including processing payroll, reviewing and approving off-cycle checks for payment, assist in overpayments and related reporting, deductions and monitoring audit reports.

Analyzes and identifies process improvement opportunities to streamline workflow and deliver enhanced customer service to the organization.

Supports timely resolution of complex issues/inquiries including customer inquiries.

Document changes to payroll processing due to Finance Transformation.

Contributes to an outstanding customer-service environment, including strong collaboration with other team and subject matter experts external to the ISC as required.

Assist in training activities for Payroll (internal and external).

Utilizes ServiceNow to facilitate management of inquiries/issues in accordance with established protocols.

Work with a diverse group of individuals; placing a value on diversity, equity, and inclusiveness.


ISC Services Support

Supports periodic Workday update processes, including Payrolls testing activities.

Supports ISC knowledge management processes, including identification and verification of additions/changes to the working repository of knowledge content.

Supports ISC training activities, including development and verification of relevant content.

Other duties as assigned


REQUIREMENTS:

Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Economics, Human Resources, Public Administration or Business Administration or related field and four years of experience working in a payroll, accounting or HCM/HR related role. Equivalent combination of education and experience from which comparable knowledge and skills have been acquired may substitute for degree.

Working experience processing transactions in the payroll/finance domain demonstrating excellent accounting skills/knowledge with a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail.

Working knowledge of data analysis, metrics and reporting.


Demonstrated experience using Excel, and strong data mining skills.

Experience documenting processes and workflows.

Experience establishing and maintaining collaborative relationships with key stakeholders.

Extensive experience interacting with customers, including resolution of complex inquiries and efficient performance during high-volume timeframes.

Demonstrated experience in working on diverse groups and teams; respects, values, and contributes to UW Finance and UW’s commitment to diversity, inclusion, and equity.


Equivalent education/experience will substitute for all minimum qualifications except when there are legal requirements, such as a license/certification/registration.


DESIRED:

Working knowledge of data analysis, metrics, and reporting.

Working knowledge of Workday and other University of Washington systems.

Working knowledge of University of Washington HR and payroll policies.

Experience supporting system testing and/or data validation activities.

Being part of Accenture Strategy & Consulting means becoming an expert at making the New happen Now. To us, the New is all about the wise pivot that turns constant disruption to continuous reinvention. If you love solving challenges and not just studying them, then Accenture Consulting is the right place for you. Accenture Strategy & Consulting, Utility Industry, Retail Energy and Customer Service Practice helps energy providers around the world to reimagine, transform and grow their business and create new value propositions, revenue streams, commercial models and ecosystems. Join a team of industry practitioners with global footprint and local camaraderie. Visit our site to learn more about Accenture Strategy & Consulting Utilities Practice.

A skilled utility industry practitioner who knows how to reinvent Customer Experience in the new digital world. You have experience designing and implementing digital transformation in a functional and/or technical capacity with CRM / Customer Care focus on business process improvement and/or supporting technical solutions (e.g. in the contact center, back office and strategic departments of a retail utility). You identify, target, and organize for intelligent customer and retail growth with new connected energy experiences. In fact, every day you are looking for opportunities to challenge the status quo and you are not satisfied with step change. Data scientist delivering analytics solutions tied to utility customer programs.
Understand client challenges and articulate the value of transformation in terms of business outcomes

Your entrepreneurial spirit and vision will be rewarded, and your success will fuel opportunities for career advancement. You’ll make a difference for some pretty impressive clients. Access to leading-edge technology.

description:
PURPOSE: Responsible for assisting in the development, validation and maintenance of the reporting and BI applications and systems to support data analysis for operational, analytical, and strategic activities. Assists with the implementation and continued support of the Epic Enterprise Reporting System. Maintains standardized report request mechanisms and works with system users to clarify requests. Maintains applications that allow users to access and analyze data in an operational data store, data warehouse or data mart. Works with business requirement analysts to understand and prioritize user requirements. Assists with the development of end-user training and business oriented meta-data and universal definitions.
Develop and maintain standard reports/ad-hoc reports using EPIC Clarity, Salesforce, and other agency databases, Epic Reporting Workbench Data Models, SAP Business Objects applications, including Web Intelligence, Crystal Reports, Tableau, Power BI, SQL, data warehouse and ETL.
Analyze work process flows and technical solutions to bridge the gap between current and future states; interact with ACRS users and perform detailed requirements analysis; support analysis and testing of enhancements to meet requirements; collaborate with other application teams such as clinical, non-clinical, finance/billing, data/records, human resources to understand and prioritize user requirements.
Support the maintenance of agency data warehouse databases.
Participate in collaborative projects and processes to support quality improvement and the achievement of team/project goals, including planning, process documentation, and facilitation of assigned team and project meetings.
Participate with teams to evaluate and troubleshoot EPIC EMR issues.
Assists in the development of training, including . Provide updates and training related to garding new EPIC enhancements and reports.
Participate in meetings with software vendors and external stakeholders.
Attends all agency, program and team meetings, in-service trainings, and supervision.
Other job-related duties as assigned by management.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORKING CONDITIONS: Regularly required to walk; use hands and arms to reach and operate objects, tools, or controls. Must occasionally lift and/or move up to 20 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and the ability to adjust focus. Some work will be performed offsite (i.e., outside classes or meetings with employers). The noise level in the work environment is moderate.

QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field and two (2) years relevant experience in information technology.

OR
Associate degree and five (5) years of experience in information technology.
AND
Minimum two (2) years of experience in Epic Clarity database reporting.
Minimum two (2) years of experience with Microsoft SQL, Windows environment and supporting Microsoft network.
Able to use SQL to develop tables, views, packages, stored procedures, functions triggers, test, and debug.
Experience with Data Processing including: ETL (extract, transform, load), processing, integration; database design such as physical and/or logical data modeling, ERD, Query and Report development.
Proficient knowledge of SSIS, SQL Server database or other development platform for data collection interfaces and data workflows.
Database security, and cloud computing is preferred.
Proficient knowledge of creating reports by using Crystal Report and Microsoft Reporting Service, Power BI or other data analysis and visualization software.
Strong communication and customer service skills; ability to use non-technical approaches to train others in the use of computer hardware and software.
Ability to provide effective and respectful service to employees, visitors and clients of diverse cultural beliefs and practices.
Self-motivated with the ability to identify and resolve issues, advance personal knowledge, execute complex tasks through organization and details driven approach, and demonstrates excellent interpersonal communication skills, among facility customers and teams.
Effective ability to navigate a personal computer. Competency in use of the Microsoft Office and other relevant software for word processing, calendaring, e-mail, and data entry. Efficiently research and perform various tasks via the internet.

Posting Description:

Aon is looking for a Patent Analyst
As part of an industry-leading team, you will help empower results for our clients by delivering innovative and effective solutions supporting our New Ventures Group, specifically Intellectual Property solutions
Your impact as a Patent Analyst
As a Patent Analyst in Aon Intellectual Property Solutions, you will collaborate in the development and delivery of strategy and other consulting service projects, as part of a small team of IP professionals. These service projects are foundational to our relationship with clients, are intended to drive growth in clients’ enterprise value, and are essential to the evolution of our business.
In this role, you will work closely with clients and more senior team members to assess clients’ business objectives and to tailor project scope, content, and implementation to best address those objectives. You will perform IP and other research and analysis and prepare detailed reports and presentations to summarize findings and provide recommendations/conclusions. You will help develop a team of less experienced IP professionals supporting that work. Your experience and judgement will be essential to the delivery of superior results to clients.
You will contribute to a range of projects for different clients, involving different types and mixes of IP, different technology/market sectors, and different transactional and other business contexts. In addition, you will work with more senior team members on select projects involving organizational management
To be successful in this role, you should be prepared to respond promptly, thoughtfully and effectively to changing client needs, work environments, and team priorities. You should be able to communicate effectively and appropriately with internal team members, other Aon colleagues, clients and other stakeholders. You will be essential to the efficient functioning of our team.
Job Responsibilities:
Enjoy collaborating with more- and less-experienced team members on consulting projects such as foundational landscape analyses, IP valuations, patent acquisition strategies, due diligence assessments, insurance underwriting related to IP, written reports and presentations, newsletters
Support the creation of project proposals tailored to client business objectives and constraints
Work collaboratively with clients and other team members in the delivery of services
Participate in presentations to clients, presenting select content and addressing select issues
Serve as a key resource to the team by independently seeking out answers to questions and taking the initiative to address project needs
Demonstrate an ability to identify and prioritize the important work, address pressing issues and establish process improvements
Engage with members of Consulting team to gain a deep understanding of existing systems, the underlying data, and how each system supports the business
Aggregate and analyze data across multiple systems to ensure data accuracy, integrity and consistency
Utilize and maintain various databases as required
Utilize queries to retrieve, analyze and manipulate data as necessary
Identify opportunities for improvement across our current software platform and recommend solutions to ensure maximum efficiency and utilization
Perform hypothesis testing, efficiency testing, target customer, and market research for building and expanding IPS proprietary tools
Have access to internal and external resources for client and industry research
Prepare to shine, as you analyze data and produce high quality spreadsheets and other outputs using public and proprietary analytical tools and methods
Enjoy open communication to leaders and team members
Other duties and projects as assigned
You Bring Knowledge and Expertise
Required Skills and Experience
2+ years of analyst experience.
Advanced level of computer literacy, including intermediate to advanced proficiency in MS Excel, MS Access and database design, with Python and/or data visualization experience a plus
Demonstrated critical thinking skillsTeam player with good communication
Highly organized.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Able to manage multiple priorities with flexibility and adaptability to rapid growth or change.
Work effectively and professionally with employees in multiple locations.
Comfortable making decisions with imperfect information.
Strong attention to detail.
Comfortable giving and receiving feedback.
Experience with legal and/or consulting industry a plus.
Preferred Experience:
Experience with multiple domains of IP practice (e.g., more than one of asset development, risk mitigation, data and analytics, portfolio management, licensing, transactional due diligence, patent and non-patent IP assets/risks).
Engineering or technical training highly desired
Experience with a wide range of publicly available IP analytic tools and other resources, including IP portfolio management databases.
Relevant IP experience, preferably including time working as part of an in-house IP team.
 Education:
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, other technical discipline, business field (e.g., finance), or relevant work experience.
We offer you
A competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization.
Our Colleague Experience:
From helping clients gain access to capital after natural disasters, to creating access to health care and retirement for millions, Aon colleagues empower results for our clients, communities, and each other every day. They make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. This is the Aon Colleague Experience, defining what it means to work at Aon and realizing our vision of empowering human and economic possibility. To learn more visit Aon Colleague Experience.
About Aon:
Aon plc (NYSE:AON) is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance.
Aon provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran, marital, or domestic partner status. Aon is committed to a diverse workforce and is an affirmative action employer.
DISCLAIMER:

Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.

This position will be responsible for developing detailed business requirements, process flow diagrams, user journeys, along with other appropriate standard analysis artifacts. The ideal candidate will be a collaborative and creative problem-solver who communicates effectively while working with a diverse group of stakeholders and executive level leadership.
The selected candidate will be involved in program/project implementations. This individual will support multiple customers and stakeholders throughout the project life cycle to help realize business benefits and define a set of business requirements and user journeys that will translate into valuable business solutions and technology systems. The candidate will work closely with end users, user experience designers, business unit representatives, development architects/engineers, quality assurance and others in all stages of the project lifecycle including discovery, design, construction, testing, and implementation. This individual should demonstrate the highest levels of customer service, communication, productivity and professionalism. In addition, the candidate will have the ability and aptitude for leadership and self-motivation, possessing strong analytical skills expertise.
If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined.

ROLE

Stakeholder and team interaction:
Determines business influence and relationship needs.
Builds and manages business relationships including business partners, users, vendors, customers, project team members, and management leaders.
Interacts with technical team(s) to translate functional specifications into technology solutions.
Requirements management process:
Develops business analysis artifacts (use cases, customer journeys, business models, etc.) to document “as-is” and “to-be” requirements and change management plans as they pertain to specific projects and/or functional areas. Identifies and communicates risks and issues that may require changes to plans or scope.
Prioritizes requirements effectively based on appropriately identified factors.
Organizes and synthesizes large amounts of information provided by stakeholders.
Ensures that all requirements and journeys support the delivery of business value, fulfills goals and objectives and meet stakeholder needs.
Leads and participates in Business and User Acceptance sessions for confirmation of requirements. Collaborates with solution architects, process specialists, software developers, and other project stakeholders to design exceptional user experiences.
Analyzes and evaluates current user interfaces and proposes usability improvements. Conducts competitive analysis research to better understand prevalent interaction solutions.
Creates interactive simulations/prototypes to help project teams, stakeholders, and users explore and understand proposed business solutions.
Elicitation and communication:
Ensures appropriate stakeholders are involved and obtain required information for capturing and validating requirements, journeys and other artifacts.
Manages requirements traceability and future reuse.
Prepares artifacts in an understandable and presentable format.
Exceptional communication skills, both oral and written, including presentation skills (many interactions will be with teams where English is not their primary language).
REQUIRED

Minimum 8 years’ Business Analysis and Ecommerce experience.
Deep understanding of business requirements elicitation pursuant to specific user journeys, programs/projects involved.
Proficient in requirements gathering, business modeling, user journey modeling/documenting, project scoping, and use case creation.
High level proficiency in utilizing development, data, and business process analysis tools/utilities (SDLC, Business Process models, use case modeling, context diagramming, functional decomposition).
Proficient in the use of the Google products: email, spreadsheet, document, presentation, analytics. Experience in negotiating timelines and deliverables.
Proven experience in Agile / DevOps methodologies.
Strong process knowledge of System Development Life Cycles.
 Experience with executing project governance including change control and issue/risk management. Working knowledge of Project Management Tools (Confluence, JIRA, Microsoft Project, SmartSheets, etc.) and standard SQA Tools.
Excellent interpersonal and diplomatic skills as well as a positive attitude.
Proven leadership skills, demonstrated team-building skills with ability to influence and motivate team members that report to other groups in the organization.
Extreme responsiveness with a strong sense of urgency.
Adept at assessing issues with ability to devise workable solutions quickly responding appropriately. Able to work independently.
Excellent organizational and planning skills, with experience building tactical plans.
Flexible, must be able to change priorities quickly, focus on new ones without distraction, able to deal with conflict and work under pressure to meet deliverable dates / timelines.
Must be able to adjust work hours to accommodate global teams.
Ability and willingness to travel globally.
24 x 7 x 365 operations - evening, weekend, and holiday work may be required.
Recommended
Experience in Ecommerce Solutions (specifically SAP Commerce Platforms).
BA in Business Analysis, Business, Information Technology, or equivalent.
Professional business analysis certifications, such as CBAP or CCBA.
Experience with projects focused on infrastructures and software solutions.
SQA experience working within an iterative development framework.
2-5 years of retail business knowledge.
Knowledge of French, Spanish, Korean, Mandarin a plus.

Resume

Actively seeks opportunities to influence, build and sustain successful relationships and gain alignment with peers, functional partners and/or external partners to accomplish business objectives.
