POSITION SUMMARY:

The role develops and prepares business analyses of USFab projects past, present, and projected financial position. He/she develops tools to monitor the operating and financial performance of multiple company projects. The person produces financial information and analyses. The position has detailed involvement in the compilation of project cost and budget data.


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:
(This list is not intended to detail all aspects of the assigned work but is representative of the job’s overall responsibilities.)

Supports Project Manager in the process of preparing, calculating, coordinating and maintaining internal budgets. Consolidates business unit-wide information and produces various financial reports while ensuring data integrity.
Works with Project Accountant to assist with project cost performance reporting and ensure internal financial controls processes. Assist with preparing, developing and inputting project controls data.
Analyzes variances of actual expenditures vs. budgeted for multiple projects, identifying key variances and tracking corrective action. Provides Estimate At Completion (EAC) projections, updates, and analysis utilizing Earned Value Management Systems (EVMS) practices. Prepare and present weekly and monthly variance reports.
Prepares customer invoices and supporting documentation. Inputs data into existing company ERP.
Researches, collects, and analyzes data for project cost implications. Clearly presents general and detailed financial analysis. Prepares and presents analyses of Project Management Team requests as required.
Prepares periodic financial reports. Creates and updates ad hoc financial models and measurement tools as required. Provides periodic financial information as scheduled. Performs analytical projects and participates in projects as requested. Translates data into information.
Conducts or coordinates month end accounting procedures such as revenue recognition, subcontractor accruals, and other related analysis necessary for the corporate Vigor Industrial accounting close.


JOB SCOPE:

This position functions within the general parameters of the financial and accounting policies of Vigor Industrial as well as USFab project controls.


SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY:


This role does not have staff directly reporting to it, however does interact closely with various managers and staff throughout the business unit to obtain necessary inputs and information in executing its own deliverables.


INTERPERSONAL CONTACTS:

Interact on a day-to-day basis with Vigor Industrial management, including the Manager of Finance & Accounting, as well as with the USFab vice president, directors, managers, and staff of the program teams, business offices, and support departments.

Interact on a frequent basis with the Vigor Industrial corporate Finance & Accounting team, including the Sr. VP of Finance, Controllers, and other Accounting staff to communicate, report, and resolve matters having implications to the consolidated company.


KNOWLEDGE SKILLS AND ABILITIES:

Ability to perform in depth analyses and reviews of data from multiple sources.
Analytical ability to research problem areas and make conclusions.
Outlines and presents general and detailed information clearly and concisely.
Knowledge of operations and project management.
Ability to work within tight schedules and complete assigned work on time.
Exercise sound judgment, work well independently, prioritize duties and follow through tasks to completion.
Well organized, detail oriented, and customer (internal and external) focused.
Possess strong computer spreadsheet, word-processing, and database skills.
Have a solid understanding of Finance and Accounting.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both oral and written, for constant interaction with all departments, employees and outside customers.


EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE:

AA in Business or related required.
BA/BS Degree in Finance or Accounting preferred (may be substituted with general business degree and appropriate level of experience).
One – three (1-3) years of experience in financial modeling and analysis, budgeting, and/or accounting, preferably in a project based environment. Alternatively, equivalent years of operational management or project management may be considered. Demonstrated ability to manage financial performance of projects, analyze business problems, and communicate results of analysis. Advanced spreadsheet and database query tool experience required.
EVMS (Earned Value Management Systems) experience desired.


CERTIFICATES, LICENSES AND REGISTRATIONS: None required, but any relevant certifications are helpful.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

Work is conducted in a dynamic, fast-paced office setting with moderate to loud noise levels from production activity in the shipyard. The person may be need to work more than 8 hours a day and/or on weekends. Good finger, hand and wrist dexterity required for extensive computer operations is required. He/she may spend extended periods of sitting in front of a computer terminal entering/manipulating data. The person may be required to lift up to 20 pounds. There may be out-of-town travel (including air travel) up to 5% of the time with notice. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


WORK ENVIRONMENT:


While in production areas the person will be exposed to all weather conditions, noise, fumes, dusts and odors. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Description:
Providence St. Joseph Health is calling a Telehealth Billing Coding Analyst PSJH to work remotely within our footprint states: AK, CA, MT, NV, TX, OR and/or WA.
Apply Today! Applicants that meet qualifications will receive a text message with additional questions from our Modern Hire system.
We are seeking a Telehealth Billing Coding Analyst PSJH who will join a team that has the overall responsibility for positioning PHS to implement best practices for Telehealth programs on a multi-state scale, while leveraging the dynamic financial ecosystem to our advantage. Acts as PHS Subject Matter Expert for telehealth coding and billing guidelines, legal and regulatory issues, and payor policies. Responsible for directing research and discovery process, educate stakeholders, and advocate for change in policies and processes, and monitor progress. Responsible for collaborating with PHS parallel SMEs and stakeholders to design and implement PHS future strategy and approach for telehealth reimbursement and coding/billing practices.
In this position you will have the following responsibilities:
Research telehealth billing codes, billing practices, payment policies, and limitations to include Medicare, Medicaid, regional payment policies, as well as PHS policies and practices.
Document research findings, analyze data, and make recommendations for required change(s) in support of PHS telehealth business objectives.
Act as the change agent, driving for policy and process changes where necessary, internally and externally, while monitoring and documenting progress, and escalating issues where indicated.
Provide subject matter expertise, quality review and feedback to regional billing teams.
Primary resource to PHS stakeholders for telehealth coding and billing guidelines, legal/regulatory issues, and payor policies. Ensure customer satisfaction through follow-up, client responsiveness, and thorough communication; manage partners’ expectations.
Based on current coding/billing practices, designs and implement a future approach and strategy for collaborating with partners. Responsible for current and future coding and billing practices, and set policies based on the current environment and collaborate with stakeholders to drive that future state.
Liaise with appropriate PHS resources to develop strategies for payor negotiation and contracting, including government agencies and commercial payors.
Develop and implement coding education, policies, procedures, and documentation guidelines for Telehealth providers and staff. Define requirements for ICD-9, ICD-10, CPT, HCPC, and modifiers for Telehealth program development.
Design and implement process and product improvements to integrate multistate systems for Telehealth coding/billing issues.
Travel to each region to adopt and refine billing processes as they evolve with changing reimbursement rates across the various Telehealth service channels.
Build platform for centralizing Telehealth billing and coding.
Support local physician leaders in the development of coding templates and encounter forms in Epic.
Ensure Epic instances and revenue streams are appropriately reconciled.
Implement and perform compliance audits for telehealth billing practices in conjunction with regional billing teams.
Develop process for data driven analysis to assist in negotiations with payers and to drive organizational performance.
Support Telehealth Provider Network and Clinical Operations team on tools and approaches to integrate and automate processes.
Qualifications:
Required qualifications for this position include:
Education to meet certification, license or registration requirement.
Certified Professional Coder (CPC credential), or. • Registered Health Information Technician (RHIT), or. • Holds at least one of the following coding credentials from the American Academy of Professional Coders (AAPC) and/or American Health and Information Management Association (AHIMA): Registered Health Information Management Administrator (RHIA). Registered Health Information Management Technician (RHIT). Certified Coding Specialist (CCS). Certified Coding Associate (CCA). Certified Coding Specialist – Physician Based (CCS-P). Certified Professional Coder (CPC). Certified Professional Coder – Outpatient Hospital (CPC-H). Certified Professional Coder – Payer (CPC-P).
7 years Billing, coding experience and/or a combination of both, or equivalent experience in a similar healthcare domain.
Experience in medical billing.
Experience in a medical inpatient or outpatient admitting setting.
Track record of delivering high levels of customer satisfaction.
Demonstrated track record in change management.
Preferred qualifications for this position include:
Inpatient and outpatient settings.

description:

Experience with Excel is required, including use of lookups and pivot tables.
Experience with SQL, Tableau and/or other data visualization software is required.

Job summary
Amazon is looking for a motivated individual with strong skills and experience in analytics, technology, and supply chain to be part of a high visibility, strategic team that directly impacts the Amazon customer experience worldwide. In this position you will help us discover and solve real world problems and build metrics using existing and not-yet-existing data for a growing business. This position will focus on improving the utilization (fill rate) of our middle mile trailers, reducing cost for North American Linehaul and impacting sustainability goals. The successful candidate will be highly analytical, have an extremely high level of customer focus and a passion for process improvement.

Responsibilities include:

Developing and driving critical metrics to monitor and optimize the business.
Partnering with internal teams to identify process and system improvement opportunities
Designing and implementing reporting solutions to enable stakeholders to manage the business and make effective decisions.
Supporting cross-functional teams on the day-to-day execution of the existent program implementation.
Driving small to medium operational enhancement projects.

Ability to organize and manage multiple tasks simultaneously
Working knowledge of LEAN and SIX SIGMA methodologies and familiarity with Oracle business intelligence tools is a plus.
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of SQL, Perl, Unix/Linux, Visual Basic or other programming languages are a plus
Excellent written and verbal communication skills complemented with the ability to problem solve independently

positionName: Senior Analyst, Strategic Initiatives & Direct Mail
description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Sales Marketing Operations
Job Details
Are you passionate about delivering easy-to-use solutions that bridge functions and address global challenges?

Do you enjoy learning, defining, and sharing new systems and processes? Are you an organized individual, with strong communication skills that have a knack for project management? If so, the Global Field Marketing Strategy team has an opening for an Analyst, on the Strategic Initiatives & Direct Mail team . This role will manage several demand generation and marketing technology platforms and processes, with an emphasis on the Direct Mail channel. This position will wear multiple hats that require a blend of both technical and non-technical skill sets. The ability to communicate effectively across several key stakeholder teams is a critical function as well as the ability to analyze data to deliver informed inputs that drive global strategy to fuel growth, pipeline, and ACV.


About the Team:

We are champions of Success for Everyone, Everywhere. As the Global Field Marketing Strategy Team, we deliver easy-to-use solutions that bridge time zones and functions, address global challenges, and develop 80/20 frameworks that drive scale, manage efficiencies, and allow us to work smarter as one team. We combine analytics with insights to create compelling data-driven executive narratives and communications that elevate the visibility of our business success. Through globally aligned tools & technology, we rapidly scale efficiency and the impact of our teams. In all things we do, we place the customer at the center of our solutions. We actively seek out differing perspectives , leverage and build upon our global diversity, and harness best practices to bring forward global marketing solutions that accelerate our success.


Responsibilities:
Support project intake and manage users on our technology platforms, specifically for Global Direct Mail Program
Onboard and enable new, and existing users on processes and tools (in partnership with vendors)
Collaborate and manage projects across the field marketing team, regions, stakeholders, and SMEs to build marketing pipeline, accelerate selling cycles, and drive ACV
Develop 80/20 frameworks that drive scale, manage efficiencies, and allow us to work smarter
Track project milestones and tasks across multiple teams via robust documentation
Assist in data analytics, including but not limited to the development of program metrics, attribution, and overall analytics
Work collaboratively with Operations, Compliance, Legal, and other supporting technology groups to develop process and system solutions
Support international expansion, onboarding, and enablement of our technologies
Analyze current processes and determine ways to automate, and streamline, the experience
Assist with setting up Quarterly Business Reviews with our stakeholders
Facilitate team discussions and resolve conflicts quickly
Support other Top Initiatives for the Global Field Marketing organization including Performance Steering and Tiger Team management

Required Skills/Experience:
4-5 years of Marketing Operations and Marketing Analytics experience
Ability to work in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment while remaining flexible and calm under pressure
Experience working with remote and diverse teams across regions and departments
Proficient in MS Office, Google Docs, Quip, Slack, and virtual meeting software
Preferred experience with Marketing Operations tools such as Google Analytics and Tableau CRM
Aptitude to quickly understand systems and technical concepts in order to explain to business partners
Ability to identify, share, and align around project requirements, all while staying highly organized
Self-motivated and enthusiastic with proven creative and critical thinking capabilities
Strong verbal, written, presentation, and interpersonal communication skills with the ability to build effective presentations and project plans
Ability to lead productive calls, identify decisions made, and clearly state action items
Experience working with Sales and Marketing is highly preferred

We are a dedicated team of collaborators, doers, and problem-solvers who are relentlessly committed to using data to drive the future of human space exploration. This position will directly impact the history of space exploration and will require your expertise and detailed attention towards safe and repeatable space flight. Join us in lowering the cost of access to space and enabling Blue Origin’s vision of millions of people living and working in space to benefit Earth!
As a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, you will be responsible for building reporting, dashboards and performing adhoc analyses to help Blue Origin build a road to space using data. Our partners include a broad range of disciplines and range from the CEO to individual contributors across the organization. This person will propel the reliable operation of the company and strengthen the value of analytics and data science in modern aerospace.
What makes our data team successful?
Deeply comprehend our customers’ problems and work develop solutions to address them
Be the trail blazer to develop novel ways of using existing and new datasets to move our customers forward and unlock new insights
Passionate about mapping business process to data inputs and outputs
Confirmed background collaborating with Sr. Executives and Business Owners
Clearly identify requirements and translate to technical implementation plans
Deep knowledge of the business and building data solutions to tackle business challenges
Data storytelling and visualization knowledge with a demonstrable record of driving adoption through crafting products and dashboards people want to use
Responsibilities:
Craft and develop interactive dashboards and data solutions utilizing SQL, Tableau, and other tools
Understand data in source systems and develop requirements for crafting raw data to meet business requirements
Develop scalable SQL queries to satisfy self-service and ad-hoc analytics requirements
Develop and maintain documentation, run books, data dictionaries and guides
Collaborate with executive partners and program management to identify and build metrics and KPI’s that enable leaders to lead their areas
Collaborate with Data and Business Intelligence engineers to develop strategic reporting solutions for leadership to support Weekly Business Reviews (WBR), Program Management Reviews (PMR) and Monthly Operational Reporting (MOR)
Work with customer-partners and domain specialists to generate reporting, application, and integration requirements
Provide business analysis and technical expertise to internal and external partners
Maintain day-to-day workflow and communication with a variety of partners across the company
Qualifications:
Passion for our mission: Millions of people living and working in space!
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
1+ years’ building business reporting datasets and data visualizations
Strong analytical SQL skills
Experience reporting off of large and sophisticated datasets
Experience working with end users to build mockups and design documents
Experience crafting user stories in a Tableau Reporting environment
Excellent written communication and presentation skills
Attention to detail and high level of accuracy
Experience presenting information to executive partners
Ability to earn trust and maintain positive professional relationships
Self-starter, strong bias for action in high ambiguity environment
Knowledge of ETL tools and processes
Must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.
Desired:
Familiar with Python
Familiarity with AWS Services, especially Redshift, S3, RDS EC2
Familiarity using version control to check in production code in a shared repository
Familiarity with OLAP Data Warehouse systems (especially Redshift) – query scaling, performance tuning
Experience with implementing Data Quality monitoring and alerting systems
Familiar with manufacturing, PLM tools, and supply chain operations
Experience with hierarchical data structures and recursive processing techniques
Experience with JIRA, Gitlab and Confluence
Business domain knowledge in procurement, supply chain, manufacturing, aerospace
Data warehouse architecture and modeling experience

positionName: Business Analyst II/III (Product Owner) – Order Management, IS Operational Experience
description:
Company Description
“We’re not in the shipping business; we’re in the information business” -Peter Rose, Expeditors Founder
Global supply chain management is what we do, but at the heart of Expeditors you will find professionalism, leadership, and a friendly environment, all of which foster an innovative, customer service-based approach to logistics.
18,000 trained professionals
300+ locations worldwide
Fortune 500
Globally unified systems

Job Description
As part of IS Operational Experience Portfolio, the Order Management group is responsible for developing core business applications that enable relentless management of customer order data to achieve superior supply chain execution leading to positive results for Expeditors and our customers. These systems enable our world-wide network to deliver a supply chain execution model in sync with our customers’ order processes and network design. The basis of the service is to receive customer orders electronically and then manage and report upon the milestones presented on the orders. Integration in our global operating system of our customer’s order details with the shipment is standard. By utilizing Order Management Services, customers recognize tailored supply chain solutions regardless of sourcing location.
As a Product Owner and Business Analyst, you will be responsible for shaping the direction and quality of the Order Management systems being developed. As a member of the Order Management development team, you will drive the long-term vision, development priorities and requirements for a development team in alignment with core business objectives.
You will fully understand and support our team’s objectives by clearly articulating business value, breaking features down into user stories with clear acceptance criteria, and collaborating closely with program and IS leadership to ensure our Order Management systems meet the high expectations of our business and our customers. This work aligns with our Strategic Initiative: Deliver the exp.o System.
Roles and Responsibilities
Serve in a decision-making, leadership role on an Agile Scrum team as Product Owner
Build, refine, and prioritize team backlog in alignment with the program vision and roadmap
Draft specific team objectives for each sprint and program increment
Craft meaningful requirements that align stakeholder needs to capabilities
Clearly define story acceptance criteria and accept stories into the team backlog
Collaborate with other Product Owners and Business Stakeholders to resolve dependencies, coordinate efforts, and deliver cross-functional initiatives and technical enablers
Lead backlog grooming sessions to facilitate shared understanding of upcoming stories and acceptance criteria
Collaborate with Order Management Product Manager to define Business Features and deem them ready for development
Collaborate with Order Management Product Manager and other groups that may include Air Product, Ocean Product, Cargo Services, Ground Network Services & Transcon, and Connected Customer team on dependencies and shared objectives
Analyze and decompose complex business requirements to build software systems and influence design for testability and scalability
Participate in team demos, reviews and retrospectives with an eye for continuous improvement
Prepare for and participate in ART activities, including PI Planning, System Demos, and Inspect and Adapt

Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications
3+ years of software business analysis experience
Proficiency with the system development lifecycle, including agile techniques and other methodologies
Proven interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate effectively
Effective at navigating ambiguity and helping diverse teams drive towards clarity and consensus
Management of multiple and competing priorities
Ability to compose concepts, ideas, and designs into actionable/measurable deliverables
Excellent time management and organization skills
Outstanding verbal and written communication
Ability to recognize and mitigate risks
Driven, strong 'get it done' attitude
Certification or ability to become certified as a SAFe Product Manager/Product Owner
Desired Qualifications
System or Data analysis experience
Working knowledge of the UML (Unified Modeling Language) with the ability to effectively communicate business requirements through Business Object Models, State Diagrams, and other UML diagrams
Understanding of the transportation/global logistics industry
Working knowledge of Office 2013 or above, Azure Dev Ops (VSTS/TFS), SharePoint
Passion for technology
Experience as a Product Owner for an Agile team
Experience working with Reference Data and/or Data Governance products
Additional Information
Expeditors offers excellent benefits:
Paid Vacation, Holiday, Sick Time
Health Plan: Medical, Prescription Drug, Dental and Vision
Life and Long Term Disability Insurance
401(k) Retirement Savings Plan
Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Training and Personnel Development Program
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Successful candidates must pass a background check.

Responsible for understanding client requirements and work with the Platform team in creating a generic capability that can span across tenants.Collaborates with marketing, experience product teams and enterprise technology to create requirement set.Responsible for highlighting and documenting solutions at a technical architecture levelResponsible in creating technical user stories for the sprint teams, test and accept the delivered solutions.Track in-sprint progress of deliverables along with the scrum masterWork with the Platform Product Managers to align the sprint stories to overall product road map.

Knowledge of SCRUM methodologiesStrong working knowledge of commerce functionality. For eg: Cart, Checkout, Catalog, Tax, Inventory, Promotions, BrowseStrong verbal and written communications skills, with the ability to convey business and technical concepts to subject matter experts and non-technical professionals. Ability to present product functionality, lifecycle and customer experience to stakeholders.Ability to make decisions and solve problems while working under pressure.Ability to show judgment and initiative and to accomplish job duties.

Oracle Analytics Specialist - USDC


Are you an experienced, passionate pioneer in technology - a solutions builder, a roll-up-your-sleeves technologist who wants a daily collaborative environment, think-tank feel and share new ideas with your colleagues - without the extensive demands of travel? If so, consider an opportunity with our US Delivery Center - we are breaking the mold of a typical Delivery Center.


Our US Delivery Centers have been growing since 2014 with significant, continued growth on the horizon. Interested? Read more about our opportunity below ...


Work you'll do/Responsibilities


Provide expertise in performing application development, configuration and unit testing of Oracle Analytics Cloud (OAC), Data Visualization (DV) and Data Integration (using ODI, PL/SQL, SQL).

Work closely with Oracle Analytics team members and Testers using Agile sessions to develop high BI data models to support reporting needs.

Provide hands-on technical solutions to business challenges & translates them into process/ technical solutions.

Log and track defects and communicate to teams for resolution

Deliver high quality work and adapt to new challenges, as an individual or as part of a team


The Team


Analytics & Cognitive


In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence, embracing decision making with clear, data-driven choices that deliver enterprise value in a dynamic business environment.


The Analytics & Cognitive team leverages the power of data, analytics, robotics, science and cognitive technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform decision-making. Together with the Strategy practice, our Strategy & Analytics portfolio helps clients transform their business by architecting organizational intelligence programs and differentiated strategies to win in their chosen markets.


Analytics & Cognitive will work with our clients to:


Implement large-scale data ecosystems including data management, governance and the integration of structured and unstructured data to generate insights leveraging cloud-based platforms

Leverage automation, cognitive and science-based techniques to manage data, predict scenarios and prescribe actions

Drive operational efficiency by maintaining their data ecosystems, sourcing analytics expertise and providing As-a-Service offerings for continuous insights and improvements

Qualifications


Required


6+ year of primary focus on developing customer solutions using Oracle's analytics offerings: Oracle Analytics Cloud, Data Visualization, Fusion Analytics for Warehouse, OBIEE, OBIA, Machine Learning and Autonomous Data warehouse(ADW)
6+ year of extensive, hands on, end to end implementation experience using OAC/OBIEE Reporting tools - BI Publisher, Analysis & Dashboards
6+ year of Deep Expertise in design and development of Oracle BI Repository (RPD) solution
Experience in configuring OBIEE / OBIA security (Authentication and Authorization - Object level and Data level security) as well as tuning and multiple source systems
Advanced knowledge of OBIA pre-built content and deep experience with customizing/extending OBIA pre-built content of different modules
Solid understanding of Business Intelligence (BI) tools, Data Warehouse (DW), Data Modelling concepts and SQL/PLSQL
Good knowledge of Oracle Applications - Oracle E-business Suite or Oracle ERP, Oracle HCM (the Oracle cloud SaaS offering) is preferable
Deep knowledge of Database, Cloud Concepts, Autonomous Data warehouse (ADW), Data Integration (ODI/GoldenGate) is an added advantage
Basic Knowledge/awareness of Tableau/Power BI/ML Studio/Snowflake and Azure/GCP/AWS background is a plus

Travel up to 20% (While 20% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice).

Must live a commutable distance to one of the following cities: Atlanta, GA; Austin, TX; Boston, MA; Charlotte, NC; Chicago, IL; Cincinnati, OH; Cleveland, OH; Dallas, TX; Detroit, MI; Gilbert, AZ; Houston, TX; Indianapolis, IN; Kansas City, MO; Lake Mary, FL; Los Angeles, CA; Mechanicsburg, PA; Miami, FL; McLean, VA; Minneapolis, MN; Nashville, TN; Orange County, CA; Philadelphia, PA; Phoenix, AZ; Pittsburgh, PA; Rosslyn, VA; Sacramento, CA; St. Louis, MO; San Diego, CA; Seattle, WA; Tallahassee, FL; Tampa, FL; or be willing to relocate to one of the following USDC locations: Gilbert, AZ; Lake Mary, FL; Mechanicsburg, PA.

Limited immigration sponsorship may be available

Qualifications


Preferred


Experience in Oracle's analytics offerings: Oracle Analytics Cloud, Data Visualization, Machine Learning, Essbase, OBIEE, Fusion Analytics for Warehouse
Have solution design skills to provide expertise and guide customers for specific needs
Be extremely hands on with Analytics and Data Warehousing report/solution development
Deliver PoCs tailored to customers' needs and proof points

Company Description
As a leader in the Aerospace, Defense and Commercial markets, Systima Technologies advances state of the art technologies through innovation and engineering, research and analysis, development, prototyping, fabrication and production. Our mission is to provide high value, responsive engineering and innovative products that enable the defense of our democracy and the exploration of land, sea, and space. Our teams take pride in delivering rapid, end-to-end engineering support and solutions, from concept to delivery.

Job Description
SUMMARY
Systima Technologies (www.systima.com) is looking for a Business Analyst I with 1-3 years of relevant experience, to support the Chief Financial Officer in providing business, contractual, and financial guidance to management and program managers. The ideal candidate will possess a commitment to customer service, and a desire to develop, improve, and optimize current business and financial measuring metrics and analytics.
PRIMARY DUTIES
Design, implement and maintain project-based business analytics
Provide project and business guidance to management and program managers
Work with managers to create program budgets and schedules
Perform/assist in work plan reconciliation and reporting
Provide weekly/monthly project metrics to CFO and VPs
Review current business and corporate financial metrics for improvement and optimization
Research and implement cost savings strategies
Support the Chief Financial Officer in organizing and creating proposals, purchase orders, and RFQs
Support government audit request
Ad hoc duties (i.e. revenue projections, market research, competitor analysis, etc.)

Qualifications
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
Bachelor’s Degree in business discipline: Business, Management, Finance, Accounting, Operations Management
1-3 years as an analyst in business analysis, supply chain or operations
Proficient with Microsoft Excel
Ability to communicate internally to managers and externally to customers/suppliers
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Experience working with engineering firms - Preferred
ERP software experience – Preferred
Must be a U.S. Citizen
Additional Information
BENEFITS AT SYSTIMA
Systima Technologies is a dynamic and growing company. We work on innovative, fast-paced projects from concept to production. We offer a comprehensive benefits package including Paid Time Off, 401(k), paid holidays, medical/dental/vision coverage plans, education reimbursement, semi-annual bonuses and more. Plus, Systima has rolled out a new 9/80 work schedule with every other Friday OFF - this is a pilot program that we hope will successfully highlight our commitment to each employees' well-being, as we continue to deliver excellent service to our customers.
WE'VE MOVED!
Systima recently purchased an outstanding property to accommodate our current staff and anticipated future growth. Systima's operations were previously based in Kirkland, WA. Then in mid-2021 our team relocated to the Harbour Pointe Tech Center, overlooking Puget Sound in beautiful Mukilteo, Washington.

Are you interested in being part of a growing team that leverages TM1/Planning Analytics to build robust financial reporting and planning tools that scale? Do you have a passion for solving complex business problems and providing data driven solutions that optimize the customer experience? Do you want to be apart of supporting Amazon's current and future growth? Well, this is job for you.

WW Consumer FinTech is looking for a Business/Application Analyst who will help us optimize our TM1/Planning Analytics solutions for our Consumer Finance business partners. Our ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, relishes working with big data, looks forward to rub elbows with our finance, product, program, engineering business partners, and enjoys the challenge of highly complex business problems that are typically being defined in real-time.

Collaborate with our business partners on researching and analyzing pain points with current applications and document for reference

You will assess the feasibility of syncing TM1/Planning Applications with external data sources through innovative design where applicable
You are prompt, professional, articulate, and persistent in your interactions with customers and our partners.
Excellent communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills, and an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams.

Role Description

The BI Analyst/Sr Analyst will support the development of the data pipelines which delivers resources critical to reporting, analysis, and efficient operations. Most importantly the role will drive the transformation of our legacy data processes as well as influence the data strategy of the organization. The candidate is expected to be data-savvy with a strong interest in both Finance and BI solutions. The candidate must demonstrate initiative, ownership, and passion, as well as excellent teamwork, and problem-solving skills. This position helps drive continuous improvement with a focus on scalability and maturity. The ideal candidate is someone who is flexible, change- and detail-oriented, a problem solver who possesses strong execution skills, and is comfortable with a fluid mix of projects and activities that change with the pace and priorities of the organization.
Your Impact
Working with business stakeholders to optimize our data supply chain, you will design and build data curation processes and datasets that enable financial modeling, operations intelligence, and reporting of critical performance, cash flow, and scale metrics. You will help manage and design security for our data to ensure the right people have access in alignment with Finance and Enterprise standards. The role will involve accelerating our path to Data Management Maturity by maintaining data supply chain documentation such as metadata in Alation as well as query/code repositories so that information is shareable, searchable, and easy to be found. You will work closely with the Finance Office of Data as well as other Strategic Transformation Initiatives to help develop and implement our data strategy. By becoming a subject matter expert on the datasets and sharing this knowledge through documentation, user guides, and presentations you will enable the TFO team to deliver faster speed to value with our data.

Who We Are:
At PEMCO it’s all about people, starting with our customers. We’re a mutual insurance company owned by our Northwest policyholders and protecting their dreams since 1949. We believe in listening to our customers and showing that we understand them in ways that others don’t.
Why We Need You:
PEMCO has a dynamic and challenging opportunity for an experienced Senior Financial Business Analyst to join our community. In this role, you will be responsible for preparing financial analysis, budgets, forecasts, and financial reporting for the organization. In addition, you will provide functional administration of the financial systems which support the corporate accounting, budgeting, forecasting & financial reporting processes. If you want to be empowered to make a difference in the lives of customers, coworkers, and the community, we encourage you to apply. If you have expertise supporting the IT space, we’d particularly love to chat with you about this role.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Perform regulatory reporting and compliance analyses
Support the Corporate Treasury operations including the creation of cash flow analyses, banking & investment systems support, reporting, mitigation of financial risk, disbursements, investment, and funding activities
Provide management with complex financial analytics and recommendations
Provide functional system administration for ERP and Performance Management software applications such as PeopleSoft Financials, Oracle Planning & Oracle Analytics Cloud, BI & DV (OAC)
Design and create enterprise-wide financial reporting and financial dashboards
Create, maintain, and update Oracle Planning security, calc scripts, rules logic, webforms, and Navigation Flows
Assist in the development of business requirements and perform data conversion and validation, testing and training for application upgrades/enhancements/implementations for Oracle ERP and Performance Management software applications
Prepare and support enterprise-wide budgeting, forecasting, financial reporting, ad-hoc analysis, and long-range modeling for data-driven decision making
Maintain controlled processes around metadata and mapping changes; load and validate financial & operational Essbase data to ensure proper reporting. Demonstrate behaviors consistent with PEMCO's policies, values, code of ethics, and business conduct
Authentically support the PEMCO Brand and constantly are on the lookout for top talent to join us to achieve our Mission to Worry Less and Live More
Other duties as assigned
What You'll Bring:
B.A. or B.S. degree or equivalent work experience (Business, Finance or Accounting or other related fields)
6 years of experience in business, financial, or accounting roles with increasing responsibility is required
5 years of experience in financial analyst, business analyst, data analyst or other related roles
Precision: Is detail orientated and has a strong desire for accuracy and thoroughness is required
Skilled proficiency in Word, PowerPoint, Outlook is required
Advanced proficiency in Excel is required
Proficiency in Oracle Products to include SmartView, Planning Calculation Manager, Business Rule, and Essbase Calculation Script is required
Experience in developing reports and dashboards using OAC, Tableau, Financial Reporting Studio, or other reporting platforms is required
Highly Analytical: Is passionate about working with disparate datasets bringing data together to answer business questions. Collaborates to create, manage, and translate data to meaningful insights. Can work with external vendors to integrate data for analysis; knows how to build efficient and scalable infrastructure and data models is required
What We Value:
PEMCO has identified the below competencies as critical for employees and the future of our business. The competencies are intended to define skills or abilities expected of our employees, behaviors which employees can develop, and be evaluated against in their job. Proficiency levels include Beginner, Skilled, Advanced, and Mastery. Not every employee is expected to master every competency. Instead, we expect that employees will build skills in these areas as they progress through their roles and career at PEMCO.
Agility : Handles risk and uncertainty, shifts gears with ease and speed, copes with and manages change well
Growth Mindset: Develops abilities through dedication and hard work, views challenges and failures as opportunities to learn and improve skills
Service Passion: Provides excellent service to others and seeks ways to improve that service; ensures the customer experience (internal and external) is a key consideration in policies, procedures, and decision-making
Complex Problem Solving: Solves ill-defined, ambiguous problems in complex settings using logic, process, and experience
We’ve Got You Covered:
Competitive salary
200% match on your 401(k) up to 6% of your pay
Generous medical, dental, disability, and life insurance plans
A friendly, professional work environment
The opportunity to work at a place of integrity, where customer service is emphasized
At PEMCO, we celebrate and support our differences. We know employing a team rich in diverse thoughts, experiences, and opinions allows our employees, our products, and our community to flourish. PEMCO is honored to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are dedicated to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, or veteran status.

positionName: BI ANALYST - GLOBAL SUPPLY CHAIN - SALES & OPERATIONAL PLANNING
description:
Summary:
The BI Analyst, Global Supply Chain – Sales & Operational Planning (S&OP) acts as an integral member of the Supply Chain organization. As a BI Analyst, this individual owns and is responsible for projects from Inception through Benefits Realization. As a data and reporting leader, this person drives transformational data and analytics initiatives for improving the effectiveness and efficiency of the Supply Chain business functions.
Key Responsibilities:
Interprets and analyzes data from multiple sources
Provides key analytics and reports for senior leadership, with ability to story tell and assist departmental and business insights/decision making
Provides project management in support of key business initiatives
Supports in the development of processes and technical design
Additional Responsibilities:
Acquires knowledge of Trident’s Environmental and Safety Policies by completing required training programs and performing designated work activities in accordance with training and procedures/work instructions
Notifies designated personnel of any environmental or safety incidents or risks not previously documented, in accordance with Environmental Awareness and/or safety trainings
Other responsibilities, as assigned
Minimum Requirements
Education
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Engineering or related field, or four to five years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Experience:
Minimum 5 years in analytical or business intelligence position
Technical Competencies and Skills:
Deep understanding of BI methodologies, Data Architecture principals, Master Data, and metadata.
T-SQL expertise – Advance ability to design and troubleshoot complex queries, stored procedures, functions, views, indexes, constraints, unions, joins, and similar development tasks
Ability to maintain and troubleshoot optimized ETL solutions that incorporate various back end SQL Server data sources
Ability to interpret business logic and develop appropriate data flows and data dependencies
Advanced skills in Power BI Development and DAX
Microsoft Excel expertise (VBA a plus)
Qualifications:
Passion for numbers and algorithms
Strong data and BI analysis skills - detailed analysis and definitions of important metrics, measures, business logic and calculations, hierarchies and aggregations, source system analysis, and reporting requirements
Experience in developing and deploying BI capability in Supply Chain is a plus
Ability to travel 15-20% (estimated)

Next Generation Enterprise Network (NGEN) Service Management, Integration, and Transport (SMIT) is one the largest IT services program for the Navy and U.S. Marine Corps (USMC), supporting approximately 400,000 seats around the world. Under SMIT, the SMIT contractor will provide enterprise services to the Marine Corps Enterprise Network (MCEN), Navy-Marine Corps Internet (NMCI), and OCONUS Navy Enterprise Network (ONE-Net) including transport, datacenter, network operations, service desk, cybersecurity, and managed services. CDW-G will be supporting the SMIT contractor in several of these service areas. https://federal-careers.cdwjobs.com/

The Analyst role leads business and functional requirements gathering activities, business solution design and systems analysis. This role also designs, documents, measures and optimizes key business processes. The Analyst is guided by project management methodology in development of requirement specifications for organizational projects. Review, analyze, and evaluate business systems and user needs. Document requirements and define scope and objectives and formulate systems to parallel overall business strategies. Assess IT Organization to identify existing processes, procedures, and re-categorized them into ITIL/ITSM terms. Provide ITIL best practice service management consulting at a strategic, design, and operational level for IT organization. Gather the required inputs on people, practices and processes, organization structure, ITIL tools in-use, as-is process, details on current vendors. Provide ITIL/ITSM training and mentoring to all staff resources as identified. Provide professional guidance to the Process Owners and overall IT strategic initiatives. Leverage presentation skills, verbal and written communication skills, and facilitation skills with good documentation and process flow diagramming skills.

Key Areas of Responsibility
Collaborate with stakeholders to clarify project requirements and business objectives and acquire commitments.
Decompose business problems quickly and work with the project team to determine the root cause and provide solution alternatives.
Derive a detailed understanding of the stated business problem and objectives and work with the stakeholder and technical team toward resolution to achieve the objectives.
Plan and facilitate requirements gathering utilizing focus sessions, one-on-one interviews, and job shadowing.
Utilize advanced modeling techniques to develop high-level system narratives, presentations, storyboards, use cases and user interface prototypes.
Serve as a conduit/broker for cross-functional collaboration & knowledge sharing.
Perform quantitative & qualitative analysis to help justify the investment necessary to deliver a solution.
Build credibility and trust across stakeholder groups.
Gather and prepare supporting analysis and design documentation from a business perspective.
Assist with alignment of project objectives and solutions to organizational business strategies and objectives.
Develop strong internal relationships with key stakeholders and subject-matter experts across the organization.
Act as an active contributor to process improvement by remaining current in software engineering best practices.

Required Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Business or an IT related field or equivalent experience
3 years experience leveraging ITSM tools to identify and document business needs and specifications utilizing business analysis and system design techniques.
3 to 5 years of work experience in an analytical position
Ability to understand, remember, and apply oral and/or written instructions or other information. Ability to organize thoughts and ideas into understandable terminology. Ability to multi-task, organize and prioritize. Ability to apply common sense in performing job. Ability to understand and follow basic instructions and guidelines. Ability to travel as needed.
Security Clearance.
ITIL Foundation
Preferred Qualifications

Demonstrated work experience in process definition including facilitation, process documentation, change control, and process improvement.
Successful track record of facilitating and leading meetings, tailoring messages to the given audience.
Experience in evaluating information, identifying risks and opportunities, while possessing creative problem-solving skills with an understanding of business concepts and models.
Proven elicitation and facilitation skills of project and system requirements.
Demonstrated negotiation and persuasion skills, with the ability to enable win-win resolutions.
Excellent written and verbal and communication skills with the ability to effectively interact with all stakeholders
History of balancing multiple priorities simultaneously with the ability to adapt to the changing needs of the business while meeting deadlines.
Critical attention to detail and solid creative problem-solving skills.

Overview
:

US Anesthesia Partners is seeking a Sr. Financial Analyst to join our team in Seattle, WA. The Sr. Financial Analyst supports finance leadership in revenue analysis, modeling compensation and making recommendations for target groups. Will also assist in ad hoc analysis of revenue and operations efficiency and provide insights on business processes. Completion of the monthly close and analysis with interaction from USAP Corporate Accounting & Finance. This role will deliver Financial Analysis for the company that is focused on providing value added analytics on business performance.
Job Highlights
:
Prepares financial analyses, including trending analysis, productivity metrics, revenue cycle analysis, and other ad hoc projects, as well as financial reports and presentations
Aggregate, analyze, and publish performance and financial data by division
Prepare various monthly managerial financial, operational reporting and ad hoc reporting including performance analysis by facility, provider and service line
Analyze Monthly Operating Report (MOR) as it relates to revenue, payer trends, headcount and expenses. Prepare monthly MD&A (Management, Discussion and Analysis) write- up
Prepare the Clinical Governance Board and other committee meeting presentations
Act as liaison for the various information data sources and troubleshoot program logic in a well-organized and systematic manner
Assist in the preparation and analysis of the annual budget and on-going forecasting
Assist in the preparation of a presentation of the results and the analysis of those results
Proactively analyze data to identify opportunities for improvement / best practice
Qualifications
:
Strong proficiency in business analytics, with demonstrated ability to draw conclusions from the data and “put brains to the numbers”
Strong ability to understand and analyze user requirements as they relate to organizational goals and objectives
Proficiency in financial reporting and PowerPoint for preparing financial packages and presentations
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and/or other reporting applications (Adaptive Insight, Hyperion, Access, etc.) – i.e., lookups, Pivot Tables, nested logic functions, etc.
Knowledge of general ledger software reporting
Knowledge of database software reporting
Superior written and oral communication skills
Strong work ethic and ability to work autonomously in a high production environment
Education/Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Accounting, Finance or related area required, Master’s preferred
3-5 years of related experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience
Healthcare background preferred
For this position, US Anesthesia Partners requires all employees to acknowledge and agree to the terms of the USAP COVID Personal Health & Safety Policy, which includes the requirement that employees working onsite to be vaccinated for COVID-19, subject to accommodations for religious or medical reasons.

This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. In 2018, Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals.

Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”.

Costco’s Identity and Access Management is responsible for the design and implementation of Identity solutions that align with business goals and objectives. This is a Senior Technical role that is responsible for the design, implementation and operational stability of identity systems in the Provisioning domain.
This role will be responsible for managing expectations with application stakeholders, designing, implementing, and troubleshooting solutions related to the integration with Identity Management Systems. This role will also be responsible for various aspects of infrastructure management including maintenance, performance and capacity planning, security, and support. You will need to understand and interpret global technical and business requirements, including participation in the discovery, documentation, validation/refinement of solutions, deployments, and hypercare.

If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined.

ROLE

Responsible for requirements gathering and documentation, manages time, interview schedule, demos, etc.
Defines and analyzes requirements refinements and builds specific use cases and personas.
Builds the requirements management plan along with identification of the stakeholders and roles/responsibilities.
Identifies and normalizes the common requirements.
Develops the requirement, traceability, strategy, and verification in the user stories and test cases.
Creates a requirement change control plan.
Identifies and resolves any conflicting requirements.
Must be able to prepare UML diagrams such as use case, activity, and sequence diagrams.
Creates flow charts and data models.

REQUIRED

Minimum 2 years’ as a Technical Business Analyst.
Strong knowledge of a typical BABOK Methodology.
Excellent troubleshooting, analytical, and problem solving skills.
Excellent ability to drive, document, and communicate requirements from business processes and interviewing stakeholders with tribal knowledge.
Must be able to effectively drive requirements until all requirements are defined and analyzed.
Demonstrated experience producing effective requirements documents.
Ability to create use cases from functional and nonfunctional requirements.
Solid understanding of the requirements life cycle management.
Self-starter, able to work independently with little or no guidance.
Ability to report status upward to Project Manager and/or stakeholders.

Recommended
Experience in one or more of the following technologies: Identity and Access management Services (On-Prem and Cloud), Authentication, Provisioning, Policy Management, Federation, PKI, Security and integrations with Enterprise Solutions (SAP, ServiceNow, etc).
BABOK Certification.

Required Documents

Cover Letter
Resume

Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.

At KPMG, you can become an integral part of a dynamic team at one of the world’s top professional services firms. Enjoy a collaborative, future-forward culture that empowers your success. Work with KPMG’s extensive network of specialists & enjoy access to our Ignition Centers, where deep industry knowledge merges with cutting-edge technologies to create innovative solutions. Join a diverse team helping high-profile clients understand, analyze, and respond to complex business opportunities and challenges. Develop your career through a range of multifaceted engagements, formal training, and informal mentoring.

positionName: Business Analyst II/III (Scrum Master) - Tracking & Reporting, IS Customer Experience
description:
Company Description
"We're not in the shipping business; we're in the information business." -Peter Rose, Expeditors Founder
Global supply chain management is what we do, but at the heart of Expeditors you will find professionalism, leadership, and a friendly environment, all of which foster an innovative, customer service-based approach to logistics.
15,000 trained professionals
250+ locations worldwide
Fortune 500
Globally unified systems

Job Description
The Business Analyst (BA) will take on the role of Scrum Master for an Agile Development team. They will communicate effectively with team members and stakeholders throughout the Program Increment (PI), maintain and execute the PI plan, and help raise awareness and mitigate risks.
They will direct the day-to-day activities of Analysts, Engineers, Developers, and other IS personnel for the duration of the PI. The BA (Scrum Master), in conjunction with the Release Train Engineer (RTE) and other Scrum Masters, is responsible for the success of the PI plan, and ensuring committed work is completed on schedule and the flow of value is optimized for the agile team they manage.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Coaches the team in adoption of SAFe/Agile core values, principles, and practices
Leads the team in self-organization to deliver quality working software with predictability, efficiency and velocity
Facilitates and conducts team SAFe ceremonies: daily stand-up, iteration planning, iteration review and iteration retrospective
Assist the Product Owner in the analysis process while proactively collaborating with the team
Provides metrics for the team & ART (e.g. capacity, planned/actual velocity, story point burn down)
Removes impediments and provides visibility and/or escalation to leadership
Fosters a positive and productive environment within the Agile team
Keeps team organized and focused
Promotes a mindset and focus on relentless & continuous improvement
Understands the context and status of each feature and story in the PI plan
Supports the RTE in administering PI planning
This position will sit in Seattle, WA. Candidates must be local or willing to relocate. Relocation assistance is not offered for this position.

Qualifications
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
1-3 years of software business, process, data, and system analysis experience
Ability to successfully navigate and execute within ambiguous and stressful situations
Strong communication and execution capabilities
Working knowledge of Agile development methodologies and activities, particularly Scrum and Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe)
Continuous learner; receptive to feedback, with a desire for improvement
Aptitude for business analysis demonstrated through applied skills and knowledge
Experienced problem solver, strong collaborator, and able to provide organization and clarity around complex topics
Assertive personality, interpersonal, action and outcome driven mentality
Ability to actively inspire, coach, mentor, and motivate
Well organized with a keen attention to detail
Servant leader
DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
1-3+ years Business Analysis, Project Management or Scrum Master experience
SAFe Scrum Master certification or similar
Experience working in cross-functional Agile teams to deliver results with tight deadlines
Understanding of the transportation/logistics industry
Applicants are required to be eligible to lawfully work in the U.S. immediately; employer will not transfer or sponsor applicants for U.S. work authorization (such as an H-1B visa) for this opportunity.
Additional Information
Position is full time (40 hours per week) Monday through Friday. We are a business professional attire company.
Expeditors offers excellent benefits:
Paid Vacation, Holiday, Sick Time
Health Plan: Medical, Prescription Drug, Dental and Vision
Life and Long Term Disability Insurance
401(k) Retirement Savings Plan
Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Training and Personnel Development Program
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Successful candidates must pass a background check.

Are you excited to harness your data analytics, program management, and leadership skills to tackle some of society’s greatest challenges? Are you ready to bring a voice to data that addresses sustainability, cybersecurity, racial equity, and humanitarian needs? Would you like to come to work every day and have a fundamental impact on your family and friends?
Our Data Science and Analytics team, led by Microsoft’s Chief Data and Analytics Officer, has a mission is to use data, analysis, and AI to solve some of society’s greatest challenges.
We seek an experienced Data Analyst Program Manager to join our team and deliver world-class analysis and visualization solutions. In this role, you will collaborate with Microsoft’s societal programs, public policy, and product teams to understand their goals and deliver impactful analysis, insights, and PowerBI visualizations.
Our team is agile and moves fast. We adjust to the changing landscape of societal challenges and focus on impacting the world today. A strong aptitude and excitement for learning new areas and technologies will help you excel in this role. In addition, you should have agility in decision making, flexibility in the way you work, and a growth mindset in all that you do.
Responsibilities
Responsibilities:
Collaborate with internal and external partner teams to clarify requirements and generate ideas for analytics and visualization solutions.
Perform hands-on technical analysis across a range of societal problems by identifying and gathering data, data transformation and manipulation, analysis, and insight generation.
Design, develop, and deploy world-class highly visible PowerBI visualizations used internally at Microsoft and externally with our customers and partners.
Present your analysis with a clear and concise narrative utilizing impactful visualizations that produce compelling and actionable insights.
Partner with our data scientist team to define and drive AI solutions by clearly understanding opportunities, exploring data readiness, and working with data engineers and data scientists to ensure solution success.
Qualifications
Qualifications:
3+ years of experience in data analysis and visualization solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches
3+ years of program management experience, including defining and clarifying requirements, monitoring project execution, and communicating status to stakeholders
Excellent verbal and written communications skills with proven experience communicating analysis clearly, precisely, and with actionable insights to non-technical stakeholders
Extensive experience in designing and developing visualization solutions using PowerBI, Tableau, or equivalent enterprise data visualization software
Proficiency in extracting, transforming, and analyzing data using SQL
Experience with data analysis programming in Python, R, or equivalent analytical programming languages
Experience with statistical data analysis such as regression, probability, and classification techniques
Preferred experience in any of the following: cybersecurity, threat intelligence, identity systems, fraud, or abuse
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering, information management, mathematics, statistics, economics, or equivalent background with industry experience as listed in the requirements section of this position

positionName: Sr. Incentive Compensation Operations Analyst - Seattle, Dallas, Boston, DC or Arlington
description:
Bachelor’s Degree required
5+ years in progressively more senior analytical roles, preferably related to sales incentive compensation
Familiarity with SQL
Advanced Excel skills (macros, Vlookup, pivot tables, report building)
Experience in a hi-tech sales organization

AWS is seeking an experienced Senior Incentive Compensation Operations Analyst. In this role you will be a key member of a team responsible for administering compensation plans and payouts. Specific responsibilities include managing the sales incentive compensation team's interactions with Amazon payroll, managing communication with Sales Operations on sales incentive compensation timelines, supporting the rhythm of the business activities (including weekly business reviews and operational planning), and responding to inquiries from senior leadership.

Ideal candidates have superior analytical abilities and proven track records for rolling up their sleeves, maintaining a high level of ownership and accountability, and delivering best-in-class support to internal and external customers. LOCATION FLEXIBILITY: Position may be located in Seattle, Dallas, Boston, DC or Arlington, VA. Relocation offered from within the US only to these locations.

About Us

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Superior organizational and prioritization skills

Ability to source, work with, and combine multiple disparate data sets to answer business questions and isolate anomalies

Strong attention to detail

Thrives in ambiguous situations and working autonomously

positionName: Director, Data Analytics, Commercial Systems & BI, Strategy & Operations
description:
Are you passionate about the role data and analytics can play in Microsoft’s digital transformation? Are you a fanatic about helping scale Actionable Insights to 20k+ sellers, managers and sales leaders at Microsoft? Are you a seasoned Analytics Leader who can turn customer, partner, cloud telemetry and sales operations data into a competitive advantage for MCAPS? If so, we have a great opportunity for you!
About the MCAPS Strategy & Operations organization:
Strategy & Operations (S&O), within MCAPS (Microsoft Customer & Partner Solutions), drives the development and execution of the Commercial strategy and field operating model. This includes how the organization benefits customers and partners, enabling MCAPS to support them more effectively, efficiently, and with competitive differentiation. Our mission is to drive cross-company insight and execution excellence, bringing strategy and priorities to life.
About Commercial Systems & BI (CSBI) team:
Our objective is to build world class platform and intelligence capabilities to serve how Microsoft manages and delivers our company’s business, both internally and externally. We will achieve this by fostering a customer-focused, collaborative culture, and fueling growth through the people and programs we support. Our principles are to be customer obsessed, simple & focused, data driven, innovative, and business aligned.
About the Director of Data Analytics role:
We are searching for a leader to help us form and structure a critical new capability on our team to design and deliver advanced analytical capabilities. This role will help integrate existing ML and AI models into our core data platforms and experience and envision, design and develop new models that augment our insights and drive improvements to our execution and business results. What is unique in our role is that we are driving a Microsoft-on-Microsoft approach that is enabling our employees to realize productivity and effectiveness using Microsoft technology. We have a platform that integrates data from sales, finance, cloud product telemetry, marketing, services, partner and many others parts of the business – providing a wealth of opportunity to synthesize this information into actionable insights.
Responsibilities
Envision, design and develop ML/AI and Advanced Analytical models to improve our understanding of the business and drive actionable insights into our core BI experience.
Work in partnership with Data Science teams across GTM, Engineering, Finance teams and others to integrate existing models into the core platform and experiences
Communicate and present findings of data research projects and backlog
Provide overall Data Analytics competency and lead the development of this critical function and capability as part of our BI Center of Excellence
Understand and partner with technical teams to leverage the latest technologies to impact the performance and effectiveness of ML/AI models

Meet The Team

Hitachi Vantara, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Hitachi, Ltd., guides our customers from what’s now to what’s next by solving their digital challenges. integration solutions and providing sophisticated data quality analytics. The right candidate for this position has a proven track record as a principal consultant with superior technical and analytical skills and demonstrates the ability to deliver complex technical solutions to broad audiences.

Excellent critical thinking and analytical skills

Power BI experience is desirable

DESCRIPTION:
We are a diverse team of collaborators, doers, and problem-solvers who are relentlessly committed to a culture of safety. This position will directly impact the history of space exploration and will require your commitment and detailed attention towards safe and repeatable space flight. Join us in lowering the cost of access to space and enabling Blue Origin’s vision of millions of people living and working in space to benefit Earth.
As part of a small, passionate and accomplished team of experts, you will work with stakeholders , technical product managers , engineers and architects to (1) document requirements, (2) define scope, (3) articulate objectives and key results, and (4) curate intelligible catalogs of information (both business focused and technically focused) to support the design, expansion, maintenance and operation of a modern data platform . This position requires resilience to ambiguity, ability to work in a fast paced, quickly changing environment. As a Business Analyst, your commitment to quality and attention to detail will directly impact the history of space exploration and will require your dedicated commitment and focused attention toward safe and repeatable spaceflight.
Responsibilities
Collaborate with departments , technical product managers , engineers and architects to collect , document and communicate business and system requirements
Observe, document and validate business processes in a wide range of business functions
Recommend controls by identifying problems and documenting improvements with business justification of increased safety, reduced risk, or improved efficiency
Map systems and solutions to business capabilities and identify OKRs to measure the improvements or otherwise of a particular solution to that capability
Define and prepare reports for monitoring internal team processes, and to track the success or failure of projects and initiatives
Understand and communicate the financial and operational impact of system and process changes related to data platforms
Support software and platform releases and User Acceptance Testing
QUALIFICATIONS:
Required
4 + years of experience as a Business Analyst, Data Analyst or similar position
Bachelor’s Degree in a technical or business related field
Advanced experience in database interrogation of SQL and NOSQL databases
Strong analytic al skill set and a high degree of proficiency in data mining
Proven ability to define requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
Proficiency in Excel, Tableau, PowerBI or similar reporting/analysis tools
Excellent written communication and presentation skills
Demonstrated skill and passion for problem solving and operational excellence
Must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.
Desired
Master’s Degree in Computer Science , Mathematics, Analytics (or similar area of study) and/or Master’s in Business Administration
Experience working hands on with cloud infrastructures such as AWS, Azure, GCP
Experience working in Agile Development Teams
Experience working with Web based APIs (e.g. REST, SOAP)
Experience with a high level programming language (e.g. Python, R, GO)
Advanced understanding of a wide array of data models including relational, dimensional, document-based, object oriented, object-relational, and graphical
ITAR Requirements
To conform to U.S. Government commercial space technology export regulations, including the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR), 8 U.S.C. § 1324b(a)(3), applicants for employment at Blue Origin must be a U.S. citizen or national, lawfully admitted for permanent residence into the U.S. (i.e. current green card holder), or lawfully admitted as a refugee or granted asylum under 8 U.S.C. § 1157-1158.
