positionName: Data Analytics Control Lead - Tech & Ops
description:
Description
About this role
Data Platforms and Solutions (DPS) is entrusted with maintaining all data integral to the investment decision process. The function serves BlackRock the Investment Manager and its BlackRock Solutions (BRS) business, in our proprietary Aladdin® end-to-end investment platform. This team closely partners with key internal teams, such as Portfolio Management, Global Capital Markets, Relationship Management, Portfolio Compliance, Risk Analytics, Regulatory Reporting, and others, to ensure their business data needs are met accurately, timely, and efficiently.
The DPS philosophy is anchored on BlackRock’s cornerstone principles: Fiduciary focus, Passion for Performance, the unified purpose of One BlackRock, taking Emotional Ownership and Being Committed to a Better Future. Through this lens, we strive to build value for our clients by understanding their needs, the markets, and using technology to create best in class solutions. Our function has presence across 12 offices in 8 countries, servicing more than $25 trillion in AUM on Aladdin for a client base spanning 6 continents and all spectrums of the financial markets.
Within DPS sits the Quality Control function, which owns security and portfolio level risk analytics quality control along with the governance and design of these QC processes. This team ensures our clients have the highest quality of risk analytics. We do so by focusing on building scale and efficiency by integrating data science to craft and implement a centralized quality control platform for key risk analytics metrics. The team strives to build in-depth subject matter expertise in risk analytics, capital markets as well as BlackRock's proprietary risk models and Aladdin software suite to service that mission.
Key responsibilities:
All facets of people management to be performed including ensuring appropriate staffing model, depth charts and succession plans are assessed.
Oversight of daily quality control and validation of intraday risk analytics and occasionally consulting on reference, returns, performance, index, and pricing data.
Utilizing research skills, critical thinking and financial math to analyze macroeconomic and market trends to incorporate into enhancement proposals to QC models and methodologies.
Initiating and driving platform and process innovations to support new business needs, minimize risk, enhance quality, and navigate the changing markets while mitigating operational risk.
Collaborating closely with the market analytics and financial modeling groups to expand understanding of our models.
Understand client data needs and service levels while working with internal BlackRock Teams to provide relevant and intuitive analysis.
Acting as an agent of change to consistently improve procedures and own projects within the QC environment and documenting best-practices.
Skills:
Consistent record of leadership experience and positively influencing junior talent and their career progression.
Proficiency in Microsoft office products (with an emphasis on Excel) or other programming languages and an aptitude for learning new applications.
Strong, effective analytical and problem-solving skills along with executive decision-making abilities.
Knowledge of SQL, Python, UNIX, VBA, PERL will be an added advantage.
Attention to detail and excellent interpersonal skills to effectively articulate solutions to internal and external partners and clients.
Capability to assist in creating a team vision, planning and executing steps to align to Key Performance Indicators and objectives.
Strong initiative to follow up on outstanding issues – identify what needs to be done, act and follow through to resolution.
Experience:
A bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Accounting, Economics, Finance, Computer Science, or Engineering is required.
8 – 12 years of financial services experience and a good understanding of Financial Markets, preferably within the Investment Management industry.
Possess and demonstrate a proven understanding of fixed income, equity, and derivative financial instruments.
People management experience; demonstrated experience in leading teams of professionals, staff development, mentorship and performance assessments.
Proven track record in project management.
Experience in working with senior partners, client experience a plus.
Experience or education related to agile methodologies is a plus.
Our benefits

To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including a strong retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, comprehensive healthcare, support for working parents and Flexible Time Off (FTO) so you can relax, recharge and be there for the people you care about.
About BlackRock
At BlackRock, we are all connected by one mission: to help more and more people experience financial well-being. Our clients, and the people they serve, are saving for retirement, paying for their children’s educations, buying homes and starting businesses. Their investments also help to strengthen the global economy: support businesses small and large; finance infrastructure projects that connect and power cities; and facilitate innovations that drive progress.
This mission would not be possible without our smartest investment – the one we make in our employees. It’s why we’re dedicated to creating an environment where our colleagues feel welcomed, valued and supported with networks, benefits and development opportunities to help them thrive.
BlackRock is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, and other statuses protected by law.
BlackRock will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records in a manner consistent with the requirements of the law, including any applicable fair chance law.

7+ years of direct analytics experience, or equivalent combination of degree and experience
BA/BS degree in Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Operations Research, Business Analytics, Information Systems or related field
Advanced understanding and experience leading teams focused on with data warehousing, data quality
Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Excel (e.g., complex statements, VBA, conditional formatting)
Familiarity with SQL, relational databases, and ETLM
Familiarity manipulating large sets of data, summarizing into metrics, and conducting appropriate statistical tests (e.g., regression, t-test, chi-square)
Experience in designing and implementing custom reporting systems by managing or guiding technical teams

Are you motivated by solving problems, data-savvy, and business focused?

Join the Recruiting Engine Team to help us reinvent how we recruit at Amazon. Recruiting the right candidates across all of Amazon is critical to our ability to innovate and build on behalf of customers. As the search for talent becomes more competitive, we are bringing together recruiting, analytics, tech, programs, and process teams to find and hire candidates who raise the bar more quickly and efficiently. We are responsible for supporting the recruiting teams that find diverse, bar-raising candidates that connect talent to the most in-demand tech roles at Amazon.

We are looking for an analytical and technically skilled Sr Manager, Business & Data Analytics to lead our analytics team for Recruiting Engine. This position will be responsible for developing metrics and reporting, understanding and managing data structure, strategic analysis, and rigorous deep dives to impact the business. They will work with technical teams, product teams, program teams, finance, and operations globally to drive process improvement and track progress against goals. This role requires an individual with excellent analytical abilities as well as outstanding business acumen and comfort with technical teams and systems. The successful candidate will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, with strong attention to detail, an ability to work in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment.

Responsibilities:

Serve as the Single Threaded Leader for the Recruiting Engine BI team working across multi-functional teams to prioritize roadmaps, improve processes, facilitate communications, and remove external obstacles.
Drive standard business reporting processes, including weekly/quarterly business reviews, and annual operational planning.
Accountable for generating key business insights required to deliver against core input/output metric goals.
Proactively seek to identify business opportunities and provide solutions based on a broad and deep knowledge of Amazon’s data resources, industry best-practices, and work done by other teams.
Be the voice of the customer (candidate and recruiter), aligning stakeholders with scalable mechanisms to incorporate key learnings into product and engineering decision-making processes.
Grow and develop a team of talented Business Analysts, and Business Intelligence Engineers, working to align career aspirations with business objectives.
Graduate degree in statistics, decision-making sciences, or related field or 10+ years of professional experience with a heavy emphasis on data and analytics
Experience with visualization tools such as Tableau, AWS QuickSight
Experience in analytical intensive roles within consulting, talent/HR, operational, or marketing environments
Experience implementing basic software solutions to automate data source, visualization and/or data modeling application
An ability and interest in working in a fast-paced and rapidly-changing environment
Experience conducting large scale data analysis to support business decision making
Business-relevant knowledge of AWS Big Data technologies, like RedShift, S3, Aurora, Data Pipeline, QuickSight, Kinesis etc.
Project management experience; Excellent written and verbal communication; high quality document and report preparation

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.
Experience
5-7 years in computer or science-based field

Experience managing projects or a portfolio of projects, preferably in an IT or Automation context
Experience with cGMP/GMP, ICH guidelines, date integrity, computer system validation, and working within a Quality organization
Preferred Qualifications:
High degree of analytical skills to advise on automated solutions to improve processes and integrate new equipment to meet project objectives.
Capable of exercising sound judgment while adapting to rapidly changing priorities, challenging situations, and deadlines.
Demonstrated ability to work in a matrixed structure; focused strongly on customer service and communication.
Highly motivated individual with the ability to work independently as well as on a cross-functional site and corporate teams.
Technical understanding of cell culture processing. Familiarity with cell therapy a plus.
Excellent written and presentations skills.
BMSCART
Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Empowered to apply our individual talents and diverse perspectives in an inclusive culture, our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.
Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.

Internet Brands is looking for a Sr. Manager Data Analytics to support our Legal vertical (e.g. Avvo.com, Nolo.com, Lawyers.com, Martindale.com).

The Ideal Candidate:

You are an organized self-starter with a keen business sense who loves digging into data to understand trends and performance. You have a passion for manipulating large volumes of data, building dashboards, and have a consistent focus on efficiency. You easily understand requirements and communicate the progress of your work. You have a bias for action and know when to apply the 80/20 rule. You’re also a great teammate who likes a rapidly changing environment and wants to join a company that offers a ton of opportunities to build your skills.

The Manager’s primary role is to be responsible for insights and analysis support. To achieve this, they will guide other analysts on the team or by directly providing the information. This position requires an ability to understand the key metrics of a business and interpret the results to the business owners. They will work in a project team-oriented and dynamic environment which will require working closely with other teams and adjusting to new developments as they arise. Various software packages and tools will be utilized to collect, mine, and report on this data. Strong analytical and communication skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines are critical for this position.

In this role, you will:

Provide insightful summaries and next step recommendations of projects to the business owners.
Create insightful, easy-to-understand visualizations that provide performance, trending, and benchmarking analysis to meet business needs.
Manage and mentor other analysts in generating visualizations, analysis, and insights.
Performing advanced analysis of web traffic, email engagement, and app engagement data to measure the success of programs, including click-through analysis, retention, re-engagement, and A/B testing.
Become a subject matter data (and business) expert related to appointed areas of responsibility.
Collaborate with agile engineering teams to design flexible solutions to support analytic needs.
Apply a broad range of analytical approaches, from back-of-envelope approximations to what-if scenarios, to deep dives, uncovering patterns, identify trends, and new opportunities.
Manage and prioritize requests from stakeholders and set expectations
Required Qualifications:
Experience (6+ years) in a hands-on analytical role with a focus on analyzing business problems.
Experience coaching and developing advanced analysts.
Strong analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities.
Strong communication skills including experience in supporting and communicating data-driven analyses to various departments and stakeholders.
Highly Proficient (3+ years) with creating, maintaining, and optimizing Tableau workbooks.
Highly Proficient (4+ years) in using SQL for data analysis and reporting.
Advanced Excel skills are required.
Demonstrated ability to manage and prioritize workload and roadmaps.
Excellent business and product sense
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience using web analytic tools (Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics)
Experience working with Data Engineering, Marketing, Product, and Sales teams
Experience in modeling with R or Python

We're looking for a smart and happy data-driven, outcome-focused, and high performing leader to join our data, analytics and performance metrics practice. This role will work closely with our clients and in tandem with our experience design, technical implementation and ongoing operational support teams to analyze user behaviors, content performance and business outcomes including ROI and TCO measuring, tracking and reporting. Provide ongoing performance metrics reporting, analysis and recommendations to clients
Produce intelligent, scalable, and automated solutions by leveraging Data Science skills.
Work closely with Tahzoo experience design and technology implementation teams on development of new capabilities to define requirements and priorities based on data analysis and business knowledge.
Developing expertise in specific areas by leading analytical projects independently, while setting goals, providing benefit estimations, defining workflows, and coordinating timelines in advance.

Experiences matter.


As the architects for the experience age, Tahzoo crafts memorable moments for our clients' customers. Creating insights to revolutionize an industry
The Opportunity:

Accurate and creative insights are integral in allowing us to fulfill our mission of fixing the user experience in global trade and being a first mover. At Flexport, you'll conduct analyses and make recommendations for new products and strategic projects that are at the forefront of reshaping the entire logistics & supply chain industries. You'll work alongside fellow entrepreneurial self-starters interested in solving real-world problems and streamlining the inefficiencies in the complex global trade industry.

As the go-to analyst within the Office of the CEO, you will help prove hypotheses, analyze new opportunities, ideas, and strategies. This includes conducting financial modeling, sales opportunity analysis, and sourcing new data sets when necessary. You will be a jack of all trades, excelling at the intersections of financial analysis, business development, operational analysis, and implementation strategy.

You will:
Meet with business stakeholders including VPs and executives to deeply understand business requirements, and use your analytical mindset to progress a new strategy from ideation to pilot to full implementation. Our mantra is to make sure everyone is working smarter rather than just harder.

Clearly and expertly communicate complex analyses and processes into actionable insights.

At Fortive, we are committed to accelerating progress toward a sustainable future for all. We are driving toward a stronger, safer and smarter world where our products and services power clean energy, reduce water waste, keep critical infrastructure up and running, and ensure safe workplaces and healthy hospital environments.

This is an opportunity to join a growing and dynamic team to build in-house research and analytical capabilities enabling us to analyze and identify strategic opportunities to accelerate our sustainability (ESG) performance across the company and our value chain. As the Sustainability Senior Analyst/BID, you will work with cross functional partners to determine business requirements, establish priorities, support key performance indicators (KPI), and further enhance our analytics strategy. This includes working with business operations, technology support, and software development teams to design and document business processes, dashboards, alerts, and reports.

We seek a seasoned Senior Analyst/BID who has demonstrated ability to utilize metrics, statistical analysis and visualization tools to dive deep into complex issues while deriving actionable insights from operational and enterprise data. A successful candidate must have outstanding business acumen, a restlessness to answer “why?”, and is passionate about using data to enable decision making. The Senior Analyst/BID will own the Sustainability data collection and reporting system end-to-end, including administrative management, user support and engagement, managing data campaigns, and developing reports and data visualization products. The Senior Analyst/BID will support all facets of the Sustainability program, including carbon, energy, water and waste metrics; product and service attributes and lifecycle data, as well as the Fortive Foundation and Fortive Scholarship program.

Deep dive into large data sets to answer key business questions using SQL,DAX, Excel, and other data manipulation languages.

Develop data visualizations to enhance understanding of performance
Report key insight trends, using statistical rigor to simplify and inform the larger team of noteworthy story lines.
Maintain data integrity, perform QA audits and diligently troubleshoot issues.
Continually improve ongoing reporting and analysis processes, while automating or simplifying self-service support and access to authoritative data sets.
Develop training for system users to empower Fortive operating companies to customize Sustainability dashboard and reports for their use
Own and perform individual deep dive analyses, including communicating results and implications to business leaders.
Generate monthly, quarterly and annual data reports for business reviews.
Respond with urgency to high priority requests from senior business leaders.

Required:
3-5 years of experience with data mining and developing reports using a variety of reporting/analytics software packages with an aptitude for learning new reporting software
3+ years of professional experience in a business analytics/intelligence role utilizing enterprise databases with large-scale, complex data sets performing data mining and deep dive analysis.
Proven competency for analyzing data and interpreting results

We’re hiring a Director of Finance to lead our Business Intelligence and Data Science teams responsible for forecasting our multi-faceted online travel business utilizing external and internal drivers to enable driving optimal business decisions.
What you’ll do:
Provide thought leadership on design of systems, tools and processes for financial forecasting and reporting
Set strategic vision and roadmap for the Forecast and BI team and delivery of outcomes
Lead multiple initiatives to drive forecast simplification, sophistication (including use of leading indicators) and automation
Experiment with driver-based forecasting identifying most relevant drivers for our business (internal or external) and incorporating them into our forecasts
Drive business outcomes through accurate forecasts and scenarios
Partner with finance and business teams to scope problems and deliver solutions
Play a critical role in our efforts to modernize finance through automation and simplification.
Manage and mentor BI & forecast data science teams (~10 team members) collaborating with the team on projects, reviewing models and ensuring work meets business objectives
Who you are:
A visionary leader with passion for driving business outcomes and leading automation and process improvement initiatives to modernize finance.
7+ years experience leading and managing high-performing teams in a technical finance, analytical or strategy role
Embraces and leads change with ability to influence others outside of direct reporting lines
Demonstrated ability to frame and solve unstructured problems
 build relationships with stakeholders and partners
Drive insights and influence outcomes
Strong analytical and modelling capability
Ability to remove barriers to progress
Ability to lead multiple projects with excellent organization skills
Business knowledge understanding of Machine Learning, Data science
Intellectual curiosity and desire to learn new things, techniques and technology
Solid understanding of financial concepts and processes
Degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, Statistics or other analytical field. MBA a plus.
Nice to have: Experience with data visualization tools and packages and knowledge of at least one of the following programming languages: Python, RLI-AG3

Expedia Group (NASDAQ: EXPE) powers travel for everyone, everywhere through our global platform. Company
Market Leader has over 20 years of experience partnering with real estate agents, helping them to leverage our software to meet more home buyers and sellers in their local markets. Market Leader is on a mission to enable real estate agents to focus on what they do best – building relationships – and to let technology take care of the rest. From lead generation to an intelligent CRM and state-of-the-art websites and excellent customer care, real estate agents and their clients experience rely on Market Leader to make home selling and buying a personal and professional experience.
About the role
Market Leader is looking for a Business Intelligence Lead to join our Data and Insights team. In this role, you will be responsible for the curation of our business-critical data sets and the continued development of our data pipelines and reporting infrastructure (Power BI or Tableau). This means synthesizing business problems and data requests across Market Leader including our product and data science teams and creating clean, easy-to-use, and information-rich data that facilitates building data-driven product features, gathering actionable insights, and self-service reporting and analytics. You will be working with our 24-7 streaming data pipelines that leverages modern technologies such as AWS Kinesis, AWS Lambda, Apache Parquet, SQL Server CDC, Databricks Spark and Delta.
Expectations
Data Enrichment, Transformations and Cleansing:
We expect our BI Lead to have extremely strong analytical data programming skills with PySpark, SparkSQL and ANSI SQL. You must be comfortable constructing highly intuitive user-facing datasets that rely on a combination of joins, aggregate functions, subqueries, and window functions that runs in production 24-7.
Data Modeling:
You are an architectural thinker when it comes to the data warehouse. You identify common access patterns and demands of the data, and then design data sets that balance performance and ease-of-access using whatever tools or patterns work best for the job. You should have an appreciation for order and consistency in data as well as experience avoiding (and taming) chaos.
Reporting Infrastructure:
We strive for self-service when it comes to reporting. This means you should be able to intake requests from across the organization, find commonalities in what people are trying to understand, and create experiences in Power BI or Tableau that allow users to address a variety of related problems.
Skills
Expert-level analytical SQL (ideally using Databricks or Apache Spark, Snowflake, or a similar MPP data-warehouse technology)
Experience with at least one other data language beyond SQL such as PySpark, Python and C#
Strong hands-on experience developing and maintaining Power BI or Tableau
Strong foundation in data-modeling principles, including third-normal form, dimensional modeling, and denormalization
Exposure to a variety of data sets, including marketplace, e-commerce, or subscription data, as well as large-scale event data
B.S. Degree in Computer Science related fields strongly preferred

Paid Holidays
Paid Time Off (PTO) for vacation/sick time
Employee recognition program with quarterly awards
Employee referral program
Employee assistance program
Medical:
Medical, Dental and Vision – starting on Day 1!
Company-paid short term and long term disability
Company-paid life insurance and AD&D coverage
Wellbeing program, so you can earn additional $ toward medical expenses.
Financial:
401K retirement savings plan with company match
Eligible for Profit Sharing Bonus
Employee stock ownership program

Job Description Summary:
Join us in the Fine Wine Industry at RNDC! As a Portfolio Business Analyst for The Estate Group, you will serve as a business partner with other internal business colleagues including the Director, Portfolio Management, Portfolio Managers, Director and Managers, Sales Finance for Washington and/or Oregon.


Job duties for this role include supporting the Portfolio Managers and Director, Portfolio Management in managing the portfolio of designated suppliers including various key responsibilities which are directly related to supplier relations and performance tracking in Washington and Oregon.


WA: Auburn
Job Description:
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Maintains and updates reports on sales and distribution programs and confirms the accuracy of the required reports.
Tracks sales incentives and recaps at the end of each program period.
Supports Portfolio Management team with reports and data for all supplier review meetings, planning meetings, etc.
Coordinates and/or manages all pre-sells, holiday VAP orders, specialty and a llocated i tems once Portfolio Managers have determined the proper distribution levels.
Maintain current sell sheets in box and other electronic filing systems.
Review backorder report and other inventory management tools daily to identify inventory issues and opportunities. Communicates any issues timely and with a sense of urgency to the appropriate chain of command.
Identifies sales opportunities through analysis of categories, trends, price categories, etc.
Participate in supplier review meetings, when needed and assists in providing written meeting recaps and in communicating follow-up steps internally and externally.
Assist in coordinating new item set up and launches for sales divisions.
Help to maintain current list of supplier portfolio contacts.
Manage applicable workflows, standard of operations and appropriate record keeping for compliance.
Attend meetings with sales leadership and assigned suppliers, when needed. May participate in budget or KPI reviews when needed.
Assist in the identification of real and potential portfolio problems and help troubleshoot issues for solutions.
Carry out responsibilities in accordance with all company policies and applicable laws.
Perform other related duties and responsibilities as needed or as assigned.
Required Qualifications
High School diploma, or equivalent.
2+ years of related analyst experience.
Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint skills required.
Experience with manipulating large amounts of data.
Ability to quickly learn new systems/tools is necessary.
Experience with supply chain software.
Desired Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in a related field.
2 or more years of related analyst experience is required.
1+ years of experience in the beverage alcohol industry.
Knowledge of and basic skill working with Oracle.
Familiarity or experience with Demantra.
RNDC has sold fine wines since the end of Prohibition. Our long history and emphasis in the wine business can be attributed to our family roots; focused on family-owned wineries that share many of the same values and goals. Our robust portfolio of fine wines spans the world’s most prestigious wine-making regions, from Australia, Chile, and the Rhone Valley of France, to Washington and Oregon. We believe that the wine business is a people business, and with each wine there is a story, a wine maker and a sales team that delivers on each and every bottle. We are dedicated to providing our customers valuable wine expertise. We are dedicated to delivering best in class service and value to our customers.
EOE/Minorities/Females/Vet/Disability
Enjoy a career with us!

Job Description Details
Zulily's Merchandise analytics team is a diverse group of data professionals that work to derive strategic insights aimed at driving Zulily’s sustainable growth. The team works with key business partners across Marketing, Quality Assurance, Supply Chain, and Tech to support Zulily’s goal of providing the best experience for Mom. This is an opportunity to be part of an innovative, data-driven culture that is changing the way data and technology are used to shape eCommerce.
We are looking for a talented Senior Business Analyst dedicated to generating powerful insights surrounding our inventory that enable our merchandisers and marketing teams to continue to provide the best-curated products and drive customer engagement and growth. Your primary focus will be conducting in-depth analysis on how inventory trends are impacting the business and generate actionable insight for leadership regarding strategic next steps. This role will also be responsible for creating & maintaining processes surrounding the management of current inventory and the planning for future inventory.
Success in this role requires a strong preference for action and the ability to execute daily at the highest level. The Senior Business Analyst should be able to take direction and should also be capable of leading and working independently across all levels of the organization with minimal guidance. You drive projects from beginning to end, leverage your curiosity and analytical skill-set, and are eager to initiate new ideas, approaches, and actions to move the business forward. In addition to a deep technical background and analytical mind, an ideal candidate will demonstrate strong organizational agility and executive presence. You will rely heavily on data to find areas of opportunity and are comfortable communicating with and influencing all layers of the organization, from entry-level to executive audiences.
Your primary focus will be building scalable data solutions, maintaining and improving the planning process for future inventory, accounting for capacity and profitability constraints, developing success metrics and KPIs, creating insights, and making recommendations to enable success and drive inventory goals. The role will require assessing technical and implementation challenges, making recommendations on the feasibility of projects and ensuring any needs for new data logging are integrated into project plans to allow for performance reporting.
Essential Job Functions:
Develop and streamline necessary reporting, dashboards, and one-off analyses, providing the ability to monitor initiatives while effectively communicating performance.
Provide in-depth analysis to leadership regarding inventory trends and their impact on business performance.
Collaborate with stakeholders to define and operationalize KPIs for short and long-term measurements that align with company inventory goals.
Maintaining and improving the planning processes for future inventory, accounting for capacity and profitability constraints.
Develop and manage processes to maximize the amount of inventory available to customers.
Aid in the development of re-pricing models for aged inventory for holiday sales and various business needs.
Build scalable data solutions, data sets, views, queries, reports, dashboards, and scheduled processes.
Troubleshoot code, research root causes, and document solutions.
Keep stakeholders informed regarding problems and resolutions. Deliver products on schedule and communicate updates regularly.
Effectively partner and influence across analytics teams, technology groups, and business functions to accomplish goals.
Prepare and present quantitative and qualitative analyses to influence peers to C-level leadership.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in a related field (such as Statistics, Analytics, or a similar field) and 5+ years in an analytical role or 3 years plus a Master’s degree in a quantitative field; a background in eCommerce is preferred but not required
Strong bias for action and experience in high-paced, high-volume, multi-tasking roles, and environment.
The passion for digging into data, structuring problems, and building models and analyses that translate into actionable business recommendations
Experience leading programs at the enterprise level
Strong analytical skills and data-driven approach; ability to measure the impact of project deliverables
Advanced capabilities in extracting and manipulating large data sets using SQL or similar
Skilled in Excel, Tableau (or similar data visualization software). Familiarity with R or Python is a plus or willingness to learn
Proven ability to lead cross-functionally and communicate effectively with other areas of the business
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Proven understanding of complex cause-and-effect relationships
About Zulily, LLC
Zulily, LLC, is a retailer obsessed with bringing its customers special finds every day—all at incredible prices. zulily features an always-fresh curated collection for the whole family, including clothing, home decor, toys, gifts and more. Unique products from up-and-coming brands are featured alongside favorites
from top brands, giving customers something new to discover each morning. zulily was launched in 2010 and is headquartered in Seattle with offices in Nevada, Ohio and Pennsylvania. For more information visit www.zulily.com . zulily, LLC, is a wholly owned subsidiary of Qurate Retail, Inc. (NASDAQ: QRTEA, RTEB), which includes QVC, HSN, Zulily and the Cornerstone brands (collectively, “Qurate Retail Group”), as well as other minority investments. Qurate Retail Group believes in a third way to shop - beyond transactional ecommerce or traditional brick-and-mortar stores - and is #1 in video commerce, #3 in ecommerce in North America and #3 in mobile commerce in the U.S. (according to Internet Retailer). The Finance Department has an outstanding opportunity for a Sr. Financial Reporting Analyst.


The Sr. Financial Reporting Analyst is responsible for supporting the timely and accurate preparation of financial statements prepared according to the Governmental Accounting Standards Board (GASB), detailed supporting schedules and footnotes, analysis of results, and executing on complex technical accounting work and projects in various forms. They provide support to campus customers on accounting topics and serve as one of the subject matter experts in the Financial Reporting group on accounting and reporting matters.


This person utilizes their senior-level technical accounting and analysis skills to support the accounting and reporting processes in the Financial Reporting unit. They are relied upon by the Associate Controller as someone that is able to pick up nonstandard, complex, highly technical work and complete that work with minimal direction and oversight. They own or contribute to reporting and analysis deliverables that are presented to executive leadership and the Audit Advisory Committee to the Board of Regents. They are an informal leader for other accounting staff in the unit and a knowledge expert on the work done in Financial Reporting.


The Sr. Financial Reporting Analyst will play a key role in helping to transition the accounting and reporting processes owned by the Financial Reporting unit as they are impacted by the implementation of the UW’s Workday ERP system (scheduled to go live July 2023). They work independently and in partnership with the Associate Controller and Controller, as well as in close collaboration with process partners across campus.


This position requires the ability to understand and work with highly technical accounting topics, and to perform complex analysis on the data underlying financial statement results. They are required to communicate effectively in order to explain complex transactions and accounting issues, often in ways that can be understood by nonaccountants.


The position coordinates with external independent and state auditors to provide supporting documentation and explanation of results. The position also communicates with departments across the University regarding accounting issues and guidance and regarding updates and changes to the accounting processes.


Data Management and Analytics


The senior level Analyst is responsible for financial reporting and analysis with a primary focus on supporting Finance leadership. This includes gathering, analyzing, and reporting financial data and results where underlying data often originate from multiple sources. The position requires an innovative, creative, highly motivated, team-oriented individual. Operate from a proactive and positive business approach, focused on meeting current and future needs where data and knowledge derived from data will play a critical role in executive-level decision-making.

Support and continually improve the accounting processes which contribute toward preparation of periodic GASB-based financial results, and preparation of the annual UW Financial Report which is relied upon by the university’s Board of Regents, Audit Advisory Committee, external bondholders, and the state of WA Office of Financial Management.

Directly contribute to preparation and analysis of periodic financial reports for senior management using advanced features of applications such as Excel, SQL Server analysis tools, etc.

Use UW administrative system tools including, for example, MyFD, Workday, and the Enterprise Data Warehouse to extract and download system data for analysis.

Work collaboratively with process partners, peers, and leaders. Oversee and deliver accounting data, results, and analysis to the VP of Finance.

Monthly, quarterly and annual reports out to Controller and Finance Vice President:

Use detailed knowledge of data mining within Financial Systems and an in-depth understanding of how to interpret and use data to produce viable and accurate financial reports and analytics.

Work collaboratively and in partnership with a matrixed level of positions across the University and ability to take the lead in guiding other analysts.

Use a deep knowledge of software programs to ensure the credibility of reports and analysis.

Provide holistic financial reporting and review of the University.


Campus Support


Serve as a resource to the Financial Accounting department and various other departments across the University to support accounting processes, research and analyze data and trends, explain accounting treatments and results, interpret and implement new accounting requirements, etc. Work with a diverse group of individuals; placing a value on diversity, equity, and inclusiveness.


Create ad-hoc reports that help businesses address their financial questions and/or root-cause problem-solving.

Heavy involvement in the organization-wide process and policy changes. This may include developing reports and analysis which are provided to VP/AVP and Director Level leaders to inform of changes and/or impact on university finances.

Significant involvement in the fiscal year-end and biennium close process.

Outreach, collaboration, and support to department leaders across campus.

Manage and modify existing database applications and other programming applications as needed. Develop reports and present data for special projects as assigned.

Responsibilities include understanding the business purpose, strategy, and drivers behind financial results, and creating and analyzing variance reports.

Assist Finance leadership in developing and implementing dashboards, key business and financial metrics, and/or productivity platforms.

Assist Finance leadership in the development of policies and procedures to maintain and improve adherence to university, state, and federal rules and regulations

Design & build operational best-practices across Finance and UW


Process Improvement


Focus on continuous process improvement activities related to Financial Accounting and Reporting.

Continually identify opportunities for improvement or gaps in business processes across Finance. Work to develop and implement process improvements.

Assist in driving process change across Finance.


Accounting, Fiscal Oversight, and Special Projects


Support and continually improve the accounting processes which are responsible for complying with the accounting and reporting directives required by the State of WA Office of Financial Management and which support the preparation of the Annual Comprehensive Financial Report (ACFR).

Provide oversight to ensure departmental processes and procedures compliance with University, State, and Federal policies and guidelines.

Develop sophisticated tools that enable automating current manual processes and increase departmental efficiency.

Provide fiscal leadership to program initiatives including tracking of sponsorship commitments, cash transmittals, expense transfers, and providing reporting of fund balance.

Ability to manage and execute projects from start to finish as assigned.

Additional duties as assigned.


MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:


Bachelor's degree in Accounting or related field and five years of experience in full-scope accounting, including use of data analysis tools.

Demonstrated proficiency with Microsoft Excel including the ability to design, build, document, and maintain complex workbooks in a user-friendly, intuitive and logical manner.

Demonstrated ability to analyze, interpret and explain financial results, and to formulate and implement process improvements.

A collaborative, customer service attitude

Excellent communication skills

Demonstrated experience in working on diverse groups and teams; respects, values, and contributes to UW Finance and UW’s commitment to diversity, inclusion, and equity.


Equivalent education/experience will substitute for all minimum qualifications except when there are legal requirements, such as a license/certification/registration.


DESIRED EXPERIENCE


Experience in public accounting.

CPA license or demonstrated progress toward CPA designation.

Proficiency with Microsoft Access.

positionName: NSS (NAES Staffing Services) Client Credit Analyst
description:
At NAES, you’ll find engaging and challenging career opportunities in the power generation, renewable energy and industrial construction industry. At every level of the company, we share a common goal: To instill confidence in our clients through our steadfast commitment to safety, integrity and quality of work. We are committed to supporting a culture with unique perspectives. We value Individual Differences in Each other in an effort to create a brighter future in the power generation industry.
We operate more than 190 power plants throughout the United States, Canada, Mexico and the UK that span all technologies and provide over 49 GW of capacity. With the strength of 4000 people, our growing family of companies now addresses the entire life cycle of power generation and other industrial plants.
As the largest independent operator of power facilities in the industry, we’ve come to be viewed as an employer of choice. We strive to attract and retain employees by offering competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits package (including retirement) and promotional opportunities.
NAES Staffing Services (NSS) provides cost-effective, custom-tailored staffing solutions – temporary or permanent – for a range of industries including power generation (all technologies), industrial/manufacturing, oil & gas, refining, and construction.
Summary
The Client Credit Analyst is responsible for performing a broad range of credit related analysis on existing and future clients. The individual in this role will evaluate the financial risks involved with a client by initiating background research to complete necessary due diligence steps; thus, reducing the Company’s exposure to bad debt losses.
Primary Duties
The ideal candidate will evaluate the financial health of existing and potential clients by analyzing available financial and other data to determine credit recommendations, ensure client information is accurate and securely maintained. An important part of this role is adhering to internal controls, policies, and procedures surrounding the credit assessment process.
Scope of Responsibilities
Research and evaluate creditworthiness of potential and current customers
Examine credit history and/or financial transactions, documents etc. case by case
Determine degree of risk involved
Carefully analyze data producing clear and objective reports
Routinely monitor monthly credit reporting and rating requirements
Adhere to established policy, standards, and internal controls; communicating with Management staff and NAES subsidiaries
Monitor corporate portfolio quality on an ongoing basis within established tools
Maintain accurate records of client credit application / renewal packets
Ensuring and maintain accurate data within established tools for tracking client credit
Draft models of credit information that predict trends on an ongoing basis
Monitoring trade receivable and billings for collections and potential bad debts
Provide recommendations on opportunities to improve or optimize procedures, standards, policy
Participate in JSOX audit requirements when assigned
Working Relationships
This position reports the Senior Manager Finance Operations and/or the Client Credit Manager. The position will not have direct reports.
Education and Experience
At least 2-years proven work experience as a Credit Analyst or similar role
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Business Administration, Finance or similar field (a plus)
Advanced knowledge of accounting software, Microsoft suite, MSD365 ERP solutions (a plus)
Excellent analytical, negotiation, and problem-solving skills
Detail oriented with good communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to self-manage in stressful situations
Specific Skills and Knowledge
Ability to accurately manage details, meet deadlines and support decisions with appropriate support within a fast paced, sometime ambiguous environment
Aptitude to recognize and resolve issues in a timely manner
Manage complex workload with a high degree of ethics and integrity, with discretion
Knowledge of accounting principles, credit scores, collection policies, and credit related laws
Physical Requirements and Working Conditions
Normal working hours are 8:00a.m. to 5:00p.m. Monday through Friday in an office environment while sitting at a desk. Overtime may be required during periods of high workload, to meet deadlines, or major projects.
Fit for Duty
All employees will participate in the Fitness for Duty Program. This program includes a post-offer physical examination and drug screening and post-employment random drug screening. There are extensive smoking restrictions in and around the facility.
Performance
All employees have the responsibility to both the customer and their co-workers to do the job right the first time, and to ensure the customer’s needs are being met.
NAES Safe
Safety is a core value of NAES and as a condition of employment, all employees are expected to be mentally alert and work safely at all times. Additionally, employees are required to adhere to all safety warnings and posted safety signs whenever on company property. Furthermore, employees must follow all NAES safety rules and procedures. Effectiveness in carrying out this responsibility is part of the evaluation of each employee’s performance.
Education
Preferred
Bachelors or better in Accounting or related field
Skills
Preferred
ERP
Microsoft Dynamics
MS Office Suite
Verbal and Written Communications

We are a diverse team of collaborators, doers, and problem-solvers who are relentlessly committed to a culture of safety. This position will directly impact the history of space exploration and will require your commitment and detailed attention towards safe and repeatable space flight. Join us in lowering the cost of access to space and enabling Blue Origin’s vision of millions of people living and working in space to benefit Earth.
As part of a diverse and hardworking team of specialists, you will participate in defining KPIs and supporting dataset creation for various spaceflight systems. You will share in the team’s impact on all aspects of the New Glenn vehicle. You will be responsible for applying your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and data presentation to identify trends and opportunities. To be successful in this role you must be a proactive, service-oriented individual with excellent oral, written, interpersonal, and analytics skills who can thrive in a fast-paced environment.
In this role, you will provide coordination and oversight on various technical tasks on projects of varying complex nature. It’s critical that you understand business application data to ensure accuracy and quality, while identifying opportunities to integrate between systems. As a Program Analyst, you will elicit and gather user requirements to translate into detailed documentation to be used for technical execution. You must be able to regularly communicate to management regarding status of technical deliverables, identify and monitor technical risks, and communicating roadblocks and issues to stakeholders. You will be responsible for assembling plans to track key execution/technical milestones and communicating status to the technical team and management. As the Program Business Intelligence Analyst, you must have a strong understanding of business needs in order to effectively interface and communicate with business users and technical support resources.
We are looking for someone to apply their technical expertise, leadership skills, and commitment to quality to positively impact safe human spaceflight. Passion for our mission and vision is required!
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field, with at least 5 years of professional experience
3+ years’ experience doing quantitative analysis within a large-scale company or fast-paced environment
Strong experience in SQL to query and create tables for Business Intelligence
Strong experience in generating Tableau Reports based on user stories and business requirements
Strong analytic skill set and a high degree of proficiency in data mining utilizing Python or R
Experience communicating the results of analyses with product and leadership teams to influence the strategy of the product
Analytical, organization, and problem-solving skills, with a strong bias for action, attention to detail and high level of accuracy
Must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.
Desired:
Fundamental knowledge of Kimball data modeling techniques
Knowledge of ETL tools and processes
Familiarity using AWS cloud technology to collect, store and analyze data
Experience with Postgres and Redshift DBs
Experience with Data Visualization in Python

GameStop’s Merchandising Analytics team is seeking a Senior Data Analyst to perform complex analyses and generate insights to help make and inform important decisions that impact our customers and business. The scope of the Merchandising Analytics team spans GameStop’s core business areas, including Power Up Rewards (our membership program), GameStop stores, GameStop.com, sales of new and pre-owned items, the trade-in business model, and more. The team aims to improve the customer experience by identifying and evaluating how we can improve the selection we offer to them, their membership experience and value, and their experience online and in stores. We aim to sustainably grow the business by analyzing and identifying opportunities to improve the underlying economics of our programs and offerings and measuring the effectiveness of our marketing and customer outreach campaigns. We achieve these goals by performing experiments and tests, leveraging simple and complex statistical analyses to generate causal inferences, using internal and external data to identify the drivers of customer engagement, building custom and automated reporting, supporting strategic financial and econometric analyses for the GameStop leadership team to better understand the long-term implications of business decisions, and translating data into compelling insights and actions. Joining this team is an exciting opportunity to make a significant impact on GameStop’s customers and business, as we are using data to solve some of the most challenging and important problems for the merchandising organization.

In this role, you will use your expertise in SQL, Excel, data mining, and data visualization to dive deep into the data, provide in-depth analyses, and generate meaningful insights and recommendations from the data. You will have the opportunity to apply statistical techniques in your work. You will collaborate with business leaders to understand their businesses, challenges, and the most important questions or hypotheses that could be answered with data. You will communicate and provide clear and concise visualizations of the data to business partners and help them interpret the data to understand what it means for their business in both the short and long-term.

**We are looking for multiple levels of Analysts and encourage all levels of experience to apply**

Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities

Dive deep into the data to perform complex analyses on historical and real-time data, creating actionable insights and recommendations.

Establish metrics, reporting and review mechanisms to enable data-driven decision, while setting up automated and scalable mechanisms.

Create robust and easy-to-understand data visualizations to quickly show senior business leaders key problem areas, new opportunities, and emerging trends.

Design and evaluate tests and experiments to measure the impact of business decisions and changes to the customer experience on customer engagement and business performance.

Collaborate with Merchant teams to identify new metrics, build out reporting, and data analyses that will drive insights that lead to customer experience and business improvements.

Present your written analysis and data insights to senior business partners regularly, across the organization.

Translate business questions into hypotheses that can be answered with experiments, tests, the application of statistical methods, and/or data analysis.

Proactively identify business opportunities through your understanding of the data and our customers.

Identify areas where improvements in the underlying is data required for analytics and/or the operation of the business.

Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in business, finance, computer science, statistics, engineering, or equivalent.

3+ years of relevant experience in data analytics, business analytics, economics, business, or finance.

3+ years of experience and expertise working with SQL and or BigQuery. Strong SQL knowledge including but not limited to; complex queries, CTEs, temp tables, stored procedures, cursors.

Expert-level Excel capabilities (e.g., data manipulation, advanced formulas, modeling, summarizing and reporting).

Strong dashboarding and data story-telling experience; proficient with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI.

Experience partnering directly with business functions and communicating complex analyses to non-technical leaders.

Ability to work independently with minimal oversight.




Ability to work under demanding time constraints and adapt to changing priorities.

Preferred Qualifications

Master’s Degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, engineering, finance, business, or equivalent.

5+ years of relevant experience in business intelligence or business analytics.

Experience working in a retail and/or e-commerce environment.

Experience using Google Analytics and other parts of the Google Cloud Platform.

Experience in Python and/or R programming languages

Experience in the application and interpretation of statistical concepts, like regression analysis, A/B testing, and causal inference.

Company Description
Zscaler (NASDAQ: ZS) accelerates digital transformation so that customers can be more agile, efficient, resilient, and secure. The Zscaler Zero Trust Exchange is the company’s cloud-native platform that protects thousands of customers from cyberattacks and data loss by securely connecting users, devices, and applications in any location.
With more than 10 years of experience developing, operating, and scaling the cloud, Zscaler serves thousands of enterprise customers around the world, including 450 of the Forbes Global 2000 organizations. In addition to protecting customers from damaging threats, such as ransomware and data exfiltration, it helps them slash costs, reduce complexity, and improve the user experience by eliminating stacks of latency-creating gateway appliances.
Zscaler was founded in 2007 with a mission to make the cloud a safe place to do business and a more enjoyable experience for enterprise users. Zscaler’s purpose-built security platform puts a company’s defenses and controls where the connections occur—the internet—so that every connection is fast and secure, no matter how or where users connect or where their applications and workloads reside.

positionName: Staff Data Analyst - Core Shopping Experience
description:
Our Opportunity:

Chewy is seeking a bright and curious Staff Data Analyst in Bellevue, WA, to leverage a wide set of analytical skills to help us advance core shopping experience. You will have the opportunity to dive in and investigate strategic business problems as we grow, scale and enter new markets.

What You’ll Do:

Partner with cross functional teams (product management, engineering, and business operations) to understand the insights they need to manage and grow their businesses
Develop, maintain, and enhance analytics solutions to provide business insights that guide strategic decisions and uncover optimization opportunities
Perform investigations into data questions and weaving those findings into an effective story to be actionable for business users
Proactively monitor customer behavior to identify trends that are sources of opportunity or potential issues, determine root causes, and work with business partners on next steps.

What You’ll Need:

A bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, MIS, Engineering or related quantitative discipline with at least 5 year of related, full-time experience in an analyst role working on a business team or a Master’s degree in Information Systems, or quantitative field
Strong SQL skills with a working understanding of databases, ETL process, Data Modeling on unstructured or undefined data sets across multiple business functions.
An ability to develop production level code that can be implemented at an org level
Demonstrated experience with BI Tools (Tableau, Power BI, Knime, OBIEE, Qlik, etc.)
Experience interpreting data, designing metrics and analyzing results using exploratory as well as statistical techniques
Experience presenting findings to business partners across the organization, including executive leadership
Excellent technical skills and a strong passion for data analysis and investigation and should also be intellectually curious in the quest for answers to the cause and effect of business outcomes.
A self-starter mentality and ability to operate within a fast-paced and ambiguous environment
Proven analytic skills using SAS, R or Python.
A foundational understanding of statistical techniques such as regression, predictive modeling, forecasting, time series analysis, and clustering and apply those to answer business needs
Position may require travel

Bonus:
Experience using Vertica, Snowflake SQL, Google analytics, BigQuery, Click stream data, Data modelling, data warehouse, ETL process
Previous experience with ecommerce retail or similar setting or marketing / advertising technology

positionName: Senior Data Analyst, Decision Intelligence (Remote within the US or In Office PA, CA, UT)
description:
Nav is democratizing small business financing. In other words, we give small business owners access and control. Yes, this challenges the norm, but it means working with curious, purpose driven, dedicated, and inquisitively smart people who push themselves, our company, and the community to the next level (and every level after that). We are the people behind the tech. And when it’s good, we look for better. We don’t over think the value we bring nor spend time trying to revamp mantras. We also do not come up with some crafty way to tell you who we are and what we offer. We are Nav! Here, you’ll gain a wealth of experience, learn the tricks of the trade, and work with winners. All companies say people are connected to their mission but in our case our mission and our people are one – it is a way of being not just a cause you are committed to. And since 2013, Nav has holistically and organically developed its own ideology because Nav can only be Nav.


This role will work closely with the executive team to become the source of truth for various product initiatives, customer conversion and behavior, and the development and tracking of key performance indicators. This position will need to be able to transform data in its raw form into consumable information that drives actionable insights and tangible results. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter, possess an innate desire for continuous improvement, be experienced with business and financial strategies, and be an effective communicator.
WHAT WE EMPOWER YOU WITH:

Determine the ROI of various product and customer initiatives
Identify the ideal customer segmentation and messaging
Own and manage standard reporting strategies and KPIs
Create interactive dashboards and visualizations using tools like Tableau, D3, Highcharts, Recharts, and React-vis
Properly understand and be able to manipulate large amounts of data, separating data from noise
High level of ownership and driving the direction of data analysis
Being a thought leader and partner to leadership in driving our data strategies forward
Interest in machine learning and decision intelligence.

WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE:

3+ years of solid analytical / BI experience
Strong knowledge of SQL and data analytics and reporting

Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Experienced with BI software, notably Tableau
Cohorting/Unit Economics Modeling (statistics, applied math, applied finance)
Strong performer & demonstrated knowledge in excel/google sheets
Strong oral and written communication skills and comfortable presenting and transforming technical findings into consumable information which leads to actionable insights
Experience with marketing automation tools, CRMs, marketing analytics tools such as Google Analytics or Sitecatalyst, and marketing testing tools
Passionate about our customers and using our data to deliver the best customer experience
AB/Multivariate testing
Revenue attribution modeling
Familiarity with ETL process and data piping
Familiarity with machine learning concepts


WHO YOU ARE:

Someone who is mission driven and loves having an impact in the lives of others.
Motivated, self starter looking to “hit the ground running”. You eat fast-paced environments for breakfast.
An active listener who empathizes and truly wants to understand our customer’s needs.
You're excited by change when it means we are continuously improving and meeting the changing needs of our customers.
A high-energy multitasker with exceptional organizational skills.


INCLUSION AT NAV:

At Nav, we celebrate what makes our employees unique because the businesses we serve are progressively diverse and distinctly original. Navericks are diverse, side hustlers, immigrants, veterans, queer, and we push generational boundaries. We are college dropouts, PhDs, special needs parents, allies, pet owners and community leaders. Navericks are human. We are committed to upholding a safe, supportive environment where everyone matters. We are committed to making a better future for all of us. We have created a workplace where people of all backgrounds can express their identities authentically. To put it simply we want you to be proud to be you.


OUR COMPENSATION PHILOSOPHY IS SIMPLE BUT POWERFUL.

We believe great, enduring relationships are grounded in trust and transparency. Compensation shouldn’t be a distraction, and employees should understand how pay and career advancement decisions are made. Providing equal pay for equal work is table stakes for being a great place to work. Gender and ethnic inequity should only be something that our children read about in history books. We believe providing Navsters with company ownership, competitive pay, and a range of meaningful benefits is the start of creating a culture where people want to give the best they’ve got — not because they’re simply making money, but because they’ve fallen in love with our vision, mission, values, and team.


OUR IMPACT ON YOU:

Company Ownership (equity). Unlimited Planned Vacation. Benefits Day One. 6 Weeks Paid Parental Leave. Work From Anywhere (yes we were distributed before it was cool). Flexible Work Arrangements. Free Telehealth and Telemental Health For All Employees. Employee Networking and Events. Community Network Groups (women’s, PRIDE, culture). Meaningful Perks and Rewards. Learning and Development Opportunities. Pet Insurance.


A NAVERICK’S DNA:

We look at the future and say “why not”; we see possibilities where others see problems or routines. We show the way ahead and are committed to achieving ambitious goals.
We practice straight talk and listen generously to each other with empathy. We value different opinions and point of views. We ensure that we connect outside as well as inside to learn from others and inspire each other.
We hold ourselves accountable for delivering results. We choose to not to be a victim of circumstance. We make decisions & take responsibility so that we can act & support each other, rather than adopting defensive, and “finger pointing” behaviors.


As leaders we motivate & engage our teams to undertake beyond what they originally thought possible, by developing our teams & creating the conditions for people to grow and empower themselves through enabling & coaching.

Description:
Providence is calling a Principal ERP Technical Analyst to our location in Renton, WA or Portland, OR.
We are seeking a Principal ERP Technical Analyst who will use a wide application of principles, theories, and concepts related to technical and operations, to provide solutions to a diverse array of difficult problems. May lead medium project and work teams and will work on a number of complex technical policies, programs and initiatives. Acts as a data analyst to implement complex systems configurations programs and policies for a large multi facility healthcare organization. Addresses topics and issues that are both strategic (long term) and operational (immediate) in nature. Implements and maintains complex programs of IT resource configuration and operation. Ensures that improvements in and/or changes to operations are implemented and monitored to increase efficiency. Provides technical and operational assistance to EBA teams to ensure that installed systems are documented according to organization standards and policies. Acts as a source and mentor for direction, training/skills development and guidance for less experienced departmental staff. May be assigned a lead role to assist management in short or long term management needs.
Performs all duties in a manner that promotes team concept, high quality customer interactions and reflects the Providence Health & Services mission, vision (know me, care for me, ease my way) and core values of; respect, compassion, justice, excellence and stewardship.
In this position you will have the following responsibilities:
This position will be involved in the implementation and ongoing daily support of business applications. Works very closely with the IS organization’s technical and operational departments, vendors and contractors, and other IS caregivers to implement and maintain these policies, methodologies, and standards
Able to offer customer value-added enhancement ideas
Mentor analysts in technical skills, operational approach and effective communication.
Actively seek out and develop opportunities to leverage IS services to improve reliability and availability of IS systems, customer satisfaction and reduce costs and enhance overall operational efficiencies.
Coordinating with other IT areas who are responsible for file transfers, security administration, reporting, databases and other functions.
Help investigate and resolve system functional and technical errors. Troubleshoot on systems and data, and generate solutions which may include systems modifications enhancements or new procedures.
Identify and analyze operational and systems issues and opportunities and produce effective solutions
Identify and create standards and processes to support the application portfolio management.
Review, recommend and support new standards, protocols and process within teams
Lead project teams as needed. Contribute to project budget and effectively and independently manage IS projects collaborating with business partners, stakeholders, and vendors.
Perform complex qualitative and/or quantitative analyses.
Write expert technical documentation to be used as training and reference materials for technical staff and application teams.
Solution across multiple applications and non-application functions in innovative ways.
Use in-depth information and analysis to provide management with advice and counsel on a variety of business issues. Issues are often highly technical and complex in nature.
Qualifications:
Required qualifications for this position include:
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Business Management, Information Services, Engineering, Commerce or an equivalent combination of education and relevant experience (at least 8 years of functional experience).
Eight (8) years of experience with diverse technical background/orientation detailed working knowledge of servers/storage, networks, databases, applications, operations and configuration management.
Three (3) years of experience with large scale business transformation and ERP system implementation projects with scope spanning multiple technical domains of IS modernization.
Demonstrated ability to successfully execute strategic plans for highly complex issues; experience standardizing complex and disparate processes; methodologies related to application management such as system deployment, support, and life cycle; experience in process improvement methodology, change management, operational improvement in complex systems. Must have proven ability to interact at and communicate to all levels of an organization.
Preferred qualifications for this position include:
Master's Degree in Information Services, Business Administration, Commerce, Engineering.
Minimum of three(3) years of experience with implementation or support of large multi-site ERP systems such as Oracle Cloud, PeopleSoft, Infor/Lawson.
About the department you will serve.
Providence Strategic and Management Services provides a variety of functional and system support services for all eight regions of Providence Health & Services from Alaska to California. We are focused on supporting our Mission by delivering a robust foundation of services and sharing of specialized expertise.
We offer comprehensive, best-in-class benefits to our caregivers. For more information, visit
https://www.providenceiscalling.jobs/rewards-benefits/
Our Mission
As expressions of God’s healing love, witnessed through the ministry of Jesus, we are steadfast in serving all, especially those who are poor and vulnerable.
About Us
Providence is a comprehensive not-for-profit network of hospitals, care centers, health plans, physicians, clinics, home health care and services continuing a more than 100-year tradition of serving the poor and vulnerable. Providence is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Providence does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, disability, veteran, military status, religion, age, creed, national origin, sexual identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, genetic information, or any other basis prohibited by local, state, or federal law.
