Senior Business Analyst
Seattle WA

Doxo is disrupting bill pay. We are founded on the idea of having a simple, secure way to pay all your bills from a single account. We're a rapidly growing startup looking for a high energy, detail-oriented, technical Senior Finance Operations Analyst.

 Doxo Culture

We’re seeking enthusiastic, collaborative and resourceful people from a range of backgrounds who know how to get things done. Success comes from our culture, diversity, and dynamic global team. We value people who are authentic, take ownership, and deliver together. Does this sound like you?

Senior Business Analyst

Under Doxo’s VP Finance, you will provide financial and data analysis critical for strategic and tactical decision-making. This role is key to Doxo’s success, enabling our leaders to make sound business decisions and meet its financial objectives based on quotative data. This role will require very strong skills in data analysis and reporting tools. You will contribute support through information analyses, preparation of operational data, and analyses for various constituents throughout Doxo.

What you’ll be doing

Provide reporting and analytical support for assigned company departments.
Assist in the development and maintenance of the standard report library.
Responsible for the preparation of pricing analysis and other commercial-based exercises.
Generate/analyze the monthly business KPIs.
Identify, analyze, and propose new plans for operational improvements (policy, procedures, processes, etc.)
Analyze data, create multiple scenarios, build models, and identify trends
Extract major insights and conclusions from the analysis

What to bring

5+ years of experience in financial analysis
Bachelor’s degree required in business analytics/finance / Industrial engineering or related area; MBA preferred
Exceptional analytical skills and experience with various data analysis tools – Tableau / SQL, etc. Python is a plus.
Experience using Excel extensively, include Pivot Tables, etc.
Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals.
Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from senior (VP level) managers and other internal customers
Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists.
Experience working in a fast-growing company.

You’ll be a great fit if

You love being part of a small, dynamic, and agile team that encourages you to learn and grow
You love finding solutions to interesting problems and figuring out how things work
You welcome having autonomy with complex tasks
You are passionate about using your experience and expertise to inspire the team
You have strong written and oral communication skills
You are detail-oriented and organized

Our Company Perks and Benefits

100% employer-paid medical, dental, and vision coverage for full-time employees
Generous equity grants
401k match to help you save for your future
15 days PTO to start, plus paid holidays
Charitable donation match
Student loans support
Pet insurance
Plus plenty of corporate discounts


doxo is an equal-opportunity employer and we welcome applicants from all backgrounds.

QUALITEL Profile:

Qualitel is a contract manufacturer of mission-critical electronics, specializing in a full range of high-mix, low-volume and high-reliability products and services.

Qualitel was started in 1995 by its current President, Tuanhai Hoang and has become one of Washington State’s fastest growing companies in the new millennium. Located only 20 miles north of Seattle in Everett, Washington, Qualitel remains a private company with a reputation for products and services of the highest quality.

The company is known for its commitment to a “lean” culture which allows it to offer the shortest lead times and highest quality production available today. By placing a singular emphasis on flexibility and responsiveness, Qualitel is able to offer efficient execution of unique, difficult and complex projects.

Company success is further predicated on:

Customer focused service
Operational excellence using lean manufacturing systems
All relevant quality registrations and certifications
High-mix and high reliability EMS expertise
Open-book costing
State-of-the-art, redundant equipment
Inventory and obsolescence management
Supply change management and automated BIM ordering systems
Barcode component and WO traceability
Trained and certified IPC-610 and J-STD-001 workforce


PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES:


Data Analyst has overall responsibility for analyzing all costs and pricing at Qualitel with the purpose of finding cost reduction and variance opportunities. This will include:


Costing and pricing analysis & variance reporting
Analysis of actual, standard, and quoted costs for labor and materials.
Analyze variances for sales orders, purchase orders, and work orders to quoted costs and standards
Analyze expenses and COGS
Providing managers and team with clear, understandable and useful reports and metrics
Using data and relevant analysis, advises manager on improvement of profit margins, and cost of goods and services.
Review, interpret, analyze and communicates important financial information to President and leadership team.


Search Criteria:

 MUSTS:


Experience with data/financial analysis, and specifically with product/job costing, variance analysis, profit margin analysis.


Using advance functions in Excel and Pivot Tables.


Experience with accessing complex data from SQL and Access databases and translating this understandable language for operating personnel.


Experience in a manufacturing environment, and preferably a component/assembly environment.


Experience with setting up and working with cost methods in ERP


Demonstrated ability to make operational and management decisions in response to changing conditions and emergencies.


Ability to effectively interface and team with all levels of an organization, and to maintain positive, constructive relationships with operating personnel.


Exceptional interpersonal communications skills, including strong verbal and writing ability; presentation skills; ability to listen “actively” and to calibrate communication style to all levels of the company for maximum effectiveness.


A Bachelor’s degree, preferably in finance, accounting, supply chain or related.


 PREFERRED:


Experience with “lean” and “continuous improvement” principles and practices.


Experience in a multi-line, multi-product manufacturing or electronic assembly company with complex costing challenges.


Experience with box-build and high level assemblies with many configurations and subassemblies.


COMPANY CULTURE: The culture of Qualitel is characterized by doing what it takes to get things done, continuous improvement of processes and systems, a “hands on” commitment to accomplishing the best product possible for the customer, a bias for action and excellence, and operating with a lean mentality.


Employees are held to high performance standards, but always treated with respect and dignity.


INITIAL EXPECTATIONS:

FIRST 3 to 6 MONTHS:


Analyze costs and profit margins for the current customers, major product lines, and top gross margin products.
Help implement cost analysis system that can quickly provide profit margin by product by Compares quotes to actuals to provide variances from WO to Sales Order.
Analyze top 3 COGS accounts
Fix found system costing issues and variances as identified
Provide existing weekly and monthly dashboard and metrics


BETWEEN 6 to 12 MONTHS:


Analysis of all COGS and expenses
Complete analysis of profit margins for all products and new products introduced.
Analyze costings for Express division
Improve existing dashboard and metrics
Provide better analysis timely and identify cost reduction opportunities
Provide accurate profitability and variances by work orders and by item.
Clean up labor and materials variances on financial statement


AFTER 12 MONTHS:


Have a cost analysis system that will identify profitability for all new products and existing products that other can use.
Update a cost model that Qualitel can use to quote include labor and materials burden rate.
Qualitel has a system that can effectively review variances timely.
Set up automated reports and alerts with IT


BEHAVIORAL TRAITS & SKILLS:
 Someone committed to hard work in a TEAM environment—doing what it takes to get the job done in a timely way.
Someone who demonstrates a commitment to continuous learning in the way they perform their everyday work.
A person who naturally conveys and promotes a positive, “can-do”, forward looking attitude and approach.
Someone who demonstrates a high “EQ” (Emotional Intelligence) and evidences a preference for collaboration across departments and disciplines.


REASONING ABILITY: Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables.


PHYSICAL DEMANDS: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, and sit. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, and distance vision.


COMPENSATION: A competitive base salary, benefit package and profit sharing

positionName: Sr Financial Reporting Analyst - Treasury & Capital Management
description:
Sr Financial Reporting Analyst - Treasury & Capital Management
 - (057676)
At Bank of the West, our people are having a positive impact on the world. We’re investing where we feel we can make the most impact, like advancing diversity and women entrepreneurship programs, financing for more small businesses, and promoting programs for sustainable energy. From our locations across the U.S., Bank of the West is taking action to help protect the planet, improve people’s lives, and strengthen communities. We are part of BNP Paribas, a global leader supporting the UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). Yes, we’re a bank, but as the bank for a changing world, we are continually seeking to improve the ways we help our customers, while contributing to more sustainable and equitable growth.
Job Description Summary
Responsible for performing financial reporting and accounting for derivative activities related to the bank’s Capital Markets and Treasury Department, including the preparation of highly-complex shareholder reports, detailed analysis on models used to measure fair value and the review of financial information from our systems to ensure the accounting entries are appropriate. Responsible also for understanding and preparing related schedules to support the Bank's annual financial statements in compliance with legal and regulatory requirements, company policies and procedures, and GAAP.
Essential Job Functions
Develop and maintain robust documentation for all key accounting/reporting processes - automated and manual - associated with the systems used to record Capital Markets and Treasury activity
Compile data for and prepare periodic financial reports of a highly complex nature
Analyze data from various systems used to account for the bank’s derivative portfolio to ensure the valuation is appropriate
Manage day-to-day financial reporting responsibilities including reconciliations to the general ledger
Interacts with auditors and control governance teams to provide information and access to accounting records and financial reports
Financial reporting responsibilities including developing ways to improve reporting or monitoring templates focusing on efficiency and compliance with U.S. GAAP

Other Job Duties
Research technical accounting literature to analyze and critically assess reporting information with a focus on not only compliance, but improvement as well. Present recommendations to Management.
Participate in projects as required for new initiatives, process improvements or technology implementation and development.
Stays current on new and evolving accounting pronouncements, keeping management informed as to their relevance to the Bank.
Frequent interaction with Business Analysts and Technology Resources.
Ability to write clear business requirements.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Required Experience
Requires deep knowledge of Treasury and Capital Markets products including interest rate derivatives and hedging activities
Requires strong data analysis skills
Requires 7 years minimum prior accounting/reporting experience

Education
Bachelor's Degree Accounting or Finance

Equal Employment Opportunity Policy

Bank of the West is an Equal Opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers without regard to any status protected by applicable law. Bank of the West is also an Affirmative Action employer - Minority / Female / Disabled / Veteran.

Bank of the West will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance subject to the requirements of all state and federal laws and regulations.

Primary Location United States-California-San Ramon
Other Locations United States-Wisconsin, United States-Washington-Seattle, United States-Missouri, United States-Nevada, United States-Arizona-Tempe, United States-Texas-Dallas, United States-Georgia-Atlanta, United States-Nebraska-Omaha

positionName: Lead Specialist, DAS Analytics, Data Architecture, TMT
description:
The KPMG Advisory practice is currently our fastest growing practice. We are seeing tremendous client demand, and looking forward we don't anticipate that slowing down. In this ever-changing market environment, our professionals must be adaptable and thrive in a collaborative, team-driven culture. At KPMG, our people are our number one priority. With a wealth of learning and career development opportunities, a world-class training facility and leading market tools, we make sure our people continue to grow both professionally and personally. If you're looking for a firm with a strong team connection where you can be your whole self, have an impact, advance your skills, deepen your experiences, and have the flexibility and access to constantly find new areas of inspiration and expand your capabilities, then consider a career in Advisory.
KPMG is currently seeking a Lead Specialist in Deal Advisory and Strategy Analytics for our Deal Advisory practice.
Responsibilities:
Lead industry domain data modeling, data management and visualization
Collaborate with Deal Advisory industry leaders for their data needs and create data products to meet those needs
Define and create an industry common data model based on various (internal & external) data sources
Lead data engineers to create data pipelines to map client data attributes to industry common data model; lead data visualization engineers to create industry specific analytical insights
Qualifications:
Minimum eight years of recent experience in Database management, Data Analytics and Data warehousing, including cloud-native database and modern cloud-based data warehouse
Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university
In-depth knowledge of the Microsoft data and analytics platform (Azure Data Factory, Microsoft SQL Server, Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Managed Instance, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Databricks, etc.)
Strong functional specific industry and domain experience
Advanced knowledge of data architecture, standards and data governance in relational and nonrelational databases
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to document and communicate technical information to IT Leadership, the business, developers and support staff
Strong experience as primary technical leader on successful large application deployments with the ability to manage resources and multiple projects simultaneously
KPMG LLP (the U.S. member firm of KPMG International) offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package. KPMG is an affirmative action-equal opportunity employer. KPMG complies with all applicable federal, state and local laws regarding recruitment and hiring. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other category protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. Who We Are:
At Brooks, we believe a run can change a day, a life, the world. Everyone who works here is a key part of our obsession to make the best running gear on the planet. We want our business — which also happens to be our passion — to be a place where everyone feels welcome and comfortable being themselves. Our company culture defines us, bonds us together, and drives our success. We live this culture daily through our brand values: Runner First, Word is Bond, Champion Heart, There is no “I” in Run, and Keep Moving. This means we always solve for the runner, do what we say we will, give it our all, are generous with our humanity, and find a way to keep moving every day, because joy is kinetic.
Are you ready to help create something extraordinary?
Your Job:
As a Senior Functional Analyst (ERP), you are a “hands-on” ERP Subject Matter Expert, who will be an integral part of the global IT team responsible for supporting and administering Infor M3, the ERP system used by our sales, operations and customer service teams, as well as our retailers and consumers.

You will collaborate with business and technology teams across Brooks as cross functional business processes (for example, Procure-to-Pay or Order-to-Cash) interface with the ERP and other internal and external applications such as Planning systems, Warehouse Management System, Order Management System, Point of Sales systems, EDI and sales channels, such as B2B and B2C, Financial systems.

You will be responsible for designing, leading and maintaining the configuration of business processes in the ERP, that support flexible sourcing, order fulfillment and inventory management, enabling Brooks to efficiently source product and service it’s customer base.

You demonstrate an understanding of Master Data Management (“MDM”) & Data Governance and drive adoption of MDM best practices through design and execution.

You will ensure that change management approach is incorporated in all aspects of service delivery, ensuring that all impacts of the change are understood and incorporated in design decisions.

You will partner with a team of architects, developers and engineers, who are responsible for architecting and delivering enterprise-class, Infor standard integration architecture. You will provide functional input on business processes and follow application and industry best practices on projects.

You will champion QA best practices, when delivering solutions to our internal customers. You will mentor your teammates on inner workings of M3 processes.
Your Responsibilities:
Develop and maintain a thorough understanding of all business processes supported by the ERP application understanding both the day-to-day business operations and cadence.
Be aware of any gaps and assumptions and keep your own knowledge and documentation current.
Serve as a consultant for the business teams, leveraging your Infor M3 expertise and industry experience towards continued cross-functional process improvements, system enhancements and new applications to support business strategies and operational needs.
Provide subject matter expertise to project teams involved in the implementation and test plans associated with complex application upgrades and implementations.
Guide project teams on the impacts on other inter-related systems and process flows.
Perform functional and technical analysis of business requirements and contribute to solution architecture and design. Analyze data to support your understanding and design recommendations.
Translate high-level business and user-defined requirements into system functional requirements and functional design documents to support new or enhanced functionality, fully understanding and accounting for any impacts to the business processes introduced as a result of this change.
Create and maintain system and operational documentation, including configuration documentation, functional specifications, user training material, business process and procedure documentation, process flows, troubleshooting/support documentation, and test scenarios and scripts.
Manage system stability and scalability by using available tools to monitor system performance, space utilization, resource contention, etc. Research and recommend additional tools where needed.
Support an Enterprise Data Governance process by monitoring data guidelines and promoting data accuracy.
Follow ITIL best practices for change and incident management.
Perform root cause analysis on production application failures and drive necessary remediation of defects.
Manage relationships with vendors providing supporting services for assigned application systems to ensure performance and deliverables adhere to contract terms.
Mentor other functional analysts actively sharing knowledge to develop in-house expertise
Support other technologies as required.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering or relevant experience. Additional higher education and/or technical certifications a plus!
8 + years of experience implementing, administering, managing and/or supporting ERP application and evolving integrations to the ERP from other applications/partners, preferably Infor M3, in the consumer products goods industry.
Demonstrated ability to take initiative and a growth mindset to learn new technologies, business processes and their application to meet business needs.
Demonstrated functional knowledge of customer order allocation, fulfillment and management; and supply chain operations, planning, sourcing, logistics, finance related business processes within the ERP.
Experience with configuring and implementing new business processes and features within the ERP to support new use cases.
Experience with Infor M3 Grid – monitoring and application patching. Grid administration is highly desired.
Deep knowledge of M3 business engine database, proven ability to query databases such as DB2 and SQL server is a must.
Knowledge and experience with project management frameworks (agile – scrum/kanban, waterfall) and best practices.
Highly developed troubleshooting and problem solving skills; tenacity and hunger for finding the root cause of a problem and awareness to propose thoughtful, practical solutions.
Demostrated adeptness with keeping the documentation and knowledge base current.
Keen attention to detail and awareness of change management opportunities in planning, organizing and executing tasks, while still seeing the big picture and understanding how all the pieces fit together and affect one another.
Excellent interpersonal and collaboration skills that inspire and build trust for effective working relationships across the company, including mentoring other team members in a rapidly changing environment.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to tailor approach based on audience and message.
Dependable and reliable; available to provide after-hours support as needed.
Unwavering demonstration of Brooks’ corporate values: Runner First, Word is Bond, Champion Heart, There’s no “I” in RUN; Keep Moving.
Be an active participant in Brooks Runner Experience and Run Happy Journey!
At Brooks, we celebrate diversity & equity. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment, and encourage people of all backgrounds, perspectives, experiences, and skills to apply. Brooks is proud to be an equal employment opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, the presence of a sensory, physical or mental disability, medical condition, military status, marital status, pregnancy or child birth, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, political ideology, or any other non-merit based factors.

positionName: Sr. Financial Analyst - Inbound and Supply Chain
description:
Our Opportunity:

Chewy seeks a highly motivated, analytical, and enthusiastic Senior Financial Analyst – Inbound Transportation and Supply Chain Finance to join our rapidly growing Supply Chain and Transportation Finance Team, in our Bellevue, WA or Dania Beach, FL headquarters. Combining an understanding of finance, strong practical knowledge of financial statements and using data to make-and-drive decisions, this candidate will perform various financial planning and analysis processes to support key decisions, drive growth, and ensure financial objectives are achieved. This individual will partner with key decision makers across the organization to provide analytical and financial support.

What You'll Do:

Update and create financial metrics to be reviewed on a weekly and monthly basis.
Monitor Inbound transportation expense and inventory management for Supply Chain.
Partner with team members and cross-functional leaders in Transportation and Supply Chain and lead weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual financial review and forecasting processes to identify planning assumptions for key business drivers and track performance while explaining variances to plan and identifying risks and opportunities
Review month-end close processes (knowledge of GAAP), experience with journal entries and financial forecasting and budgeting processes
Recognize and propose analyses influencing business partners and finance leaders to drive positive changes in the business
Extract and analyze data from central databases using Hyperion, SQL, and Tableau
Effectively manage numerous projects at a given time in a fast paced environment
Challenge current processes to find efficiency improvements while maintaining data integrity
Aid in the reporting and financial performance management frameworks for the business and help define key metrics and performance indicators to evaluate overall business performance
Perform modeling and analytics required to synthesize large sets of data and produce concise outputs to convey recommendation and/or conclusions to leadership

What You'll Need:

BA/BS degree in Finance
Experience in financial analysis, key performance indicators, forecasting, budgeting, and variance analysis
3-5 years relevant finance experience with a basic understanding of GAAP and strong grasp of financial statements
Strong financial analysis and modeling skills, and experience in forecasting, budgeting, and variance analysis
Comfort in dealing with ambiguity
Advanced Excel (i.e. VLOOKUP/Index Match, SUMIFS, pivot tables, etc.) and PowerPoint/other Visual Presentation skills
Ability to think creatively, self-start, work independently, deal with ambiguity, and meet tight deadlines / prioritize changing workloads
Ability to take ownership of projects and drive them through to completion
Very strong written and oral communication skills
Results-oriented mentality, highly energetic, dynamic individual with hands-on mentality
Strong Communication skills – ability to distill and convey complex information messages clearly and succinctly

Bonus:

MBA, preferred
Previous financial analyst, supply chain or transportation finance experience
Experience with SQL, Tableau, Hyperion SmartView, Oracle ERP
Chewy is committed to equal opportunity. We value and embrace diversity and inclusion of all Team Members.


If you have a disability under the Americans with Disabilities Act or similar law, or you require a religious accommodation, and you wish to discuss potential accommodations related to applying for employment at Chewy, please contact HR at chewy dot com

positionName: Process Engineer II/III, Business Analysis Modeling
description:
Just is seeking a highly motivated process engineer in the Manufacturing Technical Operations group that desires a significant opportunity to improve worldwide access to biotherapeutics. The primary focus of this job is to develop and maintain modeling and simulation tools for clinical and commercial biologics manufacturing, data analysis and visualization, and conveyance of modeling insights through dashboards and presentations. The selected candidate will also be responsible for performing bioprocess modeling, revising computer programs, and generating technical reports or documentation. In addition, this team member will gain an understanding of new manufacturing technologies and equipment, including disposable-based systems and continuous processing technologies for a first-of-its-kind flexible and reconfigurable cGMP manufacturing facility. Position Requirements: •B.S. degree in chemical or biochemical engineering and MBA/Master’s degree in a business discipline with 0-2 years of experience and/or Ph.D. degree. Formal training in data analytics or related discipline (e.g., data science, statistics, etc.) is a plus •Knowledge of modeling and data analytics pipelines using specialized software programming tools (e.g., Python, MATLAB, C/C++) •Ability to communicate technical ideas to business units within the organization •Knowledge of bioprocess engineering, including basic unit operations models for bioreactor fermentation and recovery and purification of products •In-depth scientific knowledge of biopharmaceutical manufacturing, process cost and economic models, financial and investment valuation techniques •Knowledge of scientific visualization techniques, including abstraction of complex and multivariate data using Tableau, Python or R •Ability to organize, analyze/interpret, and effectively communicate individual results •Applies knowledge and expertise to solve complex technical problems; may apply novel approach that provides significant technology advancement •Can work independently and deliver results within specific timelines; contributes to multi-disciplinary teams at the functional level; mentors and provides technical advice to individuals within the team •Good interpersonal, team, and collaborative skills are a must •Excellent oral and written communication skills Additional Preferred Qualifications: •Knowledge of algorithm and software development for plant simulation (e.g., dynamic modeling, plant scheduling and debottlenecking) •Working knowledge of database querying and programming (e.g., SQL, Access) •Working knowledge of manufacturing process equipment and automation systems •Scientific journal publication writing experience is desirable

Our Cloud First group of more than 70,000 cloud professionals delivers a full stack of integrated cloud capabilities across data, edge, integrated infrastructure and applications, deep ecosystem skills, culture of change along with a deep industry expertise to shape, move, build and operate our clients’ businesses in the cloud. positionName: Sr. Global Partner Business Solutions Leader, Data & Analytics
description:
·

10+ years of sales or business development experience in the software and/or Data Analytics technology industry
Experience in managing partner business teams, growing a partner business and creating partner GTM solutions
Expert in Data & Analytics and its partner landscape
Experience working with Fortune 100 & 500 companies
Experience driving emerging/disruptive technologies like open source software, virtualization, and Software as a Service delivery models
Business owner/ entrepreneur mind set

Global Partner Business Solutions Lead, Data & Analytics

Would you like to be part of a team that is redefining the IT industry? Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for a Global Partner Business Solutions Leader to build, own, and manage the strategic plan and competency program for our partners focused on the Data & Analytics Global Partner Portfolio. Global Segment Business owners at AWS are responsible for the overall partner strategy for each global business segment, which includes aligning go to market plans with our top consulting and technology partners, along with supporting programs that are focused on driving demand in the segment.

As a Solutions Lead on the Partner Strategic Initiatives team, you will have the opportunity to dramatically accelerate adoption of AWS by owning the partner strategy and execution of our Data & Analytics global partner business segment. This role has a global responsibility and will work closely with AWS product teams, partner development managers, solution architects, professional services, our partners,sales teams, and end customers. AWS customers are developing some of the most exciting and innovative new businesses on the planet; and the AWS Partner Network (APN) is helping to exponentially accelerate innovation on the AWS Cloud.

This role will possess a deep background in Data & Analytics along with business development, strategic alliances, and entrepreneurial skills. You should have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about new business models, solution selling, partner engagement, and technical challenges to help build and convey compelling value propositions for AWS customers with our partners. You should also have a proven track record of influencing innovation through a partner ecosystem with prior solutions and program successes.

Roles & Responsibilities:

Be the subject-matter expert (SME) for the Data & Analytics partner solutions segment including a knowledge of the top partners that make up the ecosystem
Own the strategic plan for each D & A market segment, which includes aligning with partner development managers, who manage our top AWS technology and consulting partners
Focus on Data & Analytics solutions and Go to Market motions with and for our AWS partners.
Collaborate and influence partner development manager (PDM) teams, build C-level relationships with our top partners and generate interest in new AWS programs focused on Data & Analytic solutions
Represent the AWS partner strategy for Data & Analytics to our internal and external stakeholders including the AWS sales teams as well as media coverage and industry events focused on the segment
Help prioritize AWS investment in partners who focus on the Data & Analytics market segment to drive incremental results for both AWS and select partners
Execute go-to-market and routes-to-market plans that have clear and measurable ROI
Define and own the requirements and benefits of the AWS Partner Network (APN) Data & Analytics Competency Programs
Work with cross-functional groups including training and solutions architecture to build enablement & acceleration programs that allow strategic partners to develop capabilities, achieve proficiency and exponentially grow with AWS
Work collaboratively inside of AWS to drive new solutions to market with our product management, solution architect, and professional service teams
Collaborate with AWS consulting partners to create solutions that combine our top technology partners with packaged implementation services
Prepare and give business reviews to AWS senior leaders
Effectively team with PR, marketing, legal, and support teams
Identify strategic partners that AWS may want to recruit into the Data & Analytics business segment which should include leading startups,market makers, consulting companies, and established technology vendors

Work/Life Balance
Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Inclusive and Diverse Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust


Prior knowledge of AWS and infrastructure technologies, services, and standards

·

Computer Science background or equivalent
Experience working for either a startup or a larger corporation on Data & Analytics projects or services
Experience creating and executing joint solution and GTM strategies to grow a business
Experience engaging and influencing C-level executive

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Kwx is an integrated home experience company that seamlessly unites the KW ecosystem to keep the agent at the center of the homeownership journey.
Austin, Texas-based kwx is the holding company of Keller Williams Realty, the world’s largest real estate technology franchise by agent count. With more than 1,070 offices and 190,000 associates worldwide, Keller Williams is also No. 1 in units and sales volume in the United States.
In 2020, Keller Williams initially began the formation of kwx, composed of Keller Williams, Keller Williams Worldwide, Keller Offers and Keller Home Financial Services, consisting of Keller Mortgage and Keller Covered.
Since 1983, the company has cultivated an agent-centric, technology-driven and education-based culture that rewards agents as stakeholders. For more information, visit kwx.kw.com.
We consider the health and safety of our team members to be of paramount importance. Therefore, the Company’s COVID-19 Vaccination Policy applies to all team members who physically work in the Austin, TX or Dublin, OH offices. It does not apply to team members who are working remotely (unless they come into the Company’s offices, in which case, this policy applies).
Essential Job Functions and Basic Duties
Create & implement performance analytic reporting & analysis for supported business units
In conjunction with the business leaders develop a forecasting model & process that can be used for both short term/long term projections
Work with sales & operations teams to develop capacity planning models
Perform market research/business intelligence to ensure forecasts are accurate as well as identifying industry benchmarks
Identify and create process improvements for reporting and dashboards
Partner with internal business leaders to uncover opportunities and provide insights based on financial results vs targets
Present forecasts, variance analysis and commentary to key stakeholders
Assist in the development of a framework to analyze data that will result in automated reporting
Minimum Qualifications
Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills are required
Five or more years of experience as a Business Analyst or Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst (FP&A Analyst) within a financial services environment; preferred candidates will have mortgage experience
Experience in building complex financial models, capacity planning and forecasting tools
Demonstrated experience optimizing tools and processes to increase accuracy of models and analysis
Proven proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite
Proven proficiency with data query/data management tools (SQL, Tableau et al)
Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, or a related field
MBA or CFA preferred

positionName: Human Resource HRIS Analyst (Remote Long Term Contract)
description:
Open up to the Possibilities!
Working at Purolator International, Inc. is more than a job. It's an opportunity to be part of a winning team and to contribute to the success of our growing company. Purolator International is a subsidiary of Purolator Inc., Canada's largest integrated freight and parcel solutions company with over 50 years of delivering reliable, efficient and cost-effective shipping to, from and within Canada for more than 210 countries and territories worldwide. We are the leading provider of cross-border logistics between the United States and Canada. This is an exciting and evolving industry and we’re leading the change as we strive to deliver the future. Purolator International is rapidly expanding throughout the United States and seeking talented individuals to join our team. Are you open to the possibilities?
Successful applicants for this position must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment, subject to reasonable accommodation, including state/province and federal law. If you have questions, please feel free to ask during your interview.
SHIFT: Full Time, Monday - Friday, 8:30 am - 5:00 pm (some overtime may be necessary as needed)
ASSIGNMENT: This is a long term contract role, expected to last through March 2023. Come March 2023, we will re-evaluate the needs of the assignment and will evaluate any possibility for a permanent placement within the organization under the Human Resource division. For the duration of the contract assignment, we will be offering healthcare benefits, 401k eligibility and paid time off.
LOCATION: Remote
Job Summary:
The HRIS Analyst (Long Term Contract) is a Human Resource position reporting into the Corporate HR Manager. This position is responsible for the effective maintenance and ongoing management of the HRIS/Payroll System, UKG (formerly UltiPro).
This position is also responsible for reporting, analytics and day to day system troubleshooting and compliance. The HRIS Specialist is responsible for serving as the functional expert for the organization's HRIS/Payroll system and provide outstanding support to ensure data integrity and accuracy for all HRIS/Payroll transactions, procedures, report writing, and processes. The HRIS Specialist will partner with HR Reps and Payroll to collaborate on projects and daily priorities including but not limited to organization/position management , employee onboarding, payroll, benefits administration and dash boarding/analytics.
Experience Required In Order To Be Considered:
5-7 years related professional experience in a similar role
Understanding and/or experience in multiple disciplines of Human Resources and Benefits required
Experience with UKG report building and presenting metrics to management required
Advanced Microsoft Excel User
Must thrive in a fast-paced environment with competing priorities and provide the necessary attention to the details required in HRIS and Payroll administration
Understanding of HR functions outside of the Analyst role (i.e. Benefits, Policy, Staffing, etc).
Daily Functions:
System Administrator for the ongoing configuration, integrations, and management of HRIS/Payroll System, UKG
Actively seek out knowledge on system modules and functionality
Act as Security Administrator responsible for all phases of system security including user/role updates, password resets and role review audits
Create and maintains monthly metrics for HR dashboard
Seek continuous improvement to consistently research new metrics and analytics
Evaluate, test, and implement HRIS/Payroll system enhancements, upgrades and troubleshooting
Analyze data and provide analytical reports to internal customers on a weekly, monthly and quarterly basis
Leads the day-to-day functional workflow including providing the HR/Payroll department team members with leadership, direction, and training, as well as leading continuous process improvement initiatives
Understands system requirements and ensures administration of data alignment with HRIS, Payroll and legal requirements
Assure company compliance with ACA reporting, EEO, payroll/tax updates, company audits and other laws and mandates that arise
Responsible for open enrollment participation, online session development, plan structure updates, feed file management, plan and rate updates and daily benefits reporting and auditing
Serves as company liaison and system administrator to UKG
Identify, understand, and communicate all UKG updates, events, problems and solutions to HR/Payroll Dept.
Dvelope UKG tutorials and trair users upon request
Set up demos and recommend adoption of future UKG enhancements
Responsible for transmission of biweekly 401k contribution and participant files
Works with users to support functionality and troubleshoot system-related problems Carry out other duties as appropriate and as assigned by his/her Manager

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Requirements:
Must be able to independently prioritize assignments based on urgency and communicate timelines effectively, Strong follow up skills
Must be able to handle highly sensitive data with confidentiality
Must be able to identify areas of improvement and develop creative solutions
Must be able to identify system glitches, inaccurate set ups and troubleshoot effectively
Superior organization skills, quality and accuracy on all functions
Ability to analyze and interpret complex documents
Strong time and project management skills
Strong customer service mindset
Strong computer skills, including Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Outlook
Education and/ or Work Experience Requirements
Preferred BA/BS degree in Human Resources or related degree, or equivalent in experience

Posting Number: 51232

Job Code: 960

positionName: Application Modernization & Innovation Business Analyst or Business Process - Senior Consultant
description:
Application Modernization & Innovation Business Process - Senior Consultant


Are you a talented professional that focuses on the planning, execution, and monitoring of project initiatives? Are you a resourceful problem solver that thrives in the identification and definition of creative, effective technology solutions? As a Business Analyst or Business Process Senior Consultant, you help clients set-up, manage, and operate their most complex projects, define functional requirements for technology solutions, and design and derive transformative approaches for technology systems.

Deloitte's Application Modernization & Innovation Practice comprises passionate, like-minded technology enthusiasts who strive to fundamentally transform how our clients deliver value.

We focus on key client issues that impacts the core business by driving down the cost of quality and enhancing technology innovation. Each member of our professional team is a strategic thinker, with a passion for helping organizations innovate the way they work.

Success is defined in our ability to ask our clients the tough questions, challenge them towards making real, sustainable change and helping them achieve the change, by working with them, side by side. If this sounds like you, keep reading!

We are looking for frontrunners with experience in Business Analyst or Business Process roles.

Work you'll do

As a Senior Consultant you will lead work threads within an engagement team to create software solutions that help our clients solve problems, expand market share, improve operations, and grow their business. You engage in:

Project and Program Management
Requirements Elicitation and Management
Joint Application Design Sessions
Creating Robust, Effective, Scalable Solutions
Being the lead person to interface between the clients and our Deloitte teams
Serve as an integrator between business needs and technology solutions, helping to create technology solutions to meet clients' business needs.
Developing & reviewing system requirements, designing the solution, redefining the business, presenting the prototype, and leading the testing of our custom technology solutions

The team

Application Modernization & Innovation

At Deloitte Consulting LLP, Deloitte Application Modernization & Innovation consultants leverage the best of innovative technology, people, and delivery approaches to help our clients dream, explore, build, and optimize their future. The AMI practice delivers end-to-end technology solutions to enable and improve our clients' core business operations. AM&I is composed of three different areas- Service Delivery & Business Design, Application Modernization & Migration and Quality Engineering.

Business Analyst and Business Process Senior Consultants are required to have:

Strong knowledge of the SDLC
Strong knowledge of Agile methodologies with experience working in an Agile environment
Experience in requirements planning, functional design, business process modeling and enterprise business analysis and leading these IT streams with clients
7+ years of relevant consulting or industry experience, with 2+ years leading small-to-mid sized teams
4+ years supporting the planning and management of project initiatives in a Project Management Office or similar team environment
4+ years of experience with Project Management Tools such as Microsoft Project and Microsoft SharePoint
4+ years of experience with Requirements Management and Traceability tools such as the IBM Rational suite and HP Quality Center
3+ years of experience translating requirements into optimized designs and identifying alternatives
Travel up to 50% (While 50% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice.)
Limited Immigration Sponsorship maybe available

In addition, successful Senior Consultants will have the following preferred background:

Experience or testing cloud solutions on Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, and/or Google Cloud Platform
Knowledge of DevOps, CI methodologies
Industry certifications such as CCBA, CBAP in the business analysis are a plus
Experience using tools such as ARIS, IBM Requisite Pro or other similar BPM tools
Experience working in a collaborative environment
Experience leading work planning, monitoring, and reporting
Experience conducting interviews and documenting requirements
Experience leading design sessions and defining future state processes
Ability to work independently and manage multiple assignments
Strong oral and written communication skills
A Bachelor's Degree in a relevant field with preference in technology or engineering.
CBOSESDOLP2021

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.
Equal Opportunity Employer

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

About The Chartis Group
The Chartis Group (Chartis) is a comprehensive advisory and analytics services firm dedicated to the healthcare industry. With an unparalleled depth of expertise in strategic planning, performance excellence, informatics and technology, and health analytics, we help leading academic medical centers, integrated delivery networks, children's hospitals and healthcare service organizations achieve transformative results.
We are comprised of uniquely experienced senior healthcare professionals and consultants who apply a distinctive knowledge of healthcare economics, markets, clinical models and technology to help each client address their most pressing issues. We question everything and apply thoughtful and rigorous analysis to each challenge, issue and opportunity.
We are lucky to have extraordinarily talented people working in our firm – all brought together around our unifying mission, a shared dedication to our core values, and the emphasis we place on creating an environment that enriches the experiences of our clients, our colleagues and our communities. In this way, we find that we are remarkably aligned with our clients. And that has made for achieving some truly great things.
The Chartis Group has offices in Atlanta, Boston, Chicago, New York, Minneapolis, and Nashville.
Role Overview
The Chartis Group’s Advanced Analytics Team is responsible for providing high quality data and analytic support to client engagements, internal research, and development initiatives within the firm. They apply advanced database management and sophisticated analytical tools and skills to derive compelling quantitative findings from large client, industry, and proprietary datasets.
The Data Associate will work directly with our consultants and clients to provide analytic support on a range of healthcare projects. This is an exciting opportunity for an innovative and quantitative thinker who is passionate about healthcare to help develop the analytical capabilities of our rapidly growing firm.
Responsibilities
Participate in the entire project lifecycle – from requirements definition and scoping, through execution. During this time, you will work with both project teams and clients to define and fulfill data and analytic requests.
Perform complex analysis (e.g., merging multiple datasets for new insights into relationships between variables) and provide data and analytic support to Chartis consulting engagement teams
Thoroughly QA and cleanse raw datasets, ensuring accuracy of your deliverables
Build new datasets to maximize utility using advanced data management and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Excel, Alteryx, R, SQL, Python, Snowflake, etc.)
Execute core analytics for a range of client engagements (e.g., strategy, performance improvement, digital health)
Develop impactful data analytics and visualizations including mapping using business intelligence software (e.g. Tableau)
Document analytic methodologies and approaches
Codify datasets and outputs into client-ready deliverables and transfer to project teams/clients
Support the analytic and research needs of Chartis’ internal firm teams and practice areas, including contributing to practice development initiatives, whitepaper development, training, and knowledge management initiatives
Qualifications & Desired Skills
Bachelor’s degree in a related field such as mathematics, statistics, computer science, or engineering
At least 2-3 years data analytics experience, ideally in a professional services firm or healthcare provider setting
Strong Tableau skills (Desktop/Creator) required. Experience with Tableau Server and Tableau Prep is greatly preferred.
Experience with data visualization, mapping and data cleansing
Ability to create dashboards from a variety of data sources
Familiarity with SQL and managing large data sets (>1M rows) required; additional experience with Snowflake, SAS, Alteryx and/or similar programs preferred.
Familiarity with healthcare data (e.g., claims data, hospital reporting data, or clinical decision support data) and analytics preferred
Proficiency with MS Office applications
Strong work and time management skills; able to work effectively under tight timelines and adapt to shifting priorities, in both individual and team settings
Open to learning new software programs as needed for new types of projects or client engagements
Comfortable working with consulting colleagues, including clearly communicating analytic findings in the context of client engagements

positionName: Sr. Finance Manager- Data Analytics Team
description:
Empower every person and organization on the planet to achieve more. That’s what inspires us, drives our work and pushes us to challenge the status quo every day. Through our Cloud-first strategy, we strive to deliver solutions that are optimized for the world and enable customers to drive their business more successfully. Microsoft’s Margin Strategy and Investment Optimization (MSIO) team is an exciting and fast-evolving finance team at the forefront of Microsoft’s Cloud-first strategy. We are looking for a talented and motivated individual to help shape the future of our cloud products.
The team’s charter is to optimize our investments in Microsoft Azure Intelligence portfolio for Data Transformation Platform (DTP). Intelligence Platform team has 5 major product areas Data Integration (Azure Data Factory / Power Query), Analytics (Azure Synapse), Search (Azure Cognitive Search), Business Intelligence (Power BI) and Messaging. As a crucial member of the team, you’ll also support long term bets and drive competitive intelligence to keep Microsoft Cloud ahead of the competition. All while enhancing transparency into Cloud Infrastructure investments, safeguarding shareholder interest.
Responsibilities
We are looking for a Sr Finance Manager to drive decision support and insights for the Azure Intelligence platform business:
Lead day-to-day partnership with C+E engineering CVP and his LT to drive best-in-class profitability by understanding the margin implications for new services along with driving low unit cost down for the portfolio.
Lead the efficiency forum (Margin Accountability Plan) in partnership with Azure Intelligence Platform in engineering LT
Partner with 1P finance teams to land Internal pricing for 1P workloads at cost
Partner with revenue business health / planning teams and EG partners to drive towards North star margin for this portfolio
Partner with the engineering and product marketing teams to support new Analytics product launches
Manage the financial health through defined OKRs and P&L from our internal tools (Gross Margin Health). Flag risks and opportunities thereof.
Partner across finance orgs, including revenue planning, infrastructure, R&D, and FP&A to drive results.
Articulate findings into high quality communications and facilitate executive decision making across C+E business and finance executive leaders.
Qualifications
Minimum Required Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Accounting, Finance, Economics, Data Science, or related field AND 2+ years of post-graduate financial analysis, accounting, controllership, or finance work experience OR Master's Degree in Business Administration, Accounting, Finance, Economics, Data Science, or related field OR equivalent experience.
Preferred Qualifications
Strong partnering capabilities, with the ability to influence business partners without direct authority and to appropriately push back when required.
Self-starter who thrives in ambiguous, fast moving environments with evolving technology and business model trends.
Strongly prefer deep understanding of the technology industry, particularly commercial public and private cloud services, business models and economics.
Ability to communicate complex analysis in a simple way. Executive level oral and written communication skills.
Proven leadership skills, with demonstrated results in proactively driving and delivering high value/high-impact project results through both individual and virtual-team efforts.
Strong analytical skills, financial modeling capabilities, and ability to think strategically.
Comfort working at multiple altitudes, from strategic/high-level projects to detailed COGS analysis.
Ability to handle multiple tasks under tight deadlines, quickly prioritize for impact and the resourcefulness to deliver.
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. A remarkable team of nearly 30,000 caring professionals comes together each day at UW Medicine to improve the health of the public. For us, working here is not just a job—it’s a calling. As providers, faculty, scientists, staff and administrators from diverse backgrounds, we are united by our dedication to excellence in providing patient-centered care, conducting innovative research and teaching the next generation of healthcare professionals.


UW Medicine Faculty Practice Plan Services (FPPS) supports UW Physicians (UWP), a practice group for more than 1,800 physicians and other healthcare professionals associated with UW Medicine. UW Medicine includes Harborview Medical Center, UW Medical Center - Montlake, UW Neighborhood Clinics, UW Medical Center - Northwest, the UW School of Medicine, Valley Medical Center, and Airlift Northwest. UWP members also practice at the Seattle Cancer Care Alliance, a partnership of UW Medicine, Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research Center, and Seattle Children’s Hospital.


UW Medicine Faculty Practice Plan Services - Technology Integration & Operations Support (TIOS) has an outstanding opportunity for a Manager, Clinical Integration and Business Analysis. This individual is a senior leader in the TIOS department that provides professional and technology services to the University of Washington Physicians (the University of Washington School of Medicine's clinical faculty practice organization), its administrative staff, School of Medicine Clinical Departments, Children's University Medical Group, and other UW Medicine departments.


TIOS is a multiple discipline department that provides technology integration, business analysis, project management, education/QA, operational excellence/Lean Six Sigma program services and data analytics services. The department is responsible for ongoing support and maintenance of the FPPS cloud based administrative and office productivity applications and serves as a liaison between IT and Operations. The TIOS department also provides oversight and strategic direction of enterprise professional billing applications along with the implementation of new services and applications that are used to support and further the UWP/UW Medicine mission.


The Clinical Integration & Business Analysis (CIBA) Manager is a an operationally focused IT professional responsible for providing leadership and both technical and business analysis oversight of UW Physicians core business systems, UW Medicine enterprise systems, and business analysts. In support of UW Medicine’s mission, the Clinical Integration & Business Analysis Manager provides leadership for the planning, and maintenance of a robust environment of UWP core business and shared systems that support patient care, financial, and business processes across the UW Medicine enterprise. Serve as liaison between Clinical Applications, Business Applications, and FPPS Operations.


RESPONSIBILITIES:

Strategy/Leadership

Business Analysis

Issue Resolution

Application Management

Operations Support - Coding and Revenue Cycle

Personnel Management

Communication and Customer Service

Project Management

Operational Excellence/Process Improvement

REQUIREMENTS:

Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, or related field.

Epic Resolute PB Administrator Certification, Coding Certification (CPC, CCS-P).

Six (6) years experience working with professional billing systems including experience with successful major system implementation, project management, and quality improvement processes.

Three (3) years with physician coding in a complex multi- specialty environment.

Two (2) years progressively responsible IT/Professional Billing systems leadership/management experience including experience with managing system vendor relationships.

At least five (5+) years of experience should include the following:

Recent experience supervising teams of information systems professionals, including implementation
Two to three (2-3) years of experience analytical, auditing or training experience in a Health Care environment.
Familiarity with reimbursement and billing regulations such as the WAC, CMS, DSHS and L & I.
Three to five (3-5) years of experience in business analysis and requirements definition with a thorough understanding of data analysis and requirements documentation techniques.
In-depth knowledge of testing methodologies, QA practices, strong diagnostic and problem-solving skills.
Demonstrated ability to effectively lead and influence with delegated authority.
Experience acquiring and implementing package software solutions in a hospital environment.
Demonstrated ability to plan, organize, coordinate, direct and control all aspects of projects and area of responsibility described in the job description
Proven ability to make administrative/procedural decisions and provide guidance and leadership to professional personnel in areas of expertise
A strong customer service orientation is essential, as is the ability to work positively with diverse users from director to clerical level.
Critical thinking skills, initiative, follow-up and the ability to prioritize effectively.
Strong written and verbal communication skills

An equivalent combination of education and experience may substitute for stated requirements.

DESIRED:

Previous experience in and knowledge of the academic healthcare environment

Certification or in 1 or more Epic Ambulatory or IP Clinical Modules or experience

Development of Epic application governance of shared master files

Certification or experience with Lean or Lean Six Sigma Methodologies

Overview:

Data Analyst III - REMOTE
Company Overview:
CoventBridge Group is the leading worldwide full-service investigation solutions company providing: Surveillance, SIU and Compliance, Claims Investigation, Counter-Fraud Programs, Desktop Investigations, Social Media, Record Retrieval, Canvasses and Vendor Management programs. With offices in the UK and U.S. the company provides top tier data privacy and security practices, deploys robust case management technology customized to clients’ needs and delivers worldwide coverage via its 1000 employees and affiliates worldwide.
About the Opportunity:
The Data Analyst III Performs high-level complex evaluation and analysis of data to support potential fraud cases and requests for information using claims data across multiple Medicare/Medicaid benefit types. The potential fraud cases involve high dollar amounts, sensitive issues, or otherwise meet criteria for referral to law enforcement, recoupment of overpayment, and/or administrative action based on reactive and proactive data analysis. Serves as a mentor to less experienced data analyst associates and assists management with special projects.
In assuming this position, you will be a critical contributor to meeting CoventBridge Group's objective: To provide services to our clients that exceed their expectations and contribute to improved healthcare delivery by identifying and eliminating fraud, waste and abuse.

The Data Analyst III position will report to the Data Supervisor and will work in our Grove City, OH office or if not local, remotely from a home office.
Responsibilities/ Requirements:
Responsibilities:
Work with local management, investigators, and analysts to provide reactive and proactive case development support and to fulfill law enforcement data requests.
Communicate effectively with internal and external customers, including federal law enforcement officers.
Performs quality assurance and validates data analysis results and analytically identifies potential fraud, waste and/or abuse situations in violation of Medicare or Medicaid laws, guidelines, policies, and regulations.
Serves as a mentor to less experienced data analysts.
Develops and documents new processes and procedures to improve staff efficiency and better meet department and contract goals.
Works with Statisticians and Data Analysts to ensure quality data analysis results with statistically high probabilities of producing case referrals to law enforcement, overpayments, and/or administrative actions.
Prepares, develops, and participates in staff training as related to Medicare/Medicaid fraud, waste and/or abuse data analysis.
Proactively monitors data sources (claims data, internet, etc.) to identify new and emerging Medicare/Medicaid fraud, waste, and abuse trends.
Comply with and maintains various documentation and other reporting requirements as needed.
Assists with special projects that require complex analysis of data.
Requirements:
A minimum of three (3) years of previous experience in healthcare data analytics, with preference given to candidates with Medicare/Medicaid program integrity experience
Demonstrated experience and knowledge of health care information (health claims data; specifically, Medicare and Medicaid, ICD-9-CM and ICD-10-CM codes, physician specialty codes) is required.
Have high proficiency level with MS Office Products.
Requires a working knowledge of SAS and/or other software applications necessary to perform healthcare claims data analytics.
Full COVID-19 vaccination and documentation are required as this position directly or indirectly supports a Federal Government Contract. [2 doses of Moderna or Pfizer; 1 dose of Johnson & Johnson]. Medical and religious accommodations are considered for exemption.
Benefits:

Benefits:
Medical, Dental, Vision plans
Life, LTD and STD paid by the employer
401(k) with company match up to 4%
Paid Time Off and company paid holidays
Tuition assistance after 1 year of service
*CoventBridge is proud to be an EEO-AA employer M/F/D/V.*

Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.

Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).

positionName: Senior Data Analyst Talent Acquisition (TA) PSJH
description:
Providence is calling a Senior Data Analyst Talent Acquisition (TA). This position is virtual and open to Candidates residing in Alaska, Washington, Montana, Oregon, California or Texas.
Applicants that meet qualifications will receive a text with a additional questions from our Modern Hire system.
We are seeking a Senior Data Analyst Talent Acquisition (TA) PSJH who will provide strategic consultation, insights, analysis and reports by leveraging solutions and systems data, market and competitive intelligence and benchmarking research to support Talent Acquisition with strategic planning and decisions, TA success measurements/metrics/results/ROI and business outcomes. Regularly identifies, designs and conducts quantitative and qualitative analysis of talent acquisition data to reveal critical insights, enable actionable decisions, develop strategies, adjust tactics and tell the story of the value of the TA function. The TA Senior Data Analyst focuses on enterprise efforts and maintains "expert" status in recruitment and marketing data and reporting capabilities of the systems, solutions and vendors. This role also creates and applies technical expertise in building reporting infrastructure and advancing capabilities and maturity of the insights and intelligence function.
This position identifies, designs and conducts quantitative and qualitative analysis of enterprise wide talent acquisition strategies and partners with HRIS to make connections to the people strategy. Performs all duties in a manner that promotes a team concept and reflects the PSJH mission and core values.
In this position you will have the following responsibilities:
Provide analysis and reporting for of Talent Acquisition data for the purpose of strategic planning and decision-making by TA, HR PSJH leaders and executives. Enables TA and HR leaders to tell the story of the value of TA and the hiring of talent through data and competitive intelligence.
Work with HR staff and other customers to analyze and satisfy data requests through production of established intelligence or utilization of various tools and applications to develop new intelligence. Works with HR, Finance, Marketing, and TA vendors to analyze data using various systems, data sources and benchmarking research to develop new intelligence and insights to support TA.
Ensure validity of data including identifying and reconciling discrepancies in intelligence from multiple reporting sources and/or systems and/or conducting period audits to improve data quality.
Identify, design, and document process workflows, data models, system decisions, designs and procedures related to TA information systems and related functions.
Create new value and maintains credibility and strong relationships with TA stakeholders, including hiring managers, recruiting teams, and HR leaders.
Proactively seek out benchmarking and best practice sharing opportunities and implements industry best practices for accessing, analyzing and disseminating data.
Lead critical initiatives and projects to improve data and insights and serves as project lead or work stream lead on major informational projects that involve TA data.
Educate users of TA intelligence on how to access, utilize and discuss TA information, including group and one-on-one training.
Provide reviews, assessments and recommendations for tools and technologies used to generate reports or streamline processes.
Investigate, resolve and perform follow-up tasks on complex system and data related problems as needed.
Qualifications:
Required qualifications for this position include:
Bachelor's Degree in any related field or equivalent education/experience.
5 years related experience.
Experience in an HR, TA, Finance, Sales, Retail, Supply Chain, Technology or Marketing or other business environment working with data reporting, analytics and insights consultation.
Experience in an HR TA, marketing or healthcare environment and data.
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques.
Experience extracting and analyzing data using a variety of enterprise reporting tools and data sources (Examples SQL, Tableau, Oracle Business Intelligence (OBIEE), Crystal Reports, ATS, CRMS and Microsoft BI).
Experience presenting and communicating outcome-based analyses to senior leaders for strategic planning and decision making.
Demonstrated proficiency in influencing and negotiating.
Experience educating others on basic data analytical techniques and concepts.
Experience leading complex projects through an established project management methodology
About the department you will serve.
Providence Shared Services provides a variety of functional and system support services for our Providence family of organizations across Alaska, California, Montana, New Mexico, Oregon, Texas and Washington. We are focused on supporting our Mission by delivering a robust foundation of services and sharing of specialized expertise.

https://www.providenceiscalling.jobs/rewards-benefits/

Providence does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, disability, veteran, military status, religion, age, creed, national origin, sexual identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, genetic information, or any other basis prohibited by local, state, or federal law.
