The opportunity:

Fast, accurate insights are integral in allowing us to fulfill our mission of fixing the user experience in global trade. At Flexport you'll lead a cross-functional "squad" of data analysts to transform data into action via quantitative strategy, statistical analysis, data visualization, and data modeling initiatives.

You'll work alongside self-starters interested in solving real-world problems and streamlining the inefficiencies in the complex global trade industry. You'll have the opportunity to improve an industry by analyzing the new operating system for global trade.

You will:
You will lead your data cross-functional domain of data analysts in building self-service tooling (e.g. dashboards, SQL code repositories, data dictionaries, and data catalogs) and advanced analytics to power data use cases throughout the enterprise
Develop your analysts along their career paths and skill generation, as their primary coach and support system, connecting them to the rest of development opportunities at Flexport. Successfully setting up our team members for their next role, whatever that may be, is a critical responsibility we take seriously.
Be the primary, strategic partner for the senior VP stakeholders supported by your squad: understanding their requirements, interpreting needs into bi-weekly sprint plans, and using your analytical mindset to direct the implementation of solutions ranging from process improvements to statistical models to actionable dashboards.
Own the development and execution of your domain's data roadmap, including product vision, end-to-end project management, and outcome responsibility.
Collaborate with your peer analytics managers and data leadership to ideate and implement organizational improvements for Data during Flexport's high-growth, rapid evolution.
Contribute and grow the culture of data excellence on our team by bringing mature empathy, best practices, and processes to our organization.

Proven experience being a Player-Coach, managing cross-functional teams and projects with multiple contributors.
7+ years of experience in related analytical, business systems and data engineering fields; including 2+ years of experience as a People Manager leading high performance analytical teams, including hiring, coaching, and promoting individual contributors.

Experience at a fast-growing company that lives and breathes data.
The opportunity to take a prominent role defining the culture of our rapidly growing Data org, further maturing an organization that in 3 years has grown 8x and become international across 8 offices
The exciting growth challenge to learn to build a self-sustaining, high-impact, fast-moving analytics team

About Flexport:
We believe global trade can move the human race forward. That's why it's our mission to make global trade easier for everyone. We aim to do this by building the Operating System for Global trade - a strategic model combining advanced technology and data analytics, logistics infrastructure, and supply chain expertise. Flexport today connects almost 10,000 clients and suppliers across 109 countries, including established global brands like Georgia-Pacific as well as emerging innovators like Sonos. Started in 2013, we've raised over $1.3B in funding from SoftBank Vision Fund, Founders Fund, GV, First Round Capital and Y Combinator. We're excited about the three big ways we're moving forward after our recent $1B investment from SoftBank Vision Fund in February 2019.
Worried about not having any freight forwarding experience?
Don't be! We're building the first Operating System for Global Trade. That's why it's incredibly important for us to bring people from diverse backgrounds and experiences together with our industry veterans to help move the freight forwarding industry forward.
What's freight forwarding and why does it matter? Freight forwarding is the coordination and shipment of goods from one place to another and it's what makes global trade possible. Flexport is on a mission to make global trade easier for everyone because we believe it can help connect the world and break down economic barriers.
We know this industry is complex. That's why we invest in education starting day one with Flexport Academy, a one week intensive onboarding program designed specifically to set every new Flexport employee up for success.


At Flexport, our ability to fulfill our mission of making global trade easy for everyone relies on having a diverse, dedicated and engaged workforce. That is why Flexport is committed to creating and nurturing an environment where anyone can be their authentic self. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical and mental disability, health status, marital and family status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

positionName: AWS Analyst Relations Manager, Data Integration
description:
Bachelor’s Degree or relevant experience
5+ years of analyst relations, communications, or product marketing experience in the tech industry
5+ years experience directly interacting with Gartner, Forrester and other major IT industry analyst firms
Experience in supporting Public Relations, Sales, Product, and/or Marketing teams

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is seeking an experienced, self-motivated, personable, and detail-oriented Analyst Relations (AR) Manager to work on the Data Integration AR program. The AR Manager will manage and execute the company's AR strategy and tactics to effectively communicate key differentiators for AWS Data Integration services.

The AWS cloud computing platform is used today by millions of businesses and developers around the world, ranging from start-ups to Fortune 50 enterprises. Cloud computing is arguably one of the most impactful developments in technology within the last 20 years. AWS is a pioneer and leader in the fast growing field of cloud computing. Because of this, there are thousands of analysts worldwide who are trying to understand AWS to then help their clients realize the transformation potential of cloud computing for their business. Our role is to inform these analysts and explain how AWS is different from traditional IT infrastructure offerings, and to work with these analysts to understand core customer requirements and concerns.

The right candidate possesses analyst experience and a track-record of demonstrating successful AR program management – this includes the ability to quickly understand technically deep topics, successfully deliver on numerous collaborative projects, and manage day-to-day operations related to program activities in a global organization. In this role, the candidate will have a direct opportunity to innovate AWS AR programs and measurement of results via new approaches. They must be comfortable with balancing strategic thinking with tactical, detailed execution while working independently, sorting through ambiguously defined problems, and identifying market challenges and opportunities for our customers.

Position will be located in an Amazon/AWS U.S. Corp office based in the following locations: Seattle, WA (HQ); Arlington, VA (HQ2); Palo Alto, CA; San Francisco, CA; San Diego, CA; Santa Barbara, CA; Santa Cruz, CA; Portland, OR; Phoenix, AZ; Las Vegas, NV; Salt Lake City, UT; Chicago, IL; Detroit, MI; Dallas, TX; Houston, TX; Austin, TX; Washington, DC; New York, NY; Jersey City, NJ; Pittsburgh, PA; Boston, MA; Nashville, TN; Charlotte, NC; Atlanta, GA; only. Relocation offered from within the US only to these locations.

Responsibilities:

Develop and execute a global AR program to educate the analyst community specifically focused on Data Integration
Proactively manage vendor evaluations, and secure positive placements of AWS in key reports
Drive analyst awareness of AWS Data Integration offerings and significantly expand analyst understanding.
Deliver on-going AR program activities such as analyst briefings, events, inquiries, reporting and other core program tactics
Prioritize and manage incoming requests for information, research review, customer references, event speakers, and research
Write presentations and prepare AWS Executives for engaging with analysts
Drive alignment with sales, marketing and product teams to maximize awareness of customer requirements, existing market evidence, and AR program impact

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.


Previous experience in cloud computing via product programs or a Marketing role
Experience managing vendor evaluations for Gartner Magic Quadrants and Forrester Waves
Passion for working in a lean, fast-paced organization, and desire to own and refine key operational processes
Ability to adapt to a fast-changing and evolving role
Desire to grow with the team and take on additional responsibilities
Natural tendency to invent, simplify, and take innovative approach to AR
MBA a plus
Excellent written and oral communications skills
Clearly understands technology and can abstract business/solution value
Self-starter with a strong sense of ownership
Able to prioritize in a complex, fast-paced environment
Creative thinker with bias for action

As the Business Intelligence Manager - Change Management, you will play a key role in ensuring major projects meet objectives on time and on budget by increasing employee adoption and usage. You will be focused on the people side of change, including changes to business processes, systems and technology, job roles and organization structures.

Your primary responsibility will be to establish & maintain repeatable change management practices while simultaneously working with project managers and initiative sponsors on active projects, creating and implementing change management strategies that maximize employee adoption and usage, while minimizing resistance. You will also quickly stand out amongst your peers, as you lead a group of change champions.


By driving faster adoption, higher ultimate utilization of - and proficiency with - the changes that impact employees, you will have a direct impact on increased benefit realization, value creation, ROI and the achievement of project’s results and outcomes. You’ll also be able to leverage your strong quantitative and qualitative analysis background to facilitate the creation and measurement metrics to track change readiness, ensure reinforcement of the change itself, and to identify system & process solutions that further advance desired changes. At times, you may also find yourself facilitating the design and development of project-related reporting structures to be utilized cross-functionally.
At least 18 years of age
Legally authorized to work in the United States
High School Diploma or GED
T-Mobile requires all employees in this position to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 prior to starting work. The CDC defines "fully vaccinated" as two weeks after the second dose for Pfizer and Moderna, and two weeks after the single dose of Johnson & Johnson. T-Mobile will require proof of vaccination and consider requests for exemption from this requirement during the offer phase as a reasonable accommodation for medical reasons or sincerely held religious beliefs where the accommodation would not cause T-Mobile undue hardship or pose a direct threat to the health and safety of others.
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Communications, Organization Behavior, or Management Information Systems, or an operations field (i.e. Supply Chain, Procurement, Project Management).
4-7 years of experience working with large-scale organizational Change Management initiatives
4-7 years of experience working in Project Management
4-7 years of Experience in intermediate-to-advanced analytics using readily-available applications such as MS Excel and Power BI.
Extremely comfortable in highly ambiguous situations with very little direction – you love to jump right in and work with others to ‘figure things out”
Natural storyteller with proven experience in developing narratives from data
A solid understanding of how people go through a change and the change process
Experience and knowledge of change management principles, methodologies and tools, and how to apply them to active projects
Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal across all levels of the organization – you understand how to tailor your messaging whether its to senior leaders or frontline teams
Excellent active listening skills
Ability to influence others without authority, and move teams toward a common vision or goal
Ability to establish and maintain strong relationships
Organized with a natural inclination for planning strategy and tactics
Problem-solving and root cause identification skills
Able to work collaboratively with and through others
Acute business acumen and understanding of organizational issues and challenges
Familiarity with project management approaches, tools and phases of the project life-cycle
Intermediate-to-Advanced functional knowledge (i.e. Telecom; Supply Chain; Network Technology; Procurement)
Ability to work in a fast-paced development environment under tight schedules
Manage and drive analytical projects end to end
Experience with presenting recommendations to broad audiences with outcomes as result of influence.
Experience coaching others on the importance of change management and how to develop change management strategies.
Excellent presentation skills with ability to drive senior level business leaders to take action
Certifications and Licenses (preferred):
Prosci - Change Practitioner (or equivalent)
PMI – Project Management Practitioner (or equivalent)
Apply a structured methodology such as Prosci, and lead change management activities: Apply a change management process and tools to create a strategy to support adoption of the changes required by a project or initiative.
Drive communications efforts: Collaborate with the Procurement Chief of Staff and Project managers in the design, development, delivery and management of communications.
Assess impacts: Conduct impact analyses, assess change readiness and identify key stakeholders.
Consult and coach Project teams: Provide insight, develop and conduct training programs aligned to new strategies requiring change.
Create actionable deliverables for the five change management levers: communications plan, sponsor roadmap, coaching plan, training plan, resistance management plan
Define and measure success metrics and monitor change progress
Create & maintain dashboards & presentations tracking progress & results of change.
Own the process of driving core insights and creating strategies for ongoing support of change initiatives.
Present analysis & strategies to project teams and senior management in verbal & written forms.
Other Duties/Projects as assigned by business management as needed.

positionName: Manager, Internal Audit Data Analytics and Automation
Associate Director, RA Data Reporting and Analytics
description:
Responsible for planning, directing and strategic oversight of the programmatic functions of the OptumCare Washington’s risk adjustment (RA) function, including accurate coding and diagnosis for risk based contracts (including Medicare Advantage and Dual Eligible, Accountable Care Organizations (ACOs), commercial or Medicaid capitation, and any other value-based performance reimbursement with chronic conditions). Responsible for the assessment, gap analysis, operational planning, deployment, and management of RA programs for prospective and/or existing partners in Washington. Under the direction of the Vice President of Risk Adjustment Operations, the Associate Director develops in-year strategies and tactics to ensure high performing RA programs supporting Optum Pacific Northwest’s growth.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: The duties listed below are intended only as illustrations of the various types of work that may be performed. The omission of specific statements of duties does not exclude them from the position if the work is similar, related or a logical assignment.
Support the development and implementation of a system that delivers great patient care consistent with the quadruple aim for all value-based programs
Develops strong relationships & supports the assessment, gap analysis and integration plans for prospective & existing entities in WA
Implements & manages RA programs at the direction of the PNW RA & Value team leadership as well as WA market leadership
Supports network growth through strategic expansion of the PNW region’s value-based care contracts. This strategy includes ensuring the appropriate infrastructure and support of any new member lives through employed & affiliate engagement, deployment of point of care tools & incentive programs, and the implementation of wrap around services
Manages risk adjustment initiatives in our WA market, including health assessment initiatives, HCC risk adjustment data & documentation integrity, and supporting vendor programs
Leads the assessment, implementation, and management of attestation programs to promote complete and accurate coding & documentation activities at the point of care.
Leads implementation of programs designed to ensure all diagnosed codes and conditions are properly supported by appropriate documentation in patient chart. Programs include but are not limited to: training and educational activities, clinical chart review programs, retrospective reviews, submission, reconciliation, and electronic data submission.
Accountable for patient engagement and outreach initiatives to facilitate comprehensive health assessment for Medicare Advantage patient population, and other managed or risk-based populations.
Selects and manages vendors for programs such as in-home health assessments, embedded NP, screening tools, medical chart retrieval, and medical coding.
Assists in the design of incentive and reimbursement programs for group constituents to incentivize appropriate coding and documentation practices related to RA activity.
Coordinates with clinician leadership to ensure the clinical aspects of RA and best practices are communicated to providers & clinical staff.
Identify and analyze implications of key changes to the regulatory & policy environment on provider organizations in the areas of risk adjustment and compliance.
Support effective business relationships with external entities, including payers and health plan partners with continuous focus on performance improvement related to population clinical quality and patient experience goals.
Organize and provide executive, management and front-line initiatives and performance reporting and communication for any manages programs.
Prepares timely and accurate monthly and annual reporting as required.
Requires significant collaboration with internal stakeholders including, but not limited to, primary care section and specialty service lines, IT, business services and finance, contracting, compliance, as well as external entities and vendors will be required.
Provide supplemental expertise and bandwidth in existing regional markets, as needed.
Leads, manages and mentors RA managerial and project management staff to support OptumCare achievement of deliverables on documentation completeness and accuracy, clinical quality and patient experience. Uses evidence-based, consistent practices in coordination with external entities and guidelines.
Evaluates the performance of direct report(s), including performance to identified standards and metrics for the team.
Consistently exhibits behavior and communication skills that demonstrates Optum’s commitment to superior customer service, including quality, care and concern with each and every internal and external customer.
Duties listed below are integrated into all job functions:
All staff members are to promote a positive and productive work environment by acting maturely and responsibly, satisfactorily performing his or her job responsibilities and conducting themselves in a professional, courteous and respectful manner toward fellow employees, physicians and patients.
Must be facile at operating independently in new and ambiguous market scenarios
Must relate to other people beyond giving and receiving instructions: (a) get along with co-workers or peers without exhibiting behavioral extreme; (b) perform work activities requiring negotiating, instructing, supervising, persuading or speaking with others; and (c) respond openly and appropriately to feedback regarding performance from a supervisor.
Performs all duties in a manner which promotes and supports the Core Values and Compact of.
Integrates Lean principles, practices and tools to improve operational efficiency, reduce costs and increase customer satisfaction.
Frequently must follow written and oral instructions as well as complete routine tasks independently.
Completes annual compliance training on HIPAA/Privacy/Confidentiality/Non-Discrimination/Harassment/Integrity Statement and signs Agreements.
Ensures confidentiality of patient information following HIPAA guidelines and OptumCare policies.
Attends training to meet requirements of the job position and as needed or mandated by OptumCare policies, Div. of Occupational Safety & Health (DOSH), OSHA, L&I and other state/federal regulations.
Has regular and predictable attendance.
Performs other duties as assigned.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities: Note that these requirements are representative, but not all-inclusive, of the knowledge, skill, and ability required to perform this job.
Experience leading risk adjustment activities in a large Medicare HMO or provider organization
Ability to interact effectively with C-Level employees across the organization
Knowledge of regulations related to Medicare Advantage, Medicaid, Commercial risk adjustment
Knowledge of claim coding and payment methodology utilized in Medicare and Medicaid lines of business
Strong leadership capabilities, and ability to initiate and maintain cross-team relationships
Excellent analytical, actuarial, and problem-solving skills
Ability to effectively direct preparation of various financial analysis and data mining activities
Ability to effectively interface with staff, clinicians and management
Excellent teaming/interpersonal and verbal and written communication skills
Education: Bachelor's degree from a four-year college and/or a professional certification requiring formal education beyond a two-year college. Master’s degree in Healthcare Administration, Business Administration preferred.
Experience: 4 - 7 years of experience in a healthcare setting. Over 3 – 5 years of management experience. Experience in analytics and data analysis. Preferred background in supporting risk adjustment & quality activities, clinical informatics, and fluency in Microsoft applications.

positionName: AI/ML - Business Intelligence Analyst, Annotation Operations
description:
Summary
Posted: Aug 16, 2021
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:200268002
Do you love thinking analytically? Are you passionate about solving complex business problems in a fast-paced environment? Apple’s AI/ML Annotation Operations team is looking for a highly motivated analyst with proven experience in business planning, forecasting, analytics, and operations. As part of the capacity planning team, you’ll play an integral role in driving efficiency and financial health for the AI/ML organization. In this role you will engage with teams across Apple’s AI/ML ecosystem with the ultimate goal of delivering high-quality annotated data that meet each team’s needs. You will be responsible for converting internal customer annotations projects into quantitative demand requirements, and assembling and executing on the capacity plan necessary to deliver. Being successful at Annotations Capacity Planning means that teams all across Apple, working on unreleased products and/or existing beloved features, will come to rely on you to meet their annotations needs with high quality, cost-effective, and timely annotated data.
Key Qualifications
5+ years of experience in a Forecasting, Planning, Data Analyst, or Data Science role
Experience with using large scale data analytics in service of solving complex business problems
Proficiency with data visualization tools such as Tableau for analysis, insight, and presentation
Ability to condense complex concepts and analysis into clear and concise takeaways that drive action
Superb communication and presentation skills with meticulous attention to detail
Strong time management skills with ability to work to under tight deadlines for executive requests
Excellent in teamwork and relationship building. Not above doing whatever it takes to get the job done.
Self-directed and proactive. You thrive in an ambiguous and fast-paced environment.
Description
You are an experienced business analyst who loves working with people across technical and non-technical domains to solve problems and deliver results. In this role you’ll have a chance to lean on all of your technical and people skills while engaging with teams across Apple’s ecosystem who are working on cutting-edge machine learning technology. You will work with teams in operations, engineering, and program management to forecast demand, develop capacity plans, and partner in the execution of annotations projects on a daily basis that support Apple’s machine learning and AI efforts. You will work with client engagement and program planning to gather data and prepare projects for execution. You will partner with data engineering to improve project execution automation, analytics, and reporting. You will communicate performance trends to leaders on a weekly and quarterly basis, highlighting opportunities to drive further efficiency.
Education & Experience
Bachelor's or Masters degree in economics, mathematics, engineering/computer science, or other relevant field that demonstrates quantitative skill.
Additional Requirements

About Highspot
Highspot helps sales teams improve customer conversations and achieve their revenue goals. From content optimization and performance analytics to in-context training, guided selling, and more, the Highspot platform delivers enterprise-ready features in a modern design that sales reps and marketers love. Using Highspot, marketing leaders have deep insights and analytics into the performance and influenced revenue of content, campaigns, and marketing assets. What makes the solution special? It’s loved by sales reps globally, and is the #1 rated sales enablement platform on G2 Crowd.
We are committed to diversity as both a moral and business imperative.
About the Role
The Revenue Operations team at Highspot is at the intersection of marketing, account development, sales, services, and finance. Revenue Enablement and Revenue Operations work together to strategically and proactively optimize the effectiveness and efficiency of our go-to-market teams. Our work is imperative to driving consistent and scalable growth.

We are growing fast and are looking for an individual contributor to help build a world-class Revenue Operations team. This infrastructure will be critical to the continued success of our business. The ideal candidate for this position will take an innovative, creative approach to designing processes and delivering solutions. The person we’re looking for will be collaborative, systematic, and analytical when solving problems. This person will have the ability to quickly pivot between brainstorming, strategy, and execution based on the internal audience. They will be resilient, resourceful and tenacious when working cross-functionally. The ideal candidate will be passionate about leading and developing individuals and teams.


What You'll Do
In this role you will support the Sales Leadership & teams with analytics and insights to proactively manage and optimize business strategy, processes, and performance.
Responsibilities include:
Develop consistent and scalable processes to continuously monitor data integrity.
Gather business requirements from a diverse number of users across Sales teams and translate requirements into scalable and cohesive solutions; enhancements, bugs, new processes, requests, ticketing system, etc.
GTM Reporting - Support GTM Leadership with just-in-time data and reporting needed to successfully manage and optimize performance; Salesforce reports and dashboards, team and individual performance scorecards, Sales Attainment and Atlas.
GTM Funnel Analysis - Orchestrate consistent analysis of our GTM funnel and present findings to appropriate stakeholders:
Account Development Analysis (market segment, industry, persona)
Sales Analysis (pre-sale, post-sale)
Competitive Analysis
Pricing Analysis
Sales Insights - Provide Sales leadership with insights that will help in developing innovative, high-growth strategies to optimize performance and reduce costs through:
Market insights (market segment, industry, persona)
Account insights (firmographics, behavioral)
Customer insights
Growth insights (growth testing)
Data Quality - Maintain excellent data hygiene and accurate usage of schemas in reporting.
Sales Planning and Compensation - Coverage and territory management, pipeline forecasting, revenue predictability modeling, quota and compensation planning.


Your Background
5+ years of experience in operations, analytics, strategy within a SaaS company.
Experience partnering with different go-to-market teams, ideally, marketing, pre, and post-sales.
Ability to cover a range of activities; from C-level presentations to hands-on, data deep-dives with other analysts.
Ability to create a performance- and metrics-focused culture.
A very thorough understanding of traditional B2B sales, Account-based Sales, pipeline management, and forecasting.
Strong communication skills, including the ability to summarize and visualize complex analyses that tell a compelling story.
Experience working with IT and Data Warehousing teams to ensure the infrastructure supports the needs of Revenue Operations.
Experience developing customer segmentation and journey maps in a B2B SaaS environment.
Expertise with Tableau, Salesforce, and SQL.
Benefits
Full medical, dental, and vision benefits
Flexible work and vacation schedules
Transportation benefits
Competitive compensation and equity
Fully-stocked kitchen with healthy snacks and drinks
Free catered Friday lunches
Team building outside of the office
Company bonding events throughout the year
Opportunities to attend trade shows, conferences, and industry events
Open office, based in the heart of Seattle
Great views of the city and Puget Sound
Meaningfully contribute to a compelling vision
Equal Opportunity Statement
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of age, ancestry, citizenship, color, ethnicity, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or invisible disability status, political affiliation, veteran status, race, religion, or sexual orientation.

Description
Job Description:
The NISC IV program at Leidos is seeking a Business Process Analyst to support the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) Western Service Center (WSC) Planning & Requirements Group (PRG) with Program/Project Analytical support.
We are seeking a talented and energetic candidate to work with the best and brightest employees around the country in creating innovative all-encompassing solutions for our programs. You will work in a fast-paced and diverse environment, enjoy flexible work arrangements, and will have a management team that encourages your career development and growth.
In this role, you will gain many intangible skills, such as time and task management, critical thinking and problem solving, the ability to communicate complicated problems in a concise manner, as well as solve complex problems using available tools.
The selected candidate will be responsible for analyzing and measuring the effectiveness of existing business processes and developing sustainable, repeatable and quantifiable business process improvements. Duties include researching best business practices within and outside the organization, collecting and analyzing process data to initiate, develop and recommend business practices and procedures that focus on enhanced safety, increased productivity, and reduced cost. Duties may include determining how new information technologies can support reengineering business processes.
Primary Responsibilities:
Areas of support for the selected candidate will include research, gather, and analyze complex data to develop reports; prepare dashboards; identify trends; and make recommendations for process improvements for all phases of program management.
Specific tasks will include:
Evaluate and analyze data from internal budget, training, and organizational goals to identify trends and make recommendations.
Develop and maintain SharePoint/KSN, Tableau dashboards, and other databases; provide statistical analysis of multiple databases; and prepare presentations and reports from the data.
Develop and maintain organizational charts.
Develop and maintain Director level dashboards.
Provide tracking and reporting for program and management action items.
Provide support to team, group, and management meetings as needed.
Provide PRG with ad hoc technical writing and editing support.
Please Note: Must be able to work onsite in Des Moines, WA (once temporary Pandemic related remote work is over or when asked to return to the office).
Basic Qualifications (Required Skills):
Experience in technical writing and editing various documents; and able to write in explanatory and procedural styles for multiple audiences.
Working knowledge and proficiency utilizing Microsoft Office applications to include: Word, Excel, Office and PowerPoint.
The position requires the candidate to travel approximately once per year within the Western Service Area.
Ability to obtain and/or maintain Public Trust Security clearance.
Have a BA degree and 4+ years of prior relevant experience OR a Master’s degree with 2+ years of prior relevant experience OR additional years of relevant experience may be considered in lieu of degree.
Preferred Qualifications:
Knowledge of SharePoint/KSN, and/or Tableau dashboards for the purposes of administering, managing, sharing, organizing and presenting analytical and organizational information, is desired.
Familiarity with technical writing, editing, and data presentations through charts, graphs, and MS PowerPoint, is desired.
Candidate must be organized and detail oriented, have strong analytical skills, and is a team player.
The selected candidate will have highly developed presentation skills, self-motivated and proactive team player, and excellent written and oral communication skills.

We value and support the well-being and mobility of our employees with competitive benefit packages, complementary e-learning training, work-life flexibility, an exciting External Referral Program, and a diverse, inclusive and ethical work place. Data Associate
About The Chartis Group
The Chartis Group (Chartis) is a comprehensive advisory and analytics services firm dedicated to the healthcare industry. With an unparalleled depth of expertise in strategic planning, performance excellence, informatics and technology, and health analytics, we help leading academic medical centers, integrated delivery networks, children's hospitals and healthcare service organizations achieve transformative results.
We are comprised of uniquely experienced senior healthcare professionals and consultants who apply a distinctive knowledge of healthcare economics, markets, clinical models and technology to help each client address their most pressing issues. We question everything and apply thoughtful and rigorous analysis to each challenge, issue and opportunity.
We are lucky to have extraordinarily talented people working in our firm – all brought together around our unifying mission, a shared dedication to our core values, and the emphasis we place on creating an environment that enriches the experiences of our clients, our colleagues and our communities. In this way, we find that we are remarkably aligned with our clients. And that has made for achieving some truly great things.
The Chartis Group has offices in Atlanta, Boston, Chicago, New York, Minneapolis, and Nashville.
Role Overview
The Chartis Group’s Advanced Analytics Team is responsible for providing high quality data and analytic support to client engagements, internal research, and development initiatives within the firm. They apply advanced database management and sophisticated analytical tools and skills to derive compelling quantitative findings from large client, industry, and proprietary datasets.
The Data Associate will work directly with our consultants and clients to provide analytic support on a range of healthcare projects. This is an exciting opportunity for an innovative and quantitative thinker who is passionate about healthcare to help develop the analytical capabilities of our rapidly growing firm.
Responsibilities
Participate in the entire project lifecycle – from requirements definition and scoping, through execution. During this time, you will work with both project teams and clients to define and fulfill data and analytic requests.
Perform complex analysis (e.g., merging multiple datasets for new insights into relationships between variables) and provide data and analytic support to Chartis consulting engagement teams
Thoroughly QA and cleanse raw datasets, ensuring accuracy of your deliverables
Build new datasets to maximize utility using advanced data management and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Excel, Alteryx, R, SQL, Python, Snowflake, etc.)
Execute core analytics for a range of client engagements (e.g., strategy, performance improvement, digital health)
Develop impactful data analytics and visualizations including mapping using business intelligence software (e.g. Tableau)
Document analytic methodologies and approaches
Codify datasets and outputs into client-ready deliverables and transfer to project teams/clients
Support the analytic and research needs of Chartis’ internal firm teams and practice areas, including contributing to practice development initiatives, whitepaper development, training, and knowledge management initiatives
Qualifications & Desired Skills
Bachelor’s degree in a related field such as mathematics, statistics, computer science, or engineering
At least 2-3 years data analytics experience, ideally in a professional services firm or healthcare provider setting
Strong Tableau skills (Desktop/Creator) required. Experience with Tableau Server and Tableau Prep is greatly preferred.
Experience with data visualization, mapping and data cleansing
Ability to create dashboards from a variety of data sources
Familiarity with SQL and managing large data sets (>1M rows) required; additional experience with Snowflake, SAS, Alteryx and/or similar programs preferred.
Familiarity with healthcare data (e.g., claims data, hospital reporting data, or clinical decision support data) and analytics preferred
Proficiency with MS Office applications
Strong work and time management skills; able to work effectively under tight timelines and adapt to shifting priorities, in both individual and team settings
Open to learning new software programs as needed for new types of projects or client engagements
Comfortable working with consulting colleagues, including clearly communicating analytic findings in the context of client engagements
At The Chartis Group, we pride ourselves on having a diverse workforce. We value and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals and the different perspectives the provide. We offer equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, or protected veteran status.
Atlanta | Boston | Chicago | Minneapolis | New York | San Francisco

We Are:
Accenture Interactive—a new breed of agency that’s all about the Experience. For us, customer experience is not an add-on; it’s foundational to who we are and how we empower our clients. As the world’s largest, most disruptive agency, we drive lasting growth for clients by helping them design, build, and run meaningful experiences that make people’s lives better, more productive, and more meaningful. We do this in three ways: by transforming organizations through standout products and services; by building and delivering award-winning campaigns so brands can engage and communicate creatively with customers at scale; and by using our top-notch skills to pilot, integrate, scale, and run the platforms that underpin the world’s greatest experiences. Visit us here to learn more about what makes us the Experience Agency.

Our Digital Commerce services create new, innovative customer journeys through bleeding-edge, end-to-end solutions that unify the digital and physical. Leveraging deep industry knowledge and expertise, we build connected and personalized customer experiences that catalyze customer buying decisions—at speed and at scale. We strategize, design, develop and implement omni-channel B2C and B2B commerce capabilities, platforms and systems. By improving digital channel maturity and delivering integrated experiences, we boost customer interaction and engagement, delivering tangible results and a better bottom line.

Job Description:
Have you developed a reputation for your ability to strategize, analyze, design and implement important eCommerce initiatives Do clients rely on you to create and communicate the detailed technology architecture and implementation strategy for the solution If leading technical teams through the design and development of complex transactional systems sounds like a challenge you want to tackle, then we want to meet you.

The work:
Participate in the analysis, design, and implementation of relevant eCommerce platforms such as hybris, Oracle/ATG, Magento/Adobe Commerce, Sterling Order Management, Manhattan Associates, Demandware, Intershop, and IBM Websphere Commerce
Apply specific functional knowledge of eCommerce or WCM applications to help guide the design and implementation of the solution
Manage and conduct requirements gathering, stakeholder interviews and initial client discover work

Lead testing efforts in conjunction with the Project or QA Manager, including the design and execution of test scripts and scenarios
Prepare training materials appropriate for target audiences and developed solution and conduct training sessions
Assist with gap analysis, business process redesign, roadmap planning and developing proof-of-concepts
Support the development of strong client relationships by building trust, rapport and strong working relationships with key sponsors, stakeholders, and team members
Please note: The safety and well-being of our people continues to be the top priority, and our decisions around travel are informed by government COVID-19 response directives, recommendations from leading health authorities and guidance from a number of infectious disease experts.

Here’s what you need:
Minimum 3 years of experience gathering and documenting requirements
Minimum 2 years of full lifecycle implementation experience using various SDLC methodologies
Minimum 1 year of implementing eCommerce applications
Bachelor's degree or equivalent (minimum 12 years) work experience
Bonus points if:
Functional expertise in relevant eCommerce or WCM technologies such as Magento/Adobe Commerce, hybris, Oracle/ATG, Sterling Order Management, Manhattan Associates, Demandware, Intershop, IBM Websphere Commerce, Cloudcraze
Experience eliciting high-level business requirements and creating detailed functional specs as well as other documentation like requirement traceability matrixes, work-flow diagrams and use-cases
Ability to lead team and client meetings and to clearly articulate the solution being developed with all the stake holders
Experience in a consulting environment with demonstrated track record of continuing responsibilities, creativity and innovation.

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.

We give you a world of potential.
Computershare has an exciting opportunity for a Data Systems Analyst with our team.
This is a great opportunity to begin a career with an industry leader in mortgage servicing solutions for the financial services and investment banking industries.
A role you will love
As a Data Systems Analyst you will be responsible for producing and tracking the day to day flow of various reports and Servicing Agreements along with updating and maintaining Policies and Procedures. This position will also be required to create and maintain various adhoc reports to support the Investor Reporting Department.
Creating and maintaining various databases for reporting and tracking purposes. This will include, but is not limited to tracking, reconciling and reporting supplemental proceeds, losses, and tracking loss severities.
Collecting and reviewing data files, including Sale Files, Prefund Files and Loan Substitution Files to ensure Loan Accounting, Inventory Management and Investor Reporting has performed all necessary tasks prior to the stated cutoff.
Creating and maintaining Investor Reporting Policies and Procedures and creating process flows for all Investor Reporting processes.
Other duties or tasks as assigned by management.

What we need from you
Required:
Advanced proficiency with Excel, Access, and SQL skills.
Preferred:
Experience with Python.
Word, Accounting software, Internet software, MortgageServ and/or other mortgage servicing systems knowledge.
General organizational, problem solving, and strong communication skills.
Ability to amortize loan payments.
Key qualifications
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Education and Experience
Required:
High school diploma or general education degree (GED).
Preferred:
Bachelor’s Degree in accounting, finance or related field preferred, or equivalent work experience
Experience working on a team or in cross-functional work groups, project management and/or process improvement.
Experience with Investor Reporting.
A company to be proud of
Computershare (ASX:CPU) is a world leader in financial administration with over 12,000 employees across 21 different countries delivering expertise to over 25,000 clients. At Computershare, it’s more than just a job, our open and inclusive culture means that we will help you to grow, to move forward and make the most of the world of opportunities we have available. With infinite possibilities, we could take you anywhere. #worldofpotential
Rewards designed for you
Employee Share Plan. Set aside salary to purchase shares in our company and you’ll increase your investment when you receive a generous company contribution towards additional shares.
Health and Wellbeing. Our health and wellbeing rewards can be tailored to support you and your family.
Save for Your Future. We will support you along your retirement savings journey.
Paid time away from work. Our employees enjoy a competitive paid time off package, including a day each year to volunteer time for a good cause that is important to you.
Employee Discounts. We’ve partnered with other organisations to offer you extra savings. Enjoy discounts with banks, car manufacturers, on flights, accommodation and days out as well as with many big brand shops.
Extra Rewards. From tuition reimbursement to cash bonus recruitment referral programs, our comprehensive benefits package offers a multitude of options.
Compensation. Colorado based candidates $70,000 - $85,000 per year.
A diverse and inclusive place to work
Computershare celebrates the diversity of our people, and we welcome applications from everyone.
We believe that having a culture of inclusion is essential in delivering good results. Attracting, retaining, and developing a diverse workforce where employees feel valued, respected, and empowered allows people to reach their full potential. As a business this diversity helps us to better reflect and understand.
Covid-secure
We’ve kept our business running during the pandemic by moving most of our employees to remote working, and by creating and maintaining a safe environment for those people who need to be in the office. We carefully limit the amount of people at our locations and ensure that those who cannot work remotely are kept safe with proper distancing and protective equipment.
In most circumstances we are currently performing all interviews, assessments, and background checks online to ensure the safety of everyone involved. Should you be successful in securing a role and it can be performed from home, we will arrange for equipment to be sent to you and your onboarding and training will be provided remotely.

Lexmark is currently seeking an exceptional IT Strategic Data Analyst to join our Continual Service Improvement (CSI) team. The successful candidate will work cross-departmentally to:
UNDERSTAND our key IT and business processes
DESIGN and DEVELOP reports, performance analytics, and dashboards
PROACTIVELY SUPPORT operations improvements, project monitoring and status, and strategic decisions for IT
Specific Responsibilities and Tasks
Provide thought leadership and data-driven insights for IT and business stakeholders by focusing on measurement and tracking of business value
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business and insight goals
Identify relevant KPIs and diagnostics to pursue
Analyze data and provide insights to drive better informed tactical improvements and strategic decisions
Prepare and present compelling analytical presentations and effectively communicate complex concepts to IT and business stakeholders
Monitor performance targets and quality standards, and take remediation action if necessary
Develop a plan for data governance and validation within core reports, KPIs, and metrics
Education and/or Experience Qualifications
3+ years of experience in report building and performance analytics
3+ years of experience in predictive intelligence and/or data science (machine learning / AI)
2+ years of experience working with a BI tool (Power BI preferred)
Ability to visualize data for varying audience levels
Knowledge in querying languages and how to build complex queries
Understanding of Javascript to support development of data collection jobs and advanced dashboards
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel (including pivot tables, look-up formulas) and Powerpoint
Preferred: Experience with ServiceNow reporting, including Performance Analytics Premium
Preferred: Knowledgeable in SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework), SSDL, and SDLC
Preferred: Experience and/or certification in ITIL 4 Foundation
Preferred: Bachelor’s degree in quantitative discipline (business, statistics, economics, engineering, informatics, or an IT related field)
Communication, Engagement, and Focus
Build and maintain constructive relationships with IT practices and business units based on mutual trust and respect
Know the Lexmark business units’ functions and understand how decisions are made
Present a sharp vision of what can realistically be achieved, and deliver on commitments
Be persuasive and influential in presenting plans and ideas
Demonstrate advanced written and verbal communication skills
It is preferred this position be in Lexington, but will consider remote for a strong candidate.
**Relocation assistance will not be offered for this position.

To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Sales
Job Details
Our Global Enablement Technology Team is looking for a BA Lead to join our team and be a key player in transforming the way we enable our internal employees at Salesforce.


If you have a strong aptitude to understand business needs, capture project requirements, and collaborating/communicating with stakeholders to support the development and implementation of enablement technology solution this role is for you.


As the ideal candidate, you will have deep hands-on experience with the Salesforce platform and understand how to leverage data for practical business insights.


Responsibilities

You facilitate meetings to understand business pain points, synthesizing the discussion and circulate meeting decisions and action items with clear objectives and success measures.
You partner with business process experts to write business requirements and create process flows to translate into functional compensation design. Engage with project stakeholders for alignment and feedback.
You conduct gap analysis to provide recommendations, analytical insights, and process improvements to meet business needs through system automation.
You lead system-related projects focusing on key strategic initiatives related to Global Enablement technology systems and are responsible for end-to-end implementation planning
Lead, coach and mentor business analysts and business leaders in preparing for and sustaining change.
You can juggle multiple projects and tasks with complex dependencies with other team

Minimum requirements :
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience is required
Strong leadership skills with proven ability to facilitate cross-functionally at all levels of the organization (both business and technical-facing).
7+ years experience in business analysis or related consulting experience
5+ years of proven hands-on project management experience with the ability to take initiative and produce results, including a history in bringing projects successfully to completion
5+ years in complex business and technical environments
Proven Salesforce Platform hands-on configuration experience and associated certifications, including experience with Salesforce Reports and Dashboards (Required), Tableau CRM (Preferred), and Tableau, Excel
1+ Experience working and delivering products in an agile/lean environment
Preferred requirements:
Excellent written and verbal communication skills - including presenting and deck work
Able to think independently and consider cross-functional and upstream/downstream impacts
Structured thinking and problem solving - ability to break down complex problems into composite parts and a naturally inquisitive mindset to properly investigate and resolve problems
Demonstrated ability to drive process improvements, problem-solve, and produce results
Excellent interpersonal skills; ability to articulate verbally and written, willingness to appropriately debate difficult issues; ability to think quickly
Ability to excel in a fast growing/fast paced environment delivering accuracy while managing to deadlines where adaptability is imperative
Ability to understand broader business and enablement issues, juggle multiple projects and tasks, and to work with deadlines and in a fast paced environment
Structured, organized, and a keen sense of urgency, and self-motivated
Strategic forward-thinking business operations thinker, supported by deep analytical capabilities and a data driven approach
Ability to work independently and thrive in a team environment
Ability to lead and coach your team to deliver value for our business

Job Overview
The ideal candidate will be an experienced, client-facing Business Analyst to serve as a cornerstone with our clients and blend their insurance domain knowledge with a thorough understanding of the Majesco software solutions. The Business Analyst will be a key liaison between the Insurance carrier and the Majesco software development teams.
Key Responsibilities
To assist clients in effectively gathering business requirements
To understand and analyze client’s documentation, identifying implications, issues, and risks
Maintain a Traceability Matrix for mapping the customer requirements to corresponding functions
To develop business rating requirements documentation from client specifications
To prioritize customer’s requirements throughout the release lifecycle
To analyze and evaluate existing and/or proposed insurance systems
To analyze underwriting and rating manuals to determine rating similarities and differences across states
To work with multiple stakeholders to support development of client’s core insurance software solution and business process
To create visual design diagrams for all audiences
To develop test plans & participate in the testing process to ensure high quality project deliverables
To review test cases created by the client
To interact with other team members and clients to ensure quality solution
To communicate with the client to track and debug testing issues, resolve them, and perform regression testing.
To act as a mentor to colleagues and the client
To train customers on solutions provided
To support development of detailed requirements, user stories and functional design documents that can be referenced by global delivery staff, respond to their questions, and reconcile the functionality of their deliverables to these documents.
Perform gap analysis for new requirements in case of product implementation. Manage scope of work and support to project team in query resolution
Act as a product owner and represent the customer and the business in a scrum team
Skills and Competencies
10+ years of experience in strategic BA role for large scale projects in IT
Strong Property & Casualty domain experience and expertise on Policy administration systems
Knowledge of ISO/NCCI rating (manuals)
5+ years of experience in requirements gathering and management of Commercial Lines web-based applications (e.g. Worker’s Compensation and Commercial Auto & other LOB’s) or Personal Lines web-based applications (e.g. Personal Auto, Homeowners Insurance & other LOB’s)
Experienced in processes in SAFe methodology (Scaled Agile Framework)
Work Experience
Overall 10+ years’ experience in Business Analysis with at least 5+ years of experience in Property & Casualty commercial lines.
Business Travel and Physical Demands
Preferably based in Morristown, NJ
Business travel of approximately 30% yearly is expected for this position.
Education
Bachelor’s Degree required
Majesco is a leading insurance solutions and services provider.
Majesco's software for core insurance functions include Policy Administration, Underwriting, New Business Processing, Billing, Claims, Product Modeling, Incentive Compensation and Producer Life cycle Management. Additionally, Majesco offers consulting and insurance specific IT services for testing, data conversion, data-warehousing/BI, mobility, enterprise integration and BPM. Majesco specializes in connecting people and business to insurance in ways that are innovative, hyper-relevant, compelling and personal. Our technology, expertise and leadership helps insurers modernize, innovate and connect to build the future of their business – and the industry – at speed and at scale.
Majesco is an inclusive equal opportunity employer and complies with federal, state and local laws regarding equal employment opportunity. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to race, color, national origin, religious beliefs, sex (including pregnancy), age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, citizenship status, military status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by federal, state and/or local employment laws.
If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process, please contact reasonableaccommodation@majesco.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting and your contact information. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. This email alias is not for the general submission of application materials and any application materials submitted through this alias will not be considered. In addition, Majesco will not provide a response to inquiries made to reasonableaccommodation@majesco.com that are not related to accessibility of the online application system by persons with disabilities.

positionName: Auto, Transportation, Hospitality -Cloud Data & Analytics Senior Manager
description:
Auto, Transportation, Hospitality -Cloud Data & Analytics Senior Manager

Our Consumer industry practice is focused on serving the changing consumer, who have rapidly evolving needs, behaviors and preferences for products, services, and experiences. Our Automotive, Transportation, Hospitality & Services sector is going through an unprecedented period of significant evolution and opportunity with silos being broken down and an increased focus on the customer experience. Organizations are building differentiated customer experiences and highly integrated supply chains while maintaining growth and profitability, which creates unique challenges to innovate, modernize technology, and transform their business models.


The Team

Analytics & Cognitive

In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence, embracing decision making with clear, data-driven choices that deliver enterprise value in a dynamic business environment.

The Analytics & Cognitive team leverages the power of data, analytics, robotics, science and cognitive technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform decision-making. Together with the Strategy practice, our Strategy & Analytics portfolio helps clients transform their business by architecting organizational intelligence programs and differentiated strategies to win in their chosen markets.

Analytics & Cognitive will work with our clients to:
Implement large-scale data ecosystems including data management, governance and the integration of structured and unstructured data to generate insights leveraging cloud-based platforms
Leverage automation, cognitive and science-based techniques to manage data, predict scenarios and prescribe actions
Drive operational efficiency by maintaining their data ecosystems, sourcing analytics expertise and providing As-a-Service offerings for continuous insights and improvements

Work you'll do

As a Senior Manager, you will lead and deliver large, complex client engagements that identify, design, and implement creative business and technology solutions for large companies. You will contribute to the firm's growth and development in a variety of ways including:

Engagement Management:

Lead engagement planning and budgeting; mobilize and manage engagement teams; define deliverable structure and content; facilitate buy-in of proposed solutions from top management levels at the client; direct on-time, quality delivery of work products; manage engagement economics; manage engagement risk.

Relationship Management of executive clients and sponsors:

Participate in Business Development, develop and maintain contact with top decision makers at key clients, organize and lead pursuit teams, participate and lead aspects of the proposal development process, contribute to the development of proposal pricing strategies.

Practice Development & Eminence:

Develop practical solutions and methodologies, develop "thoughtware" and "point- of-view" documents, participate in public speaking events, get published in industry periodicals.

People Development:

Perform the role of counselor and coach, provide input and guidance into the staffing process, actively participate in staff recruitment and retention activities, provide leadership and support for delivery teams and staff in local offices.

Qualifications

Required:

Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future.

Preferred:
Strong project management and delivery experience, including budget oversight and staffing of project teams including time management.
Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment.
Previous experience mentoring, training and developing junior members of the team; experience in employee performance reviews.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple task assignments.
Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills (MS Visio, MS PowerPoint). Working knowledge and experience of MS Office applications and training development tools.
Located within a commutable distance of a Deloitte office.

positionName: Senior Marketing Data Analyst - C3 & Smart Transformation
description:
Job Description
This Senior Marketing Data Analyst reports to the Senior Director of Data Science and Advanced Analytics and is responsible for leading a data driven culture across marketing for Fortune Brands Global Plumbing Group (GPG). The Senior Marketing Data Analyst provides insight, analysis and self-serve analytic solutions across the Marketing organization. This person will have deep analytics and statistical skills to evaluate marketing performance leading to optimized marketing campaigns to acquire and grow customers at GPG. This person needs to be comfortable working with diversified business partners including varied marketing functions, business operations, and data engineers. This role can be remote in the mainland U.S.A.
Responsibilities
Act as the subject matter expert for all marketing data, reporting and attribution for all channels.
Produce detailed reporting dashboards that will be used to track our performance and impact on overall goals.
Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, and use cases.
Help to craft an ongoing experimentation program, including hypothesis formulation, experimental design, significance-setting, and post-experiment analysis.
Educate and support teams with strategies on how to connect data to results.
Collaborate with creative, ecommerce, product, and engineering teams to test and optimize every touchpoint of the customer’s journey.
Embrace a culture of always testing and always learning.
Be proactive when scoping, sizing and fulfilling large and small requests balancing efficiency and quality.
Work with marketing team and data engineers to ensure marketers have access to user data needed for segmentation and targeting.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative field (Statistics, Analytics, Finance, Computer Science). Master’s Degree preferred
Minimum 5 years of related experience. A Master’s Degree may offset 2 years of experience
Minimum 3 years experience with SQL (Snowflake, MySql, etc.) and with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Domo, Qlik
Experience manipulating large data sets, interpreting data trends, and using a multitude of disparate data sources and tools
Familiarity with marketing funnel reporting and industry KPIs
Experience with creating, executing, and analyzing complex AB/MVT test constructs to test stakeholder hypotheses
Experience in analyzing consumer behaviors and market trends to provide data driven decisions
A strong interest in analytics and a desire to understand the ‘why’, and not just the ‘how’, a campaign performed
Proven ability to quickly learn new applications, processes, and procedures
Additional Information
Fortune Brands' Global Plumbing Group (GPG) is a multi-brand plumbing business that is inspiring people by designing beautiful experiences with water. GPG's trusted brands include Moen and the House of Rohl portfolio. We welcome you to visit the Moen.com and HouseofRohl.com websites to learn more about us and why we are a top workplace.
Equal Employment Opportunity
Fortune Brands' GPG is an equal opportunity employer. GPG evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, disability/handicap status or any other legally protected characteristic.
Reasonable Accommodations
Fortune Brands' GPG is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please send an e-mail to TalentAcquisition@moen.com and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information.

American Specialty Health Incorporated is seeking a Business Analyst II to join our Customer Service – Fitness department. This position will be the liaison between the Product Owners, Business Owners (i.e. Fitness Call Center), IT managers, and developers and will also lead the Fitness Systems Workgroup.
Remote Worker Considerations:
Candidates who are selected for this position will be trained remotely and must be able to work from home in a designated work area with company-provided technology equipment.
Responsibilities
Functions as the technical liaison for the Fitness Call Center and Fitness Operations teams partnering with development groups and product owners for the various Fitness applications.
Maintains working knowledge in areas of assigned responsibility including, but not limited to, IHIS, ASHCore, FMS, Incentive Platforms and processes, Websites, EDI, Payment Processing Vendors, and Reporting.
Maintains in-depth knowledge and expertise in Fitness Call Center processes, programs, and technology interdependencies.
Uses SQL to help build queries to analyze issues reported.
Reviews and reports on vendor inquiries and issues, chart trends and presents analysis
Assists Product Owner with creating talking points when vendor updates and/or data issues occur
Represents the Fitness Call Center and Operations teams in all Fitness product planning and development meetings
Supports Call Center implementation team activities by maintaining constant communication with stakeholders and assisting with technology and data deliverables.
Supports workgroup and project team meetings and prepares related documents as necessary.
Maintains follow up to ensure timely and accurate completion of assignments.
Fitness Systems Issues (FSI) Workgroup Facilitator
Document system bugs, errors, and solutions
Coordinate with business owners and product owners to resolve issues impacting members and/or Fitness Call Center and Operation teams
Recognize unique or problem situations within areas of assigned responsibility.
Research and formulate solutions in conjunction with the FSI Workgroup members
Partner with Fitness stakeholders to prioritize work items based on severity, effort, and member impact
Maintain FSI Workgroup issues tracker and solicit regular progress updates.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Information Management, Business, or equivalent experience. If equivalent experience, high school diploma required.
Minimum 3 years of experience working with software development teams.
Familiar with all phases of the software development life cycle from requirements to the release and maintenance of enterprise level applications.
Familiarity with agile development methodologies (Scrum methodology preferred).
Proficient in VSTS, SQL, and MS Office.
Demonstrated ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical staff in order to gather necessary details.
Ability to create business and system process diagrams.
Ability to facilitate and manage meetings.
Core Competencies
Demonstrated ability to interact in a positive, respectful manner and establish and maintain cooperative working relationships.
Ability to display excellent customer service to meet the needs and expectations of both internal and external customers.
Excellent listening and interpersonal communication skills to identify critical core competencies based on success factors and organizational environment.
Ability to effectively organize, prioritize, multi-task and manage time.
Demonstrated accuracy and productivity in a changing environment with constant interruptions.
Demonstrated ability to analyze information, problems, issues, situations and procedures to develop effective solutions.
Ability to exercise strict confidentiality in all matters.
Mobility
Primarily sedentary, able to sit for long periods of time.
Physical Requirements
Ability to speak, see and hear other personnel and/or objects. Ability to communicate both in verbal and written form. Ability to travel within the facility. Capable of using a telephone and computer keyboard. Ability to lift up to 10 lbs.
Environmental Conditions
Usual office setting.
This job posting is not applicable in CO.
