Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.

Position Description:

At a Glance
Legrand has an exciting opportunity for a Business Analyst to join the Legrand Data, Power & Control Team under the direction of the Director of Sales Operations. The Business Analyst will provide data analysis to support, compile and report key information for operations and business objectives. This position will pull information from ERP, CRM and other various databases and use data analysis tools to analyze information to allow the Company to measure our Customers, Vendors, and Products to further enhance our business performance and profitability. The Business Analyst will provide analysis support primarily to the Sales, Product Management and Marketing teams, in a fast-paced environment.
What Will You Do?
Communicate directly with key end-users in the business to translate business/data challenges into reports, insights, and analysis.
Respond to user requests to develop, test, and run reports to extract/report on requested data, i.e. writing technical/functional specifications for end users.
Develop data models, processes, and structure to provide insights to key business stakeholders.
Analyze and intimately understand database tables to establish knowledge of data for accurate retrieval and use in report writing.
Utilize available tools such as Power BI, SFDC and SAP to provide technical reports.
Create, update, maintain, and enhance reports and dashboards from multiple systems (i.e. Salesforce, Power BI, SAP).
Work closely with end users, programmers, and functional teams to design business intelligence and operational reporting solutions for decision making and compliance monitoring.
Analyze sales, marketing & financial data contained in various databases to identify data reporting issues and root cause analysis for existing and proposed system tools.
Responsible for Salesforce account hierarchies and data maintenance tasks including both individual and mass record updates to ensure clean reporting outputs.
Document detailed specifications for each report including both the technical specifications and a summary of the report.
Perform data consolidation/data analysis and communicate findings to the executive team.
Contribute to building out division-led analytics initiative using Power BI
Utilize software to generate metrics and develop actionable recommendations. Provide support to research teams or management by collecting and analyzing data and reporting results.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:

Required Skills
Education:
Bachelor's degree from four-year college or university with an emphasis in Business and/or Marketing; or at least 1-2 years applicable experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Experience:
A minimum of 1-2 years related experience in a data anlysis role.
Skills/Knowledge/Abilities:
Effective oral and written communication skills with the ability to provide concise insights and analysis to multiple groups in the company including Engineering, Finance, Product Management, Marketing, and Sales.
Ability to clearly communicate insights and reporting confidently to executive leadership.
Ability to problem solve and implement creative solutions to automate data flows
Strong organizational and planning skills and the ability to work independently.
Demonstrated proficiency using Microsoft Excel, PowerBI and Power Pivot/Power Query to manipulate and analyze data.
Advanced computer proficiency with knowledge of Microsoft Office products (Word/Excel/Outlook/PPT)
Experience with Salesforce.com, SQL and Python preferred.
Ability to interface effectively with both technical and non-technical team members
Work environment is fast paced, and priorities can shift quickly. All employees are expected to go outside their primary responsibilities when required, and multi-task job duties on a regular basis. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

positionName: Sr Manager Business Intelligence, Business Development
description:
Bachelor’s degree or higher in an analytical area such as Computer Science, Management information Systems, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering or similar field
8-10 years’ experience working with large scale complicated datasets; experience with relevant technologies and of enterprise-level system implementations, such as data warehouses, ETL automation, BI visualization tools, and AWS cloud-based data management tools
Demonstrated ability to manage global projects or programs including work prioritization, planning, and coordination
Strong verbal/written communication and data presentation skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams
Ability to work cross-functionally, building and maintaining trust with internal stakeholders

Amazon Fuse is a new acquisition service that enables Amazon to distribute subscription services such as Prime, Prime Video, Music Unlimited, etc. Amazon Fuse is one of the fastest-growing and strategic new business areas inside Amazon. We are looking for a dynamic, organized, and customer-focused data analytics leader who is interested in shaping our long term Business Intelligence, data architecture, and data analytics roadmap. This role will influence the way we assess current and future strategic partnerships, provide guidance to product teams around data requirements and structures, and work across groups to source data - Prime, Prime Video, Shopping, Amazon Music, Audible.

Leading a team of Data and Business Intelligence Engineers, you will have broad latitude to work with key Amazon’s business data (including High Value Actions, Down Stream Impact, Engagement Metrics, etc.) and influence Amazon Fuse product and senior management decisions. You will provide proactive, deep insights into metrics driving the business on a regular cadence. The right candidate will be passionate about working with large datasets and emerging businesses, designing building and streamline data infrastructure, defining methodologies, and create self-service business reporting tools. You will work closely with our engineering teams to influence the product roadmap and implement solutions designed to improve operations and controls reporting.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to display your skills in the following areas:

Create a compelling and globally influential long-term data strategy and roadmap for how Mobile BD and Fuse should guide business decisions and improve customer experience using data.
Design analytics solutions to measure program impact, identify trends, hot spots, and influence product/program roadmaps
Create and deliver metrics, reporting platforms, payment audits and analytical models critical for tracking and managing the business. This will include daily, weekly, monthly, and quarterly High Value Actions and engagement metrics
Interface with other business data teams across Amazon or externally to extract, transform, and load data from a wide variety of data sources to process data for modeling and reporting.
Work with product, marketing, operations, finance, economists and other functional business leaders to gather requirements, and deliver complete Data Engineering, Data Warehousing, and BI solutions
Support adjacent data needs related to Amazon's Warrants and Minority Investment portfolio.
Report on status of development, quality, operations, and system performance to leadership
Hire, develop and mentor a team of high-performance data engineers and business intelligence engineers
MBA, Master’s or Doctorate degree in math, computer science, engineering, finance, statistics, or a related technical field
Prior experience managing digital subscriptions or products
Advanced proficiency in SQL, ETL, data modeling, and working with “Big Data”
Experience with the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and Agile/Scrum methods
Experience designing and building self-service analytics, or big data solutions using AWS and Amazon tools and services

A higher degree of healthcare.


All across UW Medicine, our employees collaborate to perform the highest quality work with integrity and compassion and to create a respectful, welcoming environment where every patient, family, student and colleague is valued and honored.


UW Medicine’s IT Services department has an outstanding opportunity for an Lead Sr. PMO Business Analyst! This position is fully remote; work location must be within the United States.


UW Medicine’s Information Technology Services (ITS) department is a shared services organization that supports all of UW Medicine. UW Medicine is comprised of Harborview Medical Center (HMC), UW Medical Center-Montlake (UWMC-Montlake), UW Medical Center-Northwest (UWMC-NW), Valley Medical Center (VMC), UW Neighborhood Clinics (UWNC), UW Physicians (UWP), UW School of Medicine (SOM) and Airlift Northwest (ALNW). In addition, UW Medicine shares in the ownership and governance of Children’s University Medical Group and Seattle Cancer Care Alliance (a partnership between UW Medicine, Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research and Seattle Children’s). ITS is responsible for the ongoing support and maintenance of the infrastructure and applications which support all of these institutions, along with the implementation of new services and applications that are used to support and further the UW Medicine mission.


The ITS Project Management Office (PMO) serves to provide a structured foundation to effectively and efficiently manage incoming and active projects within our portfolio through re-usable standards and streamlined processes. Under the general guidance of the PMO Director, the Sr. PMO Business Analyst Lead (‘Analyst') is responsible for working with Project Managers, Technical Analysts, and customers to ensure that the technical solutions implemented by ITS consistently meet the needs of our customers. The Business Analysts in the PMO are the drivers behind UW Medicine’s continued growth and success in information technology; with our commitment to continuous process improvement, the Analyst will proactively identify, develop, and help implement strategic initiatives for improved efficiency and productivity.


The Analyst serves as a coach and mentor for assigned team members to ensure on time delivery of services as well as compliance with PMO standards. This position also contributes to further development of these standards, both for the PMO as well as for specific areas of responsibility. The Analyst communicates responsibilities and expectations to team members; manages daily work assignments; identifies and manages issues, risks and decisions; ensures quality deliverables and outcomes; and manages integration and consistency of all components within areas of responsibility


RESPONSIBILITIES


Project Business Analysis (50%)

Function as SME while working with business users to define and document business cases for IT project requests, including clear definition of business needs, alignment to strategic objectives, benefits, and KPIs.

Define and disseminate success criteria for areas of responsibility.

Lead and facilitate requirements meetings to perform requirements analysis and develop/document/validate technical solutions.

Develop and maintain tools, templates, standards and reports to support Business Analyst functions.

Work with IT leaders and staff to develop cost estimates and identify impacts for new project requests.

Perform impact analyses when project change requests are initiated.

Perform cost/benefit analyses and business process re-engineering activities where required.

Provide analytical services and coordinate work efforts across multiple ITS teams as needed for other enhancement/maintenance projects.

Assist with user acceptance testing.

Regularly document and communicate project status to leadership, customers, and business stakeholders.

Develop, implement, and maintain regular reports that illustrate health of Business Analyst function within the PMO, and other reports as required.

Process Improvement Initiatives (20%)

Drive the ITS PMO Business Analyst function while maturing the Business Analyst function within the PMO.

Update, implement, and maintain related procedures and methodologies.

Lead ongoing reviews of business processes and develop optimization strategies.

Participate in quality and continuous improvement activities.

Stay up-to-date on the latest process and IT advancements to automate and modernize systems.

Conduct meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings.

Develop and implement methods to monitor and report on risk, value, and return assessment for all areas of responsibility.

Establish practices, templates, policies, tools and partnerships to expand and mature these capabilities for the organization.

Develop and execute an efficient internal communication strategy for ensuring communication with all levels of management within the team. Deliver appropriate and effective executive level communication.

Strategy (20%)

Develop and implement KPIs, metrics, and dashboards for areas of responsibility through collaboration with business owners, customers, and leadership.

Understand interdependencies between technology, operations and business needs in order to help team(s) achieve organizational goals/objectives.

Participate and/or drive feasibility studies, vendor selections, and potentially proposals for evaluation by appropriate key stakeholders.

Demonstrate a functional acumen to support how solutions will address client goals while maintaining alignment with industry best practices.

Identify and develop trusted adviser relationship with business owners, customers, and leadership.

Develop and execute an efficient internal communication strategy for ensuring communication with all levels of management within the team. Deliver appropriate and effective executive level communication.

Operations (10%)

Coordinate daily operations and priorities of Business Analyst team, assigning tasks and responsibilities to appropriate team members to ensure the team is meeting all goals and objectives.

Provide leadership to team by building and motivating team members to meet goals, adhering to their responsibilities and PMO as well as team standards and practices.

Coach, mentor, and motivate team members.

Continue professional development in order to keep abreast of emerging technologies, methods, and best practices; encourage the same for team members.

Attend team and departmental meetings as appropriate.

REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor's degree in a healthcare oriented profession, a technology field, a business-related field, or other discipline that demonstrates analytical or communications abilities or equivalent combination of education/experience.

6+ years' experience must include:

Executing progressively more complex business analyses within an information technology environment including scope definition, requirements gathering, performing cost/benefit analysis, business process re-engineering, etc.

Lean Six Sigma Green Belt; if incumbent does not currently possess, will be required to obtain within six months of start date.

Demonstrated experience with a variety of research and analysis techniques, ideally including a mix of both quantitative and qualitative methods for understanding and documenting end-user and business owner requirements.

Proven customer service orientation with a history of delivering high quality products on time.

Experience in process improvement and standards development.

Demonstrated ability to lead, facilitate, and participate in cross-functional, cross organizational work groups to implement projects or organizational changes.

In depth understanding and working knowledge of various software development and service management methodologies/concepts (e.g. Agile, Kanban, ITIL, Waterfall).

Knowledge of the industry standard Business Analyst best practices (e.g., IIBA BABOK).

Advanced level Microsoft Office skills.

DESIRED

Academic Healthcare experience.

Knowledge of healthcare clinical and administrative information systems applications.

Experience with taxonomy standards and information management, and organization practices.

Relevant coursework in business analysis, business requirement documentation, standards-based modeling technologies, or quality assurance.

International Institute of Business Analysis (IIBA) Certification of Capability in Business Analysis (CCBA) or Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP).

PMP certification.

Working knowledge of program design and evaluation, and change management.

Proven training and mentoring experience.

Advanced level experience with the specific Microsoft tools used by UW Medicine ITS Business Analysts: Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Visio, Project/Project Online, and/or SharePoint.

Demonstrated ability to perform data analysis, including querying standard databases using SQL.

Knowledge and experience with ITIL methodologies and practices.

This is an Information Technology deadline-driven work environment.

The individual in this position is expected to work normal daytime hours. The majority of work is performed in an office environment during normal business hours; however, significant off-hours and weekends may be needed to resolve problems and respond to emergencies. This individual is expected to be available for emergencies (business continuity/disaster recovery efforts) on a 24x7 basis as needed.

Because of the physically separated sites for UW Medicine, this position requires the ability to travel to alternative work locations as needed.

Must coordinate and execute responsibilities without direct supervisory authority.

Must work within the constraints of multiple technical environments.

ITS provides services to all UW Medicine organizations – Harborview Medical Center, Northwest Hospital & Medical Center, Valley Medical Center, UW Medical Center, UW Neighborhood Clinics, UW Physicians, UW School of Medicine and Airlift Northwest. The individual in this position must learn many organizational structures and cultures and continually foster collaboration.

Ability to communicate clearly in English, both verbally and in writing

positionName: Director of Web Program Management and Business Intelligence
description:
The Global Demand Center (GDC) Cloud Marketing team has a vision to create world class websites by inspiring, educating, and supporting customers throughout their digital experience. We are a fast-paced group with a focus on getting things done, simplifying anything and everything, and having fun doing it. You will be in the middle of it all, helping to make decisions that impact customer experiences, acquisition funnels, and global web experiences.
This role will own and drive strategic, operational, and tactical initiatives aimed at transforming our Cloud web program management and business intelligence teams by planning, designing, operating, and managing our end-to-end project management and web governance programs. This team is looking for an experienced professional with excellent analytical skills and strong business acumen to develop and implement program management disciplines, demand and supply planning tools, and mechanisms in a fast-paced and innovative environment with global remit. This role requires someone with strong relationship building skills who will work with stakeholders on strategic planning/projects across multiple stakeholder teams.
Responsibilities
Web Strategy & Insights
Customer-centric, innovative mindset who can translate data and insights, trends, and gaps into transformational web business opportunities for our direct business
Translates voice of the customer data and insights into compelling, customer-driven strategies that impact personalization, experimentation, and growth workstreams.
Leads high-impact, cross-team web projects to meet our evolving business environment and ensure our team is achieving its web commitments in support of business goals/OKRs.
Program Management Leadership
Demonstrates a highly collaborative style with the energy, maturity, leadership and influence web strategy discussions at both the strategic and tactical levels.
Expert program leadership skills to manage multiple and cross-site, executive-level personalization, direct, and business/web strategy initiatives
Owns resource management of vendor web team, including OpEx spending to achieve fiscal goals, prioritizing high-impact, high priority web needs that serve top business objectives.
Demonstrates a highly collaborative working style at both the strategic and tactical levels to work across key stakeholders up and downstream of the web team
Helps facilitate Rhythm of Business for commercial web team cadence across customer service areas.
Capacity Management
Manages multiple web program management teams across Azure.com, Business Applications, M365 & Teams, and Security sites under a single, cohesive operating model
Optimizes programs and internal processes that drive increased speed-to-market, agility, and team overall productivity
Qualifications
10+ years of digital experience and/or Program Management and/or Strategic Consulting.
History of driving operational discipline as well as innovation.
Experience and deep knowledge within Web Marketing & Web Direct, Business Planning and/or Sales & Marketing Operations.
Executive exposure and experience in cross-functional stakeholder management.
Experience in vendor resource management.
Expert at driving process optimization.
Has translated end-to-end data analysis into actionable, strategic insights and next steps.
Strong collaborator with proficiency in bridging gaps between multiple partner teams and a demonstrated ability to influence without authority.
Demonstrated ability to problem-solve and drive solutions within complex projects spanning multiple stakeholders.
Demonstrated experience leading, influencing and managing people and teams, while fostering a healthy and productive work environment.
Comfortable working across multiple, cross-dependent timetables successfully in a collaborative and fast-paced environment.
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

positionName: SQA Analyst (3 Months Temp) (HS grad, AS, BS) / Bellevue, WA / Mobile / MHQ
description:
*This is a 3 months temporary position. Based upon work performance, you will be transferred to another project as a full-time employee.*
Software QA Analyst
Location: Bellevue, WA
BTI Solutions, Incorporated is a global telecommunication engineering company that offers mobile and system engineering solutions for the telecommunication industry. BTI Solutions is headquartered in Richardson, Texas with four regional offices located in Kent/Seattle, WA; Overland Park, KS; San Diego, CA and Bridgewater, NJ. BTI specializes in custom and outsourced testing services on mobile products and systems since 2006.
BTI is currently looking for: Software QA Analyst

Position will be located in: Bellevue, WA

Position Classification: Hourly Non-Exempt or Hourly Exempt

Travel: Up to 30%

Position Type: Full time day time work hours and may require weekend work

General Description:
SQA Analyst will work on testing mobile phones. The testing scope includes field test, connectivity test, lab test, and so on. The position requires the SQA Analyst to analyze and determine issues, check the similar/same issue history, execute test plan, field test and/or lab test, set test environment and parameters regarding network circumstance, logging, determine what the log shows, confirm whether the issue is cleared or remained, professional report, and communicate with design team and QA team.
Essential Functions:
Perform and execute test to validate 2G, 3G, 4G, 5G NR mobile devices in live networks and also executed operator-specific field testing in various markets
Perform Sanity, Regression, Stress and Reproduction testing on mobile devices.
Perform mobile interoperability tests on a live network to check device and network stability, Test include DCR (Dropped Call Rate), KPI, Throughput, Handovers (Inter and Intra Frequency, Inter RAT), Power Consumption, MRAB test etc.
Perform testing on new technologies like Firstnet, 1 Gbps TP Test, 4CA, 4x4 MIMO (12 Layers),256 QAM, 4RxD, Band 14, Band 71(600 MHz) and LAA (Licensed Assisted Access).
Perform various throughput test using Mobile applications like Ookla, Datum (Spirent), Iperf on different AT&T and T-Mobile carriers and analyzes data throughput from application and Physical layers.
Run ADB (Android Debug Bridge) Shell scripts to Automate Test cases for Regression Testing.
Report software issues and collaborate with R&D to fix it , Collect various logs and provide with reported bugs
Understanding of Wireless Network Architecture, technologies (GSM/GPRS/EDGE, W-CDMA/HSPA+, LTE, Bluetooth®, Wi-Fi) and concept with focus on Handsets and radio networks.
Good knowledge of IMS architecture / SIP Call Flow and entities such as HSS, SPR, AAA, P-CSCF, S-CSCF, I-CSCF, MGCF, MFR
Perform VoLTE Call testing , VoWiFi testing ,VoLTE Testing, RCS , IPME ,EVS ,ePDG and IMS Stack Integration Testing
Good Interpersonal, Project Management and Team Management skills
Candidate must have a valid driver’s license to support frequent business trips
 Requirements:
Preferred degrees in Electronics, Communication, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or Telecommunications
Candidate must be technically sound on hardware/software development and release cycle
Good Understanding of Cellular technologies and industry standards and techniques.
Knowledge of wireless protocol log capturing and diagnosis tools for various chipsets such as QXDM, QPST, QCAT, Shannon DM, Wireshark, Air Logging tool
High level of oral and written communication skills
(2)+ years of relevant experience with at least BSCS or equivalent degree in EE/Computer Science or similar engineering degree, or equivalent experience
 Must have the following competencies:
Reliable
Be an analytical thinker/Problem Solver/Decision Maker
Have excellent time management/Resource management
Integrity/Adaptability/Flexibility
Organized planner/Attention to detail
Results oriented/Takes initiative
Development of others/Teamwork
Innovative/Creative
Build Relationships/Client Focused/Service Minded
Self-motivated, responsible in work
Positive mindset and active personality
Great interpersonal skills/Communicator
 Work Environment:
The position will work indoors the majority of the time and will be exposed to typical temperature and noise levels maintained in an office environment.
The position will work indoors and outdoors and will be exposed to seasonal weather changes and conditions while working outdoors. When working indoors, the individual will be exposed to typical temperature and noise levels maintained in an office environment.

Physical Demands:
The physical demands of the job will include repetitive motions, standing, bending, kneeling, reaching, sitting, pulling, lifting, pushing, carrying, walking, being in static position and driving. The position will require the individual to be able to lift up to 25 lbs. up to 1/3 of the time during a work day.

Why Work for Us?
Established in 2006, BTI is an ISO 9001:2008 certified company that continues to grow dramatically within the telecommunications industry. BTI Solutions offers a competitive benefits package that includes: Medical, Dental and Vision, Life insurance, 401K, plus more.

BTI Solutions, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V.

Why We’re Rad (about us):
Rad Power Bikes, America’s largest e-bike brand, is on a mission to get people onto bikes that are built for everything and priced for everyone.
We have been a driving force behind the ebike market expansion in North American and we are growing rapidly in Europe. The company has aggressive plans to expand our global footprint and plans to double in size by the end of 2021.
We are looking for a Director - Data Engineering to architect and build our enterprise data warehouse and data analytics. This includes building a strategic roadmap for the next 3 years to address data and BI needs for every department from finance to supply chain. You will lead a team of Sr. Data engineers and Sr. Data analysts as they work on functions like Data Platforming, Data Delivery, Business Intelligence and Data Science. The ideal candidate will have a successful track record of managing data teams that lead and deliver complex data pipelines, data models and warehouses, collaborating with multiple departments and stakeholders in addressing their data needs, as well as the ability to lead change and communicate with a wide variety of audiences, both technical and business.
Why You’re Rad (about you):
10+ years of experience in a leadership role leading and managing data warehouses with significant data volumes and complex retail datasets
Comfortable with architecting from scratch, using industry leading platforms to support rapidly changing business requirements and high growth
5+ years of experience managing teams of data engineers, data scientists, data analytics and ETL developers
Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, continuous integration/deployments, testing, and operations
Lead the design, analysis, and data architecture efforts for real-time services and big data platforms to solve complex business problems
Define data standards for use across the RAD’s technology stack
Experience working with BI platforms such as PowerBI, Tableau, Google’s Data Studio and Superset in some of the following areas: data modeling, data infrastructure, statistics, financial reporting, forecasting, attribution modeling, and test design
Experience turning user data into personalized, contextual, real-time insights to power customer interactions and acquisitions.
Strategic design mindset with a successful track record of translating business vision to measurable, trackable data outputs.
Assist in the transformation of high volume complex data structures into relevant information that can be used by Data Scientists, BI Analysts, and the business
Expert in system architecture, functionality, and data flow as well as operations, processes, and tools. Leverage business and application knowledge to create flexible and robust data solutions
Create and maintain a robust data dictionary and facilitate user adoption
Additional Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Computer Engineering or equivalent work experience with outstanding SQL skills
Broad experience with Data Warehouse platforms including Google’s BigQuery, Snowflake, and integration technologies like Stitch, Fivetran, etc
Strong understanding of DevOps practices with a good understanding of AWS and Google Cloud infrastructure supporting data, data science
You get bonus points for:
Data science architecture and implementation experience, working familiarity with open source software packages
Python and other data science software languages
Experience working in consumer retail, specifically with Shopify’s systems and API
Experience with cloud-based ERPs (e.g. Oracle Netsuite) and Warehouse Management Systems (GraphQL, BigQuery, and Postgres)
Open-source contributions and personal projects you’ve shipped successfully
Project management experience
Had you been with us last month, you would have:
Developed business intelligence and reporting solutions
Utilized and built out the data warehouse foundation and set up the pipes for data sources
Managed the building of data and documentation across company wide systems
Worked cross functionally with all teams, including Supply Chain, Customer Experience, etc. to capture and report on inventory data
Evaluated the feasibility and effectiveness of proposed data solutions
Designed schemas, optimized data transformation, and managed deployments and maintenance of the data pipeline
Completed end-to-end administration and maintained tools, systems, pipelines, and ETLs
Communicated designs, issues, and trade-offs to stakeholders, handled 3rd party vendors, and managed the relationships while troubleshooting high-level issues
Helped develop the foundational data stores that power our internal/external web apps and reporting systems
Sounding good? Read on to understand what matters most to us:
At Rad we take our company values seriously. They are lived out into everything we do. Our RADICAL values really do frame what our expectations are for each and every team member. We are:
 
-Responsible to our environment, community and team
 -Accountable, we take ownership, bias to action, seek and provide feedback
 -Diverse, inclusive of experiences, backgrounds and skills, we value every voice
 -Innovators, we challenge ourselves and the status quo, we are original
 -Customer driven, completely, we do the right thing for our riders
 -Approachable, kind, we collaborate and are always willing to help
 -Learners, we grow our skills, we are humble and seek to improve
Does this sound like you? Please apply and join us!
Rad Power Bikes is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.
If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at 800-939-0310 or jobs@radpowerbikes.com.
Recruitment Agencies: Although we value the services you provide, at this time we are not leveraging external 3rd party recruitment resources for this search. Should those needs change, we will seek your assistance directly.

Are you looking to make history? GameStop is seeking a Director of Business Intelligence and Analytics to support the rapidly growing Finance function within the business. In this role, you will partner directly with business and finance teams to solve difficult problems across day to day operations, generate strategic assessments of our omnichannel, and drive meaningful impact and changes to our fast-growing business. GameStop is a rocket ship and we're moving at light speed. Come make history with us!

Essential Job Duties And Responsibilities

Gamestop is looking for a Director of Business Intelligence and Analytics to support the Finance function across multiple business teams. This highly visible role will:
Develop models to facilitate decisions for our retail, real estate, and physical store teams.
Generate actionable insights across our E-Commerce platform
Demonstrate high judgement – clearly understanding and articulating nuances within data and their impact on Customers and decisions being made
Build new business modeling to support decisions being made daily with a focus on automation and scale as we grow
Utilize database technologies, including SQL, ETL, and Redshift to design, develop, and evaluate analyses and highly innovative business intelligence tools and reporting.
Hire and develop a team of rockstar business intelligence experts
Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes for large scale data analyses, model development, model validation, and model implementation.
Manage and execute entire projects or components of large projects from start to finish including project management, data gathering and manipulation, synthesis and modeling, problem solving, and communication of insights and recommendations.
Develop queries and visualizations for ad-hoc requests and projects, as well as ongoing reporting.
RELATED COMPETENCIES
Function as an owner - High bias for action and hustle, seeking solutions and simplification, willing to take risk and drive innovation.
Emotional Intelligence- Establishing and sustaining trusting relationships by accurately perceiving and interpreting one’s own and others’ emotions and behavior in the context of the political environment; leveraging insights to effectively manage one’s own responses and reactions
Executive Disposition - Demonstrating a poised, credible, and confident demeanor that reassures others and commands respect; conveying an image that is consistent with the organization’s vision and values
Building the Best team - our quality bar is second to none. We provide rapid growth and high-reward for our top performers.
Operate with Intensity - We are in a fast paced business and speed matters. We operate with the intensity of an owner driving for change in their business.
BASIC AND PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS (EDUCATION And/or EXPERIENCE)
Accredited Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Information Science or a related field is required; additional undergraduate study, certifications, and related leadership experience may be considered in substitution
Proficiency in SQL and management of databases
Proficiency with at least modern scripting language (e.g. Python)
10 or more years of related experience required; 4 years of management experience
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS, JOB SKILLS, ABILITIES
Ability to work cooperatively and collaboratively with others.
Ability to prepare and communicate compelling, high-impact analysis for stakeholders.
Willingness to learn in a cross-functional environment to ensure business objectives are met.
Proficient project planning skills, including the ability to organize, prioritize and control job responsibilities in order to meet deadlines in an environment with overlapping and potentially conflicting priorities
Proficient knowledge of SQL, databases, at least one modern scripting language (e.g. Python), creating and maintaining end to end data pipelines
Ability to assertively solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists
Demonstrated capacity for gathering and scrutinizing data to identify issues, opportunities, patterns, and sustainable business solutions

We are a diverse team of collaborators, doers, and problem-solvers who are relentlessly committed to a culture of safety. This position will directly impact the history of space exploration and will require your commitment and detailed attention towards safe and repeatable space flight. Join us in lowering the cost of access to space and enabling Blue Origin’s vision of millions of people living and working in space to benefit Earth.
As a Manager of Business Intelligence, you will be responsible for building reporting, dashboards and performing adhoc analyses to help Blue Origin's finance teams and partners build a road to space using data. This person will partner with the central analytics organization to prioritize, co-develop, and guide key financials reports and insights for broad consumption across Blue Origin. Our partners include a broad range of disciplines and range from the Executive level to individual contributors across the organization.
We are looking for someone to apply their technical expertise, leadership skills, and commitment to quality to positively impact safe human spaceflight. Passion for our mission and vision is required!
What makes our team successful?
Deeply comprehend our customers’ problems and work develop solutions to address them
Be the trail blazer to develop novel ways of using existing and new datasets to move our customers forward and unlock new insights
Passionate about mapping business process to data inputs and outputs
Clearly identify requirements and translate to technical implementation plans
Deep knowledge of the business and building data solutions to tackle business challenges
Data storytelling and visualization knowledge with a demonstrable record of driving adoption through crafting products and dashboards people want to use
Responsibilities:
Design and develop interactive dashboards and data solutions utilizing SQL, Tableau, and other tools
Understand data in source systems and develop requirements for shaping raw data to meet business requirements
Develop and maintain documentation
Collaborate with executive partners and program management to identify and create financial leading indicators and KPI’s that enable leaders to lead their areas
Collaborate with Data and Business Intelligence engineers to develop strategic reporting solutions for leadership to support Weekly Business Reviews (WBR), Program Management Reviews (PMR) and Monthly Operational Reporting (MOR)
Work with customer-partners and domain specialists to generate reporting, application, and integration requirements
Provide business analysis and technical expertise to internal and external partners
Maintain day-to-day workflow and communication with a variety of partners across the company
Qualifications:
Passion for our mission: Millions of people living and working in space!
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Finance or other quantitative field or equivalent combination of technical education and work experience
5+ years’ building business reporting datasets and data visualizations
2+ years of managing or leadership experience in data-centric finance organizations;
Outstanding customer relationship skills including the ability to gather requirements, recommend alternative technical and business approaches and deliver against aggressive timelines
Strong analytical SQL skills
Experience reporting from large and sophisticated datasets
Experience working with end users to build mockups and design documents
Experience crafting user stories in a Tableau Reporting environment
Excellent written communication and presentation skills
Attention to detail and high level of accuracy
Experience presenting information to executive partners
Ability to earn trust and maintain positive professional relationships
Self-starter, strong bias for action in high ambiguity environment
Knowledge of ETL tools and processes
Ability to earn trust, maintain positive and professional relationships, and contribute to a culture of inclusion
Must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.
Desired:
Familiarity with AWS Services, especially Redshift, S3, RDS EC2
Familiarity with OLAP Data Warehouse systems (especially Redshift) – query scaling, performance tuning
Experience with implementing Data Quality monitoring and alerting systems
Experience with JIRA, Gitlab and Confluence
Business domain knowledge in procurement, supply chain, manufacturing, aerospace
ITAR Requirements
To conform to U.S. Government commercial space technology export regulations, including the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR), 8 U.S.C. § 1324b(a)(3), applicants for employment at Blue Origin must be a U.S. citizen or national, lawfully admitted for permanent residence into the U.S. (i.e. current green card holder), or lawfully admitted as a refugee or granted asylum under 8 U.S.C. § 1157-1158. Learn more about the ITAR here .
Equal Employment Opportunity
Blue Origin is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and is committed to attracting, retaining, and developing a highly qualified, diverse, and dedicated work force. Blue Origin hires and promotes people on the basis of their qualifications, performance, and abilities. We support the establishment and maintenance of a workplace that fosters trust, equality, and teamwork, in which all employees recognize and appreciate the diversity of individual team members. We provide all qualified applicants for employment and employees with equal opportunities for hire, promotion, and other terms and conditions of employment, regardless of their race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin/ethnicity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military/veteran status, or any other status or characteristic protected by federal, state, and/or local law. Blue Origin will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state, and local laws. Affirmative Action and Disability Accommodation
Applicants wishing to view a copy of Blue Origin’s Affirmative Action Plans, or applicants requiring a reasonable accommodation in order to participate in the application and/or interview process, please contact us at EEOCompliance@blueorigin.com .

positionName: Senior IS Program Manager – Business Analysis
description:
Description:
Providence is calling a Senior IS Program Manager – Business Analysis to one our location in Portland, OR, Redmond, WA, Seattle, WA, or Renton, WA.
We are seeking a Senior IS Program Manager – Business Analysis to be accountable to successfully planning, business analysis, budget, and lead one or more large, diverse, and complex projects for software development or data solutions. Caregiver ensures projects are planned and executed in a manner that supports the Providence mission and meets organization objectives. Caregiver feels a personal stake in the projects delivered and relationships nurtured. Caregiver establishes and communicates responsibility and scope clearly, values integrity, and manages conflict. He or she knows how things work in IS, in HI, and in the world of the clients we support. This position works for the success of PSJH, thrives in uncertainty and strives to bring order to it. Strong candidates have deep wisdom, judgment and perseverance. They keep their eye on the ball and build strong and long lasting relationships, they are constantly looking to improve self and team, and are in steady pursuit of excellence. The Senior IS Program Manager – Business Analysis will bring exceptional collaborative skills, attention to detail, strong self-motivation and a passion for driving change to make a difference in a highly matrixed and dynamic environment.
In this position you will have the following responsibilities:
Develop projects in alignment with PSJH and HI's strategic plan and objectives. Develops fluency in HI's data strategy and is able to effectively manage through conflict, disagreement and ambiguity to archive project objectives in alignment with that strategy. Maintains the right balance in meeting Client Sponsor objectives, without compromising data strategy. Works closely with the Senior Data Consultants to manage client expectations from initial problem identification through project lifecycle. Understands that what clients request isn't always the right solution for what they want or need and can assemble the right resources to quickly address and resolve.
Elicitation, organization, translation, analysis and prioritization of both business level and functional requirements.
Assess the scope requirements and translate into resource and cost estimates including developing a timeline and requesting for funding.
Work closely with engineering and architecture team to develop a solution model.
Work with cross-functional stakeholders to gather requirements, manage implementations, and drive delivery of projects. Manage relationships both within HI and the broader IS teams and with our partners in Legal, Finance, Operations and Regional Ministries or Organizations. Manage numerous requests concurrently and strategically, prioritizing when necessary.
Develop the project budget, task dependencies and schedule. Responsible for scope, risk and issue management, including documenting, communicating and facilitating resolutions or mitigation plans. Maintains all project artifacts. Identifies, delivers, and documents organizational, application and human workflows that contribute to policy and procedure updates throughout each project. Initiates business needs assessments, budgets, and risk assessments through standard project management tools.
Develops, initiates and manages a communication plan, including regular project status reports. Delivers appropriate integration, training and implementation plans and activities. Ensures open lines of communication internal and external to the project, within and external to HI.
Prepare and delivers presentations to senior leadership, management, and other stakeholders.
May lead other project managers or project coordinators, and is comfortable collaborating in a team environment while holding self and others accountable to team and project objectives.
Effectively manages and mitigates risk of the project by creatively exploring alternatives, effectively resolving conflict of time and resources, and effectively communicating between sponsors, HI Leadership Team, and the project team. Works with resource managers to resolve conflict of priorities.
Ability to craft and present a variety of analyses that help articulate HI's return on investment or value proposition to the organization. Utilize highly mathematical models and convert them to a business-driven strategy.
Serve as a key member of the HI Leadership Team in helping to drive overall HI technical strategy.

positionName: Data Engineering Director, Analytics (Facebook Reality Labs)
description:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

Come invent the future. At Facebook Reality Labs, software development is vital to turbocharging our scientific explorations and generating viable paths to the consumer products people will use for decades to come — products that will change how the world engages with computing. We are looking for a leader in our Data Engineering team to work closely with Product Managers, Data Scientists and Software Engineers to support building out a great platform for the future of computing. In this role, you’ll see a direct link between your work, company growth, and user satisfaction. You’ll work with some of the brightest minds in the industry, work with one of the richest data sets in the world, use cutting edge technology, and see your efforts affect products and people on a regular basis. The ideal candidate will have strong data infrastructure and data architecture skills as well as experience in areas such as operating system telemetry, data driven acceleration of computer vision problems & voice assistants. Candidates should also have a proven track record of leading and scaling data teams, strong operational skills to drive efficiency and speed, strong project management leadership, and a strong vision for how data can proactively improve companies.

Proactively drive the vision for data foundation and analytics to accelerate building and improvement of cross platform components across Facebook Reality Labs, and define and execute on a plan to achieve that vision.
Define the processes needed to achieve operational excellence in all areas, including project management and system reliability.
Build a high-quality data engineering team and design the team to scale.
Build cross-functional relationships with Data Scientists, Product Managers and Software Engineers to understand data needs and deliver on those needs.
Manage data foundation and telemetry plans across Facebook Reality Labs platforms.
Drive the design, building, and launching of new data models and data pipelines in production.
Drive data quality across the product vertical and related business areas.
Manage the delivery of high impact dashboards and data visualizations.
Define and manage SLA’s for all data sets and processes running in production.
Contribute to improving data engineering competency across Facebook.

12+ years of experience in BI and Data Warehousing.
Experience scaling and managing 20+ person teams.
Communication and leadership experience, with experience initiating and driving projects.
Project management experience.
Data architecture experience.
Experience in SQL or similar languages.
Development experience in at least one object-oriented language (Python, Java, etc.).
BA/BS in Computer Science, Math, Physics, or other technical fields.

Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

positionName: Manager, Data Performance and Business Intelligence
description:
WORK LOCATION: A HYBRID WORK EXPERIENCE
At Wavemaker, we believe that work is a part of life, not the other way around. To support that belief, we have recently adopted a “collaboration-led” hybrid approach to work in order to provide employees with the flexibility to do the best work of their lives no matter where they are working. This means that for roles where it makes sense, you'll spend some of your time in our incredible workspaces (when it's safe to do so) and some of your time remote. Check out this updated list of where we can hire:
California – LA or SF
Colorado – Denver
Florida – Miami/Fort Lauderdale
Georgia – Atlanta
Illinois – Chicago
Massachusetts – Boston
Michigan – Detroit
New York – New York City tri-state area (NY, NJ, CT)
North Carolina – Raleigh/Durham
Texas – Austin or Dallas/Fort Worth
Utah – Salt Lake City
THE ROLE:
As the Manager, Data Performance and Business Intelligence your role is to support and own operations that are crucial to the Wavemaker promise of making smarter, faster decisions for its clients. In this role, you will leverage Wavemaker’s proprietary data solutions to meet our clients’ and Planning teams’ needs for data management and visualization. This position requires both a strategic and tactical viewpoint, aided by intellectual curiosity, strong problem-solving skills, along with an understanding of digital and traditional media. The ideal candidate is expected to demonstrate hands-on skills in data QA, data provisioning, processing, management, and analysis.
YOUR IMPACT:
Assist in the strategy and development of Business Intelligence platforms (Datorama) for data visualization and insight generation for use in campaign monitoring and optimization.
Perform data QA and help develop automated QA processes to ensure data accuracy and timeliness while working with vendors in troubleshooting.
Assist in the development of custom databases on the reporting platform and collect data requirements from teams to assist in database build.
Manage the retrieving, compiling, and formatting of large volumes of data.
Communicate technical terms to non-technical people and helping them understand why change might be required to achieve a specific goal or to complete a project.
 YOUR QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s degree in a related field with 3+ years’ professional work experience in data management or data analytics preferably in a marketing and/or media agency.
Strong experience with Datorama and data visualization as well as tools such as Alteryx.
Knowledge of visual techniques for data analysis and presentation is a plus.
Experience with database structures; experience working with Microsoft Azure and familiarity with SQL
Organized, detail-oriented, QA-focused, and comfortable with numbers.
Familiarity with data from web/ad measurement technologies such as: ad serving platforms (e.g. DFA, Sizmek), campaign management (e.g. Prisma), website analytics software (e.g. Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics), paid search engine marketing data sources (e.g. Adwords, Marin, DoubleClick)
Ability to communicate and understand business requirements from non-technical stakeholders while simultaneously managing their expectations at the same time

ABOUT WAVEMAKER:
We believe there always is a better way to grow. We positively provoke growth for our clients by reshaping consumer decision-making and experiences through media, content, and technology. The Wavemaker way is globally consistent. Fueled by the world’s most powerful consumer data, we understand where and how marketing can intervene decisively to help brands win more sales.
Our name is our mission and our method. To make waves, you need to be provocative, even fearless. We do our best work for brave brands and people who want to be challenged to go further and faster. We know it’s not easy, but if it’s in you, we will get it out of you.
 Our 7,600 people across 90 markets provoke growth for some of the world’s leading brands and businesses. Our attitude of Positive Provocation is enabled by:
deep knowledge we have of our clients’ business
confidence to challenge what’s gone before
the support to go further than we thought possible
 We are a part of GroupM, WPP’s global media investment management company.
GroupM and all of its affiliates embrace and celebrate diversity, inclusivity, and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We are a worldwide media agency network that represents global clients. The more inclusive we are, the more great work we can create together.

We are looking for technically strong Business Intelligence Manager to lead a team of passionate BI engineers focused on engineering and part lifecycle management analytics for our Advanced Development Programs (ADP) group. The team focuses on crafting and calculating KPI's, organizational metrics, analytics and data models designed to provide visibility to the various functions and programs. We use data to tell a story about our partners performance and challenges and identify ways to optimize and remove bottlenecks. Come join Blue Origin and help us use data to build a road to space!
In this role you will work closely with program leaders, data engineering and aerospace engineering teams to deliver quality, scalable products deployed across the program portfolio of ADP at Blue Origin. You will lead a squad of analysts and be responsible for intake, requirements gathering, prioritization, execution and delivery. You will assess risks, anticipate bottlenecks, provide critical issue management, make tradeoffs, balance the business needs versus technical constraints and encourage risk taking behavior. Successful candidates will have a technical background, be detail driven and have excellent problem-solving abilities. Experience with product lifecycle and schedule performance data and systems are crucial. You should be passionate about delivering extensible, timely solutions while contributing to the development of high-performance teams through meticulous goal-setting, disciplined attention to performance metrics, continuous process improvement, and mentorship.
We will work on a diverse technology stack including Data Engineering & Architecture, BI frameworks, Big-Data and growing digital factory capabilities! We are continually evaluating our tech stack and roadmap and this role will be key in providing input on improvements we can make to modernize and optimize our analytics capability.
Responsibilities:
Responsible for the overall development life cycle of the solution and lead sophisticated projects with significant bottom line and schedule impact
Work with product managers, technology leaders and key partners in developing a strategy and road map to provide compelling capabilities for our partners across ADP that helps them achieve their program goals
Craft compelling visualizations that are readily digestible, flexible, scalable and tells a story that is impactful and drives business value
Lead and mentor a small but growing team of BI analysts and engineers
Instill standard methodologies for data modeling and documentation, assure designs meet requirements, and deliver high-quality work on tight schedules
Project management - prioritization, planning of projects and features, Partner management and tracking of external commitments
Help us define and refine our analytics technology roadmap and technical capabilities
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or other quantitative field or equivalent combination of technical education and work experience
6+ years of analytics experience in data-centric organizations; proven track record of building and leading strong analytics teams
A specialist in databases, SQL and data modeling to build scalable, documented data models and queries for self-service analytics and single source of truth data sources
Experience analyzing manufacturing and supply chain datasets including procurement, MRP, inventory and safety systems
Experience with Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) systems, Bill of Material (BOM) datasets and the bridge into MRP/ERP for manufacturing
Proven Business Intelligence development background including design patterns, data structures, test driven development
Deep understanding of data visualization methodologies optimizing for ease of ingestion, interactivity and storytelling
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Comfortable with Scrum and Agile Methodologies
Must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.
Preferred qualifications:
Master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related technical subject area
Strong business and technical vision
Ability to balance contending priorities in a fast-paced environment
Experience working with Software Development, Data Engineering and Data Science to create end-to-end analytical products encompassing the entire data lifecycle and technology stack
Outstanding customer relationship skills including the ability to gather requirements, recommend alternative technical and business approaches and deliver against aggressive timelines
ITAR Requirements
To conform to U.S. Government commercial space technology export regulations, including the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR), 8 U.S.C. § 1324b(a)(3), applicants for employment at Blue Origin must be a U.S. citizen or national, lawfully admitted for permanent residence into the U.S. (i.e. current green card holder), or lawfully admitted as a refugee or granted asylum under 8 U.S.C. § 1157-1158. Affirmative Action and Disability Accommodation
Applicants wishing to view a copy of Blue Origin’s Affirmative Action Plans, or applicants requiring a reasonable accommodation in order to participate in the application and/or interview process, please contact us at EEOCompliance@blueorigin.com .

The mission of the Corporate Infrastructure Team to own and drive strategic, operational and tactical initiatives that improve US Amazon Dedicated Cloud (ADC) operations by planning, designing, operating, and managing Remote Management Facilities (RMFs). This team is looking for an experienced business analyst with excellent, analytical skills, and strong business acumen to develop team members to implement a demand and supply planning tools and mechanisms in a fast-paced and innovative environment, at a global scale. Key Responsibilities:

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. positionName: Auto, Transportation, Hospitality Data & Analytics Dev Ops Senior Manager
description:
Auto, Transportation, Hospitality - Data & Analytics Dev Ops Senior Manager

Our Consumer industry practice is focused on serving the changing consumer, who have rapidly evolving needs, behaviors and preferences for products, services, and experiences. Our Automotive, Transportation, Hospitality & Services sector is going through an unprecedented period of significant evolution and opportunity with silos being broken down and an increased focus on the customer experience. Organizations are building differentiated customer experiences and highly integrated supply chains while maintaining growth and profitability, which creates unique challenges to innovate, modernize technology, and transform their business models.


The Team - AI and Data Operations

We establish and operate the data fabric of our client's largest and most complex deployments enabling organizations to adapt to the rapidly changing business needs using their core data platforms, applications and solutions. And we deliver this using a combination of people, automation, AI and industry leading practices to enable intelligent operations across all levels of enterprise.

We provide flexible, long-term, staffing models that allow us to optimize the data life cycle, drive agility and scale and put data in the hands of decision makers faster and drive enhanced analytics insights.

Deloitte's AI and Data Operations offering provides our clients a proven approach to optimizing, modernizing and operating their data and analytics capabilities, as well as their platforms and infrastructure. Deloitte supports Clients as they transition their data and analytics investment and operational focus from routine capabilities to a shift to driving business value and innovation.

In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence, embracing decision making with clear, data-driven choices that deliver enterprise value in a dynamic business environment.

The AI and Data Operations team leverages the power of data, analytics, Intelligent automation, science and cognitive technologies combined with the Data Dev Ops approach to help uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform decision-making. Together with the Strategy and Analytics and Cognitive practices, our Strategy & Analytics portfolio helps clients transform their business by architecting organizational intelligence programs and differentiated strategies to win in their chosen markets.


The AI & Data Operations team will work with our clients to:
Stand up and operate their data and analytics related capabilities, applications and infrastructure by providing multi-year managed services leveraging the constructs and principles of Data Dev Ops
Provide capacity by embedding talent in our client organizations to quickly scale data, business intelligence, visualization and analytical teams up and down, on-demand
Support as-a-service based subscription models at scale that include analytics and data assets supporting industry and function-specific needs

Work you'll do

As a Senior Manager, you will lead and deliver large, complex client engagements that identify, design, and implement creative business and technology solutions for large companies. You will contribute to the firm's growth and development in a variety of ways including:

Engagement Management:

Lead engagement planning and budgeting; mobilize and manage engagement teams; define deliverable structure and content; facilitate buy-in of proposed solutions from top management levels at the client; direct on-time, quality delivery of work products; manage engagement economics; manage engagement risk.

Relationship Management of executive clients and sponsors:

Participate in Business Development, develop and maintain contact with top decision makers at key clients, organize and lead pursuit teams, participate and lead aspects of the proposal development process, contribute to the development of proposal pricing strategies.

Practice Development & Eminence:

Develop practical solutions and methodologies, develop "thoughtware" and "point- of-view" documents, participate in public speaking events, get published in industry periodicals.

People Development:

Perform the role of counselor and coach, provide input and guidance into the staffing process, actively participate in staff recruitment and retention activities, provide leadership and support for delivery teams and staff in local offices.

Qualifications

Required:

Experience with Data Integration and Big Data technologies including some (not all) of the following - ETL/ELT tools like Informatica and Talend, Spark, Airflow, Cloud Based Data Integration tools like AWS Glue, GCP Data Flow and Azure Data Factory
Experience implementing or operating data and analytics solutions using cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Experience working with DevOps methodology and tools like GitHub, Jenkins, Maven, Bitbucket, etc.
Should be well versed with ITSM (IT Service Management) tools and the individual modules of ITSM
Incident Management
Change Management
Problem Management
Escalation Management
Release Management
Configuration Management
Must have a good understanding of Data Integration and Big Data technologies
Should be experienced in the data integration, provisioning and load processes of Data Warehouses, Data Marts and Data Lakes
Travel up to 50% (While 50% is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice)
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent professional experience
Limited sponsorship may be available

Preferred:
Strong project management and delivery experience, including budget oversight and staffing of project teams including time management.
Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment.
Previous experience mentoring, training and developing junior members of the team; experience in employee performance reviews.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple task assignments.
Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills (MS Visio, MS PowerPoint). Working knowledge and experience of MS Office applications and training development tools.
Located within a commutable distance of a Deloitte office.

Clear Capital is building the future of real estate data, and we need your help! We are seeking experienced product builders: with your talent as a Data Quality Analyst, help us reach our goals of knowing more about a property than anybody else and in the process making home ownership valuations more fair and equitable for millions of people.
We are the innovation team supporting and developing the production modeling systems and massive scale simulations driving Clear Capital’s novel technologies. The Data Quality Analyst role at Clear Capital will work on a team to build products and features, participating in the process all the way from proof of concept to production release. You’ll be working with a talented team of ML Engineers, Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and ML Ops Engineers who, like you, value curiosity and collaboration.
We are looking for a Data Quality Analyst to assist with the development and implementation of systems leveraging structured and unstructured data to deliver data science solutions at scale. As a Data Quality Analyst at Clear Capital, you are committed to enabling the best work of others on the team. You help yourself and your team to consistently “level up.” You think ahead to anticipate the needs of others and provide concise information for decision-making.
What you will work on
Solicit and analyst customer feedback on model quality issues, and help translate these to prioritizations for future model development
Monitor and analyze Machine Learning models in production
Establish and maintain Service Level Agreements for Machine Learning products.
Who we are looking for
Qualified candidates should have Bachelor’s degree or relevant experience with technical data collection and 2+ years of overall experience
Strong technical skills in data profiling, pattern recognition, and anomaly detection. A keen interest in the details of data
Strong knowledge of SQL and ability write SQL scripts
Significant Python scripting experience
Significant Experience with Excel
Experience with Data Modeling
Experience with version control software (e.g. Git)
You iterate quickly and are a continuous learner and are comfortable in a face-paced environment
What You Can Expect
Competitive compensation and immediate contribution!

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.
Equal Opportunity Employer
WNE is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce, providing equal employment and advancement opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Computershare has an exciting opportunity for a Data Systems Analyst with our team.

A role you will love
As a Data Systems Analyst you will be responsible for producing and tracking the day to day flow of various reports and Servicing Agreements along with updating and maintaining Policies and Procedures.
