Required:
Advanced proficiency with Excel, Access, and SQL skills.
Preferred:
Experience with Python.
Word, Accounting software, Internet software, MortgageServ and/or other mortgage servicing systems knowledge.
General organizational, problem solving, and strong communication skills.
Ability to amortize loan payments.

The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Education and Experience
Required:
High school diploma or general education degree (GED).
Preferred:
Bachelor’s Degree in accounting, finance or related field preferred, or equivalent work experience
Experience working on a team or in cross-functional work groups, project management and/or process improvement.
Experience with Investor Reporting.

Business Analyst - REMOTE

RESPONSIBILITIES


Works with other teams to interview stakeholders and elicit basic to moderate business requirements.
Assists facilitation of meetings to build deep understanding of functional business and it areas (e.g., customer, field operations) to understand business requirements.
Assists in translating business and design requirements into technical requirements.
Analyzes process/system changes, with supervision, to ensure design changes meet business requirements.
Develops experience with drawing process maps and using business process modelling techniques.
Manages overall catalogue of process flows for small to medium complexity projects.
Analyzes fairly complex data for projects with little to no supervision.
Performs QA against specifications.
Identifies issues with the quality and performance of products, services, solutions or processes and proposes improvements.
Supports small to medium complexity projects with some degree of supervision, including tracking issues and managing action items.
Appropriately documents knowledge and share lessons learned for medium complexity projects.
Assists with BA activities needed on agile scrum teams; displays understanding of agile methodology.
Analyzes, identifies, and directs solutions to eliminate problems, improve user effectiveness, and improve system accuracy.
Comes up with ideas and insights to share with senior business analysts that will optimize business results.
Works in an agile environment and engages in development practices such as XP, test driven development.

REQUIREMENTS


Developing knowledge of the practices, procedures and principles of performance analysis (trending, root cause and gap analysis), benchmarking and audit compliance.
Strong familiarity with specialized business technologies and applications (e.g., workforce management, outage management, mobile dispatch).
Good understanding of customers business model, and different parts of the business (e.g., distribution, transmission operations).
Strong proficiency in standard software applications (e.g., Microsoft Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint). 3-5 years of experience
Bachelors degree strongly preferred

Requisition Summary
The Data Analytics Manager will collaborate with all PACCAR Financial business units to streamline reporting, increase BI skills sets and accessibility to data, identify valuable use cases for advanced analytics projects, and promote best practices and highest standards on Advanced Analytics and Business Intelligence projects for PACCAR Financial’s Data Analytics Team. The Analytics Manager and his/her team will analyze large amount of business data, discover and solve high impact problems, build innovative visualizations and reporting and develop metrics and business cases that enables PACCAR Financial’s teams to continually enhance business and operations functions. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter, highly analytical, detailed and eager to take on some of the most interesting and impactful challenges at PACCAR Financial.
Job Functions / Responsibilities
Lead and grow Advanced Analytics and Business Intelligence (BI) at PACCAR Financial.
Being a strong team member by supporting others or being a subject matter expert in data analytics.
Manage project timelines and lead collaboration across the Data Analytics Team.
Build and leverage key cross-functional relationships critical to the success of the analytical growth at PACCAR Financial.
Coach and develop the Data Analytics team to follow highest standards consistent with best practices and standards for data analysis.
Work with Data Scientist/Data Analysts on defining their department analytics growth roadmap and on defining Advanced Analytics projects.
Collaborate with Department Leaders on defining and reporting metrics for analytics growth.
Collect and manage project ideas, charters, project priorities, and project benefit.
Provide Tableau training and BI best practices training, and host internal Tableau Use Group meetings.
Develop sophisticated advanced analytics models; including creating, validating, analyzing and explaining the data used for model development.
Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and analytics techniques.
Be a leading expert and organizational resource on developing and evaluating advanced analytics.
Develop processes to extract, clean, merge, transform and compile data from various data sources, including relational database, flat files, NoSQL databases and unstructured data.
Introduce improvements to increase the speed, accuracy and efficiency of advanced analytics across the organization.
Provide accurate, relevant and meaningful ad-hoc analysis to management to support strategic and tactical decision-making.
Create and present materials on data projects, data science architecture, and analytics strategies.
Qualifications
Required Qualifications:
Minimum three years of applicable job experience, with a proven ability to make process improvements.
Must be a highly-motivated self-starter and self-directed learner with a creative mind, high attention to detail and a solution-oriented outlook.
Management experience.
Bachelor’s degree.
Understanding of data analysis, report visualization and an understanding of structured and unstructured data types.
Understanding of data models and how they support key decisions and key performance indicators (KPI’s).
Proficiency with Microsoft Office suite.
Experience in creating executive/summary level dashboards and reports, integrating many data sources.
Proficient in Tableau with a strong understanding of advanced Tableau features and capabilities.
Preferred Qualifications:
Familiarity or experience with Salesforce, PowerBI, cloud storage and compute on Azure or AWS.
Experience with working with big data (Scala, Spark, Pig, Snowflake, Teradata).
Experience with, or deep understanding of, programming (R, Python, Java, or C#).
Experience with relational databases (SQL Server), graph databases (Neo4J), NoSQL databases (MongoDB) and unstructured data
Significant experience with, or deep understanding of, statistical techniques, modelling, and machine learning.
Experience with the operationalization and maintenance of analytics APIs.
Demonstrable in-depth understanding of data structures and ETL processes (including SSIS).
Experience with container deployments (Docker, Kubernetes, ECS).
Masters, PhD or DBA in Data Science, Computer Science, or related field.
Additional Job Board Information
PACCAR is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veteran/Disability.

Adaptable, open to change, and able to work in ambiguous situations and respond to new information or unexpected circumstances.

This position will also be required to create and maintain various adhoc reports to support the Investor Reporting Department.
Creating and maintaining various databases for reporting and tracking purposes. This will include, but is not limited to tracking, reconciling and reporting supplemental proceeds, losses, and tracking loss severities.
Collecting and reviewing data files, including Sale Files, Prefund Files and Loan Substitution Files to ensure Loan Accounting, Inventory Management and Investor Reporting has performed all necessary tasks prior to the stated cutoff.
Creating and maintaining Investor Reporting Policies and Procedures and creating process flows for all Investor Reporting processes.
Other duties or tasks as assigned by management.

Required:
Advanced proficiency with Excel, Access, and SQL skills.
Preferred:
Experience with Python.
Word, Accounting software, Internet software, MortgageServ and/or other mortgage servicing systems knowledge.
General organizational, problem solving, and strong communication skills.
Ability to amortize loan payments.

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. Data Associate
About The Chartis Group
The Chartis Group (Chartis) is a comprehensive advisory and analytics services firm dedicated to the healthcare industry. With an unparalleled depth of expertise in strategic planning, performance excellence, informatics and technology, and health analytics, we help leading academic medical centers, integrated delivery networks, children's hospitals and healthcare service organizations achieve transformative results.
We are comprised of uniquely experienced senior healthcare professionals and consultants who apply a distinctive knowledge of healthcare economics, markets, clinical models and technology to help each client address their most pressing issues. We question everything and apply thoughtful and rigorous analysis to each challenge, issue and opportunity.
We are lucky to have extraordinarily talented people working in our firm – all brought together around our unifying mission, a shared dedication to our core values, and the emphasis we place on creating an environment that enriches the experiences of our clients, our colleagues and our communities. In this way, we find that we are remarkably aligned with our clients. And that has made for achieving some truly great things.
The Chartis Group has offices in Atlanta, Boston, Chicago, New York, Minneapolis, and Nashville.
Role Overview
The Chartis Group’s Advanced Analytics Team is responsible for providing high quality data and analytic support to client engagements, internal research, and development initiatives within the firm. They apply advanced database management and sophisticated analytical tools and skills to derive compelling quantitative findings from large client, industry, and proprietary datasets.
The Data Associate will work directly with our consultants and clients to provide analytic support on a range of healthcare projects. This is an exciting opportunity for an innovative and quantitative thinker who is passionate about healthcare to help develop the analytical capabilities of our rapidly growing firm.
Responsibilities
Participate in the entire project lifecycle – from requirements definition and scoping, through execution. During this time, you will work with both project teams and clients to define and fulfill data and analytic requests.
Perform complex analysis (e.g., merging multiple datasets for new insights into relationships between variables) and provide data and analytic support to Chartis consulting engagement teams
Thoroughly QA and cleanse raw datasets, ensuring accuracy of your deliverables
Build new datasets to maximize utility using advanced data management and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Excel, Alteryx, R, SQL, Python, Snowflake, etc.)
Execute core analytics for a range of client engagements (e.g., strategy, performance improvement, digital health)
Develop impactful data analytics and visualizations including mapping using business intelligence software (e.g. Tableau)
Document analytic methodologies and approaches
Codify datasets and outputs into client-ready deliverables and transfer to project teams/clients
Support the analytic and research needs of Chartis’ internal firm teams and practice areas, including contributing to practice development initiatives, whitepaper development, training, and knowledge management initiatives
Qualifications & Desired Skills
Bachelor’s degree in a related field such as mathematics, statistics, computer science, or engineering
At least 2-3 years data analytics experience, ideally in a professional services firm or healthcare provider setting
Strong Tableau skills (Desktop/Creator) required. Experience with Tableau Server and Tableau Prep is greatly preferred.
Experience with data visualization, mapping and data cleansing
Ability to create dashboards from a variety of data sources
Familiarity with SQL and managing large data sets (>1M rows) required; additional experience with Snowflake, SAS, Alteryx and/or similar programs preferred.
Familiarity with healthcare data (e.g., claims data, hospital reporting data, or clinical decision support data) and analytics preferred
Proficiency with MS Office applications
Strong work and time management skills; able to work effectively under tight timelines and adapt to shifting priorities, in both individual and team settings
Open to learning new software programs as needed for new types of projects or client engagements
Comfortable working with consulting colleagues, including clearly communicating analytic findings in the context of client engagements
At The Chartis Group, we pride ourselves on having a diverse workforce. We value and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals and the different perspectives the provide. We offer equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, or protected veteran status.
Atlanta | Boston | Chicago | Minneapolis | New York | San Francisco

positionName: Human Resource HRIS Analyst (Remote Long Term Contract)
description:
Open up to the Possibilities!
Working at Purolator International, Inc. is more than a job. It's an opportunity to be part of a winning team and to contribute to the success of our growing company. Purolator International is a subsidiary of Purolator Inc., Canada's largest integrated freight and parcel solutions company with over 50 years of delivering reliable, efficient and cost-effective shipping to, from and within Canada for more than 210 countries and territories worldwide. We are the leading provider of cross-border logistics between the United States and Canada. This is an exciting and evolving industry and we’re leading the change as we strive to deliver the future. Purolator International is rapidly expanding throughout the United States and seeking talented individuals to join our team. Are you open to the possibilities?
Successful applicants for this position must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment, subject to reasonable accommodation, including state/province and federal law. If you have questions, please feel free to ask during your interview.
SHIFT: Full Time, Monday - Friday, 8:30 am - 5:00 pm (some overtime may be necessary as needed)
ASSIGNMENT: This is a long term contract role, expected to last through March 2023. Come March 2023, we will re-evaluate the needs of the assignment and will evaluate any possibility for a permanent placement within the organization under the Human Resource division. For the duration of the contract assignment, we will be offering healthcare benefits, 401k eligibility and paid time off.
LOCATION: Remote
Job Summary:
The HRIS Analyst (Long Term Contract) is a Human Resource position reporting into the Corporate HR Manager. This position is responsible for the effective maintenance and ongoing management of the HRIS/Payroll System, UKG (formerly UltiPro).
This position is also responsible for reporting, analytics and day to day system troubleshooting and compliance. The HRIS Specialist is responsible for serving as the functional expert for the organization's HRIS/Payroll system and provide outstanding support to ensure data integrity and accuracy for all HRIS/Payroll transactions, procedures, report writing, and processes. The HRIS Specialist will partner with HR Reps and Payroll to collaborate on projects and daily priorities including but not limited to organization/position management , employee onboarding, payroll, benefits administration and dash boarding/analytics.
Experience Required In Order To Be Considered:
5-7 years related professional experience in a similar role
Understanding and/or experience in multiple disciplines of Human Resources and Benefits required
Experience with UKG report building and presenting metrics to management required
Advanced Microsoft Excel User
Must thrive in a fast-paced environment with competing priorities and provide the necessary attention to the details required in HRIS and Payroll administration
Understanding of HR functions outside of the Analyst role (i.e. Benefits, Policy, Staffing, etc).
Daily Functions:
System Administrator for the ongoing configuration, integrations, and management of HRIS/Payroll System, UKG
Actively seek out knowledge on system modules and functionality
Act as Security Administrator responsible for all phases of system security including user/role updates, password resets and role review audits
Create and maintains monthly metrics for HR dashboard
Seek continuous improvement to consistently research new metrics and analytics
Evaluate, test, and implement HRIS/Payroll system enhancements, upgrades and troubleshooting
Analyze data and provide analytical reports to internal customers on a weekly, monthly and quarterly basis
Leads the day-to-day functional workflow including providing the HR/Payroll department team members with leadership, direction, and training, as well as leading continuous process improvement initiatives
Understands system requirements and ensures administration of data alignment with HRIS, Payroll and legal requirements
Assure company compliance with ACA reporting, EEO, payroll/tax updates, company audits and other laws and mandates that arise
Responsible for open enrollment participation, online session development, plan structure updates, feed file management, plan and rate updates and daily benefits reporting and auditing
Serves as company liaison and system administrator to UKG
Identify, understand, and communicate all UKG updates, events, problems and solutions to HR/Payroll Dept.
Dvelope UKG tutorials and trair users upon request
Set up demos and recommend adoption of future UKG enhancements
Responsible for transmission of biweekly 401k contribution and participant files
Works with users to support functionality and troubleshoot system-related problems Carry out other duties as appropriate and as assigned by his/her Manager

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Requirements:
Must be able to independently prioritize assignments based on urgency and communicate timelines effectively, Strong follow up skills
Must be able to handle highly sensitive data with confidentiality
Must be able to identify areas of improvement and develop creative solutions
Must be able to identify system glitches, inaccurate set ups and troubleshoot effectively
Superior organization skills, quality and accuracy on all functions
Ability to analyze and interpret complex documents
Strong time and project management skills
Strong customer service mindset
Strong computer skills, including Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Outlook
Education and/ or Work Experience Requirements
Preferred BA/BS degree in Human Resources or related degree, or equivalent in experience
POSTING DETAILS
Posting Number: 51232
Hours of Work: Mon. - Fri., 8:30 AM - 5 PM
Job Code: 960
Location: Open to various locations
Reports to: Manager, Corp. HR
Working Conditions: Office Environment

Conversion Data Analyst
Full Time/Direct Hire
Renton, WA (hybrid environment-some onsite for implementations)

The conversion data analyst has expertise working with different kinds of data, data validation, reporting, interfaces, and has ERP implementation experience where they were responsible for pulling data from one system and adding into the new system.

Prepare and present recurring and ad-hoc reports, queries, BI, and analysis that support strategic decision-making by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing data and trends.

Leverage tools to deliver actionable insights, identify critical metrics and develop and/or automate reports in the most effective medium.
Proactively analyze financial, production, productivity, performance, and other data to answer key questions.
Identify and investigate reporting processes that are inefficient, identifying reporting automation opportunities, implementing streamlined reporting processes, and ensuring data integrity via validation to achieve measurable gains in data quality and report development time frames.
Serve as a team member on projects to create new reports, data solutions, and software applications based on self-derived insights or business needs (i.e. gather requirements, document processes, and complete implementation tasks.)
Effectively communicate and interface with management and personnel from a variety of disciplines including operations and IT.
Assist with implementations and upgrades to the ERP systems in the areas of data migration, data validation, system configuration, table sharing, and documentation.
Qualifications: :
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration/MIS/Logistics or a related discipline and a minimum of 6 years of experience in business systems, supply chain, application development, or similar.
Working knowledge of Infor ERP business software applications
Familiarity with SQL Server and SSRS.
Very strong analytical ability, attention to detail, strong judgment, and problem analysis techniques.
Experience with data mining, analysis, and reporting.
Strong interpersonal skills-must be able to lead and work successfully on a team.
Ability to solve complex systems problems quickly with fragmented technical guidance.

positionName: Market Data Insights Analyst, Mexico - Apple Music
description:
Summary
Posted: Sep 28, 2021
Role Number: 200288720
Do you love music? Movies? Are you passionate about analyzing data? We do! As part of the Evaluation & A/B team, you will be a market expert for our Apple Music and Apple TV service. We represent the user’s perspective as they vet new features being introduced to Apple Music and Apple TV. Our day-to-day responsibilities will include reviewing data, analyzing data, and creating innovative ideas to help improve Apple search features, and reporting systematic issues to statisticians and engineers. We are looking for someone who is just as passionate about movies and tv as we are! This individual must have native or fluency in Spanish.
Key Qualifications
Demonstrated experience analyzing large data sets and generating reports that identify patterns for Apple Music
Works well with cross-functional teams, Engineers/Data Scientists who build complex algorithms
Ability to work effectively in a team environment with exceptional interpersonal skills
Technical - strong quantitative skills, including analytical abilities and math proficiency
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Solid verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work successfully with teams on multiple projects under tight deadlines
High attention to detail
Willingness to be proactive in bringing new, innovative ideas to the table
Required: Native or fluent in a regional language: Spanish.
Experience with data, financial, or business analysis using SQL, macros, etc.
Experience with search and recommendations engines
Experience working in the music or movies/tv space
Description
This person will be accountable for the day-to-day analysis for their market, and ensuring timely completion of projects. Supervise the quality of ratings for external vendors, collaborate and provide feedback to vendor PMs Create high quality reports analyzing the issues and patterns for your market and provide feedback to managers, statisticians, and engineers Train and lead fellow Analysts, help improve overall team growth Collaborate with Statisticians and Engineers to evaluate and analyze Apple’s search algorithms and data, and identify opportunities for improvement Vet new relevance algorithms and features by rating pages and providing feedback to the engineers for improvement Use metrics and query logs to uncover relevance and data issues and suggest changes to algorithms Work cross-functionally to help resolve search and recommendations issues
Education & Experience
BA/BS or equivalent industry experience
Additional Requirements

positionName: AI/ML - Business Intelligence Analyst, Annotation Operations
description:
Summary
Posted: Aug 16, 2021
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:200268002
Do you love thinking analytically? Are you passionate about solving complex business problems in a fast-paced environment? Apple’s AI/ML Annotation Operations team is looking for a highly motivated analyst with proven experience in business planning, forecasting, analytics, and operations. As part of the capacity planning team, you’ll play an integral role in driving efficiency and financial health for the AI/ML organization. In this role you will engage with teams across Apple’s AI/ML ecosystem with the ultimate goal of delivering high-quality annotated data that meet each team’s needs. You will be responsible for converting internal customer annotations projects into quantitative demand requirements, and assembling and executing on the capacity plan necessary to deliver. Being successful at Annotations Capacity Planning means that teams all across Apple, working on unreleased products and/or existing beloved features, will come to rely on you to meet their annotations needs with high quality, cost-effective, and timely annotated data.
Key Qualifications
5+ years of experience in a Forecasting, Planning, Data Analyst, or Data Science role
Experience with using large scale data analytics in service of solving complex business problems
Proficiency with data visualization tools such as Tableau for analysis, insight, and presentation
Ability to condense complex concepts and analysis into clear and concise takeaways that drive action
Superb communication and presentation skills with meticulous attention to detail
Strong time management skills with ability to work to under tight deadlines for executive requests
Excellent in teamwork and relationship building. Not above doing whatever it takes to get the job done.
Self-directed and proactive. You thrive in an ambiguous and fast-paced environment.
Description
You are an experienced business analyst who loves working with people across technical and non-technical domains to solve problems and deliver results. In this role you’ll have a chance to lean on all of your technical and people skills while engaging with teams across Apple’s ecosystem who are working on cutting-edge machine learning technology. You will work with teams in operations, engineering, and program management to forecast demand, develop capacity plans, and partner in the execution of annotations projects on a daily basis that support Apple’s machine learning and AI efforts. You will work with client engagement and program planning to gather data and prepare projects for execution. You will partner with data engineering to improve project execution automation, analytics, and reporting. You will communicate performance trends to leaders on a weekly and quarterly basis, highlighting opportunities to drive further efficiency.
Education & Experience
Bachelor's or Masters degree in economics, mathematics, engineering/computer science, or other relevant field that demonstrates quantitative skill.
Additional Requirements

positionName: (Fully Remote $25/hr.+) Data Analyst For Globally Recognized Company Based In Seattle, WA
description:
Equivalent Experience

Job Description:
One of the globally recognized eCommerce company based in Seattle, WA is seeking an enthusiastic, independent individual to join the Retail Operations and Initiatives team as a Catalog Data Analyst (Catalog Specialist). The Catalog Specialist will help support a Retail program that aims to reduce purchase order defects, improve product receive efficiency, and increase selection through improved awareness of selling partner package hierarchy. Responsibilities of the catalog specialist include guiding selling partners through program onboarding stages, executing catalog updates to support onboarding, and reporting on onboarding progress/next steps. Catalog specialists for this role should be comfortable working with multiple systems and have a strong attention to detail. In addition, they should be comfortable communicating to a variety of internal and external stakeholders and have experience in program management.

Requirements:

5+ years of experience within data analytics (fields within retail or ecommerce highly preferred, not a must have)
Experience pulling data and managing data
SQL experience highly welcomed
Experience working with vendors
Program manager experience (preferred, not a must have)
Ability to draft processes
Experience with catalog systems (highly preferred, not a must have)
Comfortability with Excel and reporting
Bachelor's Degree (preferred degrees would be Business Management, but open to others)

Pay: $25/hr.~$27/hr.
Shift: Flexible. Team works with another team in India. Flexibility to have morning phone calls as early as 7 AM (PST) but not every day
Location: FULLY REMOTE (HQ based in Seattle, WA but candidates from other states welcomed)
Awesome Team Culture : Fantastic team culture. Team has wine and snack Wednesdays at the end of the day. Even in virtual, they try to organize team events on regular basis at least once a quarter. Monthly game nights, to connect as team. Pretty inclusive and get along pretty well and stay pretty close as they can in virtual setting.
***Exceptional opportunity to join one of the most innovative and globally recognized top eCommerce corporation in the world.***
***We have many clients and companies that are always looking for great candidates in general. Especially within this globally recognized client as well. positionName: Senior Data Analyst Talent Acquisition (TA) PSJH
description:
Providence is calling a Senior Data Analyst Talent Acquisition (TA). This position is virtual and open to Candidates residing in Alaska, Washington, Montana, Oregon, California or Texas.
Applicants that meet qualifications will receive a text with a additional questions from our Modern Hire system.
We are seeking a Senior Data Analyst Talent Acquisition (TA) PSJH who will provide strategic consultation, insights, analysis and reports by leveraging solutions and systems data, market and competitive intelligence and benchmarking research to support Talent Acquisition with strategic planning and decisions, TA success measurements/metrics/results/ROI and business outcomes. Regularly identifies, designs and conducts quantitative and qualitative analysis of talent acquisition data to reveal critical insights, enable actionable decisions, develop strategies, adjust tactics and tell the story of the value of the TA function. The TA Senior Data Analyst focuses on enterprise efforts and maintains "expert" status in recruitment and marketing data and reporting capabilities of the systems, solutions and vendors. This role also creates and applies technical expertise in building reporting infrastructure and advancing capabilities and maturity of the insights and intelligence function.
This position identifies, designs and conducts quantitative and qualitative analysis of enterprise wide talent acquisition strategies and partners with HRIS to make connections to the people strategy. Performs all duties in a manner that promotes a team concept and reflects the PSJH mission and core values.
In this position you will have the following responsibilities:
Provide analysis and reporting for of Talent Acquisition data for the purpose of strategic planning and decision-making by TA, HR PSJH leaders and executives. Enables TA and HR leaders to tell the story of the value of TA and the hiring of talent through data and competitive intelligence.
Work with HR staff and other customers to analyze and satisfy data requests through production of established intelligence or utilization of various tools and applications to develop new intelligence. Works with HR, Finance, Marketing, and TA vendors to analyze data using various systems, data sources and benchmarking research to develop new intelligence and insights to support TA.
Ensure validity of data including identifying and reconciling discrepancies in intelligence from multiple reporting sources and/or systems and/or conducting period audits to improve data quality.
Identify, design, and document process workflows, data models, system decisions, designs and procedures related to TA information systems and related functions.
Create new value and maintains credibility and strong relationships with TA stakeholders, including hiring managers, recruiting teams, and HR leaders.
Proactively seek out benchmarking and best practice sharing opportunities and implements industry best practices for accessing, analyzing and disseminating data.
Lead critical initiatives and projects to improve data and insights and serves as project lead or work stream lead on major informational projects that involve TA data.
Educate users of TA intelligence on how to access, utilize and discuss TA information, including group and one-on-one training.
Provide reviews, assessments and recommendations for tools and technologies used to generate reports or streamline processes.
Investigate, resolve and perform follow-up tasks on complex system and data related problems as needed.
Qualifications:
Required qualifications for this position include:
Bachelor's Degree in any related field or equivalent education/experience.
5 years related experience.
Experience in an HR, TA, Finance, Sales, Retail, Supply Chain, Technology or Marketing or other business environment working with data reporting, analytics and insights consultation.
Experience in an HR TA, marketing or healthcare environment and data.
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques.
Experience extracting and analyzing data using a variety of enterprise reporting tools and data sources (Examples SQL, Tableau, Oracle Business Intelligence (OBIEE), Crystal Reports, ATS, CRMS and Microsoft BI).
Experience presenting and communicating outcome-based analyses to senior leaders for strategic planning and decision making.
Demonstrated proficiency in influencing and negotiating.
Experience educating others on basic data analytical techniques and concepts.
Experience leading complex projects through an established project management methodology
About the department you will serve.
Providence Shared Services provides a variety of functional and system support services for our Providence family of organizations across Alaska, California, Montana, New Mexico, Oregon, Texas and Washington. We are focused on supporting our Mission by delivering a robust foundation of services and sharing of specialized expertise.
We offer comprehensive, best-in-class benefits to our caregivers. For more information, visit
https://www.providenceiscalling.jobs/rewards-benefits/
Our Mission
As expressions of God’s healing love, witnessed through the ministry of Jesus, we are steadfast in serving all, especially those who are poor and vulnerable.
About Us
Providence is a comprehensive not-for-profit network of hospitals, care centers, health plans, physicians, clinics, home health care and services continuing a more than 100-year tradition of serving the poor and vulnerable. Providence is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Providence does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, disability, veteran, military status, religion, age, creed, national origin, sexual identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, genetic information, or any other basis prohibited by local, state, or federal law.

positionName: Sr Analyst, Business Analysis - Media Performance Analytics
description:
Media Performance Analytics is a high-profile team of thought leaders and problem solvers who apply rigorous analytics to help assess and steer T-Mobile’s paid media spend, driving business growth through our media investments. We combine our ability to dive into the data with sharp business acumen – we understand the drivers of performance through every stage of the funnel and advise senior leadership on key media investment decisions. Are ready to unleash your intellectual curiosity to write the next chapter of the Un-carrier?
We are looking for a driven and analytical team member who is passionate about delivering business value – and determining how paid media investments can best deliver that value. You will conduct fast-paced analysis for one or more of our paid media channels campaigns in driving high-quality prospective customers forward in the purchase funnel and resulting in incremental enterprise value. You will regularly deliver and present to executive leadership actionable, data-driven recommendations that optimize T-Mobile’s marketing efficiency and deliver business performance.
At T-Mobile, we strongly encourage everyone, including people of color, veterans, military spouses, individuals with disabilities, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and non-binary people, and parents to apply. We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome everyone to our team. If you are an individual with a disability and need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know by emailing ApplicantAccommodation@t-mobile.com or calling 1-844-873-9500. Please note, this contact channel is not a means to apply for or inquire about a position and we are unable to respond to non-accommodation related requests.
At least 18 years of age
Legally authorized to work in the United States
High School Diploma or GED
T-Mobile requires all employees in this position to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 prior to starting work. The CDC defines "fully vaccinated" as two weeks after the second dose for Pfizer and Moderna, and two weeks after the single dose of Johnson & Johnson. T-Mobile will require proof of vaccination and consider requests for exemption from this requirement during the offer phase as a reasonable accommodation for medical reasons or sincerely held religious beliefs where the accommodation would not cause T-Mobile undue hardship or pose a direct threat to the health and safety of others.
#LI-BW23
2+ years of professional experience in analytics, strategy, or management consulting roles
Proficient in SQL and comfortable with efficiently querying large databases (experience with one or more media platforms is a plus)
Ability to structure ambiguous problems in a complex media portfolio and develop data-driven insights
Ability to collaborate with and influence others on business outcomes with fact-based recommendations
Ability to communicate analytical and quantitative subjects clearly across audience types (subject-matter-expert and non-technical) and levels (peers and executives)
Excellent prioritization skills, self-motivation and the capacity to work under tight deadlines
Willingness to learn and develop new analytical skills and approaches in a fast growing, dynamic business
Relevant experience preferred in one or more of: telecommunications, consumer electronics, finance, or subscription business
Education
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (Master’s degree is a plus)
Marketing-related specialization/coursework is a plus
Okay. You've seen what we're looking for and you're up to the challenge. Here's what we can offer you in exchange for your outstanding work:
Competitive base pay plus annual bonus potential
Benefits for part-time and full-time associates
Medical, dental and vision benefits
Matching 401(k)
An annual Employee Stock Grant, and a purchase plan that gives you the chance to grab TMUS stock at a discount
Generous paid time-off programs
Phone service discounts
Education reimbursement
Serious growth potential for your career!
This is the opportunity to do something special and be part of a company revolutionizing the wireless industry. And we couldn’t do it without someone like you. So, what do you say? Isn’t it time you explored what could become the career move of a lifetime? We invite you to apply today!
Own analysis of paid media investment in one or more channels (e.g. Search, Social, Display) supporting T-Mobile’s key initiatives such as Un-carrier moves, demand gen offers, and brand campaigns
Provide strong decision support and robust recommendations to business owners based on data-driven analysis, conducting high-profile analysis and delivering data narratives across business groups
Measure the value of our media investments through attribution of media exposure to prospective customer online and offline actions, and reading incrementality test results
Support construction of executive level presentations and present complex analytical findings in clear, concise, and decision-impacting manner
Develop and lead positive, constructive collaborations with one or more cross-functional teams
Help to build standing visualizations (e.g., Tableau, PowerBI) for ongoing monitoring and self-service for key stakeholders
Equal Employment Opportunity

We take equal opportunity seriously—by choice.

T-Mobile USA, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All decisions concerning the employment relationship will be made without regard to age, race, ethnicity, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, religious affiliation, marital status, citizenship status, veteran status, the presence of any physical or mental disability, or any other status or characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. Discrimination, retaliation or harassment based upon any of these factors is wholly inconsistent with how we do business and will not be tolerated.

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.
Equal Opportunity Employer
WNE is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce, providing equal employment and advancement opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Location. Remote – United States
We give you a world of potential.
Computershare has an exciting opportunity for a Data Systems Analyst with our team.
This is a great opportunity to begin a career with an industry leader in mortgage servicing solutions for the financial services and investment banking industries.
A role you will love
As a Data Systems Analyst you will be responsible for producing and tracking the day to day flow of various reports and Servicing Agreements along with updating and maintaining Policies and Procedures. This position will also be required to create and maintain various adhoc reports to support the Investor Reporting Department.
Creating and maintaining various databases for reporting and tracking purposes. This will include, but is not limited to tracking, reconciling and reporting supplemental proceeds, losses, and tracking loss severities.
Collecting and reviewing data files, including Sale Files, Prefund Files and Loan Substitution Files to ensure Loan Accounting, Inventory Management and Investor Reporting has performed all necessary tasks prior to the stated cutoff.
Creating and maintaining Investor Reporting Policies and Procedures and creating process flows for all Investor Reporting processes.
Other duties or tasks as assigned by management.

What we need from you
Required:
Advanced proficiency with Excel, Access, and SQL skills.
Preferred:
Experience with Python.
Word, Accounting software, Internet software, MortgageServ and/or other mortgage servicing systems knowledge.
General organizational, problem solving, and strong communication skills.
Ability to amortize loan payments.
Key qualifications
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Education and Experience
Required:
High school diploma or general education degree (GED).
Preferred:
Bachelor’s Degree in accounting, finance or related field preferred, or equivalent work experience
Experience working on a team or in cross-functional work groups, project management and/or process improvement.
Experience with Investor Reporting.
A company to be proud of
Computershare (ASX:CPU) is a world leader in financial administration with over 12,000 employees across 21 different countries delivering expertise to over 25,000 clients. At Computershare, it’s more than just a job, our open and inclusive culture means that we will help you to grow, to move forward and make the most of the world of opportunities we have available. With infinite possibilities, we could take you anywhere. #worldofpotential
Rewards designed for you
Employee Share Plan. Set aside salary to purchase shares in our company and you’ll increase your investment when you receive a generous company contribution towards additional shares.
Health and Wellbeing. Our health and wellbeing rewards can be tailored to support you and your family.
Save for Your Future. We will support you along your retirement savings journey.
Paid time away from work. Our employees enjoy a competitive paid time off package, including a day each year to volunteer time for a good cause that is important to you.
Employee Discounts. We’ve partnered with other organisations to offer you extra savings. Enjoy discounts with banks, car manufacturers, on flights, accommodation and days out as well as with many big brand shops.
Extra Rewards. From tuition reimbursement to cash bonus recruitment referral programs, our comprehensive benefits package offers a multitude of options.
Compensation. Colorado based candidates $70,000 - $85,000 per year.
A diverse and inclusive place to work
Computershare celebrates the diversity of our people, and we welcome applications from everyone.
We believe that having a culture of inclusion is essential in delivering good results. Attracting, retaining, and developing a diverse workforce where employees feel valued, respected, and empowered allows people to reach their full potential. As a business this diversity helps us to better reflect and understand.
Covid-secure
We’ve kept our business running during the pandemic by moving most of our employees to remote working, and by creating and maintaining a safe environment for those people who need to be in the office. We carefully limit the amount of people at our locations and ensure that those who cannot work remotely are kept safe with proper distancing and protective equipment.
In most circumstances we are currently performing all interviews, assessments, and background checks online to ensure the safety of everyone involved. Should you be successful in securing a role and it can be performed from home, we will arrange for equipment to be sent to you and your onboarding and training will be provided remotely.

American Specialty Health Incorporated is seeking a Business Analyst II to join our Customer Service – Fitness department. This position will be the liaison between the Product Owners, Business Owners (i.e. Fitness Call Center), IT managers, and developers and will also lead the Fitness Systems Workgroup.
Remote Worker Considerations:
Candidates who are selected for this position will be trained remotely and must be able to work from home in a designated work area with company-provided technology equipment.
Responsibilities
Functions as the technical liaison for the Fitness Call Center and Fitness Operations teams partnering with development groups and product owners for the various Fitness applications.
Maintains working knowledge in areas of assigned responsibility including, but not limited to, IHIS, ASHCore, FMS, Incentive Platforms and processes, Websites, EDI, Payment Processing Vendors, and Reporting.
Maintains in-depth knowledge and expertise in Fitness Call Center processes, programs, and technology interdependencies.
Uses SQL to help build queries to analyze issues reported.
Reviews and reports on vendor inquiries and issues, chart trends and presents analysis
Assists Product Owner with creating talking points when vendor updates and/or data issues occur
Represents the Fitness Call Center and Operations teams in all Fitness product planning and development meetings
Supports Call Center implementation team activities by maintaining constant communication with stakeholders and assisting with technology and data deliverables.
Supports workgroup and project team meetings and prepares related documents as necessary.
Maintains follow up to ensure timely and accurate completion of assignments.
Fitness Systems Issues (FSI) Workgroup Facilitator
Document system bugs, errors, and solutions
Coordinate with business owners and product owners to resolve issues impacting members and/or Fitness Call Center and Operation teams
Recognize unique or problem situations within areas of assigned responsibility.
Research and formulate solutions in conjunction with the FSI Workgroup members
Partner with Fitness stakeholders to prioritize work items based on severity, effort, and member impact
Maintain FSI Workgroup issues tracker and solicit regular progress updates.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Information Management, Business, or equivalent experience. If equivalent experience, high school diploma required.
Minimum 3 years of experience working with software development teams.
Familiar with all phases of the software development life cycle from requirements to the release and maintenance of enterprise level applications.
Familiarity with agile development methodologies (Scrum methodology preferred).
Proficient in VSTS, SQL, and MS Office.
Demonstrated ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical staff in order to gather necessary details.
Ability to create business and system process diagrams.
Ability to facilitate and manage meetings.
Core Competencies
Demonstrated ability to interact in a positive, respectful manner and establish and maintain cooperative working relationships.
Ability to display excellent customer service to meet the needs and expectations of both internal and external customers.
Excellent listening and interpersonal communication skills to identify critical core competencies based on success factors and organizational environment.
Ability to effectively organize, prioritize, multi-task and manage time.
Demonstrated accuracy and productivity in a changing environment with constant interruptions.
Demonstrated ability to analyze information, problems, issues, situations and procedures to develop effective solutions.
Ability to exercise strict confidentiality in all matters.
Mobility
Primarily sedentary, able to sit for long periods of time.
Physical Requirements
Ability to speak, see and hear other personnel and/or objects. Ability to communicate both in verbal and written form. Ability to travel within the facility. Capable of using a telephone and computer keyboard. Ability to lift up to 10 lbs.
Environmental Conditions
Usual office setting.
This job posting is not applicable in CO.

positionName: Sr Analyst, Business Analysis - Media Performance Analytics
description:
Media Performance Analytics is a high-profile team of thought leaders and problem solvers who apply rigorous analytics to help assess and steer T-Mobile’s paid media spend, driving business growth through our media investments. We combine our ability to dive into the data with sharp business acumen – we understand the drivers of performance through every stage of the funnel and advise senior leadership on key media investment decisions. Are ready to unleash your intellectual curiosity to write the next chapter of the Un-carrier?
We are looking for a driven and analytical team member who is passionate about delivering business value – and determining how paid media investments can best deliver that value. You will conduct fast-paced analysis for one or more of our paid media channels campaigns in driving high-quality prospective customers forward in the purchase funnel and resulting in incremental enterprise value. You will regularly deliver and present to executive leadership actionable, data-driven recommendations that optimize T-Mobile’s marketing efficiency and deliver business performance.
At T-Mobile, we strongly encourage everyone, including people of color, veterans, military spouses, individuals with disabilities, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and non-binary people, and parents to apply. We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome everyone to our team. If you are an individual with a disability and need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know by emailing ApplicantAccommodation@t-mobile.com or calling 1-844-873-9500. Please note, this contact channel is not a means to apply for or inquire about a position and we are unable to respond to non-accommodation related requests.
At least 18 years of age
Legally authorized to work in the United States
High School Diploma or GED
T-Mobile requires all employees in this position to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 prior to starting work. The CDC defines "fully vaccinated" as two weeks after the second dose for Pfizer and Moderna, and two weeks after the single dose of Johnson & Johnson. T-Mobile will require proof of vaccination and consider requests for exemption from this requirement during the offer phase as a reasonable accommodation for medical reasons or sincerely held religious beliefs where the accommodation would not cause T-Mobile undue hardship or pose a direct threat to the health and safety of others.
#LI-BW23

Own analysis of paid media investment in one or more channels (e.g. Search, Social, Display) supporting T-Mobile’s key initiatives such as Un-carrier moves, demand gen offers, and brand campaigns

description:
Equivalent Experience

Job Description:
One of the globally recognized eCommerce company based in Seattle, WA is seeking an enthusiastic, independent individual to join the Retail Operations and Initiatives team as a Catalog Data Analyst (Catalog Specialist). The Catalog Specialist will help support a Retail program that aims to reduce purchase order defects, improve product receive efficiency, and increase selection through improved awareness of selling partner package hierarchy. Responsibilities of the catalog specialist include guiding selling partners through program onboarding stages, executing catalog updates to support onboarding, and reporting on onboarding progress/next steps. Catalog specialists for this role should be comfortable working with multiple systems and have a strong attention to detail. In addition, they should be comfortable communicating to a variety of internal and external stakeholders and have experience in program management.

Experience working with vendors

Ability to draft processes
Experience with catalog systems (highly preferred, not a must have)
Comfortability with Excel and reporting
Bachelor's Degree (preferred degrees would be Business Management, but open to others)

positionName: Market Data Insights Analyst, Mexico - Apple Music
description:

Posted: Sep 28, 2021

Do you love music? Movies? Are you passionate about analyzing data? We do! As part of the Evaluation & A/B team, you will be a market expert for our Apple Music and Apple TV service. We represent the user’s perspective as they vet new features being introduced to Apple Music and Apple TV. Our day-to-day responsibilities will include reviewing data, analyzing data, and creating innovative ideas to help improve Apple search features, and reporting systematic issues to statisticians and engineers. We are looking for someone who is just as passionate about movies and tv as we are! This individual must have native or fluency in Spanish.

Solid verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work successfully with teams on multiple projects under tight deadlines
High attention to detail
Willingness to be proactive in bringing new, innovative ideas to the table
Required: Native or fluent in a regional language: Spanish.
Experience with data, financial, or business analysis using SQL, macros, etc.
Experience with search and recommendations engines
Experience working in the music or movies/tv space
Description
This person will be accountable for the day-to-day analysis for their market, and ensuring timely completion of projects. Supervise the quality of ratings for external vendors, collaborate and provide feedback to vendor PMs Create high quality reports analyzing the issues and patterns for your market and provide feedback to managers, statisticians, and engineers Train and lead fellow Analysts, help improve overall team growth Collaborate with Statisticians and Engineers to evaluate and analyze Apple’s search algorithms and data, and identify opportunities for improvement Vet new relevance algorithms and features by rating pages and providing feedback to the engineers for improvement Use metrics and query logs to uncover relevance and data issues and suggest changes to algorithms Work cross-functionally to help resolve search and recommendations issues
Education & Experience
BA/BS or equivalent industry experience
Additional Requirements

positionName: AI/ML - Business Intelligence Analyst, Annotation Operations
description:
Summary
Posted: Aug 16, 2021
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:200268002
Do you love thinking analytically? Are you passionate about solving complex business problems in a fast-paced environment? Apple’s AI/ML Annotation Operations team is looking for a highly motivated analyst with proven experience in business planning, forecasting, analytics, and operations. As part of the capacity planning team, you’ll play an integral role in driving efficiency and financial health for the AI/ML organization. In this role you will engage with teams across Apple’s AI/ML ecosystem with the ultimate goal of delivering high-quality annotated data that meet each team’s needs. You will be responsible for converting internal customer annotations projects into quantitative demand requirements, and assembling and executing on the capacity plan necessary to deliver. Being successful at Annotations Capacity Planning means that teams all across Apple, working on unreleased products and/or existing beloved features, will come to rely on you to meet their annotations needs with high quality, cost-effective, and timely annotated data.
Key Qualifications
5+ years of experience in a Forecasting, Planning, Data Analyst, or Data Science role
Experience with using large scale data analytics in service of solving complex business problems
Proficiency with data visualization tools such as Tableau for analysis, insight, and presentation
Ability to condense complex concepts and analysis into clear and concise takeaways that drive action
Superb communication and presentation skills with meticulous attention to detail
Strong time management skills with ability to work to under tight deadlines for executive requests
Excellent in teamwork and relationship building. Not above doing whatever it takes to get the job done.
Self-directed and proactive. You thrive in an ambiguous and fast-paced environment.
Description
You are an experienced business analyst who loves working with people across technical and non-technical domains to solve problems and deliver results. In this role you’ll have a chance to lean on all of your technical and people skills while engaging with teams across Apple’s ecosystem who are working on cutting-edge machine learning technology. You will work with teams in operations, engineering, and program management to forecast demand, develop capacity plans, and partner in the execution of annotations projects on a daily basis that support Apple’s machine learning and AI efforts. You will work with client engagement and program planning to gather data and prepare projects for execution. You will partner with data engineering to improve project execution automation, analytics, and reporting. You will communicate performance trends to leaders on a weekly and quarterly basis, highlighting opportunities to drive further efficiency.
Education & Experience
Bachelor's or Masters degree in economics, mathematics, engineering/computer science, or other relevant field that demonstrates quantitative skill.
Additional Requirements

The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.

Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).

We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. positionName: Human Resource HRIS Analyst (Remote Long Term Contract)
description:

Working at Purolator International, Inc. is more than a job. It's an opportunity to be part of a winning team and to contribute to the success of our growing company. Purolator International is a subsidiary of Purolator Inc., Canada's largest integrated freight and parcel solutions company with over 50 years of delivering reliable, efficient and cost-effective shipping to, from and within Canada for more than 210 countries and territories worldwide. We are the leading provider of cross-border logistics between the United States and Canada. This is an exciting and evolving industry and we’re leading the change as we strive to deliver the future. The HRIS Analyst (Long Term Contract) is a Human Resource position reporting into the Corporate HR Manager. This position is responsible for the effective maintenance and ongoing management of the HRIS/Payroll System, UKG (formerly UltiPro).
This position is also responsible for reporting, analytics and day to day system troubleshooting and compliance. The HRIS Specialist is responsible for serving as the functional expert for the organization's HRIS/Payroll system and provide outstanding support to ensure data integrity and accuracy for all HRIS/Payroll transactions, procedures, report writing, and processes. The HRIS Specialist will partner with HR Reps and Payroll to collaborate on projects and daily priorities including but not limited to organization/position management , employee onboarding, payroll, benefits administration and dash boarding/analytics.

Advanced Microsoft Excel User

Seek continuous improvement to consistently research new metrics and analytics

Understands system requirements and ensures administration of data alignment with HRIS, Payroll and legal requirements

Responsible for transmission of biweekly 401k contribution and participant files

Must be able to identify areas of improvement and develop creative solutions

Superior organization skills, quality and accuracy on all functions
Ability to analyze and interpret complex documents
Strong time and project management skills
Strong customer service mindset
Strong computer skills, including Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Outlook

A diverse and inclusive place to work
Computershare celebrates the diversity of our people, and we welcome applications from everyone.

Covid-secure
We’ve kept our business running during the pandemic by moving most of our employees to remote working, and by creating and maintaining a safe environment for those people who need to be in the office. Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.
Equal Opportunity Employer
WNE is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce, providing equal employment and advancement opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Overview:

WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
TDS is excited to share a newly created opportunity for a Senior Business Intelligence (BI) Data Analyst. If you are naturally curious, have strong problem-solving skills and can drive for results, come join our team!
WHO IS TDS?
TDS is a diversified Fortune 1000® national technology and communications services company. TDS provides wireless products and services; cable and wireline broadband, TV and voice services; and hosted and managed amenities throughout the country via our U.S. Cellular, TDS Telecom, OneNeck IT Solutions and Suttle-Straus brands.
LOCATION
We are open to filling this position REMOTELY or once safe, in any of our physical office locations: Madison, WI; Chicago, IL; Eden Prairie, MN; Urbandale, IA; Omaha, NE; Knoxville, TN; Denver, CO or Scottsdale, AZ.
Responsibilities:

WHAT WILL THE SR. DATA ANALYST DO?
Conduct detailed data analysis, proactively and as planned, on data (corporate supported) used across business units to evaluate business processes and improve on/create new analytic and reporting features
Respond to data and product related inquiries in real-time to support business and technical teams
Perform various data analytics using established company toolsets, statistical models, or other approved industry accepted tools
Provide expertise and translate the business needs to design; and develop tools, techniques, and metrics, and dashboards for insights and data visualization
Provide expertise in data storytelling, leading mentoring sessions, and training.
Consult with users and stakeholders to provide advisory services in relation to analysis and data storytelling.

Qualifications:

WHAT SKILLS & EXPERIENCE DO YOU NEED?
Bachelor’s degree -OR- 4+ years equivalent experience
5+ years experience in a data analyst, financial analyst or similar position; preferably with experience working in report creation, modeling, and trend forecasting
2+ years related IT experience
2+ years experience using data sets to build predictive models (e.g., logistic regression, decision tree)
Proficiency with analytics, querying and visualization tools (i.e. Power BI, SPSS, SAS, SQL, or Tableau)
WHAT SETS US APART FROM OUR COMPETITION?
TDS has a strong set of values and behaviors that help foster a high-performance culture.
We believe in partnering with local communities throughout the country and encourage all employees to participate in volunteer opportunities
TDS was recognized by Madison Magazine as one of the “Best Places to Work”
We make employee development and training a top priority
TDS promotes a healthy life / work balance in a professional, yet casual work atmosphere that values diversity and strong business ethics
Flexible work culture, wellness programs, tuition reimbursement, certification support, continuing education and more!
#TDS offers a competitive salary and strong total rewards package. To learn more about this position, or our company, please visit tdsinc.com.
